review_body: The entire staff is outstanding. The rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. While most people are vacationing here this hotel provides the perfect peaceful setting for those that are in the city for business. Outstanding food and convenient location to other restaurants in the area. I love that they no longer give bottled water but give you a reusable water bottle that you can fill at various filtered water stations located throughout the hotel. You can also reserve a beta fish to keep you comoany duribg your stay.

One of the disappointing factors of our stay was after a long haul flight we had to wait in the lobby for 5 hours as the room we had booked was not available, this was disappointing as although we were told we could wait in the lobby one of the reception staff made it clear they didn't want us sitting there and kept offering us a smaller room, so we ended up storing our bags and walking around town. This is one thing that needs to be addressed by all major hotels as guests arriving after a long flight there needs to be some leniency in allowing them to a room to freshen up. The other factor was that although the hotel advertises it has a pool you can not swim as it is only ankle deep, if we had known this at the time of booking we would had gone elsewhere. There was also certain things that we liked about the hotel, one was location as it was close to the beach, restaurants, bars and transport, the rooms were also a good size but the fridge could be larger, the bathroom was a good size but lighting poor, toilet area could be enclosed, there is no laundry and directions to one were incorrect, but there is one close by as we found, the in house restaurant meals were good as well as the service, although the hotel offered bar service it only opened 3 days after our arrival and then only stayed open for about 4 days of our stay. Overall our stay was good and most of the staff were friendly and helpful but due to Covid 19 pandemic services became very thin in Waikiki about 6 days before departure and it was hard to get healthy food.

When we stayed at the Hyatt Centric, we were so impressed by the details provided from the costumer service staff, the design of the hotel and resort, and the resources provided in order for us to have a great stay in Waikiki. When we arrived we were greeted by the hotel dog, NASA and pineapple ginger seltzer. We were given a great room with a magnificent ocean/ city/ diamond head view. We were impressed by the safety of the lobby being on the 7th floor and enjoyed the easy access to the Starbucks Reserve on the 1st floor. Overall great stay, great value for a points fanatic, and would visit again!

This Hotel has so many little surprises, the attention to detail was amazing. We were greeted by the resident dog. We brought our dog for the night as it was a spring break staycation for my daughter and I. The room was lovely and shortly after we got to our room a great quality dog bed and dog bowl was delivered.There were chic reusable take home water bottles for us in the room. A coffee maker and a fridge. The room was large and modern! The shower is to die for.

The place has no lobby downstairs, which makes waiting for friends or taxis a problem. Also, no restrooms (I guess they want to keep out the homeless) unless you take an elevator to the lobby. As we waited to depart we noticed that the bellboy has umbrellas, something we would never know. And umbrellas are so important in Waikiki. We felt like someone should have told us. The staff at check-in was nice and welcoming, the housekeeping unpredictable. Rooms have no balconies.

Wow, where do I begin?!I have had my Waikiki trip planned for about six months. My boyfriend and I decided to still go in the midst of all the coronavirus chaos. But unfortunately, a lot can happen in a few days, and we had to cut our trip short because the area we live ordered a shelter in place. Thank you to the amazing team at the Hyatt! They were the calm in the storm and assured us everything would be fine! They refunded us for the days that we wouldn’t be able to stay. Before we had to cut our trip short, we had an amazing stay at the Hyatt! The rooms are extremely clean, the pool is beautiful, and the breakfast spot is delicious. But most importantly, the employees are TOP NOTCH. They are the Hyatt’s competitive edge. They make the experience the best. Every time you walk down the halls, the cleaning team ALWAYS smiles and says “Aloha!” I wish I got their names so I could give them a shoutout. Everyone we talked to at the front desk were super friendly and helpful. Shoutout to Devonn, Rachel, and Tiare. They answered all of our questions, and kept us calm through this whole experience. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!We will for sure be back after the coronavirus has passed!

This hotel, and the staff in particular, have been absolutely amazing to say the least. The hotel is wonderful and the room was perfect. The hotel has gone ABOVE and BEYOND in taking care of my girlfriend and I.Unfortunately we live in the Bay Area and there is a Shelter-In-Place which is just one step before a lockdown. We went down to the lobby because our stay has a few days left and spoke with ***Devonn, Tiare, and Rachel*** who were all nothing short of understanding and so kind to us and they worked with us to give us our money back for the last two days of our trip.Honestly, I have never been treated so well from ANYbody in the Hospitality Industry and we will 100% be back because of ***Devonn, Tiare, and Rachel*** and the amazing company they work for!Once again, Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach, we thank you for putting our health and safety and concerns above the company making money. Thank you thank you thank you.Devonn, Tiare, and Rachel, thank you all for being who you are. Means more than you even know!!!-Caleb Prigian

Awesome experience. The location is perfect. Near shopping , restaurants, and beach. The rooms were clean. The hotel staff were super friendly and helpful , especially Tiare and Malia!! The breakfast kept us full. We appreciate how helpful the concierge was. The Hyatt Centric is becoming our go to “brand”. Mahalo!!

This hotel is in a very nice location, which is in a walkable distance to many restaurants and shops. It’s also very close to Waikiki beach! Would definitely stay here next time! Staff is also very friendly!

The hotel, its facilities and rooms, are beautiful and well-equipped. The service, however, was one of the worst we’ve ever experienced. The check-in process was horrible, the front desk was not helpful at all. I was led to a computer to book my own room. Calling for laundry service was a hassle, having to follow-up with housekeeping for pick up at least 2x . The concierge desk seemed to always be on break. And room service was non-existent. Hard to believe for a category 4 hotel with at least 4 stars.

We have experienced non-stop problems and annoyances with housekeeping ever since we checked in yesterday. First we had an unpleasant incident with finding a sizeable bloodstain on one of the "fresh" bath towels in our room. To her credit the housekeeping supervisor who was on duty yesterday addressed the issue and made amends for it. I sincerely wish the problems ended there but unfortunately they didn't. We asked at 10:15 am today to have our room cleaned; we got back 3.5 hours later at 1:45 pm with hot food and the housekeeper had just started cleaning. He said he had no idea we had asked the room to be cleaned a long while ago. He wanted to continue cleaning while we ate our food, which is ridiculous, we have the right to eat in peace. And we didn't want to schlep our food down to the lobby and eat it there because we don't want to touch all those public surfaces with the Coronavirus going around. We were hoping to rest in the room for a bit after lunch but of course that didn't happen, thanks to housekeeping. We had to hang out in the lobby area until 3:00 PM when the room was finally cleaned. To add to our miseries, the internet was down across the entire hotel all day until around 3:00 PM (which is 7:00 PM East Coast Time, and so the entire business day was wasted!), and even though we are on holiday we still have work obligations that must be done online and it was really inconvenient to tell clients and colleagues to wait because we are in Hawaii and don't have internet access at our hotel.And multiple other little annoyances such as we asking the housekeeper in writing to only leave us all regular coffees and NO decaf, and coming back to find ALL decaf coffees left in our room. I know this sounds minor but little things like this count towards the guest experience and comfort.A different housekeeping manager on duty today reached out to us and offered some meaningless apologies which didn't do anything to reverse the fact that our day was ruined by this hotel, between the lack of internet access all day and the disastrous bungling by housekeeping.This property has the potential to be a good hotel but it is badly let down by its housekeeping, Very disappointed!

We enjoyed our 5 nights here. It's central to Waikiki, and with the attached parking garage, makes it easy to explore the rest of Oahu. Yes, parking is expensive at $42/night - but it's incredibly convenient as it's attached to the hotel via the main elevator.You can get anywhere on the island within 45 - 60 minutes (outside of rush hour). This hotel is a good option for those looking to redeem Hyatt Points, as the exorbitant "resort fee" is waived. This is not a resort - it's just a nice hotel.
user_name:
FrugalTraveler2019
New York City, New York

review_body: Really not up to Hyatt standards. Our room had a fabulous view of the ocean and Diamond Head from the 21'st floor, but there was a hole larger than a dollar bill in the carpet in front of a closet and the shower leaked so badly we were mopping up with bath towels after every shower. It was a stay for our wedding and none of the staff could explain their dry cleaning service for pressing my dress, so I ended up ironing it myself on my wedding day for an hour and a 1/2. Staff was VERY friendly, just not knowledgeable. When I tried to plug in the iron, the electrics didn't work on one of the 4 outlets in the room, the easiest to use with the ironing board. The pool is minuscule, a kiddie wading pool and you are a long 5 blocks from the beach, NOT a resort in my opinion, more a business hotel where they thought they could charge resort fees if they let you borrow a boogie board - you WILL pay resort fees of close to $50 per night with taxes, and the parking is outrageous. During our stay there were plumbing issues on the ground floor and the ceiling was open and a horrible smell was permeating the place at the ground floor elevators for over a day. When I brought my issues up at check-out I did get one day of our resort fees waved by the desk supervisor - but that felt stingy to me when it was our wedding and we were already stressed. She asked if I called about the electrics...oh, sure, on my wedding day I'd like to either change rooms, or have someone investigating wiring under our feet - no thanks. We made do and just won't ever return, I suggest you skip this one unless you get a really good deal and don't mind paying a resort fee on top of that deal.

Still relatively new, this hotel is near everything in downtown Waikiki, and can access the interstate in a couple of minutes. The room was spacious and impeccably clean. Bed was so comfortable so that I could quickly take a cat nap right after work, and still have time to enjoy dinner within a quick walk to dozens of restaurants. I had a wonderfully relaxing business trip.

This hotel was a great value, just a short walk to the beach and included free access to beach chairs/umbrellas to take with you, boogie boards, and GoPro rental. Having stayed at on beach properties where you are charged for every little amenity, it was a great change of pace to have everything included. The staff was wonderful, room was comfortable; really exceeded our expectations.

Stayed here as a globalist for 4 nights and it was fine. The location is right in the middle of Waikiki surrounded by high end shopping on one side, and as is the case in Honolulu, graffiti covered shuttered buildings on the other. The price was excellent (paid about $160 a night out the door as a globalist). Staff were all nice, and the breakfast was nothing extensive, but solid quality with a few rotating items like pancakes and french toast. We were upgraded to exactly the required room per the Hyatt terms, nothing more nothing less. Room was a nice size, with a few of the city (which you can honestly do without). Shower was a good size, and the products (shampoo, soap etc) were all fine. No special note, treat, or any recognition as a globalist in the room, which a lot of hotels do, and nothing really explained regarding benefits at check in. Breakfast is an obnoxious 0600 to 1000, so get up early if you want to eat. The pool is kind of small and more of a very shallow place to sit in a chair in the water and relax, and the hot tub is a decent size, although it could have been a little hotter. Nice little deck for the pool area though and a nice place to relax.The staff were watching the manager's dog, Nasa, while we were there and she was present in the lobby behind the desk, so extra points for that. Hooray Nasa! Lots of places nearby to eat, like the excellent udon shop that is super popular and the japanese food hall across the street.Overall, if I were in Waikiki again, I would stay here again unless it was an insane price. Personally I would not pay more than maybe $250 max out the door and that would be pushing it. Really no complaints about the hotel at all. Truth is, I just don't care for Honolulu so my odds of returning are slim, but it has nothing to do with the hotel.
user_location: Wherever the cheap fares take me
user_name:
trahveller
Wherever the cheap fares take me

review_body: Pros: Spacious, well-ventilated room, very close to the beach if you don't mind walking a bit, close to everything from upscale restaurants to dive bars, plenty of ABC stores around. Comfortable beds, friendly staff. Cons: There is no pool. The "pool" is a water feature thing that only goes about fourteen inches deep. So don't expect days lounging by the pool or to get in a traditional swim. If you want to swim you'll have to do it in the ocean, which is fine. I felt this was misleading though, as I like to swim for exercise. Restaurant is overpriced and not very good. Cocktails not very good either. Resort fee not really worth it. If you're on a lower level expect lots of street noise. Overall I'll probably pick another hotel for my next Honolulu trip, but this one was pleasant.

This hotel is centrally located a few blocks from Waikiki beach and lots of shops, restaurants and entertainment. Just perfect! We were girls and felt safe and well taken care of the entire time. Starbucks was just downstairs and it was just perfect!

We prefer boutique hotels; although one would hardly call a Hyatt property a boutique hotel, this Centric hotel feels like one. Small and contained, the services offered are comparable to those that other hotesl offer, albeit on a smaller scale. The location is excellent, the lobby is small but the staff are friendly. Our suite was large and spacious with a view of the ocean. The washroom is large as is the shower and the bedroom. There is one closet and the other houses a safe, a small fridge, and a coffee maker as well as an extra set of drawers in addition to the main set. The resort fee includes a variety of activities, such as yoga, making smores, popcorn, coffee in the mornings, use of the pool facilities and gym. The pool is a wading pool with a large hot tub. I would stay at this hotel again.

I booked by Agoda on this time because I had limited Agoda coin. Then I understand I can't get nice room, but it was bad. I booked the plan "High Floor/1 King-size Bed". But my room was "10th floor/2 beds".(Their lobby is 8th floor) All wrong. Then I told to them and they gave me another 1 Bed room, but it was "11th floor". I stoped to claim because I didn't want to get bad mood for start of my great trip. But definitely it was really rude. If different from the plan, it's meaning they sold fake. Because I am Asian? I thought Hawaii is comfortable place to Japanese, but my feelings became depressed from you.And sometimes buzzer sounds even if mid night. I couldn't get nice sleep when it happened.

We stayed five nights at this hotel in an ocean view suite. Ocean view is not exactly what you would expect as the hotel is several blocks from the water and the “view” is just a sliver of blue over tons of other buildings.  Location: other than not being oceanfront, the location is pretty perfect. Centrally located in Waikiki with access to tons of shops and eateries practically right outside your door. There is a Starbucks and Jamba Juice attached, and we made use of the Starbucks every day. The tea shop up the block near Ross is awesome. Having a Ross so close was a godsend as literally everything you might have forgotten to pack is right there, and at very reasonable cost. Ross will even validate your parking for the attached garage (not Hyatt’s) for 2 free hours with ANY purchase. Tip: if you don’t want to pay $45 per night for Hyatt parking, the garage attached to Ross charges $15 for 10 hours. If you are out all day and only use overnight parking, this is a huge $ saver. Room: our room was fresh, spacious and beautiful. The ocean view suites are the smallest suites, and I wish we had booked the Mountain View one which I believe is about 200sf bigger. The ocean view wasn’t worth it as it’s barely a sliver of ocean. Only complaint about the room was the tub, which had tons of black mold in the overflow slot, and made it virtually unusable. Some bleach would fix this. Bed, lines, towels, furniture etc were wonderful. Reusable water bottles a great touch. Room was filled with sunshine all day. Food: we only tried breakfast buffet which was adequate, nothing special and cost $30 with tax/tip. My daughter only one who partook. I was fine with Starbucks. Service: very nice, cheerful staff. Why four, not five stars? I did notice some irate people at checkout a few times, and it always appeared to be over one thing: resort fee. This hotel is NOT a resort (not on beach, no real pool, no spa, no grounds, no room service, etc) and has no business charging a resort fee. We didn’t use one single aspect of it, and it sucks to have to pay for something you don’t use. If the hotel wants to charge for those “amenities“ listed under resort fee, it should be optional to guests to partake or not. It left a bad impression on us.

this hotel was very nice. perfectly located near everything in walking distance but not on the main strip. the staff was very friendly, and helpful. the hotel itself was super clean. and the rooms was nice. we stayed on 20th floor. we had floor to ceiling windows. so the views inside were amazing. if i was to say there was a down side it would be that the room we stayed in, was close to the elevator so we did hear that running late at night and early in the morning. but besides that the hotel was awesome. restaurants every where with in 5 min walk. stores and malls same, 5 min walk. the beach also(waikiki beach) was no more than a 7 min walk. i definitely would recommend this hotel couples

We were originally at another very over priced hotel in Waikiki, Moana Surfrider, but left there and came here due to a bad experience. Linda at check-in was super friendly and helpful. Our room on the 18th floor had an amazing view of the ocean and was clean and spacious. The breakfast burrito was yummy and reasonably priced. It’s also quieter than most hotels. They have beach chairs, towels, umbrellas and boogie boards you can check out for the beach. Service was great! If you don’t mind being a little off the beach I’d highly recommend this hotel!!

If you wish a truly wonderful hotel to stay during your visit to Oahu, experience the warmth and hospitality of the staff, the uniqueness of the architecture, the feeling of being a guest in someone's "home", enjoying the expertise, and welcome warmth of Dan Katona, Front Office Mgr., along with his entire staff that have smiles from ear to ear, greet you as if they have known you forever, always remember a returning guest AND their particular needs, having the pleasure to meet Malia at reception who will gladly help you with any particular need during your stay with a smile and a giggle as big as all of Hawaii, then enjoy the coziness of the lobby bar, let Glen or Robert whip you up one of their special Mai-Tai's and dont be surprised if Richard, the General Manager stops by and chats. Everyone is totally committed to customer satisfaction and it brings me back, again and again. Truly the BEST Hyatt and I feel the BEST overall hotel / experience in all of Oahu. Whether you are a single, a couple or a family, this property is an outstanding example of "Aloha".

Wonderful hotel, friendly helpful staff, excellent service. Definitely would stay there again. Extremely clean and beautiful, fantastic amenities, and very accommodating. Great location and close to everything

We’ve stayed at the Hyatt Centric twice now and will def be back. We love the location and the suites. It’s modern, clean, and well maintained. Alex from front desk is the best! Very helpful and knowledgeable. Wish they had a real pool but the splash pool works great with our young toddler.

We stayed here for our wedding. The hotel is extremely clean and modern. The staff are very helpful and genuinely friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. They even have a friendly dog named Nasa that will greet you in the lobby with a smile.

I am very happy that I stayed with Hyatt Centric! The rooms were kept clean and all the staff is extremely kind and helpful. They made me feel welcome with their warm hospitality. When we checked in the lady (i think Teri) explained to us the things we can get from a resort fee- no one has ever explained this to me on my other travels! A lot of complimentary daily stuff that you would normally buy when u go to the beach. From front desk to valet everyone’s exceptional and efficient! You’ve been part of an amazing vacation. Will be back for sure! Thank yOu!

This is second stay and I always love the location! Easy access to the beach and various shops. I can walk around all day.The service was also good. My Suite room was high floor and bight and spacious. Cleaning lady Lea was very friendly and quick to answer to my request. Front was also nice to talk to. I will come back.

There is not a single bad thing I can say about this hotel: I had an AMAZING experience.The rooms are absolutely gorgeous: Spacious, modern, with a beautiful view. (Highly recommend getting the High top room.)The staff was also incredibly friendly (special shout out to Tiare inagaki who went out of her way to show me the rooms and make me feel so welcome, Kaniala (I believe that’s his name at the front desk - with the Korean girlfriend - who was always accommodating no matter what questions I had) and room attendant Lea who cleaned room 2203 for me during my stay. She was so bubbly, kind, and did such a wonderful job. All three of them made me feel extremely welcome during my week long stay and left a lasting impression. Since I came for work and didn’t have family around, It meant a lot that they made me feel at home. In fact every service man / staff I met in the hallway were all so kind and always greeted me with a hello, and a big smile. I was floored by how great the service was.On top of that, the pool was gorgeous, they had fun activities throughout the week, and they also had a texting line to ask any questions throughout the day! (WHAT A GENIUS CONCEPT)My colleagues who also stayed at the Marriott and Hilton had rooms about 1/3 to 1/2 the size of mine and not nearly as gorgeous although similar in price (if anything I paid less). I’m grateful for the room and I’ve officially been converted from Marriott to Hyatt now. Thank you for the amazing experience and can’t wait to be back!

The best review that I can give is to say that I’ll return with my family for another vacation. The location is legit in the center of central Waikiki. You can walk to EVERYTHING - food, shopping, the beach, rental cars for your island road trip, etc. Hotel staff was super attentive and friendly. Made us feel like ohana, especially Rachel and Malia. Our room was HUGE - 2 king beds and a pull out sofa. Housekeeping (shout out to Vanessa) did a great job keeping up with us - got all the sand out of the shower and off the bathroom floor every day, which I’m sure was not easy. Thank you for an awesome place to stay during our vacay!!

We have strayed in many hotels worldwide. I think this is one of the best stay. The hotel staff was very friendly. Very clean room, bathroom etc. Elevators are nice and clean. The hotel situates in a nice location and very close to Waikiki beach. You will never regret staying in this hotel.

good hotel but didnt meet my expectationroom is very clean and staffs are friendly . drawbacks are not beside the ocean and the room doesn’t has window. very close to the malls and restaurants. Quite convenient location.

This boutique hotel is updated and fresh! I recommend staying here if you don't need quick access to the beach. I appreciated the modern decor and clean rooms. The food was good and they have daily activities to take part in.

I stayed in Honolulu for 3 weeks for work, I stayed at the Centric for 8 days and it was our favorite hotel out of all the ones we were at. Next time I come down, I will stay there for the whole time. Great service, very accommodating and polite. Clean rooms. Nice grounds and soaking pool is great for small kids.

Enjoyed our time at Hyatt Centric in Waikiki. Very close to the beach and also all the restaurants and supermarkets.Staff were very polite and attentive to our requirements. We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend it.

Review of Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort & SpaPending reviewvia mobileWe were in a suite on 11th floor. Super clean and comfortable room. Love the bath tub! The pool side was very nice and love the lounging seat in the water.Very nice location with a lot of good restaurants nearby, it’s in the central of everything yet it’s on a side street so it’s quiet.

We stayed 10 days at the Hyatt Centric and enjoyed every day! The staff was beyond helpful and resourceful, giving us great ideas on what to explore and how to make the most of our time. We loved our vacation in Oahu even more because of the staff who made it a special stay. Alex, handled our late night check in with excellent service and even gave us a personal list of places to visit and enjoy. He also shared all the resort amenities that were available for us, from hotel activities to using a GoPro for the day (so cool!), making our stay more memorable. And he frequently answered our questions with ease and friendliness. Erica, was so kind and fun to engage with. She shared so much insight on the local area and really helped us appreciate what Oahu had to offer from the beautiful culture and history, to tips on incredible experiences nearby. We made so many lifelong memories from suggestions she shared!The entire hotel experience was surpassed by great service, fun activities (from an in-house concert, and a Super Bowl party to a lei making class) and quick resolve of any needs that popped up. But we thoroughly enjoyed Oahu more because of the staff and how they created a haven to return to after a full day of adventure.Thank you Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach!

Hyatt Centric has been my top choice when I travel to Honolulu....staff are always accommodating, room is just so comfortable with the deep soaking tub in Japanese-style bathroom. It is also conveniently located next to International Market Place. Although it is not ocean-front, beach is within walking distance. Highly recommended!

Great location with restaurants and everything close by, except the beach (about 8 min away). Very friendly staff and facilities are all up-to-date. The room is of good size but the hotel doesn't have any swimming pool.

Nights didn't credit to my Hyatt membership account but the rest was totally fine except there was hair in be bed when i checked in Valet parking was great the breakfast is Sample but good staff if you are looking for Beach，it is better to find another hotel， the customer service is excellent

Super clean , perfect service , very similar to European qualities Maybe garage service was little to high but they made it up by being very customer satisfaction driven operation Hotel personnel always very pleasant

Highly Recommend Hyatt Centric Waikiki for your stay in Waikiki. Very central location, with lots of shopping and food within walking distance. The rooms are very clean and modern/chic. We chose Ocean View Room which had beautiful view every sunrise/sunset. The Hotel Staff was amazing and very helpful and accommodating to all of our needs during our stay. The downstairs lobby also had a concierge desk if you need help setting up activities for your trip. The actual Check in Lobby is on the 8th floor. Very nice touch, they provide water bottles in your room for your trip with hydration stations on several floors.

Check in was great and overall everyone working at the hotel are very friendly and nice. Room was kind of small with no bathtub. Requested to be away from the elevator bank as it is super loud and they placed us on the penthouse level floors with another elevator to access that floor. I think it was probably worse as you could hear every elevator running all night. Pool isn’t really even a pool, more like a wading pool. The resort fee is quite pricy with no real pool or showers for the pool. They do have chairs and umbrellas for the beach which his nice. Location is good, quick walk to the beach and everything else around Waikiki.

Centric hotel has been a great place to go for a quick getaway. They cater to those who know what they want and deliver. We love coming here and they always have the best customer service and they are always so friendly

Wonderful location, clean rooms and beautiful views. Housekeeping was very nice. Front desk is very friendly, ask for Rachel, she can assist with any questions and recommendations. We will definitely recommend to our friends. Great value for a wonderful hotel.

We arrived earlier than the check in time. The reception staff was most helpful and accommodating. they tried to help us find an available room even though we arrived before 3 pm. She managed to get us a room. This meant a lot to us as we had just arrived after a 9 hour flight and we were travelling with 2 young kids.

I used to stay @ Hyatt Regency in Waikiki but I find this hotel much better, except for the view. It doesn't have the ocean view but it didn't matter to me as I was there on business. My room was clean and all staff were very nice. Will definitely stay there on my next trip.

It was a pretty nice hotel at a very central location. We loved how close to Waikiki beach and the shops we were. We wish our room had a balcony and that the hotel had an actual swimming pool. The "pool" area was a lot smaller than anticipated and definitely was not as grand as the pictures make it out to be. Other than those two things, the room itself was great and the people who work in the lobby are awesome!

Front check in to check out this hotel surpassed expectations. Can’t wait to stay again. Even though is chose the rainiest weekend to book, the room was perfect to relax and take a bubble bath. I loved everything about this hotel!

Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating to our needs. I called and visited the front desk a few times during our stay and we never had to wait to speak to them, and our needs were met right away when we did. The room was spacious and clean.

We had an ocean view room. It is a little small than I expected. But beds are comfortable. Love the bathroom! It is huge, modern and clean. Hotel located in a very central location of Waikiki beach. Parking costs $42/day. However, the designated Hyatt customer parking area is a the 6th floor of the garage. It is a pain in the neck to navigate in and out through some very narrow turns. Because of the inconvenience, they should have provided free valet parking instead of charging another $50/day for the service.

Exceeded our expectations. Wonderful stay. We didn't need the beach towels we brought because we could check out fresh clean ones everyday along with boogie boards, beach umbrella, beach chairs and twice a waterproof GoPro. Sunscreen and water refills were easy on the lobby floor. Room was kept very clean despite two adults and three teens tracking sand in. Partial distant ocean view from the room. Parking costs were high ($42 a night) so we parked half a mile away at the Banyan for $80/week. Waikiki beach was a blast but we enjoyed Kailua beach and the Ko'olina lagoons more. No microwave in the room but there was a publicly available microwave in the lobby. Pineapple-ginger drink was fun on check in along with the shell leis. Fruit infused water dispenser in lobby was good. Hotel guests received free admittance to a $25/person party on the lanai for new year's Eve. We also checked out a fish for two nights ("Sushi") which the kids liked. Elevators were frequent and fast. I would be happy to stay here again.

It was a great hotel. Very modern and absolutely the most sexy and classy of hotels in the area. We have stayed at almost all the 4 star and 5 star hotels in Waikiki area. We live here and do weekly date nights where we stay in a hotel and try different restaurants as we live in the North Shore we stay the night and enjoy the night life of Waikiki. This was one of the best we have stayed at. The hotel staff was super friendly and the whole experience was a class act.
user_name:
J T
Oahu's North Shore, Hawaii

review_body: I have stayed here a few times. The hotel is modern, clean, and fairly quiet given its location. It opened a few years ago. I stayed in all class of rooms and prefer mid range rooms. The penthouse rooms feel cramped. However, as with most hotels add another $110 (estimate) for each night of your stay to whatever listed price you see. This would include the resort fee of $30.37, $42 parking, and taxes. I wouldn't mind paying the fee, however this is not a resort. The pool is small and shallow, you can't really swim, that area of the hotel feel more like my back yard. I wish they would include all these fees into the overall price, this practice has to stop. I don't use any of the listed services, other than housecleaning. However, isn't that part of having a hotel? For this reason I don't stay at this hotel. I have shifted my travel to other parts of the world which yet don't charge the fee.

For Waikiki beach I would not want a beachfront hotel. The scenic view is great but because there is public access to the entire beach the foot traffic through the beachfront hotels is tremendous. There is no privacy poolside for many hotels actually on the beach.Hyatt Centric is on Seaside, a short walk to beach. A short walk to fabulous restaurants, chic boutiques, high end stores such as Fendi. Chanel, Dior. If you want anything it is 1-9 mins away. If you need healthy smoothies or gelato turn right. If you need beach, shaved ice, high end shopping,Tesla turn left. Waikiki in general is amazingly convenient. My daughter's sandals got destroyed walking back from beach, we looked up, went into a shop and she walked out with new flip flops in 2 mins. We really didn't need the rental car. We used it from the airport, drove one day to the North shore and back and then back to airport.The hotel is very clean modern, breakfast is great. 2 adults get free, pay for kids. We loved it. The staff is super friendly. You get a complimentary concierge if you book with Expedia, seated on 1st floor of the hotel. The suites are fabulous for a family of 4 to have some separation with sliding doors. We had sublime views of the ocean and mountain. My family says I'm a great hotel picker for choosing this hotel :-)

We are walking distance to everything. Great shopping, great dining, and awesome wikkiki beach. Our travel agent was right on. We went to beach shopping and ate at great restaurants all within a few minutes.

best place to stay! centrally located to all the shopping and dining places. no need for a car. The Showers are nice and hot the bed very comfortable. A little windy at times at the pool but overall still very enjoyable

We were truly wowed by the staff at this hotel. We had two suites (kind and double queen). The room features felt luxurious. Staff were attentive to our needs. We checked in early into the room that was available and they sent up extra water for us just in case (didn’t even ask for it). Another staff gave our kids popsicles while we were at the hot pool. Also helped our mom feel celebrated since she just retired. The hotel amenities were also great such as yoga class, lei making and s’mores. Our toddlers love the little pool and the ability to rent beach toys. I missed those little mineral sun blocks they used to give out. We really love those!! But that’s it. Everything else at this hotel is fantastic and quite a deal for the price.

I have been to Honolulu many times, and this hotel made us want to visit again soon. The staffs are very welcoming and accommodating. The GoPro provided by the hotel is awesome (advance reservation required). The moment we walked in the junior suite, we immediately fell in love with the bathtub with a view! Bed is comfy and the space is just exactly what we needed. The location is extremely convenient, minutes of walking to the beach and many good restaurants/local food and stores around. The only painful thing is the costly overnight parking; other than that, this hotel is perfect.

They (Hyatt) say that you get an Ocean view. That's not entirely true. It does get blocked by certain hotels. However the suite that was offered to us had all modern amenities, and the customer service is the best by far. Should you book the suite, the living room might be a bit cramped, but otherwise a great hotel to stay. I would definitely recommend if you choose to plan a Hawaiian vacay.

I booked a king bed high floor room and somehow it's different from what I saw from the room photo of the hotel website. It was said to have floor-to-ceiling windows but turnouts it only got a small window. I paid even higher than the deluxe king room but I didn't get what I expected. I also made a special request during booking that I do not want my room at the end of floor corner and somehow, I was given a room (#1903) which was actually kinda at the corner and right next to the elevator area. I can hear the elevator noise especially at night which was kinda of annoying. Also, the quilt was old and stained.The resort pool is also a disappointment that it is so small and cannot be said to be a resort at all. The pool was very shallow. The only good things are the very convenient location of the hotel and the very friendly attitude of the staff. I would not choose to stay at this hotel again if I go to Honolulu again.

Pristine rooms, adequate amenities, fantastic location & accomodating staff. The Starbucks Reserve Bar in the foyer was a big plus which opens at 4.30am. Overall, a terrific stay. One thing I’d recommend is requesting a room away from the elevator as noise is audible in rooms next to it from early A.M. Overall, highly recommend!

The rooms here are perfect for our family’s needs. Must have the suite for 3-4 people. Bathrooms are super nice and roomy, 2 TVs, separated bedroom is clutch! Valet staff is on pointe, check in is a breeze. Hotel has a great low key vibe. Everything is walkable distance. Go compare all 3 Hyatt’s in Waikiki, I guarantee you will agree with me.

My daughter and I stayed 4 nights at Hyatt Centric and we were very satisfied. The staff was very eager to help when we asked for an early check in, a late check out and booking a shuttle to the premium outlet. The room was spacious and clean and the location was perfect for dining and shopping. Star bucks on the first floor was a bonus.We didn't book for breakfast but there were plenty of places to buy or eat breakfast like Star bucks, Heavenly, Marucame etc and they were all within 2 minite walking distances.

Our stay exceeded our expectations, starting even before we arrived. Rachel reached out to assess our needs before our actual visit. When we arrived (after a long day of travel, a missed connection, and one bag short), we were welcomed with a wonderful room with an ocean view and balloons to celebrate my birthday. Hearing that my husband’s bag missed our flight, the staff quickly put together a package of toiletries for him. They promptly brought up his bag when it was delivered the next day. The hotel is centrally located. There was absolutely nothing we couldn’t get just steps away. The hotel had all the gear we needed for the beach (umbrellas, chairs, and beach toys for children). (Note: The beach chairs have backpack straps that make it super easy and light to take them to the beach.) We enjoyed walking to the beach but also took advantage of the pool. We took the water bottles they provided with us everywhere. We indulged in the popcorn offered one day and were absolutely thrilled with the lei making activity another day. (We will never forget the wonderful instructor who taught us how to make a lei and explained the traditions behind it!) I can’t say enough about all of the staff, and the offerings that made the resort fee completely worth it. (I don’t say the latter too often.)

Spent 4 nights at this property and I was pleasantly surprised by many of the things that the hotel had to offer, from waters in the room daily, a welcome lei ,popcorn in the lobby, free beach towels boogie boards toand umbrellas to use etc it's a very nice hotel, very clean and smelled great ,its roughly a block and a half from the beach but a very easy walk and very pleasant it's in the heart of the shopping and restaurant district but that's not why I'm giving it 5 stars I'm giving it 5 stars based on how welcome we felt ,my kids repeatedly said how nice everyone was and they all went out of their way many times giving us suggestions on places to eat and visit, one person specifically Tiare Inagaki made our visit worth the 5 stars ,Thanks for all the great suggestions we hope we can come back soon, Hyatt you have won our repeat business.

Came to Waikiki to join friends for a long weekend of fun, shopping and soaking up Hawaiian sun! Decided to stay at the Hyatt Centric for the location, great reviews and using our points. Best place we’ve stayed in Honolulu for the many years we’ve been visiting our favorite island for all the possibilities. Ground floor connected to a Starbucks Reserve, across the street from an amazing Japanese Food Hall, around the corner from even more yummy food options. One block from main thoroughfare with all the shopping that Waikiki has to offer, including the newly renovated International Marketplace. The room itself was beautifully appointed with tasteful furnishings all clean - felt like a spa. Bathroom was spacious and had both separate tub and shower with nice motion sensors for automatic lighting. Separate space for the toilet was a nice touch. The elevators to the lobby (upstairs on the 8th floor from the ground drop off entrance) and guest room were fast - never waited more than a minute. We had a nice elevated view and could see the ocean with some buildings scattered about. Still nice. Great safety key in system for the elevator. Check in was really nice too - complimentary lei and a fruity ginger spritz drink. Staff were friendly and helpful. Even they aren’t in the beach directly, the hotel loans out all the beach supplies - towels, chairs etc you’ll need for some sun and water beach fun. Overall, great place to stay if you want to be near everything Waikiki has to offer.

To say this hotel is the best will be an understatement. From the moment of check-in to check-out everything was perfect. The location is amazing (only a few meters away from the strip), the ambiance is beautiful (such a cute boutique hotel) and service provided by the staff is next level! A special shout out to Erica for keeping all my parcels safe and being so informative about black friday sales etc. Our flight got delayed by a day and a half and Malea was so helpful in organising our extended stay at the hotel. The rooms are so cozy and with all the amenities. The views are amazing from higher floor. The only suggestion i would give is getting proper covers for blankets as they fall out of the current covers every now and then.I will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone travelling to Waikiki. And I will definitely return again.

I Was Here for My Birthday Week... And I Was So Happy With Everything! The Staff Made Sure I Was Happy on My Actual Birthday... Surprises Everywhere!I Also Had the Pleasure of Styling Their Lobby Statement Tree.
user_name:
Emanuel C
Lawrenceville, Georgia, United States

review_body: Hotel is very chic , the staff is lovely to talk to especially the Valet and Concierge.Wonderful place to stay while visiting Waikiki . The Lanai is overpriced and food in my opinion was not so great - it did not stand out ..

We had a great time with our furbaby Max at the Hyatt Centric. The staff was very pleasant and made every effort to make sure that our accommodations were to our liking. We had a large room so that our furbaby could play with his toys. Could not beat the location either...right in the center of Waikiki. We walked our furbaby along the Ala Wai and went all the way to Kapahulu to Diamond Head Market and Grill on Monsarat for breakfast one morning. The food there is excellent. If you've never been, you must experience the food and the onolicious desserts!

They got the Hyatt golf touch here at the Waikiki centric. Great place to stay if you want a clean room centralized location and helpful staff who genuinely care for you to have a five star stay. Look for deals here if you’ve had the Hawaiian experience and just looking for solid accommodations

Wife and I stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel was previously an office tower renovated into a hotel. They did a good job on the renovation. As a globalist, I was upgraded to a suite which was really a large room with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The room was spacious and roomy. The bathroom was well done -- a wet room with shower and tub, and a Toto (Japanese) toilet washlet. My only complaint was that the lighting was poor in the bathroom. Bedding was comfortable and the room was quiet. Housekeeping did a good job daily.Breakfast was limited; there is a small buffet ($24) and no ala carte menu.Service was exceptional. Our check in with Tiare was the best we have had at a Hyatt property and that includes Grand Hyatt and Park Hyatt. Tiare went out of her way to show us 2 different rooms for our selection. I wish all employees were as customer oriented as she was.For our purposes, Hyatt Centric is the perfect hotel. It is so well located that it is just a short walk to many fine restaurants and shopping. We are making this our "go to" hotel in Waikiki.

This hotel is close to the main street and the Waikiki beach. The 2 queen bedroom is very spacious and the price is reasonable. When I check in they also give you the welcome drinks with the welcome necklace. The pool and the spa is on the floor 8 which is where the registration is, as well as the gym.

The staff was very friendly anytime we came across them. Valet was fast and accommodating when we asked for the “free” chairs and towels. The most disappointing part of our stay was the “pool.” We were not told anywhere online that it was a tanning pool and that ruined our stay, as we wanted to lay out by the pool each day and swim. The rooms were beautiful and the bathroom was very spacious! Service from all employees was excellent.

We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for four nights at the beginning of our Hawaiian vacation. My husband had called the hotel in advance to tell them that I was celebrating a milestone birthday. We had booked the least expensive room -- city view king -- and were thrilled with the upgrade. We had a huge room with a partial view of the ocean. While the hotel is not beachfront, it's just a short walk away. They will lend you complimentary beach chairs, towels and umbrellas. There's also a very nice but small pool at the hotel.If you are not dead-set on staying in an oceanfront hotel and want a reasonably-priced place to stay, I highly recommend. They could not have done more to make our stay special.

If you are Hyatt Globalist try to check in with Malia or Kalani, they will make sure you have a great visit. Watch the hotel invoices for Resort fee charges which Globalist DO NOT pay, have them removed. Breakfast daily for Globalist is ok, ask them to make an omelet for you if you dont like scrambled eggs. Valet parking is only a few dollar more than self parking, so see if Ray is work in valet and make friends (tips) and your car will always be ready when you call down. Fast in and out if you have business appointments.

We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Hyatt Centric. The view from our 22nd floor penthouse was exceptional. Very quiet hotel. Walking distance to the beach and shops. Staff were all very friendly & excellent at their jobs.

I found the hotel using my AAA membership site. I knew being Hyatt it would be good, but I was not expecting how excellent it was in every way....location, staff, common areas, the room and the amenities. It was steps away from Kalakaua Ave. Has a Reserve Starbucks inside. There's a Ross and a Nordstrom Rack a stones throw away on the same block in each direction. The hotel is gorgeously decorated and the common areas and rooms are spacious and aesthetically pleasing to the eye. They offer towels, umbrellas, sunscreen, boogie boards, chairs and more for your daily adventures on the island. I just could not be more pleased from my visit and look forward to going back!

Hotel is situated in a great location. A sign to let you know that reception is on another floor would be handy. Staff ever so friendly. Nothing too much trouble. The breakfast is quite expensive for what's on offerVery limited food options available over the barThe swimming pool is less than adequate for a Hyatt. Pool is no more than 400 mm in depth. At least offer use of another Hyatt facility for a decent pool We opted to support the go green policy over our 12 night stay. We had our room only cleaned once during this stay. The offer of $5 per night to spend at the Hotel is very average considering the costs saved by not cleaning daily.

Stayed at this hotel while in town for a family wedding (my wife is born and raised on Oahu). Everything was great at first...room was beautiful, great view, comfortable bed, quiet. Housekeeping was not consistent on the times they showed up to clean the room. On Sunday, there was an open LGBTQ pool party so we couldn’t really use the pool and was not credited for our resort fee (lots of loud club music and loud people all day). The mai Taj’s and chocolate chip cookies we had were horrible and the bar did not have the ingredients on hand to make one of their specialty drinks on the menu! The sunscreen and after sun gel they list as one of the amenities with your resort fee is in big pump jugs by the pool so you need your own container if you want to take some to the beach. The ice machine was constantly out of ice. Overall, nice hotel, great location, just needs some fine-tuning to be really great.

Dear Hyatt-team,normally I do not write a review so early, but I am impressed. At first generally about all my Hyatt experiences. From the 1st day on, when I became a member, sleeping the 1st time in a Hyatt in Amsterdam, the service could not have been better. The Hyatt Centric Waikiki is not an exception. You fulfill wishes without asking for it, already at the check-in, you make your customers feel home from the moment they arrive. The room we got at this Hyatt is modern, beautiful has a great view, is silent and spacious. In general this Hyatt has no rooms below the 7th floor, which is great (both for silence and view). The beach is not far away and the offered services awesome. This stay finally convinced me (after already having a wonderful stay at the Waikiki Hyatt Regency and an awful, terrible stay the the Laylow next door) to always choose Hyatt hotels over others, wherever I can. You make vacations what they should be like - relaxed, stress free and enjoyable. The same applies to business trips (spending 100 days a year in hotels for work = an important aspect for me as well). Thank you so much!

The Hyatt Centric Waikiki is a lovely modern hotel with spacious clean rooms. There are no balconies (in case this is something you really want) but the location is great, a short walk from the beach and the great shops and restaurants of Waikiki. We had an Ocean View suite which was worth the upgrade for the space, but not so much for the view (stay on beach if you want proper ocean views) or the bath (it was a half-size bath more suitable for children and not big enough for adults to enjoy a good soak!). Breakfast staff were friendly, but choices were limited and by the end of the stay we were sick of the sand few options being rotated. We weren’t impressed to find a 20% gratuity automatically added to our bill each day for buffet. We wanted to tip individual staff with cash at the end of the stay, but ended up not doing so due to the forced gratuity which the hotel took. I hope this actually made it back to staff. The pool area is lovely, calm and quiet compared to other busy Waikiki hotels - but don’t expect a proper pool. As clearly highlighted on the hotel website, this is more of a “splash” area, but the large hot tub was fantastic and it was always easy to get a sun lounge. It’s just a shame that the pool bar didn’t open until late in the day and there was no pool-side service like you get at other hotels. The Manager Dan was very helpful and lovely to deal with - an asset to the hotel. Other staff were friendly but less helpful (when we rang front desk to Iet them know on two separate occasions that something wasn’t working in our room, no one came to fix them!). And as with all Waikiki hotels, beware the dreaded resort fee. The fee here was particularly expensive given that it’s a hotel not a resort, and all you’re really getting for your $ is a plastic water bottle! Overall, great, clean, modern hotel in a great location. Unsure if we will stay again of return to our usual Hyatt Regency Waikiki. Best for singles or couples.

The staff was super nice here everyone so friendly and helpful. From the valet to the front desk much thanks. Room was perfect what you would expect from Hyatt and is fine with shopping and food within walking distance.

Hotels in Waikiki are generally not reaching the level of the related chain, but this hotel misses most Hyatt standards. The rooms are good, but that's it. Greed everywhere. A $5 breakfast for $24, parking $45 and 4 hour late checkout $150. Go elsewhere!

Great 3-night staycation in a beautiful hotel that’s close to EVERYTHING. Wonderful staff, wonderful ambiance & vibe, beautiful room. Definitely be back soon. We had an upper floor so away from the noise and crowds below.

We checked into a suite at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach at the midway point of a long cruise. Our room is nicely appointed, however when we planned to go to the beach we were directed to the front door porters who checked us out two beach chairs and an umbrella and provided vague directions to the public beach, which is four blocks away through dumpster lined alleyways. We found the 10 ft by 10 ft public beach along with the rest of the tourists in Waikiki area. Extremely crowed w no amenities massive beach erosion site....the hotel has a nice pool area and we’re going to try that but I wouldn’t recommend booking this hotel if you have a beach activity planned.

Check in reps are amazing and friendly. valet personal needs improvement and training with greeting guest. At the very least, open the door for the passenger and at least approch the vehicle, don't just stand there staring at them, I had to ask if this was Valet. Other than that, it was amazing.

I have stayed at multiple properties in Waikiki for both business and pleasure. Most recently, I stayed at the Hyatt Regency. If you love large tour groups and long lines at check-in, then the Hyatt Regency is the place for you. If you want top-notch customer service in a no-nonsense, high-end hotel, then the Hyatt Centric is the only game in town. Hyatt has a terrific green program where they will give you a $5 credit per day if you decline to have your room cleaned on a daily basis. It is totally worth it. I don't like people coming into my room daily anyway and I have no problem using the same towels and sheets for a number of days in a row. I was left alone and if I wanted something like extra k-cups of coffee or tea, a simple phone call is all it took and five minutes later, someone was at my door.

I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach and was very pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms and establishment. Bed was extra comfortable and pillows were too. Great location close to shops and restaurants and beach.

It is hard to please everyone of all ages but the Hyatt Centric managed for us! Close to Waikiki...but not too close, far enough from the frantic activity...but not so far that you couldn't walk out with a 3 year old, and the absolute perfect pool for toddlers! Glenn at the bar was amazing (try his Blue Hawaiian!), as were the check in staff and cleaning staff. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed at this hotel for a week, we inquired about wanting a double bed instead of King and were upgraded to 2 x queen beds on arrival, so good! staff were awesome and always willing to help. Highly recommend you stay here! Location is 10/10/

The Hyatt Centric is beautiful, clean and the staff is amazing. I was a bit disappointed by the hotel not offering room service or having the bar open while at the pool during the day. We had to leave the hotel/pool to get food which was inconvienent if we were just lounging poolside. Also the pool is a splash pool not meant for swimming.

Dragging chairs and umbrella to beach required more effort than expected. Had blood on our sheets. elevator very noisy. We can hear it in bed. The hotel does not have pool, only has a small splash pad. Requested king bed yet gave us two queen - my child fell off the bed coz no one was on the other side. For the price... was ok.

Overall experience was excellent! The staff was great and very helpful! House keeping was excellent! The Hotel is in the heart of Waikiki. Made our vacation stay just wonderful! Everything within walking distance.

I love staying at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki. The hotel is clean, comfortable, welcoming and close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. My children love staying here and never want to leave. At home they always ask to come back to the Hyatt Centric. The staff are very attentive, polite and friendly.

excellent is the only word that could describe my stay at this hotel, the service was excellent the food was excellent and the room with the ocean view was beautiful, i would recomend staying at this hotel to any one coming to Hawaii!

Have not stayed at any Hyatt Centrics in the past, but really enjoyed our stay here. Online check-in in advance made checking in at the WoH counter much faster. As a Discoverist, received an upgrade to a higher floor which was great.The interior design of the lounge and lobbies are very nicely done. Compared to other non-Hyatt hotels we have stayed at in Hawaii which typically have a similar look (Grand Wailea included), this was probably the nicest one in terms of design.One particular thing we appreciated was the hotel doing a towel arrangement with balloons and chocolates on the bed for my wife's birthday when we arrived.The hotel offers mini activities like lei making, yoga, hurricane popcorn, etc. daily but for guests like us who check in on Monday and leave on Tuesday, nothing was available for us unfortunately. The pool was more of a wading pool and not very deep, but the children playing seemed to have a good time. The 2 beds are nice and comfy.Overall, enjoyed the stay!

Overall a nice stay. Tiare at the front desk was very helpful. Breakfast buffet included for globalists was above average with a good selection. Could also order omelets or pancake special. Only wish they had more daily activities.

Overall a great choice - we stayed for 5 nights 15-20 Oct.Room was really large and had everything you need except no lanai.Location is great and very handy for buses on Kuhio and everything else in central Waikiki. For the price, I think this is a solid choice.My only quibble is the fact that they charge a "resort fee" - Yes, I know beachfront hotels do this in Waikiki, but the Hyatt Centric is neither a resort nor beachfront, so its just a $ grab.Also, be aware that they offer you a $5/day account if you elect not to have your room serviced (cleaned). As breakfast closed at 10am we couldn't use it on our last day!!

I was over charged by the concingere service for booking my Hawaii tour. Don't use the concingere service. Other people on the same tour from different hotels paid less for the same tour. I was very dissppointed!

Overall the hotel is not bad, clean and with polite staff. We did not like the pool. All sunbeds are constantly busy and we had to sit on chairs at the table, lol. But the canopy were always empty, but you can use them only for a fee. Really? The hotel charges a fee for umbrellas and sun loungers for the beach, but sun loungers ended early in the morning, and you have to settle for only an umbrella, as an alternative you can use boogie boards instead of sun loungers. And again, seriously? I don’t even want to talk about the bar by the pool, because you can’t call it a bar. The only plus of the hotel is the staff. Thank them for their good work.

Great location. Can walk to beach, shopping and lots of dining nearby. Lots of high end shops but there’s some local shops a block off the main drive that is worth checking out. Starbucks all over the place. Maybe too much...just wanted some local Kona brew.

About a block away from the beach, the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach is centralized to stores like a Starbucks Reserved, Nordstrom Rack, Ross, and Any High End Brands you need or want, this is a great hotel property to stay at.

The reception was on the 4th floor (I think) which seemed strange but the reception area was large and airy and the staff were very friendly and efficient. Our room was large, clean and well equipped. Personally I do not see the need for a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom but there was a blind that could be lowered although this was controlled from the bedroom. There was an attractive pool area and a pool which was perfect fror children up to the age of about 5yrs but certainly no good for swimming.

Nice hotel, nice location but service was just okay compared to Wyndham where we stayed for our first 3 nights. No one helped us with our luggages when we arrived. They all just stood there. I was the the only one there also but that was fine since our friend who arrived earlier came down and helped us with our luggages. Room wasn't ready but we did confirm King bed. When rpom was ready at 1:30 but we were given 2 queen beds. When I complained to her, she told me its an upgraded room. We felt like we were lied to when we got to our room. There was no tub,no sofa, and no heated seats like the room my friend have. Maybe it was because it was on a high floor "18" vs "14" and it had 2 queens. We're Explorist member and my friend is not so we feel like they don't care of your a member or not.

Excellent location, on the heart of Waikiki! The pool isn’t a pool, but is fine to rest. Very good room with nice view and very well cleaned. All employees are very friendly! When I return to Honolulu i will stay again in Hyatt Centric!

My flight got suddenly canceled due to the typhoon hitting Japan and needed two extra nights in Waikiki. The hotel I was staying at (Hilton brand nearby) was not as satisfactory as I had expected, and decided to stay here.....Rachel at the front desk was super accommodating and friendly yet so polite. When I came into my assigned room, I WOW-ed because it is just SO perfect....have not explored the hotel as of yet, but just wanted to put the review, finally I feel I am in HEAVEN after the hell I went through (being on put on the hold for HOURS, terrible service and unreasonable cancellation by ANA!!). Anyway, the unpleasant experience gave me a new perspectives on what the "customer service" should be.....definitely I would stick with Hyatt brand (instead of Hilton) for hotels, and would try to stay away from ANA for my airline choice in the future!!

The staff at Hyatt Centric were professional, friendly, and helpful. I was so delighted with my stay and can’t wait to return. Rachel at the front desk and Diana in sales should be commended for their excellent customer service!

Check in was a bad experience. Receptionist was unhelpful, unwelcoming and unapologetic about hotel payment in which hotel stuffed up on their end, she seemed to only to care about money. Other staff were great though. Good location, limited breakfast and not a great hotel for the price paid, quite disappointed.

A picture tells a thousand words. Having stayed in many great hotels around the world, I am impressed by the room design. Contemporary, spacious and quiet. The bed is very comfy firm, rain shower is sleek and the room is well-insulated from the noise of the busy streets. I had my best sleep in town. The staff we spoke to from front desk to valet to bar were all very polite and professional. The pool was great for dipping after a hot day out at the beach. Note that though the hotel is about 2 blocks from the beach, you will need to cut across some of the busiest streets in town. It is close to 15 minutes walk to get to the beach and might be cumbersome if you are carrying chairs and umbrellas. But if you are looking to for a nice room to chill out at the end of the day, you won't be disappointed.

Wonderful two year old hotel with spotless spacious rooms. Staff very friendly and professional always willing to help. Two blocks from the beach but not a problem and you can take anything you need from the Hotel. We had King room with a view and just lived it. Walking distance to many restaurants. Would highly recommend this Hotel.

The hotel is about a ten minute walk from Waikki beach and even closer to a ton of facilities including food shops and clothing shops. There's even a japanese market about a 2 min walk which sells some incredible food. Parking is about 45 dollars a night, but we found a better rate nearby so parked and walked to the hotel. I would recommend driving on Oahu because you really get to see the sights. Arrival was great and we were welcomed warmly by the lady on receiption, given a drink and a lei. She explained everything fully and then we went to our room. They have 4 lifts so youre not waiting forever, unlike a lot of hotels. Our room was huge! very clean, everything we needed and a lovely view. The bed was so comfy! only slight issue we had was that our room was next to the lifts, so you could near a slight hum as they went up and down. But it was no big deal for us. the pool wasnt a swim pool, more of a sunbathe and relax pool, which was perfect for us, in fact i loved it. also if you wanted to go to the beach the hotel provided a raft of things such as towels, beach chairs, umberella and even sun tan lotion. we took the chairs and went to the north shore and sat on a beach surrounded by sea turtles...just heaven! the hotel even has an option if you dont want the room cleaned you get 5 dollars to use on food and drink in the hotel. and they give you a water bottle and theres a water filter to fill it up with. this is to reduce the amount of plastic bottles being bought and it was perfect for us, we didnt purchase any bottles and it saved us a few pennies. overall we would recommend this hotel to anyone. its perfect for your first visit to the area. would like to add if any management read these reviews that the staff are fantastic! so friendly and polite, they made the stay even better!

I was visiting Hawaii for the first time and was afraid of not loving my hotel choice. Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach was an excellent choice. The hotel and amenities were very modern. It was clean. I had an amazing high floor, corner view so I could see the mountains from one side and got a partial ocean-view from the other side. Walking to shopping, restaurants and the beach were all a breeze as well.

We enjoyed our stay at Hyatt Centric, the staff was helpful and responsive as needed. However, the hotel was not what we imagined it would be based on the photos provided by the website.The room we booked initially, was much smaller than what photos captured. With a toddler accompanying us, we had no choice but to upgrade to a larger room - only a suite was available. Since the suite is one of the hotels "nicer" suites, we anticipated some slightly better accommodations but didn't quite experience them. Daily room service was performed at a minimum - empty the trash, fix the bedding, change the towels. One day the room didn't even get serviced. For a hotel that houses guests coming from the beach - I would expect that vacuuming would be a regular occurrence, didnt happen.I also noticed torn bedding and the crib we requested was torn as well. I understand the concept of how hotels work and that hotel materials go through a lot of wear - but i would expect that wear to get filtered and not make it to the guest for use. Lastly, the "splash lounge" pictured on the hotel website is at a max 14" depth. That was probably the biggest disappointment. During one of the warmest and most humid visits to Waikiki - we didn't even bother using the pool because I personally didn't think it was worth getting wet for. I took my toddler a couple of times and she seemed to have fun. It was approximately waist deep for her and she is 2.5. Overall, I think our stay was salvaged by the fact that we upgraded to a suite. It gave us a little more room and space for the toddler. If we had stuck with the initial room i dont think i would have given this review as many stars as i did.

Close but not too close to the hectic scene in Waikiki - the property was very well kept, hip & modern. Starbucks on the ground floor was convenient. I had a few issues with the parking pass but that was my sole issue. Parking was pretty ample-in a shared garage connected to the hotel. A few great restaurants in the back side of the hotel-Paia, Basalt & Duke’s on Kuhio Ave. My new go-to place in Honolulu.

A 3*+ hotel got a long way to go.Ridiculous resort fees with only wading pools. Very limited or next to none resort facilities.Good location for WakkikiNeeds to fix water pressure problemBreakfast buffet was less desirable - very limited selection and non -appealing.Good hotel guest water and morning coffee in the looby

We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for our daughter’s birthday, and we all loved it. It seems more like a smaller boutique hotel, but it was nicely decorated. The staff was all friendly and helpful, and upgraded our room to a suite. The room was huge with a nice curtain partition with a sofa bed and tv. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful, with a Japanese bidet toilet! We slept nicely. Our daughter was able to have a “pet fish” for the duration of our stay, and fed it once a day. They only have a small splash pool, but the little ones had a great time. The location isn’t the best for beach access, but it is perfect to find good food - Waikiki shopping plaza, international marketplace, and royal Hawaiian sc are all steps away. The free water bottles to refill in the water fountain on your floor was also a nice touch. The Hyatt Centric was an incredible hotel, and we’d return in a heartbeat.

Best location without being right on the beach, decent price comparably too. No real pool, but cool lounge/Jacuzzi. Breakfast and bar were pricey so stayed away, also bar didn't open until 3pm. Lobby on the 6th floor threw me off a little. City view might be better than Ocean view as that direction is obstructed mostly by roof tops and parking structures. Suites are pretty awesome, with Toto toilets and all. Great complimentary items like sunscreen, boogie boards, etc. I'd def stay here again.

We stayed here as part of our 4 day stopover in Honolulu. The location is 6 out of 5 stars. Only a short 2 mins walk to the main strip, 5 mins to the beach. But because it's not on the main strip it is super quiet at night for a good sleep. Rooms are modern, large and well cleaned. Staff were ok but not helpful when we asked about showering because we had late night flights out of Honolulu.

Great hotel in a very handy location, close to beach 5mins and shops and restaurants all very close. Car hire also easy from this hotel as National are within the hotel carpark so hiring a car fro a day trip was very easy

The rooms are getting tired - few visible stains on the carpet and on the furniture, stains on the sheets and the mattress protector! The hotel is not a resort style hotel but they charge a very expensive resort fee. Their restaurant only opens for breakfast with no option for room service. The 'pool' is a complete joke - is more like a foot bath. Not worth the money and will not stay there again.

We booked this hotel and were not disappointed, we were a family of 4 and shared a 2xqueen bed room which was perfectely sized - the only negative we have is the pool and deck - the pool is 40cm depp and the deck too windy to use - but we would return as the hotel, facilities and staff were amazing.

You will not find better customer service. Location very convenient to Wakiki Hop On Hop Off Trolley, the beach, shopping and restaurants.We would definitely return to Hyatt Centric Wakiki.Refrigerator in room made it convenient to have snacks, fruit, cold water readily available. Refillable water bottles and Brita stations a nice touch.

Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach is a great hotel even if you just want to relax at the pool. The room, service, location and amenities all exceeded my initial expectations. I will definitely return and recommend as well.

We are happy with the service except that housekeeping cleans the room so late and we are out most of the day and still find the room unkempt. One time we were so tired from morning activities and the housekeeping rang the doorbell while we were asleep. We had to get up as the room needs tidying up. We were out all day and it would have been nicer if this was done earlier not late in the afternoon.

I stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach on this last trip to Honolulu and I was very pleased with my choice to stay there. Firstly, the hotel location was excellent, closed enough to the Waikiki main strip but a couple blocks away from the main street so you can sleep in peace. The staff there was very helpful to answering your questions/ request. Our room was big, spacious, and the bathroom was huge. I'm happy with the hotel considering the price we paid. The resort fee and valet/ self parking fee was a bit high, but along with the resort fee, you have many amenities available to you, such as beach chair, beach umbrella, beach towel, boogie board, and even GoPro camera for rental at no additional cost. Overall this was a lovely stay, I'd definitely come back to stay here as well as recommend it to people I know.

Hyatt is near to the Main Street with all restaurants and store for shopping. 5 min walking to the beach. The staff is really nice and available. Facilities are nice. The pool is nice just small. The room is clean and good size. We enjoyed our stay

My wife and I visited Honolulu for our wedding anniversary and were extremely impressed with the quality of service and convenience of Hyatt Centric Waikiki hotel. We will recommend this to friends and plan on returning soon!

We came here to spend a couple nights while we toured Pearl Harbor before heading to Maui. It worked out great. Very nice location with an easy walk to the beach. Also, there are many very nice restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff was excellent and very helpful. They gave us a great room on the 20th floor with a really neat view of Diamond Head. The bathroom was awesome, my first experience with a bidet and the walk-in shower was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Checked in at 0500 after flying all night. My room was ready and the check in was speedy. Room is nicely designed with outlets, USB charging ports, and lights in all the right places. Super comfortable (firm) bed with high quality sheets and great pillows. excellent relatively quiet air-conditioning. Comfortable chair with ottoman and side table (and an outlet nearby for a computer power cord.) Decent coffee in the room. Nice bathroom. Room was quiet for day sleeping, and they have blackout curtains. They hit all the elements to make a comfortable room for a business traveller. No balconies and the windows don't open, so no fresh air, but that's a minor issue.
user_name:
George R
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is suberb. Its so close and convenient to a lot of shops and restaurants. The rooms are clean and are a great size. The bathroom in our room was large. I loved the deep soaking tub and separate shower in room 1913. They are also pet friendly so we were able to have our fur baby with us.

Nice location. Good walking distance to shops and beach. Excellent staff and service. Now a resort fee? Maybe I missed something but I would definitely not consider this hotel anywhere close to a resort style hotel. Waste of money for what you get at a so-called resort. I am usually a Hyatt fan but will not be staying here again because of this added and very expensive fee.

Recently stayed 6 nights at Hyatt centric, waikiki. Absolutely loved the location of the hotel very central to everything. Rooms are nice and modern, comfortable beds and more importantly good pillows!! Pleasent staff received early check in as requested at time of booking, at no charge after arriving from our sydney flight at 6am local time. Being a converted office tower there are no balconies but this was no issue for us. The pool is only a wading pool but again no issue for us. Highly recommend to stay if after a central location and not fussed by pool or balcony. Close to all waikiki icons shopping and resturants.. bang for buck very pleased with our stay

We stayed here a night before going on a cruise. First you must know that this was an office building turned into a hotel, so its a bit odd in design. Not the worst.
