We stayed on the 21st floor and I was looking forward to the beautiful bathtub on the website. NOT! We were given a handicap room next to the elevator with loud night club music until 1AM. The worst was the elevator loud noise as it moved from every floor. It gave me a pounding headache and My daughter couldn't sleep, what a mess and a total disappointment. The next morning we had breakfast and there were kids(girls) running around the pool not dressed in their underwear. No one addressed the parent about how inappropriate this was and awful to witness. To make matters worse it turned out to be an employee of the hotel kids. The breakfast was good except they didn't have the orange souffle pancakes that were on the menu. The staff was nice but it was not the experience that I was looking for. The location was across the street from a boarded up building so not the ambiance or the safety that comes to mind when you see the pictures on the website. Also it's several blocks from the beach. Trendy place not for kids and location is not good. I hope this helps those families with small children.

The room was clean, everything else was lacking.We had early check-in confirmed by email months out because we were travelling with our 2 y.o. who would need a sleep. After waiting for more than 3 hours we were given a room at 2:56.The restaurant now only opens for breakfast. Despite advertising, NO lunch and NO dinner.As for the rooms, you need to phone for a kettle. You need to travel several floors to get your own ice or filtered water. There are no wine glasses - you need to phone for them. Not even a teaspoon.We were in a room close to the lifts xx02 - which means you don't have any water views but get the sound of the lifts penetrating through your pillow into your head every morning as people start coming and going.The pool is maybe 60 cm deep at its deepest - mostly 20cm deep. One day I took my boy to the pool to find a gay event (three pashing on the swinging chair in the lobby), and ridiculously loud music. I'm told this is a regular thing but wasn't told on booking, on arrival or at any time until I asked. The guy on the front desk said I was free to join and didn't see that taking a 2 year old boy into a swimming pool of 60 touchy-feely men might not be appropriate. Seek a refund of your "resort fee" if you lose access to the only amenity in the building. You are a good walk from the beach and away from the reason you go to Waikiki. It is EXPENSIVE. The amenities no longer exist or are disappointing. Stay at one of the tried and true beach-front resorts.

I was very pleased with my one night stay with Hyatt Centric. I was in Ko Olina for most of my Hawaii trip and then went to Waikiki for a night out and glad we picked this property. The location was ideal for us and amenities were great! The staff (Dan and Alex) were very friendly and provided excellent customer service and ensured I had a good visit. My wife and I frequent Hyatts for most of our trips and were not disappointed with this property! We will return!Pros: Check in was easy and convenient. Room was immaculate and modern and bed was very comfortable, breakfast was great, and again, customer service was excellent. Cons: None, but we do wish we knew about fun activities the property offers. At the time of our visit, looks like they also offer GoPros you can borrow!

The Valet was courteous and efficient. I like the fact that the Lobby was located on a higher floor. It was quite stunning and spacious. The Front Desk personnel, Malia and Linda, were kind, attentive and knowledgeable. They immediately offered us pineapple spritzers, which was a real treat.When we got to the room, we were impressed with the layout. It was clean, spacious and very neat. We had a King bed. The outside noise was minimum, even though we were next to a Utility room. Maid service was very good and punctual. Air conditional was very good and we had good nights of sleep.The hotel was in a great location, just off the main street and even had a Starbucks on the first level. ATM nearby was convenient too.Overall, I think I would stay there again.

Good hotel - clean and modern. Good AC. Resort fee and food prices are high, but that’s more the situation in Waikiki. Nice location near many good eats, but not crazy loud. Lots of shopping nearby. Hotel provides beach towels, etc. Recommended.

This Hyatt Centric is only 2 years old and it's in great shape. The staff were very welcoming and offered great service. The location is very convenient with the beach and many interesting restaurants and attractions nearby. I highly recommend it.

You will find bigger louder closer-to-the-sand properties but for a relaxing and restful stay pick this Hyatt. We were here with my teen daughters, but I can only imagine that this would be perfect if I was on my own in Waikiki, say, on business.

This is a good hotel; however, do not expect a resort. Great location and the Starbucks downstairs is a huge plus. Rooms are nicely appointed and renovated. Downsides - no balconies and the pool. The pool is a “lounge pool” which is great in concept. However the wadding design creates a de facto kiddie pool for the entire pool. Kids running, splashing, and generally taking over the entire pool area. Don’t get me wrong, I expect kids at a pool, but this design just allows kids to take over the entire space and the parents seem to encourage it. If you are a family — i recommend this place. For couples, probably not the best location especially if you want a lounge pool day.
user_location: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
user_name:
Austin1805
Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA

review_body: A really nice, new hotel. The location is great if you're wanting to be in Waikiki. But really, I don't know why you would. Still it was close to the airport and Pearl Harbor, which is nice. The rooms are really great here and the service is excellent. Be ready to pay out the nose for parking though. $45/day for valet! Self park is only a little cheaper. The breakfast buffet at their restaurant was hugely disappointing. Overall a great place to stay with a couple of things that were too pricey.

I stayed here for 8 nights in mid-August and I had a great experience overall. My room was very modern, sleek, and clean, and my housekeeper, Lea, was diligent, friendly, and courteous. The location is excellent and many of the best restaurants, bars, and shopping centers are within 5 minutes walking distance. The only negative (docked a star for value) is the resort fee - in comparison to other resort hotels in Waikiki, the resort amenities are a bit lacking.

We stayed here for one week, and everyone was so friendly and helpful. The room was modern and clean with the perfect location near the ocean; Erika at the front desk was so accommodating in finding the perfect room for our family! She gave us so many recommendations for delicious, locally based restaurants. Not to mention she has great handwriting! Loved our stay here so much, would recommend it highly.

We only stayed one night, but we liked it. We had a corner room on the 20th floor. It was quiet and very nice. The shower was interesting because there was a window on the side so you can see out to the view from the shower or bath tub. The bath tub is one of those modern ones that fill from the ceiling! There is no faucet...the water drops from a hole in the ceiling. Lots of outlets and even USB ports. The toilets are the Japanese Toto toilets with bidet. We went to the breakfast buffet in the morning that had a little Japanese fair (miso soup and tamago). It’s small, but you can also order omelettes or other breakfast meats as part of the buffet. The bread pudding has banana in it (super amazing)! It was a Sunday morning, and but they only had one server working so it wasn’t very quick. But not a turnoff. The lobby (8th floor) has a cool hanging chair that I posted a picture of.

This hotel is great. Very clean, modern. Staff is very friendly. The pool area is really nice. You can babysit a "fish" during your stay if you are missing your pet. The pineapple pancake soufflet is a must have.

Hi, we travel often and stay in Hyatt hotels. As always, room was spacious, staff was friendly. I would say there was a shortage of personnel,even though each employee tried to do its best to offer service. Still, you get the feeling you are staying in serviced apartments.But the pool was a total failure. Basically because there is no pool, simply a small 1 to 3 ft deep basin where one can only refresh one’s own feet.This has been a total pitfall for us, as we wished a hotel with a swimming pool. My recommendation would be to clarify this in the hotel’s website and travel sites, as those scenic pictures of a complete swimming pool amidst skyscrapers are a mirage and can be misleading.

We had a very nice experience. The room was cleaned daily, the staff was friendly, and the hotel was updated compared to others in the area. We celebrated our wedding during the trip, so it was nice that the staff at least congratulated us during the stay. Our only negative was after check out, when we realized we left a bag in the room. Staff was unable to help us locate our items, and it looks like we won't get our things back.

At the time we mad our reservations this was the least expensive hotel of quality in the Waikiki area, located near the International Marketplace. They offer large rooms and the facilities have amenities such as a breakfast and cocktail area, well equipped exercise facility, and convenient parking, though the parking is on the Waikiki pricey side. while they state that they have a pool, it is only a couple of feet deep and I dare you to swim in it.The location is central to Waikiki and easy walking distance to the beach and a number of restaurants.Would I pay the price anywhere else? No! but in Hawaii this is a great buy.

I love the location as I love shopping. Great room interior design, great space for parent with kids, but not much view though. Wood floor and nice bed, feelings of Hawaii. Overall, felt great as a Discovery member of hyatt to stay a hyatt hotel.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. Very convenient. The service is pretty good too. But, unfortunately, shower was very bad. I raised this issue and they claimed someone had looked into it (while we were out and about). But I don’t think it’s been fixed. It was so weak it took a while to wash my hair.

Not a bad trip. Everything was good except the annoying kids knocking on my door the final night of my stay. Breakfast was decent and the service was excellent. The staff are generally very personable and very warm and friendly.

Rooms were clean, and well kept . Swimming pool is is about 20 feet long with max depth of about 2 feet. Various charges were piled into our bill but staff accommodated by removing most of them. Tips were magically charged despite us leaving tips in cash. There is a cost of resort fee that's well over 15% (including resort tax) that includes lots of stuff that we were not told and had to seek out the info on what's included.

I do not have one negative thing to say about this place. From the location, to the amenities, to the people, everything was amazing. They even have a program where you can "adopt" a beta fish for your stay. Our son just loved that. It was so great! The room was spacious, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was amazing. So kind, helpful and accommodating. One day, our kids were a little cranky after the day at the beach and the nice lady at the front desk gave them each a little rubber ducky, which they loved. The chairs and umbrellas you can borrow are so wonderful and easy to get for the day. I would love to stay here again!

Great Waikiki hotel. Attentative and accomodating staff in all departments. Great customer care, service and nice clean facilities. 5 minute walk from the beach next to Dukes and in the middle of all of Waikiki. Highly recommended.

Sure, it’s not right on the beach - but you know that at booking. It is however an easy walk. We were impressed by the amount of amenities provided — welcome lei and drink, free loaner boogie board, sunscreen, umbrella and chairs and kids toys. - You will find none of these amenities at a hotel like the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Room was spot on, all employees were friendly.

Great location. it says it has a pool, but the deepest part is only 14in. They do charge a resort fee when it is not. The restaurant is only open for breakfast which is a little pricey. You can order some apps at the bar when the restaurant is closed. There are a lot of great restaurant around the hotel.

Excellent location, good value for money. The room was in immaculate condition. Staff very friendly and helpful. Free hire of boogie boards (make sure you prebook), beach towels, umbrella. The pool is nice but all shallow, just nice for lounging.

This hotel was at the center of all the stores/restaurants and a short walk to the beach. Staff was very friendly and they cleaned and gave new towels daily. The bed was comfy and I am glad we chose this hotel.

Nice hotel, great location and very friendly and helpful staff. During check in Erica took the time to explain all of the hotel amenities and could not have been nicer. Room was like new and had a nice view of the beach. Especially liked the convenience of everything being so close to the hotel and the ease of checking out beach chairs, towels and even the use of a Go Pro camera. Would definitely stay at this hotel in the future.

I stayed at 3 hotels/resorts while on my honeymoon in Kauai, Oahu, and San Diego. Oddly enough I was the least excited about this hotel, and it was the best one we stayed at. It was by no means luxury, but I got what I expected and I did not feel ripped off. The hotel room was clean and the maid did an absurdly good job considering how much sand we brought in. The location was great. Next to everything. Tons of food options and super close to the beach. We used the free rentals often and rented towels, chairs, and a boogie board for the beach which was great. The pool is not even a wading pool it really is splash pond/fountain and should be labeled as such, but the Jacuzzi was big and relaxing. I would 100% stay again. Lastly, the room rate was affordable.

Second stay here for us. We’ll stay here again. Clean, nice, friendly staff. They have supplies for the beach as well. Boogie board’s, lawn chairs, umbrellas, and sand toys all are included with the resort fee.

Extremely friendly and helpful staff. They made great recommendations about places to go nearby. Breakfast was really tasty. Room and hotel grounds were clean. Beach items available for hire from the hotel. No complaints at all!

This is a beautiful hotel with modern, updated rooms and bathrooms. Waikiki is all about location and this one is ideal. It's right in the heart of all of the attractions, but just the right amount of distance that you have a peaceful stay. A short 5 minute walk to anywhere in Waikiki you want to go. I really appreciated the beach chairs and umbrella they offer for no additional charge.There is Starbucks right in the Lobby which is very nice.We would definitely stay here again.

We had a very good experience at Hyatt Centric Waikiki. Friendly staff and the location is really great if you enjoy all the food that's within walking distance in Waikiki. Definitely a bustling tourist area, but it was a convenient place to have a car for two days and not have a car for another two. The hotel is a completely remodeled office building so the room structures are really unique! We had floor to ceiling windows with the view of Waikiki beach which was a nice touch. Price point was very reasonable as compared to the beach front resorts. There's a lot to explore and experience outside of Waikiki, but if you are headed in that direction, it's a great spot to be!

We were greeted at check in with a friendly smile, a lei and a refreshing pineapple drink. The hotel was clean and in a great location. Close to the ocean and lots of shopping. It’s family friendly. We’ll definitely be back the next time we are in Honolulu.

Good balance of amenities, centrality, customer service for the price. The gym is better than most hotels I've been to. I would rather run outside though (if its not raining).I wish more people were at the nightly events.I would stay here again for the right price.

This hotel was built 2 years ago. The rooms were nice and you could walk to the beach. The hotel had beach chairs, aloe, sun screen, boogie boards, and towels. The pool is only inches deep, so not for swimming, just to lay out in chairs in.

This hotel is centrally located. The service was truly exceptional. The whole hotel is very clean and everything is brand new! They have a lot of things free i.e. 2 water bottles for each room that are refillable. We really enjoyed our stay!

We cannot really complain it was a nice stay. The breakfast was good. The only two minor points are that there is no chance to eat in the evening and the pool is pretty small. All in all we would go there again.

Hotel was great, some staff are well trained but other staff are rude, unprofessional, liar, and doesnt go up and beyond with their costumer service skills, but others are helpful and did their best to meet theur costumer or guest needs.

This location is the best. Close to shops, restaurants and the beach. The staff is amazing. All staff from check-in to check-out are incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms are very modern and comfortable. Love this Hyatt property!

We stayed at the Hyatt Centric in Waikiki Beach for a week. The hotel was clean and the room was really nice. We stayed on the 20th floor and had a great view of the ocean. The hotel is on not the beach, but a short walk away. The hotel provides towels, chairs, umbrellas and boogie boards for guests. We had a car and parking is very difficult in Waikiki. Parking was $45 a day, which is a lot, but it seems like the going rate for hotels in Waikiki. The staff always got our car quickly and helped load it up with our beach stuff everyday. The hotel is central to all of the shops and restaurants in Waikiki, so it was perfect for walking. We were in Oahu for 7 days, so it was nice to have a car to explore the rest of the island. The gym was on the small side, but nice. The pool was set up very well, but it is only a wading pool which is not great if you really want to swim in a pool. Overall our stay was great and the hotel was a perfect place for us to stay.

Great hotel with friendly staff. Room sizes great for the price paid and much better than what you get at the Hilton in our experience. Only downside is pool a splash one rather than full one, but has a nice spa. Hotel Didnt feel too crowded despite high season. Friendly staff made the stay very enjoyable. Will come back here for sure.

The location in the heart of Waikiki, with the International Market Place, the main strip, the beach, and amazing restaurants all within 5 minutes walking distance. The customer service sets this hotel apart. I arrived at 11PM, a few hours before I could check-in and I had a suitcase full of perishables. Akane, a front desk agent, kindly offered to store them in the freezer until I got my room. My mom, fiance, and my fiance's parents were always greeted in the lobby and had their requests (from soaps, to borrowing utensils, to getting beach towels) prompty taken care of. The rooms were beautiful with a clean modern look, large windows for a beautiful view of the city and warm natural lighting. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were spacious. The lobby and pool were nice, and I spent many hours there relaxing. There were also fun little events like poolside yoga, popcorn, and lei-making. I will come back here the next time I am staying in Waikiki. High recommended.

Got to love this place. It is in a great location with very nice rooms. Shower and soaking tub in beautiful bath area. Location perfect for tours and transportation. Quiet at night and peaceful in the day. You will love it.

Good location as the name would suggest - in the centre of Waikiki and 2 minutes from the beach. However, the overall feel of the hotel lacked atmosphere - the lobby was quite shabby and the pool is more like a foot bath.Overall the room was okay but the shower had very weak pressure and was very difficult to wash properly after a day at the beach. There are much better hotels in the area - won't be returning.

This establishment does not fall under the full service hotel that I am accustom to. The only nice thing was the room itself. Every other aspect of the hotel was lacking. My bar food was made by the bartender and not in a professional kitchen. Room service was limited after breakfast hours...probably because the morning shift cook is off. The room itself was nice but the rest of the hotel supposedly amenities was a joke. Even the bar was limitedly stocked with just a handful of bottles...with so little amenities, at least have a full proper bar selection. The only inhouse restaurant only operates during breakfast hours much in tandem with room service. The pool is a complete joke with 14 inches of depth at the deepest point. Stay away from this hotel...I have no idea why so many reviewers rate this hotel with such high praise.

New, clean, great location, great chaises in splash pool, draft beer, views-what's not to like? Valet parking. restaurant on site. water bottles. Welcome drink and shell leis. Perfect bed and linens.my shower had an ocean view :)

They have the best breakfast of all the Hyatt’s on the island. I stayed at the regency down the street as well and this hotel was better. Less of a crowded feel and more like a place you could call home for a few days. Highly recommend.

Hotel room was very clean. The lobby was clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The services were great. They provided free rental of umbrella and beach chairs. The location was perfect!!!!!

Pleasantly surprised as Hyatt Globalists by our experience. Before we arrived, Dan Katona was a great communicator, emailing us back and forth several times so that we were prepared and informed about what to expect, and inquiring about our needs. Katona Great room with big bathroom (excellent large separate shower AND bathtub), nice use of open lobby space, friendly staff, and GREAT breakfast (excellent friendly service and talk story with Wei and James, who work well as a team; in addition to buffet, EXCELLENT menu items and generous portions: Acai bowl, and fluffy Pineapple Souffle Pancakes! Mahalo, guys (Wei and James)! You made our day/stay!

The hotel was awesome, breakfast buffet great, room was nice, very friendly staff, highly recommend. The only drawbacks were the fact that the pool was one foot deep (splash pool) and it was a 5 minute walk to the beach but we knew this ahead of time. Great experience!

Everything was great about this hotel. Really no complaints just recommendations to drop the daily resort fee and add microwaves to the rooms! The location was perfect, service was awesome with nice, clean spacious rooms.

The hotel provided everything you needed for the beach - chairs, umbrella, boogie board, towels. The room was great - everything new and modern. The pool was a little strange as it is very shallow - the hot tub is much deeper. But the area had lots of chairs and great outdoor views.

What a charming discovery! A personal, boutique hotel nestled in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. From the moment you enter the lobby you feel relaxed. The room was so spacious and decorated charmingly. I seriously want every piece of furniture that was in my room. Thrilled to have discovered the Centric brand.

2 stars out of 10, just for the location. Front staff were unhelpful, the concierge provided incorrect information, powerpoints in my room did not work, I had to call on 2 different occasions to get my room serviced and the pool shouldn't even be listed. Its not a swimming pool and it comes up in the search when searching for hotels with a pool. It is a splash pool only!!

The rooms are phenomenal and the location is right in the heart of Waikiki. My fiancée accidentally lost her engagement ring, which fell down the shaft of the elevator. Luckily the engineer was able to retrieve the engagement ring. The Operations Manager decided to waive the fees of the engineer coming in to conduct the retrieval. We were just extremely grateful for the sympathy and kindness of the staff. The activities that are held in the hotel are awesome and the pool is amazing. But, it’s the love of the staff that they have for their guests which reflects as to why the Hyatt is our number one choice in Hawaii

Great service and a nice, clean hotel. Pool is small and shallow, but other than that, I loved everything about this hotel. They loaned out GoPros, beach towels, umbrellas, boogie boards and even pet goldfish!!

Nice location. Good staffs. But doors slamming from other rooms was very annoying every morning. Vending machine doesn't give you change so to get the change you need to ask the front desk. They rent you towels, beach chairs, and boogie boards at the1st floor.

We stayed for 7 days with the family and this hotel did not disappoint. It’s in a great location close to everything, they have TONS of great amenities included in the resort fee (complimentary use of a GoPro, beach chairs, umbrellas, etc) and the staff is really friendly. The only complaint is that they cleaned our room late in the day and often we’d come back from the beach at 3:30/4 and still wouldn’t have fresh towels. But the staff is awesome and with a quick call to the front desk, they’d deliver some right away. Definitely an awesome experience, we’d stay there again.

The staff were really welcoming and friendly in a very authentic way. They give you this refreshing drink that has pineapple and ginger and is delicious. A map of the area and general distinct ideas of what and where you can go are given by the staff as well. The rooms are really clean and spacious too.

All room new- converted office building very impressed with layout after conversion from office building next to yococho Japanese restaurants and my favorite Udon restaurant easy access to the beach and the Biki bikes

This hotel is my new favourite in Waikiki. Location is a decent walk from the beach, but that's made up for by the pleasant rooms, which are stylish and modern. The only downside is the resort fee - absolutely not worth it for two empty bottles and the ability to borrow beach towels.

i went on my honeymoon and stay at a hyatt centric Waikiki.it was the best trip of my lifegood welcome~good location~good staff,good room conditioni wish to visit again sooni will not foget this tripthank you all~

This Hotel is beautiful, it was very clean, brand new and updated rooms and pool/lobby area, so many conveniences including using there go pros, towels, and beach chairs, and the price is great and location perfect!

Given its a new hotel, the facilities were clean and very satisfied. But the front desk and velet operation is a mess. Valet told us to give the baggage card to the front desk for the baggage to be taken to the room, but even after 2 hours after check in the baggage did not come. I called the front desk but seemed to have not informed the valet. The front desk said they will call the valet but of course it did not realize again. So I went to the valet and get the baggage by myself. and on top of this they did not mail us the check in time. But I guess this is normal for this hotel brand.

My wife and I had 10 nights here, our first visit to Hawaii.Positives:* very friendly staff* king deluxe suite was very spacious* everything was clean and fresh * relaxing pool area with use of the cabanas* complimentary beach towels, chairs, sunscreen, aloe, etc. to take to the beach* located centrally* pineapple spritzer at reception was delicious* musician performing at pool area a few nightsNegatives:* happy hour could have had more enticing prices* breakfast buffet was a bit lacking Overall, I would most definitely stay there again on our next visit. Highly recommended!

Wonderful and helpful staff. Very nice and up to date styling . My family enjoyed pool area and Fish sitting Bruce while we were there. We will definitely stay here again if we have the opportunity to visit the island again.

It was my partner and I's first time visiting Hawaii and we were offered the penthouse suite, which included a private balcony which had a great view of Waikiki! We also noted great service from the tourist desk, where we engaged in various amazing activities such as the Chief's Luau, jet skiing and parasailing. The hotel was also in a central area and close to many shops and about a 5-10 minute walk from the beach. The only one thing I have to complain about is the Betta. The images from the elevator made it appear that they were not living in the best conditions. I hope that someone at the hotel can research how to better look after Siamese Fighting Fish as animal welfare is so important to me!

Very nice stay as it was new, modern, clean and quiet. The pool is a very shallow pool which was a bummer. The bar food was horrible. But everything else was absolutely first class. Would return to this hotel in the future.

the biggest advantage of staying in this hotel is the close proximity to absolutely everything you may need while holidaying in Waikiki. The hotel is quite new and clean, we stayed there 10 nights and no complaints!huge bonus - at the reception desk you can book their complimentary GoPros for a day with all the accessories. on a downside - their roomy bathrooms have literally no railings or towel racks making it difficult to dry the towels or even your swimwear after a day at the beach. Also due to its central location be aware of the noise all the trucks can make in the early AM hours when collecting the trash or delivering goods to the nearby stores/ restaurants

The location of the hotel is super convenient ! It closes to everything. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The room is clean and big. The lobby make people feel relax and enjoy reading the book next to the pool. The swimming pool is a not a proper swimming pool, only good for kids. The spa is good though.

We recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach hotel for a family vacation. The location is fantastic; we were only a block from the main road (Kalakaua Avenue) in Waikiki. The hotel is bright, clean, and modern. I understand it was an old office building previously; therefore, there are no balconies.The pool is quite shallow (ankle to waist deep) but our toddler had a lot of fun. I like the fact that there is a Starbucks Reserve attached to the hotel. It was very convenient for us caffeine addicts.My only complaint was that the room was small. Otherwise, we had a good time.

What a lovely little hotel! We moved here partway through our Waikiki stay as our Airbnb was extremely disappointing. The reception team were very accommodating in getting a suite ready for us and we could not have felt more welcome. They all interacted beautifully with our toddler and were very friendly and always up for a chat.The hotel itself has great amenities and the splash deck is a very nice touch. It's perfect for relaxing in with a drink or for little ones to have a splash about in. They had live music a couple of times during our stay which added to the atmosphere.The suite was very spacious and absolutely spotless, with a king size bed in the bedroom and a fold out couch in the sitting area. No balcony is a bit of a shame but definitely not the end of the world. The bathroom is a good size and the shower is huge!The staff are absolutely the hotel's best asset. Nothing is too much trouble for them and they are true hospitality professionals! We'd love to come back again next time we're in Honolulu.

Comfortable, friendly atmosphere in a very convenient location - new hotel with great amenities. Price point is good compared to others of similar category. Definitely recommended!! Water bottles in room to use for the Brita filter water servers were most welcomed. Free morning coffee from 6:00am wonderful! Next to Ross, steps away from Duty Free and Royal Hawaiian Center. Fort DeRussy Beach park is a short bus ride and walking distance. TheBus stops right outside on Kuhio/Seaside and great way to get around to key areas.

I"ve stayed here 3 times, each time for a week. Location is great. The check in staff are friendly, and the rooms are always well cleaned. A good reliable hotel. I also appreciate the free water bottles for customers; which helps us to get water from the water machines. Thank you for considering the environment and saving plastic. I will stay here again whenever I go to Waikiki.

When we first arrived we were told we had an upgrade from our king bedroom to a double queen. This was our honeymoon and a king bed would have been much more ideal. Then on night two of our stay we discovered our air conditioning was not turning on. When I called down they stated they would have someone look at it. We got a call a few minutes later stating it coudn't be fixed (it almost sounded like they had been aware of the problem for a while as no one actually came to the room to check). They then said they had another room available that night. Our options at 8:30 PM were to pack everything up and change rooms or stay in our rapidly humidifying and muggy room as they could not fix the AC. Our new room was supposed to be very similar with a smaller sitting space but a bigger bathroom (with a tub). The bathroom was overall MUCH smaller. The shower was smaller and there was only one vanity (vs the two in the previous room). The sitting room was indeed smaller as well. We were just not impressed with the lack of consideration shown to us. Everything was done and said with a cheery smile but we were very disappointed to have started off our relaxing and happy honeymoon with such a poor experience. ** Also to note the chrome cast in our first room was not hooked up properly. My husband had to search behind the TV in order to find the cord and then spent quite a while trying to plug it back into the TV so that the stated service would be available for us.

1. It’s at Waikiki shopping area. A lot of restaurants nearby and most bus / shuttle pick up point. 2. Hotel staff are very friendly. 3. Room is new, clean and modern. Room is spacious. Bathroom has both bathtub and walk-in shower. 4. It’s very thoughtful that hotel offer beach umbrella, foldable chairs, beach towels, sun block, aloe Vera, and boogie board. 5. We had a ocean view room at high floor. Very quiet. We will definitely come back again !!

The staff were very rude and treated us very poorly. I paid for a deluxe room and was given a regular room and after asking was moved to another regular room with no computer desk, sofa, etc that was also dirty! The furniture in the room was very dirty which I have pictures of and the bathroom shower had cracks and some of the lights did not work. The place does not look like the pictures. I was told that I could not move to another room such as the deluxe room that I paid for because the hotel was full, however I went online and there were plenty of rooms available. In the end I decided to cut the stay short and moved to a much better hotel which was also right on the beach! This hotel is nowhere near the beach, the pool is a joke, and the staff are terrible!!It is not like the pictures. You will have a much better time if you pay a little more and stay at a hotel closer to the beach or one that at least has a balcony or windows that open which this hotel does not. I would never stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone unless you want to be disappointed!!

I highly recommend the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach hotel if you value modern, clean, spacious, quiet rooms. Great bed and pillows. Front desk staff are exceptional. Location is great for eating and shopping and a short walk to the beach. Pool is very nice for lounging but not a swimming pool and there's a nice hot tub.

I stayed at Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach 23rd-27th January. On my final day staying there, I came back from a day out my room had been serviced. I also realized that an Adidas bag that I placed near the full length mirror was missing. Inside the bag were several brand new shirts and tops I bought from the Adidas store and Banana Republic store.I called reception to inform them of this missing Adidas bag. The man at the reception rang the housekeeping supervisor who cleaners my room and advised me that the house keeping supervisor said she did see the bag there but insists she did not take it. I was then told by the staff that in order to be reimbursed for the missing items, I would need to file a police report and that there was no other way that they’d reimburse me. So I complied and had police come into my hotelRoom at 10:30PM just to file a report just so that I could get reimbursed. Hotel promised reimbursement after police report was done however I have NOT RECEIVED ANY reimbursement. Hotel keeps ignoring my multiple emails for months on end.

This was a great place to stay... The staff was very friendly and helpful... The King Deluxe room i enjoyed was the best... Saw another king room and it was very small so i guess you may want to view both rooms to see which will satisfy your needs... The only draw back was the picture of the pool... There isn't any pool... There is a hot tub and the pic on the website that is representing a pool is something with about six inches of water... Maybe it's something new and healthy and is news to me but it wasn't what i was expecting, but the ocean was a five minute walk from the hotel so that was convenient ... The location was great; right in the middle of anywhere you'd want to go! I will stay there again and will recommend it to others... Hopefully they will have a pool or a partnership with another property that allow us that pleasure...

Possibly the worst stay I've had with your hotel. Stayed twice previous. No valet or concierge help with baggage. No welcoming. Bathroom was stink and had what looked like toilet paper stuck in the drain, and staff took awhile to come clean it. The front desk didn't answer the call we made from the room, so I had top call corporate. Waiving the resort fee didn't bring back the time and ruined our reservations for our anniversary dinner. Ended up rushed and unable to find a nice restaurant to eat at. I also requested to have the room with a soaking tub, only to try fill it up at midnight to find that it doesn't work!! Couldn't leave this hotel fast enough, even with the late check out with my world of Hyatt membership, we decided to leave ASAP! 10AM. Won't be staying here again

I made a reservation for the night of May 30/31 and noted that I would be arriving early in the AM on the 31st due to my flight arrival time. I flew in from the South Pacific and landed at 3 AM and had a 12 hour layover during which time I wanted to nap and refresh. When I arrived at the hotel they had canceled my reservation and charged me as a no show. No big deal, the clerk checked me in as requested, and changed the no-show fee to the regular room charge. All ok, so I thought.On my card I was billed for two nights because the clerk checked me in for May 31 to June 1, instead of May 30/31. And the management decided to reverse the no show charge and charged me two nights! Even though I was never there for the second night. Two very long phone calls to billing, most of which was on hold, resulted in a short email saying management decided I was responsible for both days without further explanation. Even verification of my departure on a flight on the 31st seems to not be enough for them to believe I could not have even been there for a second night if I wanted too.All in all, what was a simple mistake on their part and could have been easy to fix has now turned into a huge time suck for me and turned what was a pleasant experience at the Hyatt into an administrative nightmare, something a frequent traveler like myself has no time for.

New hotel in what was formerly an office building. Pretty good job in converting it to a hotel. Interior felt modern and new. My only complaint is the lack of a seating area (e.g. sofa) - even with ample space, it had only one chair/ottoman to seat one person in a room that can sleep two people.

We had a wonderful time at the Hyatt Centric. The staff was outstanding--especially Vince!! We alwasy had a clean room, plenty of towels for the beach and chairs and umbrella. The hotel is located centrally to some phenomenal shopping, restaurants and the beach. The staff made us feel welcome and were always kind and friendly!! Not easy to find now a days. The pool area and workout room were also great. We would stay here again in a hear beat.

The room I had was very nicely appointed and made very good use of space. It didn't feel like I was being crammed into your everyday hotel room. The hotel is steps away from the International Market Place, a short walk to the beach, and reasonably priced. The hotel staff is very friendly, responsive, and knowledgeable of the area.

This is a great hotel because-It is new and the rooms are very modern and clean-Rooms are quite spacious-Cleaning people leave the room pristine-Front desk people are friendly and very helpful-Close to restaurants and shopping. I don't understand people who complain about the hotel not having many restaurants, there is so much good food within a block or 2 of the hotel-Next door to Japanese food court with free video games-Breakfast people are super nice-It is a Chase Signature Hotel and if you book through the Chase signature hotel portal, you get free breakfast-Free sunblock, aloe and gopro rental-Price is usually reasonable vs beachfront hotels-Staff is awesomeBut know what you are not getting:-This is a city hotel not a resort on the beach. If you want to step from your room to the beach with umbrellas and drink service, this is not for you. Some people say you get free beach chairs, towels and umbrellas - but you need to lug them on a 10 minute walk to the beach. I saw families trying to carry all of this to the beach and it didn't look fun in the Hawaii heat.-The pool is small and shallow. No swimming. It is on the 8th floor so windy. But free cabana if you want to sit and read, vs swim -There is street noise on the mountain view side of the hotel but good blackout curtainsSo figure out if this hotel meets what you want, if so it is great. If you want a on beach resort, this is not the hotel for you.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights on out recent Oahu trip. The check in process was super smooth and easy and the front desk employee was very friendly. The room was impeccably clean and spacious enough for the two of us. The bed was very comfortable so we both got good night’s sleep on all nights. The location of the hotel is just awesome. Close to everything! It was easy to rent beach chairs, umbrella, mats, and towels. Every staff member we ran into at the hotel was very friendly. We will definitely stay here again!

It was a wonderful week in Oahu. Staying at the Hyatt Centric Hotel was a great choice. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean and the beach was in walking distance. Enjoyed the entire stay.

There is no restaurant on site.. only does breakfast then no food available after 11am.. pool is as many others warn not a pool but an ankle deep splash around -great for toddlers but not for an adult to cool off. Resort fees plus accommodation tax is an absolute joke! Not at all a resort it's a inner city hotel

An often overlooked "gem" is the Hyatt Centric Waikiki. The entire staff is 100% committed to customer service and satisfaction. The facility is NOT the "box hotel" with long hallways and cookie cutter rooms lining both sides. Neither is this property a massive high rise filled with endless "time share" suites. Instead this hotel is populated with room architectures that vary from floor to floor, wonderful floor to ceiling windows with views of both mountain and seas. Beautifully appointed, extremely quiet, a wonderful outdoor pool area that appeals to the entire family, special activities such as yoga are available and constantly changing. All of this is combined with a staff that knows how to smile, knows how to make you feel welcome. This hotel is heaven in paradise. I have stayed here multiple times and always hated to leave. I am NOT a Hyatt employee!

It was a bit far from Waikiki Beach, but there was no difficulty traveling with my parents on family trips. Rather, it was very convenient to have a variety of discount stores and famous restaurants nearby. It is a little bit unfortunate that we do not have a balcony, but it is generally very good

My wife and I had a wonderful time, the people of Hawaii was great, the adventures was wonderful, the tours we took around the Islands was very educating to us, Learning all about the history of Hawaii was very good to know, I am sure I will be talking about this trip forever.

This is a hidden gem. Large rooms that are quiet and kept very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The only down side is the lack of a restaurant inside the hotel, but there are ample places to eat close to the hotel. Wonderful place to stay!

Having been to Oahu many times, we wanted something different for our extended family. We choose Hyatt Centric Waikiki Hotel.The old Waikiki Trade Center was extensively renovated several years ago and the Hyatt Centric has the entire building with parking from the 3rd floor to 6th floor, hotel offices on the 7th floor, hotel lobby on the 8th floor, and guest rooms from 9th floor to 22nd floor.At the front desk, we were warmly greeted and welcomed as if we were returning guests. The staff was very friendly.Our room #2108 was two queens with an ocean view. Our view overlooked the many rooftops and flanked by the Waikiki Beachcomber Hotel and the Top of Waikiki (Hawaii’s only revolving restaurant) on top of the Waikiki Business Plaza building. The view was very nice with the floor to ceiling windowsOur room was very spacious with 2 queen beds and with a large dresser, large screen TV, and wardrobe closet combination unit. Krueger Coffeemaker, mini-refrigerator, safe, and a comfortable easy chair and ottoman completed the room. Even the bathroom was very large with separate water closet (heated seat) and a soaking tub inside a very humongous walk-in shower. ((Every night I would shower and then soak in the tub...very relaxing. Later, I found out that the soaking tub is not available in all guest rooms, but those room ending in xx08)).The guest room were well decorated and coordinated in light off-whites with hardwood floor in entrance foyer and bathroom. There were 1-USB port and 2-electric plugs on the each side of the night stand for charging.The public areas were well decorated, very inviting, and comfortable atmosphere on the 8th floor lobby with boarding pass printer, fitness center, an outdoor pool/deck, restaurant & bar.Boarding Pass Printer: Two desktop computers & printer are available 24/7 for ready access.Fitness Center (24/7)The fitness room is small size with good variety of equipment — the treadmills, bicycle machines, step master, free weights along with hot & cold water dispenser and towels.Pool/Deck (6am-10pm): At the pool area, there are 3 wading pools. One with 3-foot depth hot pool (100 degree temperature), second one with depth ranging from 3-inches to 9-inches depth, and the third one with a 14-inches depth. There were several cabanas, half-dome chairs, many lounge chairs throughout the deck area.Restaurant (6am – 11am): The breakfast buffet tends to be hearty and adequate. Fresh juices - grapefruit, orange, passion fruit ; milk- regular, 2%, non-fat; four cold box cereals are available; fresh fruits - cantaloupe, grape, and oranges; yogurt; hot scramble eggs and meat (rotates every day -- sausage, sausage patty, or bacon); waffles or pancakes; baked goods - croissants, coffee cake, muffins, bread (white, wheat, and rye); and hot tea or coffee. Also omelettes are made to order (egg whites only are also available).Bar (2pm – 9pm): The bar is adjacent to the lounge arewhich was especially nice since it was quiet setting for sitting & relaxing with the Hawaiian motif. There is parking in the garage in the building and wifi.The Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and Internal Marketplace Shopping Center are within 5 minutes walking distance from Hotel. Nordstrom’s Rack and Ross Dress for Less are next door on the same block.Waikiki Trolley Stop #1 is one block away. The trolley lines cover Waikiki Beach area and the dining scene area. The Honolulu public transit system “The Bus” provides easy access from Waikiki area to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Downtown, Chinatown, Iolani Palace (the only palace on US soil), and the airport. In a nutshell:Bed mattress - firm and very comfortable Pillow - several pillows & fluffyBathroom - very roomyShower - separate, very roomy & hand sprayTub - high side tub & great for soaking Sofa & Chair - comfortable & no sunken spotsElec Outlets/USB ports - yes ... at night stand View - good ocean view between buildingNatural Lighting - southern exposureElectrical Lighting - good for relaxing & readingRoom Cleanliness- YesFresh Linens & Towels - YesStaff - very friendly & helpful Public Space - very relaxing and comfortableSince this building was formerly office building, there are several types of guest room layouts. Staying at Waikiki, there is no better place with a nearby beach and CENTRAL LOCATION ... than at Hyatt Centric Waikiki.

Best hotel on Waikiki for its value. About 3 blocks from the beach. Wonderful and helpful staff. The hotel pool is only 3 feet deep so it is great for small children. Nicely furnished rooms, just wish the rooms have balconies.

I had moved to this hotel as the one I had originally booked did not meet my standard. This hotel is incredible! The rooms are so clean, new and the interior design of the entire place is stunning. The hotel staff were so accommodating and the pool are was fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is walking distance to the beach and all the main shops of Waikiki!

I had a great experience with this hoteI. I had a red eye and they were able to get me into my room first thing in the morning, enabling me to sleep and relax. The hotel was also clean and nicely decorated. Highly recommend for a simple and enjoyable place to stay.

Hotel is very clean with nice breakfast. Good walking to sites. Unfortunately they have spent a lot of a faux pool. Not sure why someone would want to use the pool here. I was very disappointed.Would not return.

Two Words = Awesome HotelOnly stayed for one night because I had comp nights at the Hyatt Regency. However for that one night Mr Richard Elliott and staff made sure that my wife and I were taken care of.Big Mahalos to the Hyatt Centric Waikiki

This hotel and staff are awesome! They tend to all your needs and the rooms are fantastic. If you are staying in downtown Waikiki Beach this is the place to stay! Great restaurant's surrounding the hotel.

First time in Hawaii, beautiful property! Close to downtown, beach and shopping. Staff was excellent,very accommodating. Loved the pool area, very comfortable.Friday night music night was a nice added feature.

the room was very nice.the hotel staff were very friendly.the hotel charges a resort fee which is expensive.the breakfast is quite ordinary.parking is very expensive though the valet staff were exceptional.this hotel is very nice rooms are modern and well appointed howeverit is costly and there is room for improvement.

We stayed here because of our stay at its sister hotel in Chicago last summer (see my review). This relatively new property is less spartan, however, given its excellent proximity to Waikiki Beach and a purely resort (rather than business) area. Hotel rooms are basic but fully functional and comfortable, and extremely quiet. Hotel staff are exceedingly helpful and accommodating. Breakfast in the dining room is fantastic. Make use of the concierge services; they’re great.

I think it's not a big different if I am a member or not. Only thing that I have was late check out which is very great.location is very good. I hope I will have a better experience to stay in Hyatt next time.

First timers to Hawaii, stayed in the Hyatt Centrick Waikiki Beach. Would stay here again in a heart beat. We were greeted at the front desk so warmly, my family of 4 with wife and two girls were given flavoured water while they waited for me to check in, then they were greeted with beaded leis, classy touch. The hotel is 10 min walk away from Waikiki beach, 1 min away from a starbucks, macdonalds, and an IHOP as well as local fare. The hotel is amazing, the room we stayed in had two queen beds, a pull out double couch and looked like it had just been renovated, the bathroom was beautiful and room spacious. The hotel has a hot tub, the pool is "modern style"...meaning it's only 12 inches deep, it is not a swimming pool but more of a wading pool. but still it is beautiful. The loors have water stations for filling water cannisters, which is nice. The conceirge service is brilliant. going to the beach? the Concierge will pack your car with beach chairs, boogie boards , beach umbrellas, and towels at no charge extra. They also have a GOPRo for loan at no charge for the day. Our stay was 1 week and would we stay there again, ABSOLUTELY....this hotel is worth it's weight in gold for hospitality, cleanliness, and ammenities.. Book this hotel, you would not regret it one bit.

We had a great stay at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. It's in a great location- just a short walk from the beach and a lot of great places to eat. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the staff were always friendly and helpful. The splash pool was perfect for our young kids to safely play in while the adults relaxed in the cabanas or hot tub. We would definitely stay here again.

This is a great place to stay while visiting Hawaii. It’s minutes from the Waikiki beach and where all the shops and restaurants are. The reception area has a really calming feel about it and staff are really friendly and helpful. The room at the Hyatt was lovely clean and had a great bathroom. The shower was great! There is USB ports in the bedside tables for charging which was really handy. Although there were reports that the breakfast at the Hyatt is very basic I felt there was a good choice on offer and enjoyed it. There was also reports that the pool is only ankle deep. This is true but it’s lovely a lovely area to sunbathe. There’s a hot tub and plenty of sun loungers to relax. If you’re going to the beach the hotel provides towels and deck chairs in the form of a back pack so easy to carry. I had a lovely stay at the Hyatt Centric and would recommend this hotel.

I stopped here every week when Tavana was playing. Happy hour appetizers are ok. Setting is great. Check who is performing since Tavan has moved on to Queen Kapiolanei Hotel near the zoo. Happy hours are a great way to save a bit on food prices, try different foods and enjoy local musicians.

We have stayed here twice. Modern, clean, close to everything. Stay on higher floors - hotel starts on 7th floor and it is very noisy. Lots of Waikiki street noise - garbage trucks early in the morning. Otherwise a very good location and staff is good.

The hotel is located in a great spot in Waikiki and is an easy 2-block walk to the main shopping strip, restaurants and the beach. The room was beautiful, although the bathroom is under lit and we ended up in a corner room with a single small window. We were overall happy with the room but really disliked the poor view and the dark bathroom. The lobby, restaurant, and rooftop pool area are beautiful. The buffet breakfast was surprisingly good. We usually do not expect great quality from an 'expensive' hotel breakfast, but it was a great breakfast.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April 2019. We chose this hotel to be close to downtown Waikiki but not one of the super expensive right-along-the-beach hotels. It is in a fantastic location, easily walkable to Royal Hawaiian Center, international marketplace, etc. There’s a Starbucks Reserve at the ground level. Bus stop right outside. This hotel is only about 2 years old and still feels new! Our room had a very modern feel. Loved the shower and the toilet with the heated seat! Very clean. The Expedia concierge desk helped us book tours and gave us some excellent money saving advice. We also loved the water bottles with water filling stations in the hotel. Great feature. Very friendly front desk staff. Only downside is that the pool is not really a pool, but we knew that going in. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again or another Hyatt Centric property!

Great hotel, location excellent ...beautiful room and decor was lovely.Market right around the corner, NORMSTROM RACK store in case you forgot somethingExcellent Car rental next door(NATIONAL) drove around the island and dropped car off at airport...get them to throw in the drop off fee! Dukes Market...great for a fresh pizza and beautiful dinner spot...forget the crowds on the main strip...nice quaint spot

Great location, nice little 10 minute walk to the beach. Lots of food options around. Staff was awesome, always polite and courteous. Parking was a little much, but worth it. Deep soaking tub was too small for me and I’m 6’4

Really cool. Free s’mores. Relaxing. Close to food. Staff was great. Rooms are nice. They let us use a go pro daily. Boogie boards and even brought a beta fish to out room so we had a pet to take care of. The breakfast was a deal

Friendly and professional staff. Very clean and modern. Lots of spaciousness. Great pool and entertaining area. Staff were very approachable and willing to go the extra mile. The gym was excellent. Great location.

Beautiful concept of Hyatt. Practical and edgy. Utterly comfy and cozy and relaxing. The bathroom with bidet is fab! Love it so much. The people there are very friendly, and the service very good and responsive. Please keep up the good work!

Stayed at Hyatt Centric Waikiki April 22-26 and it was one of the best hotels ever!! Asaki was so helpful from the moment we checked in, and continued to make sure everything was going well with the stay. Super clean, very friendly, outstanding staff, I loved every minute of my stay and will definitely be back.

Excellent location, wonderful and attentive housekeeping services and beautifully appointed room! From check in through check out, including concierge and valet, customer service was excellent. Would definitely recommend and will hopefully return some day!

A short trip the the island for work. Added just a bit of relaxation. Hotel was nicely located in center of Waikiki. Short walk to the beach. It was great that they had chairs for you to use and the water bottles not only were convenient but nice to save environment too.

The Hyatt Centric has a fantastic central location in Waikiki. We were greeted with a drink and shell lei. Very nice! The staff provides beach towels, chairs, umbrella, aloe vera, etc. Our 19th floor ocean view was absolutely amazing. Highly recommended.

I was traveling with my baby and good thing was they give pack and play type of crib which I find it much better than the old style wooden or aluminum cribs. I however expected the hotel to be in super good shape as it was newly opened in 2018 but the sheets and the room conditions were not as nice as I expected it to be (not bad but not as super nicely new) The room sizes are bigger than the normal hotels that you would stay in. Pools are find with hot jacuzzi too but not for adults swimming. It is very shallow which would do only good for the kids. The biggest reason that I gave “average” for this hotel was because the hotel was very noisy (even at nights). I had to move my room after one night because I couldn’t sleep due to construction noises - i found out where the noise came from. It was from the elevator motors that was right below the room which was awful. Then the new room that I moved in also had this hideous sounds which I think was because of the parking lot right below. Some creepy machine sounds late at night and even in early mornings. Other than that, most of the staff were very kind and friendly and within the resort fee that I have to pay, they provide all kinds of beach stuff (boogie board, beach towels, chairs, umbrellas, and even sun screen and after sun aloes) so if you do stay with the hotel, pls try to fully leverage those privileges. Oh one more thing that I remembered - the restaurant that is in the lobby floor only serve breakfast which staff are not very helpful - they don’t come around to take orders... do not recommend...Takes one big block plus crossing the street to access to the beach so if you plan on going to the beach every day, would recommend a closer hotel.

Was really happy to be with hyatt centric, excellent customer service. Dan the front office mannager his team was great with ready to help and smile. Highly recommend and wonderful location so central never can get bored shop, stroll, eat and beach.

Staying at the Hyatt Centric in Waikiki was amazing! The staff was so friendly and welcoming to our family of 4 (2 adults, 5 year old, and 1.5 year old). On top of that, they have great beach equipment for rent at no charge (beach towels, beach chairs, beach umbrellas, sunscreen, and even a GoPro if you reserve it in advance). It made our trip so much more convenient. Also, it’s location is perfect for finding food nearby as well as hitting up the beach just 2 blocks away. We also took 2 day trips around the island and National Car rental is literally around the corner so it was easy to rent, come downstairs, load up the car with the kids AND the free beach rental equipment at the bell desk, and then be on our way. Next time we’re in Waikiki, this is definitely where we’re staying again.

Great location. Close to everything. Short walk to the beach. The 2 queen suite was huge. Very open and clean. Beds were comfortable. Small pool but why bother with the pool when you have the best beaches in the world.

We stayed at this hotel for three years in a row. The staff is always very friendly and provides impeccable service. The room is spacious and very clean. Definitely would come back for our next vacation in Oahu.

Great location. Only a 5 min walk from the beach. Lots of good eats located close by. Offers free GoPro and beach amenities. Stayed on floor 21, it was super windy that week so could hear the wind rustling when you’re that high, so hard to sleep at first. Not the hotels fault, just unlucky weather!

Had a great experience at Hyatt Centric. If you want to get close to shopping and restaurants,. then this is the place to stay. The hotel is conveniently located. Check in was do efficient and quick. We chose the green option which meant that we received a room credit instead of getting the room cleaned daily. We still had out towels and bathroom amenities topped up at our request. Loved the spacious room and modern decor. Will be staying here again on my next visit.

We stayed here during our brief stay in Waikiki. Everything was as expected or better. The only downside was not being directly on the beach, but it was only a 5 minute walk so not terrible at all. Service staff was great and extremely helpful!

The hotel is very nice and close to all of the shopping, beach, restaurants, and local convenient stores. The hotel room could have had a microwave and some type of music connectivity in it. The fridge was small. I didn’t like the fact that you had to scan your room key in the elevator to go to any floor, every time. Especially when you have bags in both hands and the key is in your wallet. The view from the ocean view suite was very nice. Hotel was very very clean, and all workers were very friendly and approachable. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

We don't want you to know how comfortable, clean, easy and happy we were to stay at the Hyatt Centric as it may get too popular!!! lolThe friendly staff, the location and the feeling of value was very assuring.

The pool deck is a great place to relax during their happy hour and especially when they have live music. Good place for a after work meeting or just to kick back. Love the Starbucks Reserve on the first floor.

This hotel has a great relaxing vibe, and the rooms are very well appointed. Have stayed at this hotel multiple times, and each time it has been a great experience. The staff are very attentive and friendly.

Coming back from the North Shore we stayed for one night. The next day we left for a cruise. The room we had was large it was like new. Bathroom large and everything was very clean. It was a short walk to the beach and everything was furnished, beach chairs umbrella and towels.

We have been to Waikiki many times and this was our first stay at Hyatt Centric and we will definetly stay at this property again. The check in was a breaze. The rooms were very new, stylish and comfortable and surprisingly large for Waikiki.

Great hotel! Bathroom was very nice and large. Staff was friendly and accommodating! Lei-making was a highlight! Everything was new and very nice. Would be nice if the room could have a microwave but everything else was great!

Hyatt Centric reminded me of a loved great uncle of mine who never owned anything that didn't rely on a piece of another item to work. That is, there were a few things you'd look at and thing it was an interesting choice. Nothing particular damaging or irritating, but more whimsical. Things like an air conditioner that made so much noise you occasionally felt the Island of Oahu was moving a bit to the left, or a bathroom that led you to believe someone in the Hyatt Design Team is a Salvadore Dali fan, or the strangely robotic toilet seat. Some fun quirks that gave the property some character. So that combined with some great service and a good location earns them my four stars. Where they loose almost 1.5 stars is the pool and the resort fee. The pool that they seem to use as the hero shot in all the advertising is in reality ankle deep. So shallow enough to wade through, but deep enough to totally destroy your phone should it accidentally fall.

Hyatt Centric is not a beachfront hotel, but for us, it was perfectly situated for a week in Waikiki. The walk to the beach was about 6-8 minutes, there's a Starbucks and Jamba Juice in the foyer for Coffee and breakfast, and right outside the door there are great places to eat and shop, with the main bus route running along the street behind.What we liked most of all was the very clean, very quiet, decent sized room. While most places in Hawaii go for a tired tropical look, this place was sleek and modern with great.staff.It's not worth paying for a beach view room, as the ocean is some distance away, and the view often blocked by other high rises. Choose a suite, like us, if you want a small separate lounge but the room was big enough without it. Bathroom was a decent size that opened out to the bedroom which some people may find off putting.Be warned, if a pool is important, the pool here is more for effect, as it is very shallow for preening around and splashing your feet.The extortionate "resort fee" US hotels have taken up with gusto in recent years at least delivers some value here, with free towels, beach chairs, water bottles, filling stations and WiFi (but this should be simply standard with any room rate as it would be in most other countries.) We really enjoyed our stay here, and though it delivered great value for a high class modern hotel, close to the action and a short walk from the beach. Contrary to some recent reviews here we saw nothing remotely threatening from the neighbourhood or its inhabitants.

Not a good place to take a family. Within a block of beach if you cut through other resorts, but don't get caught or you will be treated like a criminal! About 6 blocks to walk around all other resorts. Prostitutes down stairs were very friendly, and the homeless were not shy to approach you at every turn!

This property was very well situated along the main strip in Waikiki. Make no mistake, this is not a beach property. That being said, while Waikiki beach is iconic, there are much nicer beaches to lounge at for the day such as Lanikai. The hotel does provide beach chairs, towels and a parasol free of charge.The bar food is all but non existent and the drinks are pricy. The hot tub is nice and we did use it most evenings. It gets very windy so be warned. The pool in the picture is NOT a pool. It is barely deep enough to cover your legs and is mostly for kids to splash around in during the day. We paid extra for the ocean view, which was ok, but not great. The property is still far from the beach and there are plenty of tall buildings in the way to obstruct the view. If you are just looking for a nice place to stay within easy walking distance of everything, and courteous staff then the Centric is worthy of consideration. This is especially true if you rent a car. If you need to be right on the ocean and have a perfect view from your room, this is not the place for you.

We have had the pleasure of staying at this hotel numerous times. Malia and Glenn are two of our favorite employees at this hotel. They are very welcoming and always remember us by name. From being able to adopt a comfort fish for an evening to getting a drink poolside, this hotel has everything you could possibly need. The rooms are beautiful! My room had a bathtub straight out of heaven! Love love love this place!

Great place to stay away from the hustle and bustle, but a very short walk to the corner of the street and you are right at shops, restaurants, entertainment etc. We had an ocean view room on the 15th floor, unfortunately we looked down on to car parks so would recommend if you want a true ocean view you would need to be on a higher floor. Although it is not near the water so view is from a distance.This didn't bother us as we were hardly in our room and view was not important. We asked for a quite room and we definitely got one - thank you so much, much appreciated! The rooms are clean, tidy and the floor to ceiling glazing ensures that the room has plenty of natural light with black out curtains if you need a sleep in! All in all we had a wonderful stay in Hawaii and can't wait to go back. Would definitely book the Hyatt Centric again.

Outstanding guest service. Beautiful room and hotel. Great Location. Easy access self-parking. Pool and hot tub would have been excellent too. However, kids were allowed to play in the tub and hot tub was not hot.

The location of this hotel is perfect, it’s central to various Waikiki attractions, great shopping and returaunts. Easy to get an Uber anywhere or just walk. Our room was very spacious and clean and beautiful. I would definitely stay here again!

Hyatt Centric was excellent from the moment we arrived to checking out. The room, property and lounge itself are beautiful, but it was the staff that really made it shine. Somehow everyone that works at this hotel seemed genuinely happy and wanted to help or make our stay more comfortable.Our check in host also resembled Drew Barrymore! She started us off to a great stay, and then the front bell staff were always super helpful with getting us beach gear, helping direct us and with our rental car, always with a genuine smile. The only crappy part in our whole experience was that the pool section is tiny, and there isn't really a pool, but the only deeper part is the hot tub, which unfortunately was occupied by half a dozen kids at all times. Overall we miss Hyatt Centric even now as we moved onto Kauai and a new hotel, and we definitely will visit again next time in Oahu.Oh, also the location is fantastic, and literally walking distance to everything popular around Waikiki.

What a wonderful experience! I had a brief conversation via email with a Hyatt rep a few days prior to arrival and told them that the trip was a surprise for my 11 yr old daughter and they put balloons in our room for her and a lovely note! You are in the heart of everything...a couple of blocks from the beach, shopping is just next door, a mall, and fabulous restaurants are steps away! We really enjoyed the trip and the staff at this hotel are friendly and helpful! We even booked our Luau through them and saved money and time! Aloha Hyatt!!

The location of the hotel is perfect. I love the fact that it is located in the center of the city, but not so far from the beach. The friendliness of the hotel concierge is another advantage, and I would like to recommend this hotel to everyone.

I must say that this hotel was very nice. For my first visit to Honolulu, I had very high hopes. And in most areas, the hotel didn't disappoint. The room was nice and spacious, the breakfast was excellent and the front desk staff were kind and helpful. Where I did have an issue was with housekeeping. For whatever reason, the housekeeping person missed my room everyday. If I went to breakfast at 10am (chatted up friends there or other hotel patrons) and came back at 12pm, my room still wasn't cleaned. By the end of the week, she was coming back to clean my room at 3pm or 4pm. I would see her at the top of the hall when I was leaving for breakfast and when I came back later, she would be at the other end of hall. (having missed my room altogether. (my room was about halfway through the hallway) One time, I had to call down to the front desk because she had left the floor having missed my room once again. I mentioned the issue to them and they said it would be corrected. And whenever I saw her in the hall, she was always super apologetic but the next day it was still the same thing. Although the property was very nice, I probably wouldn't stay there again. (for fear that I would end up with the same person working on my floor)

If you're still thinking about where to stay when on Oahu, think no more. The Hyatt Centric Waikiki is a great place to stay with everything you'd want to do and see when in Waikiki within walking distance. The service is excellent. The gym is a bit small and if you're vacationing during a busy time of the year and like to get a workout in, check the times because it can get very busy given how small the gym is and limited the equipment is. Staff is super friendly, the room is one of the biggest there is for a hotel in Waikiki. Valet is a bit expensive but not more than most in Waikiki. The cost of the room is on the higher side and please be aware they charge a resort fee when really this is more of just a hotel rather than a resort. HYATT, PLEASE DO AWAY WITH THE RESORT FEE HERE AT THE CENTRIC UNTIL YOU CAN PROVIDE MORE OF A RESORT ATMOSPHERE and guaranteed more people would choose the Centric. All in all, it was a great place to stay. I would think twice about staying here if they still choose to charge the resort fee and make the gym bigger offering more equipment but otherwise, I d choose this place simply for the great staff, great service, cleanliness and close vicinty to everything on Waikiki.

My daughter and I visited Waikiki to tour wedding venues. The Hyatt is new hotel with a central location. It is not on the beach but it is about a 1/2 block away. Perfect for our needs. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the rooms were clean and quiet. The only negative I would say is some of the properties surrounding it are run down but it seems as though it is in the midst of redevelopment.

As our family began it's Hawaiian adventure, Oahu and Wakiki was our first stop. I read reviews on hotels on/near Waikiki beach and the Hyatt Centric kept jumping out at me. VERY glad we decided to stay at this hotel. The employees were incredibly nice and welcoming. The Hotel has a lovely lobby, pool area, and restaurant that we dined at for breakfast. It was an added bonus and very welcomed amenity that the hotel offers complimentary beach towels, chairs, umbrellas, and sunscreen for it's guests. We had a suite with two queen beds, as well as a pull out couch in it's only little area. There were curtains to partition that sleeping area off from the rest of the room. Our family makeup is two parents and two college kids, so to have a bit of private space was nice. The bathroom was large and well laid out. This room was a great size for the 4 of us to spend 2 nights and the location could not be beat. Right in the heart of all the shopping and a quick walk/couple of blocks, to the beach. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Hotel is reasonably priced and centrally located, and only a 10-minute walk to the beach. It's clean and modern, with friendly, helpful staff. My room was comfortable: A single king-sized bed, a generously sized bathroom, a wardrobe, and a shower. Note that there's no full length mirror or bathtub. For those looking for a tropical vacation atmosphere, this likely wouldn't meet your criteria as the bar and pool area has a very business feel to them. The bar is located inside the building and only open from 5-9 or something along those lines. The lobby isn't open-air, which is a shame, considering Hawaii's often-beautiful balmy weather. The pool looks like it could belong to a small hotel in Vegas—it's a small chlorinated wading pool, with a hot tub on one end. Plastic lounge chairs are attached to the sides, inside the pool so people can dangle a hand or foot into the water to cool down. For those who book later flights departing the island, note that there isn't a courtesy room to shower, so if you want to spend the morning at the beach, then be prepared to smell like the ocean and sunscreen on your flight (not a bad thing, I guess?). Overall, I think this is a nice, comfortable hotel. Just keep in mind that it has a sterile, business-like feel rather than a tropical vacation-like atmosphere, and you're good. Of course, if you're on the island for business, this hotel would be fantastic.

Loved our stay. First time in Oahu, and this hotel was at the perfect location. Can walk to the ocean, plenty of restaurants, shows, and shopping within minutes. Great family hotel with friendly service. Extra plus is Starbucks downstairs. Will be staying here when we come back. Love how modern and clean the hotel is.

Where do I begin? Our stay at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach during the first week of March 2019 was an absolute blast. From Check in to Check out, every interaction with hotel staff was on point. Details: We opted for an Ocean View Suite on the 12th floor for our 4 nights in the Hyatt. This included breakfast every morning at the Lanai restaurant.Check In: Very quick and easy. Upon arrival, we were greeted with shell Lei's and a pineapple drink (this is included in the mandatory resort fee, so take advantage!). 5 mins to get my room key.Room: Absolute perfection. Although a bit oddly shaped, the room itself was clean, modern, and the bathroom was out of this world. Had an amazing shower as well as a bath tub, and a SUPER awesome Toto Bidet toilet.
