Warm toilet seat all the time! Our housekeeper, Rovie, was attentive to every detail, and even arranged our toiletries out in an organized manner. These small details put this experience over the top. Came with two Hyatt water bottles, as well as bath robes.Service: Every hotel employee we spoke to went to extreme lengths to help answer our questions. Special shoutout to Kani and Malia at the check in desk. They were quick to set up a turn down service, or help us with returning a rental car. We were celebrating an anniversary, and the hotel staff gave us a free champagne toast. Wei, at the hotel restaurant, was pleasant and super helpful during breakfast times.Overall: I would HIGHLY recommend staying here. A combination of amazing staff, great facilities, and a solid location make the Hyatt Centric Waikiki THE place to stay in Waikiki. You're a 200 step walk to the beach, which is nice, since you get to avoid the crowds that take up the beach front hotels in Waikiki.Looking forward to our next stay there!

This is a nice hotel, a few blocks from Waikiki Beach. The room we had was quite spacious. The only disappointing area was the pool area. They only had a pool which was a couple of inches deep. The purpose seems to be that you sit on chairs and rest your feet in it. There was a spa, but in the warmth of Honolulu, it would be nice to have a deeper pool

Hotel was great! Only complaint would be turn the heater up on the hot tub, especially when the weather is cold and add a universal fitness machine to the gym. They have room for it and dumbbells don’t work for muscle junkies. Mahalo....

The staff and management, notably Malia, Dan and Kam, were very friendly and accommodating. My pregnant wife and I had a late flight on our check out date and they were able to accommodate our needs in terms of timing and comfort for my wife. Location is excellent, rooms are spacious, breakfast staff were attentive and knew what we want before we could ask. Would definitely recommend staying at Hyatt Centric.

Alex Lu at the front desk was amazing! He provided the best service throughout my stay during our vacation in Hawaii in December 2018. He remembers my husband and I every year we visit Hawaii and always makes sure we have everything we need for our stays. The amenities were awesome, the location is awesome right in the middle of downtown. Easy walking to great eats and shopping. Love the water bottle touch in the rooms and the filtered water for refills in the hotel. A very modern contemporary feel hotel. We made a connection with one of the housekeeping staff because we saw her everyday. She always asked if we needed anything but being so low maintenance we really didnt need much. She always took the time to ask us anyways. Unfortunately we dont remember her name. We knew she was heading to Vegas with her family for the first time and we shared with her all the places she should visit while in Vegas. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future. Ultimately the staff would be the reason we would return to the Hyatt Centric especially Alex!

My friend and I stayed for a girls getaway / belated birthday celebration. We had a great experience and are looking forward to staying again. The only two critical points I’d make is the buffet breakfast value for me isn’t there, for the price it seemed like there was too basic of variety for guests. The other, would be the fitness room definitely needs a mirror. I do a lot of weight training and like to check form during reps, this is fairly minor but wanted to present my feedback. Overall a wonderful stay, rooms are spacious and very bright. The in-room speaker was an added bonus as well! Would definitely recommend staying here, location is also phenomenal.

This is my second stay at the Hyatt Centric. The last time was May 2018. I returned because my last stay was great; hotel was in great shape, friendly staff, and an onsite bar/restaurant. That was NOT the case on my latest stay. Carpet in hallway smelled like urine, pool had trash and towels laying around and the chairs were missing cushions; no more open restaurant for lunch and dinner, only breakfast; bar tender made a good drink but did not greet me and was grumpy; had to upgrade my room to avoid the noise of the elevator; room was well kept, but the robes showed a lot of wear and tear. Valet attendants were responsive and helpful. Overall the bad outweighed the good and I feel that I did not get the value I paid for and should have chosen another hotel. I will chose a different hotel next time.

Upon checking in, we were offered to wait a couple of extra hours so that the hotel could satisfy our booking requests (high floor, with ocean view), which made us change plans for the entire afternoon. Upon coming back to get the room keys, we realized that the request had not been answered and we were given a room with no view (besides the nearby and very noisy a/c system). When explaining the issue to the hotel crew, we were told that it was due to miscommunication and that there was nothing they could do. Staff was not professional at all and could not have handled the issue in a worse manner. Not a 4 star hotel, and definitely not worth the price!

After a long flight, this was a welcome respite. Good location to walk to beach and restaurants. Very friendly service all around. Very nice room with floor to ceiling windows for great views. Very quiet which is important in a hotel.

Love this hotel. Lovely, spacious and modern. They let us check in early. Comfortable beds, ocean views and very welcoming. Love the big flat screen tv’s in both rooms. Free water bottles and refill stations. The bathroom is amazing with a separate bathtub in the shower area. Would love to return. The buffet breakfast is average. Disappointed that you have to pay for any coffee other than the old basic coffee. Espresso is not expensive to produce. If you charge for breakfast or include breakfast don’t charge for coffee! The hotel is close to everything and in a great location.

Tiare Inagaki (front desk receptionist) was definitely a highlight of our experience with Hyatt Centric - she was so wonderful and so knowledgeable! We appreciated her so much with all her recommendations from the room stay to all her foodie/travel tips! She was really amazing! Please acknowledge and praise her for giving us such a great welcoming experience! Also, as for the breakfast - definitely awesome options! Although, I wish there was some spam available as one of the breakfast options. That would’ve been superb to add onto the menu! I did like that the menu changes every day but wished there was a spam option - since we are in Hawaii! Until next time for sure! The room we stayed in was soooo nice and clean. We had an awesome view of the ocean! We stayed on the 21st floor, a corner room that had the perfect view of the Waikiki strip and the ocean. Sooo pretty to wake up to. We would definitely stay here again for sure! Make sure you book a penthouse level room! And be on the lookout for Tiare! She’s amazing! :)

Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Everyone made you feel comfortable. The interior of the hotel is awesome! The colors, furniture, and decor gave it originality. Thank you Hyatt Centric for being so awesome.

The pool was a little disappointing for my children as it was not a full sized pool, but everything else was great. The facility & room was very clean & the staff were very friendly & accommodating. The breakfast buffet was great as well. We'll be visiting again soon.

This hotel is not located on the beach and only has a dipping pool. If you are looking for a hotel on the beach with swimming pool, this is not for you.We used the hotel as a base for exploring the island and found it very comfortable and convenient. Rooms are large and bright and renovated. Very comfortable.You can get chairs and umbrellas to take to the beach which is about a 5 to 10 minute walk.We did not have breakfast at the hotel. It's not very good at all and very expensive for what is offered.There is a Kona coffee and bakery just around the corner which has amazing baked goods.We were very happy and comfortable in this hotel.

One of the many reasons our visit to Honolulu was fantastic was the perfect choice to stay in Hyatt Centric - homely and cozy hotel with attention to details in the guest room. It was beyond expectations to have the largest room we ever stayed in a 4-star hotel - modern, clean, complete amenities,perfect placement of mirrors which some 4-star hotels lacked, quiet A/C unit, bath towels smell good unlike in some 4-star hotels (stinky smell due perhaps to the choice of laundry detergent) and giant TV! Great location as the hotel is a walking distance to the shopping streets, restaurants, stores, malls, etc. Indeed an excellent base not only for a conference but also for an unforgettable holiday. With friendly and gracious front desk staff, attentive staff at the ground level, the hotel is a relaxing haven!
user_name:
Dirk S
French Riviera - Cote d'Azur, France

review_body: This was our fifth time staying at the hotel and it was absolutely amazing! We stayed in one of the suites on the seventh floor and the room was gigantic. My oldest daughter had a few friends over and had their own section in the room to have a sleepover. The girls did not ever want to leave the pool as they love that it’s only around 2 feet deep. Dan and Alex set up our stay for success and Diana, Sammy, and Jamie knocked the rest out of the park! We have stayed in most of the big hotels in Waikiki, as we’ve lived on the island for more than 10 years and Centric is the one they keep asking to go back to. Thank you again Centric Team for a wonderful stay!

Excellent Service from all employees: Front Desk, Housekeeping, Valet, Restaurant, etc. It is very obvious the Hyatt Centric appreciates our business; always a smile, a "hello, how are you today", etc. The Suites are perfect, and truly feel like home and not "just a hotel room". Housekeeping took care of our room perfectly during our 4.5 day stay. This is our 3rd visit to the Hyatt Centric and we have already reserved our next trip in December of this year.

Wonderful ocean view. Great breakfast buffet with made to order omelette. Perfect central Waikiki location made it easy to go to the beach or shopping. Staff was friendly and attentive at the front desk and the restaurant.

We were very happy on our way from Maui to the Hyatt Centric in Waikiki. Arriving in the rain, we decided to go straight to the hot tub and pool, the one we saw in the pictures and had enticed us to stay there. Well they lie about having a pool. The Front Desk described as a "Splash pool"?!? 3 feet of water, a puddle with some chairs around.The "Hot Tub", was also of the same depth and half of your body is out of the water. It was a laughable experience, if it was not extra $45 for parking and "Resort Fees" of $29.I explained in my reservation that I was in Oahu for a medical treatment, so on my check out day I woke up indisposed and requested a late check out, I was willing to pay, but they only gave me 30min. They were 100% full they said, but it did not look busy at all! Terrible place to stay, avoid at all costs!

hyatt centric wakiki beach is very nice location and building is good condition.and nearby many food shop that udung, japaness food corner and pizza shop Mc donald and subway and starbucks i love hyatt centric sea side

Arrived earlier than expected and although room was nit ready unti 3pm, we were surprised to receive a call an hr later saying room was ready. ALL staff were very courteous and helpful. Beautiful spacious and clean rooms. Only little downfall is pool is more of a wading pool but still has a spa and gorgeous grounds.

If you are looking for a newer hotel with modern, up-to-date deco and fancy Bathroom looks nowhere else, this is it! Hyatt Centric Hotel is centralized in the heart of glamorus Waikiki area, within walking distance to shops, restaurants and beaches. It is quieter because it is not right on the beach where you have constant traffic and swarm of tourists loitering along the common area. Lobby is situated on the 3rd flr, Starbucks on ground floor serves special Reserved Coffee. We requested a quiet, high-floor room 1608 with a beautiful city view and also a slight ocean view from a distance! We walked across the street to the end corner and found Island Shave Ice must try that it was so yummy! Definitely recommend Hyatt Centric Waikiki!

We stayed in Waikiki for 8 nights. We were impressed with our room. The bathroom was so nice. The hotel was lovely. We had breakfast one morning and was great. The only issue is the pool. It is a lovely area and the spa pool is big and nice to relax in. The pool is so shallow, like ankle deep. Only appropriate to dip your toes in - The beach is so close but I love to swim. Would’ve been great to have a deeper pool.

The room was pretty big & clean than I expected... the locations are very good for both city trolley and sea side.The only minor uncomportable for me was that there were no hams & yogurt in the morning buffet, these are very common in the european hotels.The front desk was on the 8th floor, all staff were very kind.Expedia local expert was always at the lobby floor, he gave me a good advice & booked a pearl habor tour for our family.

We thought there was going to be a pool but it was only 14 inches deep! Then on Thursday after having too much sun, I wanted to take a break with a nap or a little TV but the power was out so the room was extremely warm and there was only 1working elevator.

IF you are going to Hawaii for the experience and weather you will have to go outside.the rooms are well maintained and spacious but with no balconies or air flow so you can't enjoy the lovely Hawaiian trade winds and ocean.
user_name:
W Alan W
pleasanton, United States

review_body: We had a very busy schedule when visiting Honolulu. I had emailed ahead of time and made a phone call letting the hotel know we needed to check in 2-3 hours early, depending on our flight arrival. They made it sound like it was likely we would be able to. When we arrived, of course we had no room ready. So we had a lot of luggage that had to be locked up and then off we went. All this hotel has on street level is the concierge desk and taxi podium. The lobby was several floors up. This proved to be inconvenient, especially if you needed to use a restroom, talk to the front desk personnel, or retrieve your luggage. I wish I had known this ahead of time, I wouldn't have chosen this hotel. The room was fine except for the fact there was no soap dish of any kind in the shower. So you had to place your soap on the floor and bend over multiple times to pick it up. There are many hotels that work smoothly for your family. This is not one of them, especially for the price!

I was asked daily how my trip was. And concerns such as wifi were immediately addressed. My wifi issue was that I had difficulty logging into additional devices. It was resolved quickly.There is no microwave in rooms. There is a Keurig and refrig. The pool is shallow and more for wading however there is plenty of furniture for guest to enjoy the outside area.

We had a great stay. Nice bright and clean modern rooms, not the usual out-dated “80’s” designs found in most of the hotels in Honolulu. Very friendly and professional staff. Good central location. Will visit again.

In town for a few days to attend a conference. Didn’t want to stay at a beach hotel but wanted nice surroundings and vacation experience for hours after the conference. The front desk manager, Daniel, and his team emailed prior to arrival to prepare for my requests and fulfilled them. Our room was lovely and location was central to the shopping, restaurants, and beach without the crowds and noise. There were conveniences like a full Starbucks and beach equipment (including sunscreen). Mahalo!

A Very Good Hotel, has a very good location and service is great. Lighting in the bathroom could b a little better. Check in and out was very easy. Room I had was very spacious. Would recommend this hotel !!!!!!

First off, the people who work at the hotel are very nice. Unfortunately, the hotel itself was a disappointment. We arrived on a Saturday from the East. Had been up since 3am and needed sleep for our first night, but unfortunately for us, there is a DJ outside at the pool until 10pm and inside until 1am. Our bed was literally vibrating from the loud music underneath us. So miserable! The hotel room itself had very little counter space. We had our clothes piled up on the floor and the couch, as there was nowhere to put them.The bathroom was nice and big, but had a tiny little counter in the middle with one sink,. Again, very little space to put our toiletries. The pool is a very small splash area with a hot tub. The gym is small with subpar at best. They had one bench for all of the people working out. Guests were literally laying on the disgusting ground lifting weights. There was plenty of room for more benches. The hotel just didn't have them. To make matters worse, the ONLY filtered water dispenser on the lobby, pool, fitness floor is in the fitness room itself. There was a parade of guests waiting in line in the fitness room to fill their water bottles for the pool, their rooms, ect. They advertise this hotel as a 4.5 star. Not even close. I will never go to this hotel again and will discourage anyone I know from staying there.

I feel confused on what to write for this review as the hotel was nice, clean and the staff were nice but not very knowledgable about the area. There were a few extra charges that were not economically friendly for families. Parking was a bit high, so if you rented a car for the ease of family airport and travel maybe only get it for the days needed. If you needed a microwave to steam baby bottles, depending who you asked it was $10/$15 American a day! For a week stay to have sanitary bottles was insane. We also were under the impression we booked the room we ended up getting as an upgrade for $50/ day more. The photos on the booking we selected were not what we booked and ended up being the upgraded room. We were counting on the solid door between rooms for the kids privacy/ noise so again we were stuck with another hidden fee. Our rooms were not cleaned and we were told we had to call each day for room service. It was a bit of a gamble on what would be done when they came, sometimes leaving wet towels or an unmade bed behind. I get this is their busy season but room servicing should just happen. The pool also isn’t a full size pool. It’s about 1 foot deep. My toddler loved it but we were hoping to all enjoy a swim. The ocean was close so that wasn’t a big deal! It was close to all the shops and busy downtown Waikiki and a close walk to the beach.

The hotel is gorgeous! Everything is clean and new. The room.had an amazing view and bathroom was so modern and clean. Location was perfect for walking anywhere in Waikiki. The staff was so welcoming, warm, and helpful. Filled us with the Aloha spirit.

The hotel is clean and the cleaning crew especially Ellen is super nice but the rest is not. We have noticed that not every guest get treated fairly. There were a few instances where Vince the front door guy would ignore us even when we said hi and not open the door for us not that we need him to do it. But the problem is he then said hi and opened doors to others. Every guest should get the same equal treatment. In addition, the hotel staff should know that we have been staying here for the last 5 days, the front door staff/bellman should not question whether or not I’m a guest to get an umbrella. Management should make the front door staff take some extra training on customer service and hospitality because other hotels in Waikiki (Trump) provide exceptional service.

Great location- close to everything! Great rooftop pool deck. Very friendly and informative staff. Room was great - spacious, clean, modern, quiet! Only drawback is no balcony if you’re looking for one. Will stay here again!

I received one of those generic emails letting me kn ow my trip was fast approaqching and to let them know if I needed anything else. Well, for the fun of it, I emailed back and said I was all good but some milk and cookies to top off the night would be awesome (I was joking, as I wrote "lol" in the message). Imagine my surprise when I opened up the mini-frig and there was a plate of brownies and a glass of milk. In addition to a spacious and clean room, this really made my day. And on top of that, they now have e-keys available via the Hyatt app so I didn't even need a key. I love being able to check-in in via phone with an alert when my room is ready and now e-keys; I love it!

We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is located very close to the beach. The staff is very helpful and welcoming. Rooms are spacious and nicely designed. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the pool area. Although looks nice, it isn't functional as pool and it seems to struggle to accommodate all the guests who want to spend time in the area. Other than that , I would recommend this hotel and I would definetely stay again.

I recently spent 5 nights at the Hyatt, on my final day I checked out and confirmed and signed my balance. Only to find on my bank statement an extra $250 taken from my account without consent. I returned to the hotel to enquire about the charge, and was told “I didn’t pay attention to the bill.” Even though the amount I signed for was $81.85. The woman (Malia) I spoke to was not interested in resolving the situation. I also spoke to Hyatt billing company on the phone who gave me a completely different story about the charges. Breakfast was below average, so unless it’s included in your package, don’t waste your money. //Room was nice and valeting staff were lovely and friendly. Apart from that would not recommend.

My wife and I stayed here our first night in Hawaii and loved the room. It was spacious and very clean. Loved the pet fish they gave us for one night. Great hotel staff who were very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast in the morning and it was very fresh and delicious.

My husband and I stayed here for four nights, and only just returned home yesterday. We had a great experience here! We were celebrating our 5 year anniversary. When we checked in, Rachel upgraded us to a room on the penthouse level. She said it was available because there is some slight elevator noise in the room. We decided to take it because we sleep with a white noise app on our phones anyway. It didn't drown out the elevator noise completely, but it didn't bother us too much. The room was incredible! We were coming from Maui, and the hotel room we stayed in there was very musty. That wasn't the case with our room at the Hyatt at all, thankfully! It was very well ventilated. Every member of staff we interacted with here was so nice and helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect. The only negatives were that the pool isn't really a pool (it probably isn't even 2 feet deep), and the bathroom could use more light and more towel racks or a piece of furniture to place towels on closer to the tub. The shower actually had a light in it that was very bright! But the light in the mirror at the bathroom sink was somewhat dim, and there was no light above the giant mirror in the bathroom where I ended up doing my makeup often (though it was wonderful to have that mirror). But everything I look for in a hotel room usually, this place had. Comfortable bed and sheets / comforter, nice and clean (the room and bathroom smelled great too), good AC, not musty, good water temperature and pressure, etc. Would definitely recommend staying here!

Great ocean view's from this room (2201)! Room gets a bit warm if you forget to close the blinds, but that is too be expected! Love the bathroom, however the Japanese bathtub cork would not close, therefore couldn't enjoy a nice bath. Check the Iron as well before you iron your evening shirt, the iron was dirty and stained my shirt. Hotel offered to dry clean it, but we were leaving the next morning so there was no point or time. Other then that, the room was great!!! Only 4 out of 5 rating, because of the bathtub and iron issue...

Check in process was very smooth. The Hawaiian Drink at check in was a nice touch. Rooms were nice and very clean. Located near shopping and good places to eat in walking distance. Walking distance to beach also

First I would like to say how much I have enjoyed my stays at the Hotel when they first opened. The Staff is simply awesome. Alex at the front desk, Glenn at the bar are really wonderful. We have been coming to Hawaii 2-3 times a year since 2004 and when we found the Hyatt Centric we loved it so much we have stayed there the last 5 trips. This year when we returned for Christmas we found out they had closed the bar until evening and closed the restaurant except for breakfast. If we wanted to stay at a Hyatt Place, we would have booked at a Hyatt Place. This is a Hyatt Centric and we expect the amenities that come with a higher end hotel, and were very disappointed by these changes. During our stay they showed us the first "meal" they would offering while the kitchen was closed. I've been served more appealing food on an airplane...bags of chips with a small hummus selection? It seems as if they closed services to save money with no regard to the guests. I assure you they did not drop the room rate while they figured things out, nor were we aware of these changes when we booked our 5th visit. Again, love the staff, rooms are very nice but these changes will send us elsewhere in the future.

Wonderful hotel with staff that really shows the meaning of aloha. Can’t think of anywhere else to stay at on the island of Oahu than this place. We will definitely be returnees and stay longer next time.

I booked this based on the high ratings among lots of competition in Waikiki. I really loved the upscale “boutique” style feeling of all the lobby and room details, such as the beautiful wood paneled closets and floors, room artwork, and amenities (a DryBar blowdryer? Impressive!). They are right around the corner from two ABC markets so you can stock up on essentials to keep in your fridge. Walking distance from many local restaurants. My only dismay was that the hotel does not offer a fair local resident discount, like many competing hotels in the area do, and would like to see them take more care of the Hawaii residents by offering one, as the hotel is a little pricey!

Going to keep this short: Overall the staff is great, the location good enough, rooms good enough, and I would stay here again; definitely the best Hyatt location on Oahu. On the downside parking is crazy expensive, the food is inferior, the hot tub is lukewarm, and the rooms have an issue with noise and light pollution.

Only stayed during the day after a cruise to Hawaii while we waited for a nite flight home. Fantastic hotel!! Very luxurious!! Clean & spacious room. Friendly & helpful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel!!

Enjoyed getting away for the weekend with my significant other, nice room, nice amenities, liked the complimentary towels and sunscreen when we drove to the North Shore. Loved working on my laptop while my guy sat in the hot tub while the sun went down, sipping wine... lovely. Really loved the morning buffet, delicious

We checked in online and at 11 o’clock we were told the room is ready. When we got to the hotel they told us the room would not be ready until 3 0’clock. Tired of waiting my wife went to the desk and asked when the room would be ready. She was told “ I see you paid with points”. I have spent a lot if money with Hyatt for those “ points” and will never spend another dime. It gets better the next day we go to Pearl Harbor ( long day), Then diner only to come back to an uncleaned room.
user_name:
Cindy J
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: We are spending our 5th night here and absolutely loved our experience. The location was perfect and very central to walking just minutes to the downtown Waikiki shops and the bus stop is conveniently located at the cross streets for the hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful, clean and modern on the inside. We enjoyed our gorgeous, spacious room and the mountain view we had from floor to ceiling windows. The staff was also very helpful and accommodating. We enjoyed the free reusable water bottles (perfect for our time spent traveling around the city) as well as the high quality beach equipment (towels, large and study umbrella, and beach chairs) and free sunscreen and aloe gel provided to us every day upon checkout of the equipment. We hope to be back in Honolulu, and when we do return, we will be staying here again.

A great no frills hotel in Waikiki and is clean efficient and comfortable.We loved the location and as it was a short visit, this was a great option compared to our usual luxury hotel choices.Fully recommend it for someone who knows Waikiki already.

My wife and I and young child stayed here for 5 nights. The highlight was the spa and pool which we used frequently. They are situated on an outside deck which takes in some views of Waikiki. The rooms are high quality and the service is great

Very clean rooms. Hotel staff is phenomenal and very friendly. If you like Starbucks coffee, there is a Starbucks Reserve street level offering some of the most unique coffee brewing techniques available. Beach is a short walk away and tons of shopping and dinning in the area.

Employees welcome us well and helped promptly. Especially, arranged to stay at the same room for 3 separate reservation dates and extended check-out although the rooms were full. Also, the hotel rented umbrella, beach chairs, parasol, and boogie boards at concierge. (should bring parasol & beach chair to Hanauma Bay) Stayed at two queen beds room. Nice & spacious room. But no bathtub. Swimming pool is too small.Parking fee high as $40 like other hotels but could find the meter parking spaces nearby. Good time to find 6-8 pm or morning time.Location is good for shopping & dinning but a little far from beach to walk with the little kids. We swam at the other beaches that are less loud than waikiki.My most favorite was the round swing bed in the lobby and concierge. Starbucks reserve is at 1st floor.

Excellent Room & Customer Service. The house-cleaning service was exceptional. Front desk was very cordial and helpful. Their concierge (Ron) is the best in the business. The complimentary Yoga class was the best I have ever taken outside of my home gym, and I've been doing Yoga for 10 years . The Yoga instructor was phenomenal. The class should however be offered more than just once a week.

I just wanted to take the time to say Thank you to Malia at the front desk for making our stay here Amazing. My boyfriend and I stayed here in November 2018 for our Anniversary and Malia helped make our stay even more enjoyable with all her personal touches. She's very detail oriented and is so warm and friendly. Her smile is so sincere and she's very genuine. You can tell she really loves her job and takes pride in her work.From the moment I walked into our room, there were flowers shaped in a heart on the bed and flowers throughout our room even in the shower. She left a personal greeting card on our bed wishing us enjoyable stay. Our room had a rare balcony and over looked the Amazing city views. We had to take a separate penthouse elevator to access our floor. The windows were ceiling to floor. We checked in on a Friday night so after dinner we were able to see the fireworks right in our room. When we woke up there was a personalized morning greeting with our names on the TV screen. She recommended the hotel restaurant "The Lanai" for breakfast. So, the next morning we ate there which overlooks the pool. It also has a breakfast buffet. In the afternoon we went in the Jacuzzi and lounged poolside. The lobby had a cute swinging bed which seemed to always been in use. I got lucky after breakfast and was able to lay on it. Later, I asked about the gym and even throughout Malia's busy day she took the time to walk me over to show me the gym.We are now a fan of the Hyatt Centric Waikiki and Malia. We will definitely be returning and hope to have Malia assist us again. Thank you Malia for making our stay Extra Special!!

My wife and I were very happy with the level of service provided for us. Welcomed with a Lei each at reception made us feel special. We liked the fact that we were close to everyday shops and reasonable eating places.

The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and roomy, and housekeeping provided fresh towels daily. Close to beach and it is great that they provide towels, chairs, umbrellas, etc. The mattress for the pullout may need to be softer for more comfort. Overall, I think this is a great place to stay.

The staff were very friendly at this smaller scale hotel very close to the main strip at Waikiki. One block away from the main street at Waikiki. Beach is only two blocks away to the water which is very close. All beach supplies are provided by the hotel. The location is nice and quiet in the evenings. No full-time restaurant at the hotel, but there are plenty of options right outside from very upscale to McDonald’s. The gym is sufficient but no weight machines and only one bench. But it is rarely used. Excellent service by the staff once again and I will return here again.

This hotel was well located, close to the beach and centre of Waikiki shopping. The room was large with 2 large beds for 3 (my sister and my adult son and me) to share. The room was quiet and comfortable with plenty of storage and 2 couches to relax on.The fantastic staff accommodated all our requests with smiles. My sister left a valuable piece of jewellery behind but was reunited with her tourquoise over a week later! They had it locked away waiting for us to contact them, having only my email address. Honestly, it felt as if nothing was too much trouble. I would recommend this hotel.

Everything was perfect from check-in to check-out. Really appreciate the new aesthetics & design. The view of my room was amazing since I actually saw a rainbow. Special thank you to Malia & Rachel. I’ll be staying here if back in town.

We had an excellent stay in Waikiki thanks in part to the Hotel and staff at the Hyatt Centric. Excellent location near shopping and restaurants. We had a great experience at Duke's right on the Beach and only 100 steps from the Hotel.

My wife and I were very pleased with this hotel. The staff is courteous and friendly. The rooms are large, clean, and well appointed. Everything worked well. the valet for parking were very friendly and quick to retrieve our car whenever we needed it. There are not many options to eat in the hotel, but there are lots of restaurants right outside the property. Highly recommend this hotel.

It was a little out of normal for me to book a hotel that isn’t a resort, but this looked cute and unusual. My visit at the Centric turned out to be the best stay yet in Honolulu. The ambience was relaxed yet crisp and cleanly modern with noticeable efficiency by fthe staff. Check in and check out were quite easy. I also enjoyed the breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. Again the staff there were awesome, and I have to recommend trying the lilikoi yogurt! Valet parking was well run and the location made me realize I didn’t need a car to get around. I wish I could remember all the staff members names but a few I ran into several times I got-Rachel, Malia, Kani, Dan, Jamia, Wei, Zhi, and all of the valets.

We stayed here in November 2018 before heading over to the Big Island.This was my first visit to a Hyatt property in quite some time, as I'd sworn them off after an atrociously bad stay in Kauai more than 10 years ago. Yes, I hold a grudge.Anyway, I had read good things online about this place and decided to take a chance. I'm glad I did. This was a terrific choice.I liked the location a lot: close to the beach but not on it, sort of in the middle of everything in Waikiki. We didn't rent a car, didn't need one, and walked everywhere. The room was clean with a good view, and big enough. Service was quick and good, and there were enough quality touches (LG TV, etc.) to make you feel a little better about your choice. But the best thing about the place was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Especially the concierge service. We had a long conference with Richard while we went over all the possibilities for dining. His two recommendations were both excellent, and he left us with two more for next time :)We had a great time in Honolulu and the Hyatt Centric staff were a big reason why.
user_name:
Dwight H
San Mateo, California, United States

review_body: My wife and I recently celebrated my birthday and our 32nd wedding anniversary and decided to make it a staycasion. We chose a Hyatt property that was centrally located in Waikiki. Upon arrival our car was promptly and professionally valeted. We were whisked up to the lobby floor where our check in was flawless. Of course the hotel had all our personal preferences on file. Our room was complimentarily upgraded and the room was more than we expected. The service was top notch and our breakfast the following morning was hot, fresh and delicious. I recommend this property to anyone planning a stay in Waikiki. I think you’ll be pleasantly surprised.

We stayed here in November, We were given a room on the 22nd floor which was very spacious. The room was clean and tidy and contained miniture toiletries which were replenished every day. There was water stations available to fill the complimentary bottled but that was on the 7th, 8th or 19th floor which meant we had to get 2 elevators to fill them up.The staff were very friendly and helpful, there's chairs, towels and umbrellas to borrow which was nice. Didn't like the free sunscreen but still a nice touch by the hotel.My only complaint is the elevator noise, you can them ALL night going up & down which I found very disturbing.This would not put me off returning to the hotel, I'd just bring ear plugs next time!

We spent 17 days at the Hotel and its safe to say that we felt like they treated us like family. The staff were friendly and interested in us and where we were from and it felt like all staff (housekeeping, front of house, front door etc) were all on the same page with regards to their service! Highly recommend ths Hyatt Centric Waikiki.Special shout out to the front door staff - Ave, Ray, Alana et al - outstanding service!

Stayed at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki for 2 weeks and it was great! Highly recommend staying here for an extended stay or short period, the amenities were great and location from the beach was literally less than 10 mins. The hotel staff were all friendly and the rooms were modern and beautiful. The only thing that was unfortunate was that the "pool" was only about a couple feet deep. But the out doors area was nice. Great for kids. And right on the first floor of the hotel is a starbucks reserve... amazing.

Great stay. Valet service was top notch, front desk was extremely helpful, room view was one of the best ever. Staying in the center of Waikiki was awesome because it was near all the main store with in walking distance. Had a Starbucks Reserve on property that made getting coffee and a quick bite to eat before the ventures.

we booked thru Expedia and were overwhelmed with the choice of hotels. never been to Honolulu, it was purely a choice based on the pics we saw on the web. we didn't regret a minute staying here. perfectly located in the centre of Waikiki. you can either walk or uber to your destinations. rooms were very clean, spacious and modern. staff was very friendly and helpful from receptionist to cleaners. kids looked after fish in the room, which is an option if you want the kids to do that. would recommend it to everybody to stay here whilst you are in Honolulu, for couples and families alike

A great place to stay.. it's central to everything..shopping,the beach and parks.The staff is very helpfull and nice.Will definitely stay here on my return trip..i enjoyed the beauty of place and its cleanliness.

Loved this hotel! Staff was friendly, breakfast was delicious and the location was perfectly close to shops, bars, beach, and restaurants. The decor was beachy chic, the room was spacious with a beautiful ocean view, super clean too. There is Expedia concierge located at the entrance while the main lobby, restaurant, and bar are a few floors up. Highly recommend if you’re visiting Waikiki Beach!
user_name:
nicoleaygar
New York City, New York

review_body: First time I’ve stayed at this Hyatt. I really liked the location as the price/value is significantly better than the on-the-beach locations. Staff was very helpful. It’s a few blocks from Waikiki and all the shopping any one (not me). Staff when way out of their way giving good advice from their experiences and helping with a scanning business issue I had. The gym is small but did the trick for a short stay.

Hyatt Centric was awesome. It’s centrally located to shopping, dining, and the beach. Everything is in walking distance. Rooms are modern and well kept. I would definitely stay again if I were to travel to Honolulu.

Great location , walking distance to beach (and hôtel provides all beach needs), fine shopping for all pocketbooks, a variety cuisine restaurants. The personnel were outstanding: from door men to reception to maids. We will return

Had a nice relaxing time in a nice clean hotel. Excellent place to stay. It was very relaxing to stay with a great view. It was nice and updated room and the beds were very comfortable. I highly recommend the hotel. Next time I hope to get the king bed with ocean view.

In the heart of waikiki. Starbucks by the entrance, nordstromrack,high end shops...im just like in beverly hills in this area. I love it. Hotel is just near the water, transpo is easy, i love hyatt’s guava juice, atlantis’ seafood resto’s guava juice is nothing like hyatt’s. Very nice staff, very clean hotel and its a modern one.

Having been to Hawaii 9 times in the last seven years, I can honestly say the Hyatt Centric is a hidden gem. The rooms are clean and spacious as are the bathrooms. The staff are friendly and caring and the use of sun chairs and umbrellas as part of resort fee make it an exceptional hotel.

Great rooms, very friendly and attentive personal, outstanding service by far outweighs the rather small pool area and the smaller fitness center. Hotel offers complementary beach chairs and umbrellas

They have a good Valet Parkingservice, Beach chairs, Beach umbrellas and a nice bar at the Lobby Level. The room was nively decorated. They have a sun deck with a hot tub with sunchairs and cabanas. The location is perfect for a Trip to Waikiki.

Stayed here in October 2018 - the rooms itself are nice and modern since the hotel has recently been refurbished however we stayed here twice at the beginning and end of our trip and both times had very noisy rooms the first had a lot of street noise as the hotel is in kind of an ally and windows held back no noise and the second time we had a room on the top floor which is on top of the general elevator shaft which made it extremely noisy (one could literally here the elevators going & stopping) staff warned us about this but said they were full and could not give us another room. Based on our experience and the price paid can‘t recommend to stay here.

Modern hotel, extremely clean, probably the best housekeeping I have ever seen. Great location, short walk to everything, $8 Uber to alamoana etc. stayed in an ocean suite, beautiful room and bathroom. ALL staff were fantastic. My only complaint is it claims to be a resort and charges usd30 per night resort fees. This is a great “hotel”, it is not a resort and should not be charging $30 a night. They list a few things like towels and beach chairs but in reality all most people would use is the wifi, which was a great speed for a hotel but @ $30 a day it would want to be. There is no pool as such, just a “splash pool” which is more like an ankle deep pond you would toss a coin into.

On arriving at the hotel 29 aug'18 i receive a very warm welkom from your host Erica Tso. I felt right at home. The hotel room was very nice and modern. The hotel location and host Erica was excellent.

I am a Globalist, Hyatt's highest loyalty category. yet I received no courtesy and was only offerred a room overlooking a very noisy street. Trust me, you don't want to stay on that side of the hotel if you're a light sleeper. But if you are there on business and need a work area, you must stay on the street side!No one at reception cared, and over my 4 night stay, they never tried to make things better for me.

After staying for five nights at one of the hotels affected by the Strike prior to cruising on the Pride of America, it was a pleasure to stay at the Hyatt Centric! Yes it was central to everything and spacious, clean and modern. Also, half the price of the previous Strike-affected hotel. Welcome staff were most pleasant and helpful. I opted for a mountain view room and thoroughly enjoyed the view both day and at night. Wifi was excellent. Well done Hyatt Centric!

Great Hotel, room and bathroom (big shower) was spacious & lovely. Location perfect in the biz, but not on the main street which was good, too much going on, protesters and too many people. We changed our Check-in a couple of days prior and Daniel Katona was very helpful and was able to accomodate our needs, thanks Daniel you were a STAR. Cannot fault this property, we had a great experience. Down to the housekeeping leaving us sweet litte notes.

The Hyatt centric hotel is located in a good spot, easy to get around and plenty of shopping near by. The room was spacious and came with reusable water bottles, you’re able to have a betta fish to keep you company in your room if you would like, we had one called Sushi which was cool as I haven’t seen this at a hotel before. The staff at the lobby and entrance doors are very friendly.The negatives of our stay would be that the shower didn’t stay at a consistent temperature, the lighting in the bathroom wasn’t sufficient to light the whole room but the biggest negative was the man working at the bar. We went down to the bar/restaurant (the lanai), to see if we could get some dinner about 7pm we had looked at the menu prior to coming down, so we asked the man at the bar if we could go to the restaurant, his eyes were glued to watching the tv, he then turned around and rudely said it’s closed it’s only open for breakfast. Then went back to watching the tv. This didn’t seem like a one off as every time we passed by he was watching the tv.

After discovering our previously booked and fully paid for hotel was on strike and had been for almost a month, we decided at the last minute to change our accommodation to avoid the noisy protests out the front.Hyatt Centric Waikiki was great from the start! We were greeted with a nice cold iced tea on arrival and even though we arrived at 10am and check in was not until 3pm, they held our bags and contacted us 1 hour later to say that our room was ready! We booked the basic Mount View Room. It was clean, modern, quiet and a good size for the 2 of us. The hotel is in a great location. Close to the main street for shopping and restaurants and a short stroll to the beach.The only thing we found a little unusual was the pool. Whilst it's a lovely area with great poolside bar and snack service, you can't actually swim in the pool, it's more of a wading pool to just cool off, so if it's a swim you're looking for you will need to head to the beach!Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

We stayed for 1 night on the way back from the mainland to Australia. The check-in was amazing and very friendly. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite on the 21st floor which had an incredible view. We relaxed by the splash pool with drinks & nibbles & slept really well. I would highly recommend the hotel. I have stayed in 5 hotels in Waikiki this year.

My partner & I stayed at this hotel for 14 nights. We absolutely loved our stay, the hotel is in a great location if you want to shop, visit many different restaurants & go to the beach which is only a short walk away. We felt the hotel had a much more modern styling compared to other nearby hotels/resorts. The bed & pillows were so comfortable! We enjoyed the free extra inclusions provided by the hotel such as a pet fish for the duration of our stage and yoga on Thursdays which concluded with a cold towel and a smoothie! Nice touch. We appreciated that there was also the option to listen to live music on Fridays/Saturdays as well as a movie night even if we didn't attend, it was nice to know we had the option. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. The hotel also had the best wifi, I've ever experienced whilst travelling. As mentioned in other reviews the only down side is the pool, unfortunately it's designed so that you can only dip in it & not swim & that the hotel doors are really loud when they close. We feel this may have been our neighbours closing the door without thought for others but regardless these are two minor issues we had. Highly Recommend!

The hotel is a great place to stay -the staff were very friendly and helpful with different recommedations for our first time there. The first night in our room we heard a lot of loud music coming from an outdoor band playing just outside our room and we called the front desk and within the hour they had us moved to a different room away from any noise! Comfortable room and cozy bed! And the beach was a 3-4 minute walk! Plenty of restaurants and shopping just outside the hotel.

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric in Waikiki for 10 nights. We had a group of us go for 2 milestone birthdays and after searching for several months we decided on the Hyatt Centric. We all loved everything about the hotel it was clean, central no road noise you honestly could not fault anything about this property. Staff were always friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The only minus would be the swimming pool, it’s not a full size pool so if you are going there just to swim and laze by the pool I wouldn’t stay here, but with so much to see and do on this beautiful island there are lots of beaches if you want a swim. Pool is perfect for toddlers not teenagers. Would definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed our 7 days at this hotel. Helpful staffs specially Ave the porter and Linda at the front desk. It's a great location, central to everything. Actually this is our 3rd year in Waikiki, We love this place just to relax that's why we keep coming back. Thanks for your help. Hope to see you again. Thanking you,Adam ArominGrand Hyatt Melbourne

Beautiful, clean room. Perfect view of the ocean. Great location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Food in the restaurant was good. Not great but nice. Would definitely stay there again. Would recommend this hotel.

We recently found the Hyatt Centric Waikiki when a famous hotel was experiencing a strike and we had to relocate. We found the Hyatt and were so pleased at our find! From the wonderful people at the desk to the friendly bartenders to the great wait staff in the restaurant, the staff was top notch. The rooms were large, full of amenities, and very clean. The beds were especially good for a hotel. The pool was hip and the drinks were good. Overall a top notch place I will visit again.

Enjoyed our four days at this hotel. Very disappointed to be confronted by a large German Shepard dog almost every time I went to and from our room. The growl from this dog did not make me feel comfortable and I cannot believe that any hotel that allow this to occur. The dog was on a lead, but the owner was young and did not appear to be a responsible person.

Hyatt centric Waikiki:Great location, central to everything. Helpful staff and so lovely to have a nice iced tea on welcome. They had water available and also provided reusable water bottles for each person in the room. The pool was very small so not great if you want a swim but the spa was enough for us. The rooms were spacious and clean. We would stay here again and would recommend the hotel.

I really love the design and layout of the rooms! The lobby area is spectacular and relaxing! Especially with the hanging chairs and the pool so close! All the staff had SO MUCH aloha! Got lei’d Upon arrival and haven’t had that happen at a hotel in a while!Mahalo nui for the ingenious idea of having those cute fish we can borrow for our rooms as well!

This hotel is just beautiful beautiful. The staff is super friendly and welcoming. Although I was there for only one night. I would definitely stay here again. A big difference than the Sheraton prince kahulani that place is a dump. Hyatt Centric location is a 10! Did I mentioned they give you a lay and Welcome drink when you first arrive. Love this Hyatt

The room was very clean and everything looked brand new. The beds were very comfortable to sleep in. It also has a very spacious and fancy bathroom. The staff was very nice and friendly. I love the hammock and floating chairs in the lobby.

We were able to get into the hotel last minute. We had flown all night and walked into the hotel @ 5:30 in the morning and they were able to put us in a room. Good location. The noise from outside was a little loud at times but nothing you could not cope with. Very clean and a nice big room.

We were in room 1509. I recommend asking for an end room near stairs like we did. Very quiet as you only have neighbors on one side and no one uses stairs that high up. We had the ocean view suite which worked perfectly for us. We had a king bedroom where we could put the pack and play for the baby and the room could close off with sliding doors. The older kids stayed in the living area on the pull out sofa. Skip the $75 per night rollaway and buy an air mattress from Target for around $70 if you need it. The hotel is in an excellent location... Not too busy or loud but right near everything. It is close to International Marketplace and a few blocks to beach. Breakfast buffet was good. They offered eggs made to order, toast, oatmeal, white rice, bacon, sausage, pancakes, pastries and a few desserts as well as pineapple, orange and guava juice. There was also coffee, tea and sodas. Our breakfast room package came with 2 free breakfasts per day and our additional guests were $18.50 each. Kids 4 to 11 were $12.50 and under 4 was free. I wish they would have allowed us to use two coupons one day so we could all eat without having to pay extra. During our stay, they changed the buffet policy so may not offer all items previously mentioned. Not worth the price they are asking for it in my opinion. Wish they had laundry but there are laundromats not too far away. Don't forget to ask for towels and a beach pail and shovel if you are headed to the water. They also occasionally have boogie boards. We didn't use the $50 activity credit because the few activities that it could be used for were too expensive or didn't interest us.

Perfect stay! Helpful and very friendly staff. Rooms big and awesome. Beds very comfortable. Very clean and very good materials used in the rooms. I would definitely go there again. Easy to book. Express check out.

Very nice hotel, friendly people, rooms extraordinarily nice, close to convention center and within easy walking distance from shopping, food and Waikiki beach. Nice touch that they have 2 reusable water bottles in each room with fill stations on several floors. A plus having a Starbucks Reserve entrance in the ground floor lobby!

I would recommend this hotel to those travelling without kids. Having only a wading pool it wasn’t ideal, not that the kids didn’t make their own fun but needed to be concious of not making too much splash or noise. The hotel supply chairs and umbrellas for the beach but it is a bit of a walk so you don’t want to be carrying too much. Overall a lovely place to stay.

I’d been to Honolulu as a kid and now as a parent of three teenage boys I wanted my wife and sons to spend some time on Waikiki. We spent 5 nights in a house on Kauai and decided to overnight at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. All five of us were a bit wary of being in the same room but figured we could manage one night. In fact, we could have stayed many more. The service was excellent from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Nothing was overlooked. We were created by reception with a shell lay and even given a gold fish to keep us company. My wife and I enjoyed a cocktail after dinner at the splash pool enhanced with live entertainment. We all enjoyed a delicious breakfast buffet with an Asian flair the next morning and were well fueled for a beautiful morning beaching on Waikiki. Our excursion was complete with beach chairs, an umbrella and towels all supplied by the Hyatt. The experience was wonderful and all in a great value. Will definitely stay again and give this property my unconditional recommendation.

Full disclosure that I was on a business trip to Waikiki and not on vacation, so this review focuses on that. Great find and a great location. Rooms are clean and comfortable, and mine had an awesome shower and large bathroom. View was nice as well. Close to everything so I was able to take advantage of beaches, restaurants and shopping during free time. Very quiet and extremely easy to get in and out of the room directly to the street. Valet always there so easy to catch transportation. Access to a beach chair and sunscreen a plus for business travel. The pool is perfect for times when beach not possible. Not a pool for swimming, but great to hang out at for a drink, relaxation and some sun. I would definitely stay here again in the future.
user_name:
mickdup
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I was very impressed with this hotel. The location is conveniently located next to the new international marketplace. The shops and restaurants are within walking distance. Kalakaua ave is right around the block. You are pretty much in the heart of Waikiki without being on Kalakaua Ave. There is a short walk to the beach. The friendliness of the staff and beautiful property makes this hotel worth it.
user_name:
Sharisa S
Ewa Beach, United States

review_body: I visit Oahu fairly regularly for work and whenever I do, I make sure to stay here. Of the several hotels I've stayed at in Waikiki, the Hyatt Centric is by far my favorite. In addition to having a fantastic location, the hotel itself is super nice to stay in and relax. The restaurant and bar serve very good food, and the staff have always been extremely kind - they often go over the top to make sure I have a really nice stay (shoutout to Jamie, Samay, Linda, Virgee, Diana, and Malia!! THANK YOU!!!). Additionally, of all the pools in all the hotels in Waikiki, the Hyatt Centric's is unquestionably the best. The parking rate is also one of the more affordable in Waikiki.

Staff was so welcoming and helpful. I love the location, Starbucks convienently located right downstairs and great shopping next door. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Easy check-in and check-out. Be prepared for Parking and hotel fee!!!!

I have stayed at this hotel several times, and have been equally impressed each time. The rooms are clean and modern. The lobby is welcoming, as is the Staff. Rachel Klier checked us in for our last stay, and informed us of the live music that would be happening that evening near the pool. This location is perfect for a Waikiki weekend getaway, or convenient if just staying for a night out in Town. I will definitely be staying with Hyatt Centric in the future.

For the price a very unsatisfactory standard in terms of things that could make all the difference. Stayed on penthouse level and while the view was great that was all. There was not even a small table provided with chairs to sit at to eat if you chose to eat any food in the room or to sit at a computer/tablet. No complimentary water in the room itself. You have to go to another level in the hotel to fill up from a fixed Britax filter station in your "complimentary" water bottle. An ice machine provided also at same location (bonus) but dont try to capture ice in the water bottle or most ice ends upon the floor. The pool is more like a wading pool for kids. Definitely misrepresented by web photos. Room service meal seemed to be ordered from outside the hotel (not the hotel kitchen) delivered in a Uber Eats bag at excessive price. The hotel menu on TV was impossible to fathom out and did not let you minimise the screen to view the whole menu and when queried to reception they could not offer an explanation - so was provided the hardcopy menu from downstairs. Not enough bathroom supplies on arrival. A big positive was being allowed to check in earlier than advertised due to a very early flight arrival. But no kettle (only a coffee machine). No microwave even a small one. But then there would be no room to put this. A very small room for two persons on penthouse level (okay it is a hotel not apartment). When staff were asked about the table nothing happened. Could have complained but just disappointed in this hotel - instead just enjoyed Hawaii. No way to do laundry in the hotel (had to use Ohana East coin laundry which has not changed in 30 years?) Love Hawaii. But would not stay at this hotel again. Paid for the superior view in dollars - but also in lack of basics.

This was a friendly service oriented hotel, great food, nice bar and pool deck and nice fitness room. Staff was professional and courteous. Enjoyed complimentary early morning coffee and water bottle for filtered water.

Such a fantastic place to stay. The staff are so friendly and the location is great. They helped us with our tours and went the extra mile to accomodate our requests! Would happily return to this hotel.

Everything you want on a budget in Waikiki! The staff and service were the best we’ve ever had and we’ve stayed at at least 10 other hotels in Waikiki. The rooms, food, and drinks and the decor and staff are just amazing! So much aloha!!

Your accommodations are almost perfect except for restaurant. The menu meals are not very good. The buffet is passable. The air conditioning fans are very strong and makes for a very uncomfortable bed experience. There should be a fan adjustment that allows for an even flow of air instead of the full pressure of air over the bed.

I checked into hotel as part of five airline crew with UAL. Rooms were not available due to checkin time which was around noon. Hotel staff was extremely kind & helpful in providing our rooms after a 15-20 minute wait. Drinks were provided, lots of attention to our questions & very friendly service in spite of room delay. My room was extremely beautiful (#1711) a large room with an ocean view-well worth waiting for!!! Thank you so much!! I was so impressed that I later inquired as to whether they offered an airline rate because I wanted to come back on vacation with my family. We ALWAYS stay at Marriott properties. Unfortunately, airline discounts aren't offered at this hotel-too bad. Loved my short layover with you. Aloha....

I'm fortunate to have work for extended periods in Oahu. This hotel worked well for my early starts and late returns. Always greeted warmly and a comfortable, spacious room awaited when it was time to rest. Location is central to lots of options in Waikiki for food and activities. The hotel restaurant, The Lanai, never disappointed. I would have always had breakfast there, but sometimes work required my skipping it to get started.

Hotel while not location right on the beach offers great shopping to malls, restaurants, ABC Stores (you can't miss them) and Starbuck Reserve which you don't find too often. Hotel itself has nice rooms and bathroom with the standard amenities. Staff is great and helpful. Only thing is it doesn't have balcony but that's ok.

Definitely can recommend this hotel if you are travelling as a couple and you prefer to avoid the resort with a lot of kids. This hotel only has a small pool and is not on the beach front, but it offers amazing sunset views (if you have an ocean view room), does great breakfast and is very new and modern. There was no filled minibar and late night food room service options were limited, but overall I definitely recommend this hotel!

Parking was expensive, no laundry service, unable to enjoy the pool area as it wasnt a proper swimming pool. Friendly and pleasant staff, room is veryspacious and clean, walking distance to everything

We loved our 9 night stay here. Great modern room as our home base, great bathroom, queen beds and free unlimited wifi & tv. We took advantage of spa and wading pool, but the gym was not for us. The complimentary water bottles and filtered water refill point was really a great touch as well as the drink vending machine. Thanks.

We needed to evacuate our unit because of a flood and were totally pleased with our stay at the Hyatt Centric. The location, parking and room size were perfect. It was great to be able to take advantage of Waikiki while we were displaced.

It’s a shame that the hotel pool is only a splash pool not deep enough to swim in . Still the hotel is very nice and pet friendly. Great room very spacious and clean the staff are friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed our stay very much would stay again

I loved my suite, the staff was kind and service minded, the swimming pool is small but good for a relaxing day :) they don't really need a big pool when they have such beautiful nature and lots of things to do in Oahu Island so I am not complaining about anything :) except the breakfast buffé didn't have a lot of healthy options, you could order on the side or just off the menu, ate there 4 out of 6 days so was not that bad and I like cake but can be a bit too much fat and sugar.. But I remember specially one of the staff in the breakfast area she made me feel very welcome and at home so that made want to go eat breakfast there as well as less stressful then going out for breakfast I am happy with my stay but I have stayed at better 4 and 5 star hotels so that is why I am not giving this a full score :)

Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff. We loved our stay here and would most definitely come back again. Good location with all sorts of amenities close by. We were even able to book our excursion to Pearl Harbour through the hotel concierge desk and got an even better tour then we expected.

Was a nice hotel, good location, why must I do 200 characters I’m finished what I was saying, staff were nice, breakfast was ok, the hurricane missed us, I would like a door on the toilet as I think toilets should have a door.

I like the option the hotel gave me to opt out for daily housekeeping for spending dollars at the hotel. The valet service was excellent. In ever had to wait long for my vechicle. The personnel was very friendly and polite.

Had An Amazing Time At Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. The Staff Went Above & Beyond. The Property Is Beautiful & Is Like The Title Of It’s Name “Centric” Everything Was Within Walking Distance From The Hotel.
user_name:
nikki9788
New York City, New York

review_body: We came to this hotel on our honeymoon/family vacation. Everything was wonderful! The staff were incredibly sweet and helpful in every way. Our only complaint was the lack luster breakfast buffet. For the price, the food should’ve been warm!

This hotel is a few blocks from the beach but priced accordingly. Great service, warm and welcoming from the minute we got there. Rooms were spacious and clean, except for one part off the carpet. When I mentioned the sticky carpet, they quickly had someone come up and clean it. Good location. Short walk to the beach or shopping. We were there as Hurricane Lane was approaching. Of all the places we were at before, during and after the hurricane, this hotel seemed the best prepared.
user_name:
Atraveler500
New York City, New York

review_body: Before our guests arrived in Honolulu- many of whom were first time visitors- the reservations team (Jeanette Callos and Yukiko Kumano) fielded their calls and arranged the best accommodations! With so many other vendors to follow up with, we wanted to find a hotel staff that we could rely on. After touring several hotels in Waikiki, we chose this one because of how we saw the staff treat their fellow coworkers, particularly the relationship between Jeanette and Yukiko. Many hotels are beautiful, BUT you can tell a lot about a business by how the staff interacts with each other. We wanted our guests to feel that aloha spirit, and we found it at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach hotel. Our wedding weekend began with a rehearsal dinner at the hotel. With the guidance of coordinator Rommel Espina, he helped us choose a menu for our 87 out-of-town guests. We were told by several people that it was the best food they've ever had at a wedding...and the actual wedding hadn't even happened yet ! We had 14 various countries represented at our dinner, so it was a relief that the food was a universal "YES!" Rommel did an amazing job with set-up and allowing us to arrive early to add decor. There is live music at the hotel on Friday nights, so our guests were treated to a show by a famed musician, Tavana, while they ate. (One of the coolest extra touches was the note left in all the hotel rooms letting guests know there would be a reserved dinner that night! Very organized.)Our room was decorated in the most beautiful way, and garnished with a heartwarming note from Jeanette and Yukiko. We were so nervous about our wedding the following morning, but the treatment from the reservations team made us forget about all of our concerns. Thank you also to Brian at the hotel restaurant, the cleaning staff, the front desk workers, the valet drivers, and everyone involved in bringing such profound happiness to our newly blended families.

I stayed at the Hyatt Centric for 5 days to celebrate my birthday. Upon arrival, I was greeted with genuine smiles and helpful information as well as a complementary beverage (non alcoholic). Our host (Rachel, I think) was nice enough to write us a list of bars/clubs for each night of the week. The hotel was incredibly clean and well kept. Our room was very spacious and comfortable with a nice city view overlooking the pool. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and dinner at the restaurant onsite and it was delicious both times, also not too overpriced. The location is in perfect vicinity to all the action on the main strip, but not too close to be a nuisance. (Sidebar: there’s a Ross just a few steps away that stays open until 1AM and loaded with great finds unlike the ones back home lol). Approximately 6-8 min walk to the beach from the hotel. I would also like to acknowledge the doormen who were pleasant and upbeat even during overnight hours when we made it back in from partying. The only complaint I had was the live music was a little loud and obnoxious for my taste. The artist played for 2 hours I believe on a Friday night, so it wasn’t that big of a deal but definitely loud for guest rooms facing the pool area who may be trying to rest/nap. Overall, I definitely recommend this hotel! Loved everything!

We were plesantly surprised by this modren,clean,quiet hotel. It was in a very busy location, but everything you need is withn a block. the beach is a block and half away, and they provided beach chairs, umbrealls and towels. the staff were very good, (door people need more training ) But overall very good experience.

From the moment my husband and I checked in, we knew we had chosen the right place to stay. I had lost my phone on the plane (with my credit card in the case) and only realized it when we got to the hotel late at night. Alex helped right away to call every number there was for the airline so that we could locate it, called a cab for us to get back to the airport, and helped to get our bags into our room while we dashed off. He went above and beyond in that situation to do what he could for us and we appreciated it so much.My husband and I stayed for a week to celebrate my 30th birthday as well as our third wedding anniversary, and the staff were incredibly kind and accomodating for us the entire time. Diana and Virgee even decorated our room with balloons, orchids, a card and some chocolates on my birthday - it was beautiful! Alex had also provided us with free champagne drinks to toast our celebrations. When we wanted to swap into a room with a tub, it was a couple of days wait but the front desk staff made it happen for us. (Also, the rooms are fabulous - very spacious, modern and it was kept very comfortable and clean by Joan.) Considering we were first-time Hyatt guests, we weren't expecting much since Waikiki is full of tourists, but when we got there, we felt like we number one in the amount of attention they paid to us. Even down to the housekeeping staff or valet who kept doors open for us and greeted us everytime we saw them. Even though there was a resort fee, we made good use of the services like being able to borrow beach chairs, umbrellas, beach toys and towels. It was great knowing that we didn't have to bring any of our own items or go out to buy it at the store. We had sunscreen and after burn as well, but it was nice knowing that if we ran out, the valets had that on hand too. We also took home complimentary water bottles.Needless to say, we will definitely be back and staying with Hyatt Centric Waikiki again! It was hands down the best hospitality we've ever experienced and we absolutely loved it.

From the location to the property to the management to the staff...TOP NOTCH! This property is very modern, room layouts are unique / different by room location, rooms are bright, well appointed, VERY comfortable and NO street noise. The staff goes above an beyond. Makes you feel welcomed, remembered and wanting you to return. KUDO's Hyatt Centric and a very, VERY special thanks to the entire staff....it is "off the hook excellent service".

We loved our stay. There was a mix up on check in and our room still had cleaners in it. They quickly rectified this and we were given another room on a higher floor with, I suspect, with a better view. Very friendly and helpful staff. Our Ocean View Room was spacious with plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. Very large bathroom with seperate bath and shower. They could do with some more towel rails to hang wet towels. The bed was super comfortable. The rooms are kept very clean and made up every day. We loved the included water bottles and easy access to the ice water machine on our level 19. The ocean view is a few blocks back from the shore but we could still see plenty of ocean and could see what it was like outside. We really enjoyed the pool area for drinks and a light meal. We also used the lounge area for drinks after being out for dinner. Nice and cosy and relaxing. When visiting the beach we used the towels and umbrellas and chairs. We didn’t have the hotel breakfast due to previous reviews but kept breakfast supplies in our room with the occasional breakfast out. Loved the fact that you need your room card to operate the lift. We loved how the whole hotel was set up and how friendly the staff are. Sure, it would be nice to have a deeper pool but I suspect it would be a more expensive hotel. The position is very handy to everything without being too busy on the Main Street. Overall we had a fabulous time with our late 20s children. We would visit again.

Just returned from a 9 night stay. I loved this hotel great staff and beautiful rooms. Location is excellent so close to everything yet very quiet. This is a pet friendly hotel but they also offer a goldfish for company for solo travellers. Loved my goldfish friend. The staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful.I enjoyed the pool area. The splash pool creates quite a relaxed area as does the spa. I would definitely recommend a stay here and hope I can return.

I really liked this hotel. It was a short walk to the ocean. I was a little unsure when it said it was two blocks from the ocean if it would be walkable but they are very short blocks. Very doable. At night there are a lot of people still out until 10 or later so I felt very safe walking alone at night but early morning (7am) was another story. There are some sketchy people out at that time of the morning. I was glad there was security out patrolling the block when I was waiting for my tour pick up. My advice is if you are out alone after hours or in the early morning to be aware of your surroundings and if you are waiting for a pickup stand close to the building so nobody can sneak up behind you.

Our travel agent recommended this location and we were extremely pleased. It's new. The staff is excellent and the location is ideal. I would recommend it to everyone! It's only one block away fro the International Marketplace.

I was pleasantly surprised with the excellence of our stay at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. I tend to be quite particular, but the room was extremely comfortable and the staff were wonderful. I will definitely stay here the next time I am in Honolulu.

Aloha. I came to your hotel to babysit for some friends that were staying there and as I was coming to park my stock Honda Pilot, your garage was too short for me to fit in. Luckily for me, your attendants saw my problem and when I explained that I couldn’t afford full price and I was very anxious about finding alternative parking, they swept in and gave me a full day parking for a great price. Thank you for taking care of this kama’aina!

The rooms were big, clean and newly renovated. When you arrive you're greeted with a Smile and nice cold cup of Hibiscus ice tea and beautiful Shell Necklace. You're given drink bottles that you can use for fresh cold water daily. Starbucks has a secret entry from Hotel entrance and you can enjoy a reserve coffee which is delicious.we had a beautiful Mountain view. There's an amazing swin in the lobby that you can sit and relax... :) You're a short walk from main strip, Ross for Less is just downstairs and Nordstrom rack is also a 2 minute walk.

You will not want to miss their ambience, morning coffee and delightful rooms. The staff was pleasant, friendly and ensured that your stay was the best. Hotel was quiet. Even the local music was kept to friendly hours! It was a great place to "come home to" after a long work day

Staff were extremely helpful and hotel is in a great location with only a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach. Great bars and restaurants on the hotels doorstep. Swimming pool is only about 2 feet deep and was ideal for our 3 year old son. Would definitely stay here again in the future.

We went for our 15yr Anniversary and chose this hotel. They had a special that included breakfast. The location was perfect. Located next to the International Market Place and a couple blocks walk to the beach. The bus pick ups for the Luau and for Kualoa Ranch pick up is right next to the hotel as well.
