They gave us a welcome champagne voucher that we redeemed poolside. They offer umbrella and beach chairs that were included whenever we needed to use them. They gave us two orange water bottles to keep and use to refill at their water stations! Really saved us from buying water bottles. Breakfast was great it included local fresh fruits and hot breakfast items. The pool was more of a lounge vs. lap pool but it was nice. The decor was very welcoming and the entire place was very clean and modern. We stayed in the king ocean view penthouse level. The room was amazing with beautiful views of the ocean and the city! Another bonus you can watch the fireworks from our room. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Overall we had an amazing and very comfortable experience. Definitely will recommend and will come back next time we go to Hawaii!!!

We really enjoyed this hotel, local music of an evening, cocktail drinks around the pool and the rooms were fairly spacious. Very modern and nice distance to walk everywhere from the hotel. I would recommend this for a stay in Waikiki

We were disappointed with the swimming pool. It was not a "swimming pool." It was a "wading" pool with a maximum depth of approx. 14" deep. Had I known that before hand, I would have booked elsewhere. Also, our room was not cleaned until approx. 4 pm every day. We were there for 6 days.

2nd time of staying at this hotel.I was having a tough time to choose between Hyatt Centric vs. Regency.Just decided to stick to Centric cuz it is much newer.This time, I had a breakfast package, which was amazing.Simple selections, but great breakfast for quick bite.Love this hotel's atmosphere and lots of free services such as free sunblock, soothing gel, beach towels and chair, etc.Parking is a bit too high. $40/day, yikes!

Booked this resort with Visa Infinite Privilege Program, when we arrived in the evening, the staff was not familiar with the offering of this program which includes breakfast, and she insisted that it didn't come with breakfast. I had to retrieve my email booking to ensure I wasn't going nuts. The next day when I checked out, the same charge for breakfast reappeared, and I had to once again remind them to remove this as the booking included breakfast. One of our rooms were ocean view, and if you squint and focus with your binoculars, you will see there's a small sliver of ocean between the buildings which the room should be better represented as City View to avoid disappointment. The Adult Deluxe Continental breakfast buffet had no more than eight items to choose from and the lack assortment and variety, if I had to pay USD 24/person, I'd rather have breakfast elsewhere. There's also a resort fee per night for $50, and you are given two plastic water bottles, it's a great environmental initiative, but guests are required to travel up to either the 19th floor or 7th-floor water station to refill the water bottles. We were glad we only booked 1 night for transit and we had much better stays at other resorts/hotels in Honolulu and Maui.

We were pleasantly surprised with the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. The location:We were in the perfect spot-right in the heart of Waikiki and in walking distance to everything including a bus stop. The room:We had the mountain view suite and it was very spacious, clean and comfortable. We were also able to request a pet fish to be delivered to our room for the duration of our stay. We miss our pet Brucey!Hotel amenities:There was a small fitness centre in the hotel. There is 1 restaurant and bar (The Lanai) which was nice, and a Starbucks in the foyer on level 1. Breakfast buffet at the Lanai was decent (not included in the resort fee; we had to pay for it ourselves-but this was not a surprise we already knew this on booking). Food at the Lanai Bar for lunch was delicious. Drinks were awesome. Service was great. We had a waiter serving us outside while we relaxed by the pool. We were also provided with free water bottles on our arrival to avoid wasting plastic bottles. There were water stations on three levels to fill up bottles. Towels and all other beach equipment were readily available. Someone was always at the front desk willing and able to help with any queries. They also have a hotel mobile number you can text with any queries you have, and they were very prompt at responding. Everyone was friendly. The Expedia concierge on level 1 was able to help with planning activities and provide good deals for that. We were offered a $50 credit by the hotel for certain activities such as Pearl Harbour and others. The wifi was good, never had any issues. The only thing I would advise people of is that the pool was not really a ‘pool’, it was completely shallow and more of a ‘wading’ pool that you can’t swim in. This did not bother us or impair our stay at all because we did not care too much about spending our time swimming in the pool, but this is just an FYI to people who are hoping for a pool that you can swim in. I would highly recommend the Hyatt Centric and would definitely stay there again. We were sad to leave.

Visiting the area to celebrate my older brother's 60th birthday.. I chose this property specifically to try Hyatt's Centrist brand and because of its Waikiki location. As a Hyatt Globalist, I offer great remarks for this relatively new property. It is very well designed, beautifully understanded yet amped up with everything your beach vacation needs. An excellent property to escape crowds.. the bar, lobby dining and pool area are petite in size, intimate yet Big on Service. Kudos 2 Hyatt, for establishing high standards in recruiting and retaining your guest service and housekeeping staff.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit the Waikiki area. The staff is very warm and welcoming. The environment is open and modern. I appreciate the management and the care to detail the provide in each and every room and guest experience.I am a regular guest (previously a Hyatt Globalist but now a Starwood and Marriott Platinum Elite member. I only mention that to illustrate that I am very familiar with travel, hotel accommodations, and staff hospitality.

My family often travels to Oahu every 4 months to visit our UH-Manoa student. We stayed at several hotels within Waikiki before because convenient with food, shopping, and the beach. This Hyatt Centric hotel will be our home away from home from now on. We love everything about it. Clean, comfortable, quiet, and excellent in customer service from all staff members!

Hyatt Centric is the best Samay & Elani were so helpful with my special needs. I would recommend the Hyatt Centric as your base for exploring Honolulu. It would be very much worth repeating my stay the next time I am in Hawaii..

Stayed here for 7 days in August, soon as we arrived the hotel staff couldn’t be more helpful check in was quick, simple and very well organised. The room was spotless and had everything we needed for our 7 day stay. We had breakfast included in our stay and the buffet style breakfast was fine and set us for our day ahead. Slight walk to the beach but we didn’t care and the hotel offered us beach chairs, towels, water bottles which all packed into the chair and went on your back. Highly recommend this hotel. If your after a pool in your hotel don’t pick this hotel. The pool is small and not deep (can’t swim) however they have a great hot tub for relaxing in.

We were moving from Ewa Beach to Hawaii Kai and desperately needed a hotel that would accommodate us with 2 cats while renovations were made on our new home. The Hyatt Centric was a gem to find! We were so delighted that they allowed us to stay with our furry friends, and more so, were friendly, accommodating, and understanding about the pets (allowed us to schedule housekeeping times to allow for the cats to be in crates limited times, brought us a food bowl and pillow). The hotel staff far surpassed our expectations about their care and understanding about pets. I can't thank them enough for this compassion as the move and transition with pets was super stressful. In addition to the pet policy gem, during our stay, the islands experienced Hurricane Lane. The hotel staff kept us informed and calm, and never did I worry about our safety. This hotel was exactly what we needed, and would recommend to friends and visitors. The room was spacious, bathroom modern and clean, the wading pool was calming and refreshing, and the staff were always smiling and helpful. Thank you, Hyatt Centric, for making our house move transition less stressful and enjoyable. Mahalo nui loa!!

This relatively new hotel is about 10-15 mins walk from the beach. It is in a convenient central location to restaurants and shops and represents a slightly cheaper alternative to those closer to the beachfront. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room we had was very comfortable.Be aware that the pool is really a kids pool, not deep enough to swim in.Like many hotels, a ‘resort fee’ is payable directly to the hotel in addition to the quoted nightly room rate. This covers such things as beach towels and beach chairs, drink bottles and some sunscreen.

I loved the Hyatt Centric from the moment we checked in till we checked out. The staff were excellent very friend very helpful. I would highly recommend it to everyone. Very central to everywhere and can't thank the staff enough for an amazing stay.

The Hyatt Centric is a great choice with all the comfort of a big Hotel but a boutique feel to it and a little removed from the bustle of the beachfront. The location is just perfect walking distance to beach and shopping. The staff are lovely and will make your stay even more comfortable!

Second time in Oahu and decided to stay in this new beautiful modern boutique hotel in the center of Waikiki! We had a great time celebrating our 12 year anniversary and my 35th birthday and it was amazing! Can’t wait to go back! Also Malia was amazing!!!

We weathered the 2018 hurricane in this hotel, and it was beautiful. The rooms were clean, the bathroom is very large, and the linen was very nice. The staff seemed genuinely happy and very pleasant. Thanks so much!

Arriving there during hurricane warning and finding smile and a very nice room, light, wide, good furniture, efficient and silent air conditioner... a lot of facilities, good restaurant! We really enjoyed stay there!

It is our first time to Hawaii and we are very happy with the hotel. They reached out prior to our stay to make sure we had all relevant information, and again after to make sure all was going well. We are here during the hurricane and they assured us that they have plenty of supplies and water, and helped us to feel safe. They have kept us updated on weather reports and what to do in case something happened. They have fish in the lobby that you can take to your room - we are very excited about this and keep checking to see when one is available. The rooms and beds are comfortable, and clean etc. Just what you would expect from a Hyatt (high quality). The drinks and appetizers at the bar were good, and people at the front desk are very nice.

Beautiful hotel, we enjoyed our stay, very clean, the customer service was very friendly , the pool is not deep our kids loved it, it’s a 5-7 min. walk to the beach, they have a restaurant and the food was delicious, we’re definitely going back

We were passing through in thrbway to Hawaii. Order two queen beds and was told they did not have one. They ended up upgrading us to a room that had two queens and was a suite. It was a wonderful way to start our vacation. The breakfast buffet was not robust for the amount spent and thr pool is more adult oriented than family friendly. But overall we would look at staying here again if for a short stay or on a business trip.

The staff at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach were beyond friendly and helpful. Every interaction with them was so pleasant, and made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel is beautiful and modern, and the pool area is very nice. Location is great, you’re close to everything! But the highlight of this hotel is the lovely people who work there!

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The people were friendly, the ambiance was befitting and the accommodations were lush and comfy. The buffet breakfast was reasonably priced and tasty. It would be nice to add more items to the selection and an additional staff member at peak hours.

This hotel was perfectly situated within the city but out of the real hustle bustle! The staff was truly amazing and so friendly! The rooms were modern and very clean! Had a fabulous desert from the Lanai as a birthday treat from the staff! Loved every minute of our stay!

The beds were fantastic- the best I have ever stayed inThe hotel staff were fantastic as well and were there to help us outEven beach toys for the kids The pool was shallow and not for swimming It was close to Dukes Lane and there was cheap eating

Beautiful rooms! Exceptional Concierge Named Lisa! Front desk and bell hops were great . Centrally located. Pool is not a swimming pool rather a tanning pool! It’s nice but not for swimming! Breakfast buffet needs improvement.

Great people endless memories, clean environment always felt fresh walking through the Hyatt Centric, Amazing cocktails and beautiful food. Staff and security are 10/10. I reccomend going to the pool/spa from 4pm to 6pm as it is happy gour it is a great way to unwind feom a busy adventure filled day.

We went to the Hyatt Centric last year for my birthday. I’m a bathroom snob & this was great, big stand up shower, good counter space & nice lighting. We got a partial ocean view room and it was okay, obstructed views but I wasn’t expecting the ocean in front of us since the hotel is set back. We also loved the location. I didn’t realize how much I liked this hotel until our stay at Alohilani this year (definitely will not be staying there again). Overall this was a great hotel & will be staying at Hyatt Centric again.

Super Clean Room, Fantastic Position, NY style Pool, Friendly but not perfectly professional staffs. 객실 내부는 아주 좋습니다, 위치도 아주 좋고요, 여러 곳이 걸어서 갈 수 있는 거리입니다. 풀은 관상용이고 밤에 시끄럽지는 않습니다. 하얏트의 전통적인 서비스에는 못 미친다 싶고요. 렌트카 없이 쇼핑 위주로 와이키키 즐기실 분들은 최고입니다.

Our room was just the perfect size for a couple. It had a nice view of the ocean. It's not beach front but very close to the beach. It's also close to restaurants and shops including the luxury brands. They provide beach umbrella, chairs and towels which you can take along to the public beaches. Their splash pool was great to relax and sip a cocktail at the end of a long day.Staff were friendly and helpful. It's almost perfect except one day, our room was not serviced during the day; To their credit, when we called, they came up quickly to fix up the room and give us fresh towels; All in all, we are happy with Hyatt Centric

This hotel is in a great location just steps away from many shops, dining, and the beach. The staff is highly attentive, friendly, and accommodating. They give you everything you need to enjoy a day at the beach, which was very helpful (backpack beach chair, towels, sunscreen, water bottles, etc.) The rooms are spacious and clean, central self-controlled A/C, with great views. The onsite restaurant and breakfast buffet is top notch with healthy food choices. Overall, it was an excellent stay and I'd highly recommend as an option for families or couples - it's nice and tranquil/quiet while being in the heart of a very trendy part of town. Well worth every penny!

Every single member of the staff was warm, courteous, and professional. The room was beautiful and comfortable. There was live music on the weekends on the pool deck and the food at the restaurant was great. I couldn't imagine a better place to stay.

I have stayed here multiple times for business. Ideal setting. Close to everything. Hotel feels new and clean. Love the rooms and views. Staff are extremely professional/friendly and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy everything. Hotel is super relaxing.

During my last business trip to Waikiki, I decided to stay in the Hyatt because of the location and how I did not care for the Marriott that I stayed in on my last trip. I'm glad I choose the Hyatt and I was very pleased with the overall service I received. From the moment of me pulling up, I received great customer service. The front desk was fun and friendly and I had great conversations with the bartender throughout the week. The rooms were very clean and open. One drawback of the room was the workspace was not that big and it would have been nice for it to look out my view, which was of the mountains. The bathroom and shower were large and nice. That's always on the top of my list of things needed. Also, the hotel was not crowded, which was great. I would use this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Staff has been great - all smiles, very eager to help. Property is well designed - décor is lovely and the hotel is immaculate! Entertainment Friday night was very good. Love the fish for companionship.

With the addition of the Hyatt Centric, there are now 3 properties for World of Hyatt members on Oahu. I've visited Oahu several times and for room quality, this is the best of the 3 by far. The configuration is a little unconventional with the lobby on the 8th floor, but checkin was pleasant and quick. The floor plan is rather unique as well, which makes every room have a different feel. The elevators are quick and there are 4, so I rarely wait for long to get to a room on the upper floors. The surrounding buildings are mostly lower, so there are decent views in multiple directions if on a high floor. Location is central to Waikiki and everything is in walking distance. I look forward to my next trip

I enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Centric Waikiki. Everything was very close and walking distance. They made us feel very comfortable and the room was always clean. At check in, I noticed that everyone received a lei and a drink sadly that didn’t happen to myself and my family at check in:( but over all we enjoyed our time in Waikiki, Hawai’i.

The hotel was adequate in most respects but room 2101 was extremely noisy due to mechanical elevator noise. A staff member said no one had complained before but I find that hard to believe. I don't know about other rooms on the same floor or other floors but beware of the potential noise issue before you unpack and always decline room 2101.

The staff here is great! Very friendly, and they do whatever they can to make sure you’re taken care of. Coming here feels a lot less like being away from home, and the staff deserves the credit for that. The facility is clean and modern, and it’s located right in the middle of the strip. The shows on the lanai are always entertaining and picturesque. I just wish they’d bring the free pineapple juice back! That stuff was so good!

I enjoyed this hotel’s style. It had a very modern and hip feel to it. We really liked our room and the ocean view. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was really friendly and accommodating, especially Po’okela from the valet service. 12/10 would stay again.

The hotel is surrounded by shopping malls and restaurants, all within walking distance. It is also very central and convenient for me to take the public transport. And I really appreciate the efforrts put in by the staff, especially Jeanette and Aileen, to help my wife locate a parcel delivered to the hotel before our arrival.

Nice hotel. Walking distance to beach and great location. The bartender was rude and overcharged.The maid services were late in the day and non-existent on some days.The staff at door were friendly and were always ready to provide you with beach towels.

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. From the moment we walked in we lived It! Malia greeted us at the desk and was fantastic. She let us know all about the amenities of the hotel, very nice and informative. We loved the shell lei's and reusable water bottles! Our room was very large with a king bed and beautiful Ocean view. I loved having the separate soaking tub and large shower! On Friday night we sat on the couch to watch the fireworks over the ocean water, beautiful!! The hotel is close to tons of shopping and restaurants. The pool is great and I loved the lounge chairs in the water. It was perfect to rest after a day on the beach or sightseeing. The restaurant had a great breakfast and lunch. The service was great there too! We did use the chairs and umbrellas for a morning at the beach, perfect! As always, the Hyatt offered exceptional comfort and service!!

I was disappointed in the quality of the room and the cruise ship atmosphere at the Sheraton Waikiki my first night there so left and stayed at the Hyatt Centric for the rest of the week. I could not have made a better choice! The room was beautiful, very new, and plenty large enough for my wife and I. Sure it's a block away from the beach instead of right on it, but they'll loan you backpack beach chairs for free instead of the other resorts that charge you $50 extra to use a chair. On top of the great room, it was also much less expensive! Saved our working vacation.

What a great hotel! Downtown Waikiki, near to everything. Great room. Great bed and pillows. Nice “pool” area, not really a pool, but nice anyway. Good gym. Friendly service, everyone was so nice!! Would recommend!

Hotel is located in a central location to all activities and shopping. The valet people were outstanding. Not just there to park cars. Always available and knowledgeable of area, other services such as giving out beach towels. During the firework display, I thought I could see them from the hotel, but they let me know one building blocks it from others, then gave me directions to the best spot to see them. In addition, they always greeted me and other guests.

We stayed here for 2 nights with our toddler son. Loved it - hotel is only 1.5 years old so everything still feels new and clean. Highlights:- Pool is more of a lounge pool for wading and chillin'. Our toddler loved it as he could walk up and down the pool (vs. other pools where he has to be extra careful)- You can get a Beta fish as a short term pet during your stay. Just request one at the front desk.- Rooms are immaculate - bright and airy. Bathroom is trendy with large shower (no bathtub)- Staff is so friendly. Valet a little slow with the luggage though so don't be in a hurry.- Microwave in the lobby area in case you need to heat anything up- Water bottles available and water station in lobby floor- Excellent location. 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and great food is all within a blockWould stay again!

Location is perfect. Hotel / room is very spacious and clean, nice view, staff are all great. You get to borrow beach chairs and umbrella, free sun block and after sun Aloe Vera! You get two free water bottles and they have Brita filtration system to hydrate you.

My family has lived in Oahu for 30 years. I came to visit and surprise my wife for an anniversary weekend. We stayed one night at the hotel. It is a modern hotel a couple of blocks from the beach. You can see the ocean over and in between other buildings. There is a really cool shallow pool on the 8th floor which is also where the lobby and restaurant and bar is. The rooms were great and i slept well. The only complaint was the breakfast. Service was nonexistent and the food items in the buffet were depleted. No one took our dirty plates which we had to set on an adjacent table. No one brought coffee. If you want to eat go elsewhere.

WOW after a long day from JFK Alex was the day man I wanted so see he greeted us with a warm smile and such generous hospitality I will be back to your hotel to see such generous staff like him. Get this man a promotion or a raise. THANK YOU ALEX 5 Stars!! Perfect start to my honey moon :)

Stayed there for 8 days. The rooms were large and very clean. They just recently renovated. The location is very central. Excellent food and shopping within walking distance. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. Great location and super friendly staff. Lisa the concerge gave us some great advice and all her recommendations were better than we expected. Next trip to the island we will stay there again

We stayed here for 9 nights, awesome location, fantastic service and the room was great! Super modern and clean. We had a room with a sofa bed in it, both the sofa and king bed were comfortable, very comfortable pillows. The pool is very shallow, more of a kids pool but we didn't go swimming in the pool anyway because the beach is only a 5 min walk away, so wasn't an issue for us but might be for someone who wants to go swimming in a pool often while in Waikiki. Shops and restaurants just around the corner, we were on the 14th floor and didn't have any issues with street noise. Nordstrom rack is a 30 second walk from the hotel so was good to get some bargains there! Staff are very friendly and helpful. Just be aware that there is a resort fee per night on top of the hotel fee, we knew this before we left so wasn't an issue but something to be aware of. This is a fantastic hotel, super clean and comfortable. So glad we decided to stay at the Hyatt Centric, we had an amazing stay here and will defiantly be back!

Not quite sure how to rate this hotel. The rooms are stylish, clean, and comfortable. Staff pleasant. But my wife and I came here for a two-night getaway to relax. We choose this hotel over others because of the pool and hot tub. We specifically asked if there was any construction going to be going on during our stay and we were told no. When we arrived the pool was closed for the entire first day and half of the second day we were there. When I did go to the hot tub at 3 pm there were four young kids in diapers with their parents in the hot tub. We did let the hotel know but got a sort of generic response. We were told to report this to the staff when it happened but also told there was no policy for age in the hot tub. So why bother reporting if they cannot do anything? So much for our relaxing resort stay. For $250 per night, we basically got a clean room and a TV. I could have gotten that anywhere for half the price. So although the hotel is nice, it may not be the right choice for everyone depending on what you expect. For us, this was a 1-star experience.

A wonderful place to stay. I was able to check in early. The hotel is in a central location, modern and clean. Front desk is great. Good facilities available. It was a great way to start my holiday and would stay her again.

Definitely recommend staying here. Staff are lovely, good location, nice and clean. Never too much trouble for our servers at breakfast to accommodate our requests. Door staff never missed opening the door for us. Highly recommended!

Just spent four nights at this hotel with the family and I have been truly impressed. We had an ocean view room with two queen beds and it was large enough for the four of us. The bathroom was huge and everything was impeccably clean. What impressed me the most though were the employees and how kind they were. Without exception, they all went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. The true aloha spirit at its best. The helpful valets, the efficient personnel at check-in and checkout, the efficient waitresses with their killer smile at the breakfast buffet, everyone we dealt with was so pleasant and genuinely interested in making our stay a memorable one. I have rarely seen such good customer service through our many years of travel around the world. As others have previously said, the hotel is conveniently located one block away from the shops and restaurants. There are plenty of excellent dining options within a 10 minute walk. The hotel also has beach chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards and towels that you can borrow for a day at the beach. Just a heads up on their pool in case you didn’t check their website carefully, it only has 9-14 inches of water. This was a surprise to us but it was totally our fault. Last thing, if you have a late flight out of Honolulu, they can give you a late checkout for half the price of the daily rate for your room. They don’t have a hospitality suite that you can use to freshen up before your departure but we were told they are working on this to offer more convenience to the traveler. All in all, we highly recoomend this hotel especially for their wonderful staff. A big thank you to everyone at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki for taking such good care of us.

Just spent 6 days at this hotel. The customer service here was outstanding. I was contacted by the manager prior to my arrival and he was a delight. Check in was a breeze. The bell men/women were helpful. The room was clean and unlike other hotels in Honolulu this one is a bit more modern and fresh. There was free coffee in the lobby every morning and water available through out the day. They even provide a water bottle for your personal use. I accidentally dropped my water bottle while out and they replaced it with no issues. The hotel is close to the beach and they provide chairs, umbrellas, towels and sunscreen. Several good restaurants nearby. The only downside was concierge. They weren't too eager to help. After deciding not to do a tour we asked about car rental but since we weren't doing a tour he had somewhat of an attitude. He told us we wouldn't get a car at the last minute. However we walked in to National which is right around the corner and made a reservation with no issues. Definitely will keep this hotel in mind on my next visit to Honolulu.

I and my husband stayed here for 2 weeks on our first (and only, so far) visit to Hawaii this June. We just loved it! My husband kept telling me I had chosen a great hotel! It's a modern newly renovated building with spacious rooms and great views (we had a room on the 18th floor with mountains view - recommend). Clean, comfy and modern. Loved the "scenic Hawaii" TV program running 24/7. Quite close to the beach - something like 7-10 minutes of relaxed walk. The only thing you'd have to carry beach gear with you - umbrellas and chairs, kindly provided, - which we didn't mind (but could be not so easy if you are older/frail or have a few kids with you. But honestly, it totally was worth staying in really nice place and walking tiny bit compared to staying close to the crowded beach but in a much poorer room elsewhere. Plus of the location - relatively quiet street and literally a block away from all the shops/restaurants/supermarket etc. Also, check their restaurant - above expectations! Overall, 5 stars for us (and we are not too easy to please normally), recommend to anyone and hope to return there one day :)

Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the beach. What’s great is your room doesn’t have that smell of wetness that all the beach front hotels have. If you’re looking for a swimming pool, this isn’t the hotel for you unless you have kids then it’s great because it’s only 14 inches in depth. Clean, modern rooms. Very friendly staff. Get $5 credit a day for refusing room service. They still brought us towels and other necessities daily. Floor to ceiling windows and a view of the ocean are a plus! You’re also very central to all the restaurants and shops on the main strip. Shower has a hand held extension which is great because that’s what I’m used to back at home. Two negatives: one would be the auto lights in the bathroom. Lights kept turning off while in the shower and we had to swing the door open for the sensor to realize someone is still in the bathroom. Also, the toilet not having a separate door. Overall very happy with our choice.

Never having been to this island before, I was unsure where to stay. Hyatt Centric turned out to be the perfect choice. Great location - easy walk to beach, restaurants and shops. While inside the hotel, it feels like an oasis. Relax by the pool/splash area, or grab some food. Room was on the small side, but spotless. The staff were all very friendly. Would stay here again!

Perfect location for shops and restaurants. Excellent service. Should work on cleanliness of the rooms/attention to detail; I had personal items left in my room so obviously that area wasn’t cleaned..

A lovely hotel in a great location. The room was superb, which wonderful views. Beautiful pool with chic decking. The only slight niggle was the breakfast which ran out of things quickly and not replaced - but that said the most delicious apple filled pancakes!!!!

We booked this hotel last minute for a one night stay. Excellent hotel, very friendly staff. Awesome bathroom although some extra towels would have been appreciated. Great location for shopping - a bit of a walk to the beach. Would definitely stay here again.

Wonderful beds, perfectly clean, service was excellent and superb location.The swimming pool, area is really great but if you are expecting to do laps you will be disappointed. The pool is in a wading pool...with a couple of spas. All very nice, but you cannot swim

We needed a one night stay in Oahu and the Hyatt made even just that one night very special. It was our anniversary, and when we stepped into our very spacious beautiful room, we saw the staff had put orchids on our bed, and had

It's only a few minutes walk from main street and beach. The hotel room has nice view over the hills and the busy street. This Hyatt is more affordable than other big names in the same area. The facilities and decor are modern and fresh.My interactions with hotel staff had been great too.

Very pleased with the Hyatt Centric! My mum and I stayed for 8 nights and cannot wait to go back. The location is ideal. So close to the main street,, shopping, restaurants and beach. It was in a central location so made walking around possible. The rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly. Lisa from the Expedia desk was absolutely lovely and helpful! Thor only minor fault is that the pool is pretty shallow. However other thay, could not fault it.

If you are looking for a staff friendly place, in middle of shopping area of Waikiki, this is the hotel for you. It is a bit of a walk (15min) at my leasure walk pace to the beach not 5min. Yeah; it is true, they only have is a “wading pool”; 9” deep

Highly recommend the Hyatt Centric, the location is perfect, the room was light airy and spacious, staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I had an issue with the padlock on my suitcase, within 5 minutes of asking for help, the guy came and resolved the issue. Brilliant service all round.

There is a Good place. The hotel is lacated for convenience (shopping, having lunch, dinner) but I think the breakfast is ....hm...?Sometimes some foods have bad smell. I want fresh vegetables, but they wasn't .

We will be returning. From the initial interaction with the valet team to the end of our trip, we were WOWed by the experience. The valet team was very accomodating and after one day, they personalized each interaction. When checking in, we were provided with a refreshing drink, our very own water bottle and our very first lei. All fees and charges were explained so there would be no surprises. One great surprise was that we learned that in supporting their

A beautifully appointed hotel within walking distance of many Waikiki restaurants and shops. The rooms are quiet, comfortable and relaxing. As a bonus, the hotel has 2 hydration stations, and they provide guests with 2 complimentary water bottles; so no need to buy water or water bottles!

I love it! It was amazing, the only thing was the splash area, I was expecting a pool. But everyone is friend, helpful and the beaches are so close by. Stores for food and clothing are 1 min away it s amazing.

Easy and quick check in, welcoming and efficient. The room is very comfortable and bathroom very clean. Located right in the middle of everything, restaurants and bars, supermarkets and shopping. The only shortfall is the pool, which is only a wading pool and not suitable for any sort of swimming. Hotel provides beach chairs and toys.

I originally booked an Airbnb that turned out bad. So, I booked the Hyatt. On our arrival we were greeted with the Valet, then we rec’d shell necklaces & offered a beta fish to take care of . My daughter picked “Bruce”. The best part was A/C , a dipping pool & jacuzzi.. some where to cool off during the off hours, The Staff was super friendly & helpful!! The place is modern, clean.. They had live music one of the nights near the bar that was an added feature! The location was real close the strip of shopping, they had a Starbucks adjacent to them & other local eateries nearby you can buy a fresh baguette for $2 they have picnic items, wine etc & there’s tons of ABC stores nearby as wellWe would definitely stay here again!!

This hotel is perfect for you if you’re looking for a smaller hotel with great service. The decor is modern beachy and the rooms seem like they are rarely new or updated. Things to note:-if you are parking at the hotel the daily rate is $35-40-park on the 6th floor, which has an elevator leading to the lobby. The parking garage is shared with Nordstrom rack -hotel checks out beach chairs And beach umbrellas, towels-banana boat mini packs of sunblock upon request on first floor where they check out chairs and umbrellas -room comes with reusable water bottles-free refill water stations-no swimmable pool but there is a spa and outdoor lounging area -happy hour drinks and food poolside 4-7 pm-hotel does not have cotton balls, but does have makeup removing wipes upon request-if you do not like street noise request a higher floor-hotel is steps away from shopping and various stores (right next to Ross)-our room did not have a tub, not sure if other rooms might have one-room does not have outdoor balcony areaI was impressed by the speed of service and everyone we interacted with was friendly and helpful. I loved the cute shell necklaces we received at check in.Hotel is located 5 minutes away from the beach and right in the heart of Waikiki shopping area (department stores, H&M, food courts, etc). Overall, I recommend this hotel if you’re looking for something smaller, quieter, and easy to get in and out of. I regret to say that what took away from our stay in Waikiki, which is out of the control of any hotel here, is the number of homeless people on the streets (very depressing) and the presence of graffiti on some buildings and throughout the city in general. I was not aware of this prior to booking our trip. If you’re looking for a true island experience that’s not as touristy and free from the depressing reminders of big city life, you should consider going to Maui or one of the lesser populated islands instead.

Amazing hotel and great location - right off the Kalakaua Road and in the heart of the shopping district along with many great restaurants. If you like shopping and being near lots of good food then this place is for you. The nightlife is very lively and energetic because most restaurants and stores close late. Majority of the stores close around 10-10:30pm. There are multiple shopping malls/plazas around the area including a duty free mall. Hotel is very close to the beach. You can get there in just a few minutes. The staffs at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating. Room was very clean and spacious. Loved the contemporary design and the feel of the room. Our room was next to the elevators so we could hear them moving all day but it became like a white noise so it did not bother us. Will definitely come back again on our next visit.

We loved our stay at the Hyatt Centric! The room was well appointed and quite spacious for a family of four. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful at all hours of the day and the hotel's facilities were immaculate and of a high standard. Although not on the beach front, it is only a 5 minute walk around the corner and beach towels, chairs, umbrellas and sunscreen are available for guests to use at their leisure. All the favourites were offered at breakfast with a great view of the pool while you eat. We highly recommend staying here and would book again in heartbeat on our next visit to Honolulu.

Amazing hotel! Great staff, always willing to help! Great location, in the center of Waikiki. The room is big and pleasant. The hotel is brand new, stylish and clean. The restaurant has a great food and great service :) I highly recommended!

This hotel was a great find. Given the location, I thought it would be a standard room and service. Instead, we got a huge room with great amenities, and lots of personal attention from the staff. It felt very intimate, even in the midst of the hubbub of Waikiki. The location can’t be beat either.
user_name:
HeatherLynnB
West Chester, Ohio, United States

review_body: The staff was wonderful and I enjoyed speaking with them. Rooms are large and very clean. I thought the pool area was nice and relaxing. I see people complain about the pool, but the beach is a short walk away, and if you are in Hawaii, why would you not want to be at the beach! Close to shops and restaurants, very easy walk. I really liked the little herb garden the put in. Although we did not use this amenity, I thought it was really cool that the hotel had a limited number of fish/fish bowls that you borrow to put in your room. I travel a lot and have never seen anything like it.

My son and I stayed in Waikiki for 2 nights to do a pass through on our way home back to the mainland. We really liked this hotel - the staff was really friendly and it was very nice without being pretentious and had an almost

Stay away - I don’t understand how you can charge for a resort fee when this hotel is not a resort. The pool is laughable!! There is no pool!! I regret having booked this hotel, with so many others to choose from.

Nice room but the pool was not even a pool. It was not even 2ft deep. This was not what we were looking for traveling with our kids. It's more like a water fountain you can sit in. There were also druggies outside the hotel one in her undergarments in broad daylight. Stay away from this area if you are traveling with kids.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt Centric for two weeks. It’s the fifth time that we stayed there and we love this hotel. There are three things that make this particular property outstanding: 1 - The service team. The Ohana that work here are absolutely amazing. Some of the people that made our stay so enjoyable include Melia and Jamie at the front desk, Pookela and Vince for such warm greetings everyday (and storing our surfboards) and Unda for making every breakfast a delight. Everyone was super nice to our dog too, which made our stay very enjoyable. 2 - Location. This hotel is in a great location. It’s very easy to get to the beach and all the shops. The only downside to the physical property is there are no lanais (balconies) but the pool deck makes up for it. 3 - Music. During our state they had amazing musical acts by the pool. Tavana is incredible as always and the other artists that they presented were fantastic. It really made a big difference. I’m a little sad to write this review because now everybody’s going to want to go there in the room rates are going to go up but that’s OK. Enjoy this little Waikiki jewel. Mahalo nui loa!

The location is great. Room was clean. Welcome drink was excellent.very quiet. View was good. Some crewmembers were not nice but most of them were kind. Didnt have any food or drinks so no idea about them.

Stayed here due to flight change and required a hotel for one night. Joined the membership program that offers a cheaper rate. Early check in was permitted and much appreciated after overnight flight, the front desk/ check in staff were fabulous with a friendly and informative attitude. We stayed in a corner suite room that was spacious and well appointed with a separate living area and large bedroom that also had a really nice bathroom with shower and bath. It was a lower floor overlooking the pool area-the pool itself was a shallow toddler type design with a slightly deeper jacuzzi attached. It was still popular with sunbathers but unfortunately you can't actually swim. The hotel had live loud music the night we stayed and was clearly audible until around 1030 at night. Higher floors or a room on opposite side of pool would avoid this. Overall a great stay here and even though it didn't have a balcony I'd definitely stay here again. The bed was super comfortable so a great night's sleep was achieved.

Even though we got in fairly late we were greeted with a wonderful front desk staff and made it just in time to drop off luggage and get dinner from the in house restaurant. Needing a hot shower and rest, we found the room to be even better then the pictures!!We were on the 17th floor with a mountain view, so nice to wake up in the morning with so much serenity.This location is probably the best in all of Waikiki. Central to almost everything and within blocks of the beach, dining and shopping!I loved that there were water stations throughout the hotel and if going to the beach, towels and sun screen were available at the front desk. The only negatives I have was that the doors are extremely heavy so are a bit loud when closing and not on the hotel premises but a rooster woke me up around 4ish the 1st morning we were there. Slept with ear plugs the rest of our stay since I'm a light sleeper.Other then that we couldn't have had a better time and have already recommended this hotel to family and friends. Definitely the only hotel we'll stay at when visiting Oahu.

This was actually my 2nd time staying at the Hyatt Centric and I must say it is an excellent hotel. As soon as you walk into the lobby you are greeted with pleasant smell. I could hang out in the lobby the whole day. The rooms are very nice as well. And location is super great. Right around the corner from Marukame Udon and the International Marketplace you simply cannot go wrong. Oh and get this, if available they will bring a fish up to your room. Ours was named Sushi.

Newer hotel a bit off the beach but within walking distance. The rooms are a nice size and tastefully decorated. Everything was very clean. My room had a beautiful bathroom with a waterfall tub. No balcony. The bed was a little firm for my personal preference and the room was warmer than I like.  The thermostat control seemed to not respond to frequent setting the temp lower but it was not uncomfortable enough to call for intervention. The restaurant was fantastic and had live music one evening. Hotel staff were warm and welcoming, very helpful. Appreciate the smaller size of this hotel, quieter and more personal.

Off the beach though centrally located to shopping and food. Rooms have modern updated feel without being overly resorty. We upgraded to a ‘09 suite-great view, I think it’s the one from their ads. The beach is a walk down the street but ask for directions for the quickest way...good thing we are local and know the shortcuts. No swimming pool instead there’s a hot tub and wading pool. Looks like the kids have fun in it. The staff is very friendly but the some of the valets could be more attentive.

This hotel was fantastic. We loved everything about it. We went to HI for our anniversary and jumped around to a couple of hotels. Not only was the room our favorite...the staff, the environment, and even the smell was something we looked forward to every time we came back! (You have to go to understand the smell thing...)The ocean view suite was amazing. Just do it. Note: The pool is a party pool. It's like 6

we were booked in the the Hyatt Centric for 8 nights. The hotel was very modern and fresh. Room was fabulous on 20th floor with beautiful ocean views and very comfortable beds.Our agent told us we would have 2 queen beds and a sofa, upon arrival our room did not feature the sofa the staff were able to get us a rollaway with no extra charge and had it to our room within 10 mins. We had booked the night before for our early arrival, again our agent forgot to communicate this to the hotel but they were happy to waiver fees for us. The restaurant was a little expensive for our family budget but is so central waikiki that is was no issue to eat out.The pool is small and shallow but our kids loved it, however it was not available most evenings as musicians played everynight. Beach is only 10mins walk and hotel provide pool toys, chairs and towels.

Great place to stay. Staff were amazing. FUNNY and that is important to me. Always smiling, great recommendations on places to eat off the beaten path. My car was always ready for me when I asked. I am going back next week and am looking forward to the royal treatment.

When I pre-checked in, I specifically requested a phone call if the room is available. And I made sure they got my phone # correct! I did NOT receive any phone call at all (no miss call, no voice mail). I only received a system generated email. When I tried to find out why this happened. The staff didn’t admit their own mistakes or laziness but tried to argue with me!Another thing is about the amenities: the front desk informed me that I could get sunscreen and after-sut aloe gel at the valet. When I went down, the valet person told me they did not have them, and asked me to go up to front desk to get them. Terrible customer service experience!!!The hotel location is good, right in the center of Waikiki! 3 - 4 mins walk to ABC stores and Yokocho Waikiki! Very convenient for shopping (for all kinds of brands, including LV)!Nice view from the room to see some of the ocean (there are some tall buildings blocking the view a little bit)! Please refer to my pictures!I wished I knew I got $50 activities credits as part of its amenities! They are nice to give you special tea and seashells necklaces as welcoming gifts! As a member of Hyatt, I hope the management will pay attention to the staff training about their customer service, which matters to every customer!

I am writing to thank Alex Watson first for getting me an amazing room for my honeymoon. You rock Alex! I was overly concerned but he told me, relax I got you. I appreciate you putting up with me. When we got there we were very impressed with the staff. I never actually met Alex. But I did have the absolute pleasure of getting to meet Dan Katona. He greeted us when we arrived. him and a coworker got us checked him. He was familiar with our reservation and greeted us like old friends. I loved that! In my business it’s all about relationships. You have to have the goods (in this case a gorgeous hotel and room) but to keep people coming back you build relationships. Hyatt gets it. We stayed at the Hyatt regency at DFW before we flew to Hawaii. Same friendly staff. Back to the hotel: I loved it. The hotel is new and modern. I did NOT want to stay at an older hotel that smelled like a wet beach towel- you know what I’m talking about. The Hyatt Centric is new and modern. The pool area was small but not crowded with a working jacuzzi (I read somewhere it wasn’t, but it is). The pool is very shallow but I liked it for just hanging out and staying cool. The hotel is very centrally located. We walked everywhere. Rarely even taking an Uber. There are beach chairs with umbrellas available when you walk out. Easy to carry on your back on your 5 min walk to the beach.We worked out 4-6 days without waiting to use the equipment. There were 2 musical events/performances (I would not call them concerts) they went on from around 7-10 by the pool. Really quality performers. I was impressed. Overall it was a great honeymoon in Hawaii for us. The hotel was a huge part of that. I hope to see Dan again someday. He really made us feel like we were friends staying at his house. I included a view from our room... I miss it already.

We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Centric very much. Everyone was so nice and made us feel like we were with family. We really enjoyed Jamie from the restaurant who welcomed us each morning and put us in a good mood for the rest of the day. The room was nice and clean as well as the rest of the property. The pool is more of a place to sun tan than to swim.

They are very good at providing benefits for WOH (World of Hyatt) elite members - they try to go beyond to make sure your stay is great!The restaurant service (breakfast) can be hit or miss depends on how busy they are. There are a couple of nights every week they provide live music by the pool area - it gets busy and lively!

We were on our honeymoon June 2018. We only came to Oahu because we wanted to go to Pearl Harbor and then quickly leave on our way to Maui. We stayed just for 2 nights at the Hyatt Centric in Oahu. The hotel was clean, modern and well kept. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is not on the beach. It's a quick 5 minute walk. The hotel does offer chairs and towels so you can go to the beach. Our chairs were pretty worn out. The drink holders on the chairs were ripped so our beverages fell right into the sand. They weren't easy to close either. Again just very old and worn out. We went back to the hotel to get into the pool. It's a very small pool area. Not many chairs or lounge chairs for everyone. We had to wait a little to get chairs both times we went to the pool. My biggest complaint is that we were charged a resort fee of $25.00 per night. While I understand that resorts charge a resort fee, this hotel is not a resort. The pool is not an actual pool you can jump into unless you are a child. You can dip your feet in and cool off or roll around in it like we saw 4 adults do since it wasn't an actual pool. It's on the rooftop and it was extremely windy. Our room had a very small ceiling to floor window facing a parking lot and a street, no balcony and we didn't love the bathroom set up as well. Thankfully we only stayed 2 nights. If you are looking for a quick stay with no pool, this is a great hotel. The hotel should reconsider the resort fee as well or include maybe a breakfast. This hotel is far from a resort.

Perfect location! We love the feel of smaller hotels. Easier to get on & off the elevators without waiting for hundreds of people. Felt very safe & every staff member acknowledges you. I love the fact that the front desk is not on the ground floor.

We loved our stay! One of the best hotel experience I have had. The staff were above and beyond friendly and helpful. Our room and view of the ocean were stunning. Location to shopping and restaurants was great. Wish we could have stayed longer.

They made specific efforts to inform us about complimentary services in order to get best use of our resort fee and they went above and beyond other hotels I've been in to promote environmentally friendly practices

Excellent place to stay on Waikiki Beach. Close to everything, great entertainment and responsive customer service! Awesome way to accumulate Hyatt points. Great restaurant and proximate eateries. Ten thumbs up

Hotel is very central in the Waikiki area, close enough walk to the beach, also close to Major Bus/tour Pick Ups/Drop offs!Hotel has a spa, but not a pool pool. The Pool is great for children!Location is fantastic! Staff are super friendly!

Fantastic service. We were able to check in a few hours early coming from Australia and landing with a 6am flight. Rooms are modern and nice decor. No balconies on any rooms. Lift always quick. All staff so pleasant and friendly. Great location, so close to buses, shops, restaurants, bars and not too far from the beach. We stayed on level 9 and had no issues. Would recommend and would stay again! :)

Might just be my personal taste but I really liked this space. Very trendy and cool. Excellent staff and service. The rooms were very mod. Small pool area but kind of nice compared to the big noisy pools.

Very Nice place to stay .Big rooms friendly service,a all round great place.My family and I enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay here again.Keep up the great work and we hope to be back one day soon.

We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Centric! Everything from the food, rooms, and views was perfect! The staff was awesome and super friendly! Really close access to the beach and all the shops! Also super close to a car rental place. Can’t wait to stay here again!

Staff friendly from the people opening the doors, check-in, cleaners and waiters. Room (1807) was spacious with separate 'lounge' area. TV can be viewed from bed or lounge. King bed comfortable with choice of high or low pillows. Large shower with instant HOT water. Shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, face wipes, cotton buds and soaps replenished daily. We opted for room service every 3 days and earned $45 credit over the 2 weeks which we used in the Lanai restaurant for a delicious dinner. Fast and free WIFI. With 4 elevators you never waited more than a minute to board one. As others have mentioned, this is centrally located within walking distance to transport (The Bus, trolley lines, tour pick-ups & taxis), eateries, grocery stores, laundromat, shopping and the beach. Towels and sunscreen are available at the Lobby on 7th floor. Special mention must be made of the friendly and very helpful concierge, Ronald. He even printed out a couple of Google maps to help us get to a food tour in Chinatown. He told us the most efficient mode of transport for price and time. All tour receipts included items needed for every tour and where to walk for the pick-up. You even get $50 towards a tour. All in all, the best place we've ever stayed. Will go back on our next stay in Waikiki.

From the moment we arrived we were greeted and helped by each staff member. Each member was more than willing to help us; from hurrying our room to be cleaned to holding our luggage until our room was ready (insuring us it would be secure) Also helped us with arrangements for a ride to the airport.

This review is extremely late however as I am thinking of booking our holiday soon, and the Hyatt Centric Waikiki only comes to mind, I do wish to express the fabulousness of this hotel and its staff, as I should have a long time ago.Our holiday last year did not start off well - I fell extremely sick on the plane trip from Australia, as did my baby girl and husband soon after. I also have an extreme fear of flying, so I was not able to get any sleep on my flight and was exhausted.Entered the Hyatt Centric Waikiki - all we saw were beautiful, caring and friendly faces. The staff saw my condition and did everything they could to bring me comfort. This meant giving me a room to immediately rest, then finding us a more suitable room. There were constant check ins, offers of tea and honey, assistance with medical appointments - there was nothing they did not do for us.Most of our holiday was spent being unwell and on the days we were actually able to get up and head out, the staff were overjoyed to see us get the chance to enjoy ourselves. Never have we felt more cared for on a holiday.As some time has passed, I have forgotten some names, however the faces I can never forget; a beautiful lady that initially helped us book and answer all our enquiries (Tahnee?) another beautiful lady (I have forgotten her name) with long light brown hair who showed me every room I requested and made sure my family and I were comfortable, a lovely man with dark hair and an earring who ensured we had everything we needed at all times, with the loveliest smile and personality (I have forgotten his name) and Erica, who really did everything she could to ensure I was feeling well and recovering.It was the staff who made this holiday the best ever, considering our circumstances, and for that we are still to this day grateful. The hotel itself is stunning, new, fresh and in the best location. However, it is the staff that make it what it truly is.Thank you again beautiful people, I'm certain you remember us as we do you. Clearly some time has passed, but your gestures remain fresh in our minds.

This hotel was fabulous. Great location within brief walk to shopping, beach and dining. Cool reception area with comfortable seating where people enjoyed hanging out. Room was spacious. Great furnishings. Great view. They have pet fish to loan you. Cute idea. We loved Wyatt.

This is the perfect hotel for couples or young families who would like to stay close to Waikiki and International Market Place. It is also very close to restaurants, bars and late night shopping. We would definitely stay here on our next visit.

Hotel was amazing for its price, service was awesome and the rooms were such a great size, I would stay at this hotel every time I travel to Waikiki, it’s also in a great location to get to everything from shops to the trolley stop one street across

Ok, so I usually stay at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki, and I'll give a review and a comparison.First, new as a hotel. This used to be an office building. The first floors are parking, the lobby, pool, and fitness area are on the 10th, and the rooms go from 9 to 19. Nice new rooms. Instead of giving you two pre-filled bottles of water a day, they give you a pba-free plastic water bottle that you can take home with you, and provide filtered water in the hallways. Very cool.Had a shower only room with an all glass shower, which kind of freaked me out the first time I stepped in, then realized I could see out the window to the neighboring buildings and people could see in! Same thing when using the toilet, you can see outside. Fortunately, none of the neighbors had a view unless they had a telescope with them, and I started to enjoy showering in natural sunlight.My one issue is that the TV is glued to the wall, and there's no hookup for my iPad. Always appreciate hotels that make it easy to connect the iPad to the big screen, not possible here. Watched NETFLIX on a 10 inch screen when I wanted late night TV.Nice staff, except 10 minutes after I checked in, someone walked right into my room without knocking, making a delivery, but to the wrong room as it turned out. Good thing I was still thinking about changing clothes and hadn't started yet.Comparison to the Hyatt Regency (HR):Centric is newer and smaller than the HR Waikiki.Centric is 10 minutes from the beach, HR is 10 secondsCentric has no balconies, HR has great balconies (Centric windows do not open)Centric and HR are both convenient to lots of shoppingCentric has no iPad connections, HR has connections to the TV for iPadAll in all, I prefer the Regency because there is nothing that beats standing on your balcony staring down at the ocean, or being able to walk across the street and be at the beach. But, the hotel experience itself if probably better at the Centric.

Stayed here on my last night in Hawaii. The room was very clean and comfortable. Location of hotel was excellent. Love that they give a reusable water bottle during your stay. Service at check in could have been a little more informative but every other employee I encountered was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

We traveled to Oahu for my daughter's wedding. We had the most pleasant experience at the Hyatt Centric. Our room was upgraded to a penthouse suite. We had a gorgeous ocean view from the 21st floor, the bathroom was gorgeous! The amenities offfered by the hotel were perfect for our purposes (we didn't plan to spend lots of time there). Pool and spa were clean and fun. Excellent happy hour deals. The lobby is pretty and the staff are friendly and courteous, going the extra mile to make sure we got all we needed. The hotel is located close to all sorts of restaurants and shopping areas. The beach is just a couple of blocks away and you get chairs, umbrellas, and sunscreeen (if you want to) from the hotel as part of the resort feel. Parking is the only downfall, but that's a general thing in the island. Not the cheapest thing, but certainly better than San Francisco. If you're planning to rent a car, be prepared to pay for the parking structure (which includes Valet service). You'll have peace of mind, and won't have to worry about the safety of the vehicle, or walking miles to get your car. We were happily suprised by all the goodies and friendliness we received. I would certainly go back.
user_name:
Michelle D
San Francisco, United States

review_body: Great, clean hotel. Excellent location. Staff is very welcoming. Will consider staying again if returning to Waikiki Beach. Very chic, modern, and quiet hotel. Amenities are great and valet parking is fast. Overall, a pleasant experience!

A pleasurable experience. Great view on a 5 minute walk to the beach.I didn't think I would every stay in something like this.The hotel staff were helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly. They made me feel special, which I am.

What a wonderful gem in the heart of Waikiki. Clean, very modern and a tranquil peaceful resting location after a long day exploring the island or at the beach. We were genuinely surprised by the wonderful hotel experience. They go above and beyond to delivery such nice personal touches, that we cannot wait to go back again soon!

There were very courteous employees so willing to make your stay superb which they did. Beautiful accommodations perfectly kept. Very upscale and high tech. I felt very safe there. I will always look for a Hyatt Centric where ever I go from now on. We loved staying there.

Everything was excellent, location at the heart of Waikiki and shopping. My only issue is the lack of a pool, the pool on the property is a splash pool, so other than soaking in the jacuzzi, no swimming. Also, happy hour prices were slightly higher than other surrounding area bars and hotels. I would definitely recommend!

We enjoyed a staycation. Our second time using this hotel. We like the quality of this hotel. It is very nice and enjoyable when we come here. It is centrally located in Waikiki, easy to get around the area.

Beautiful hotel near Waikiki Beach and the best shops. Staff were amazing and helpful. Stayed at Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa first two nights of business trip but they could not accommodate us the final night of our stay. I WISH we had stayed at the Hyatt Centric the whole trip!

After having flights cancelled 24hours prior to flying out, we had to leave another hotel and book here as this was only place where there was a room available. On arrival we were greeted with a lovely iced tea at the reception and a very nice person who checked us in. The hotel looked and smelt so clean, and both my partner and I wish we had booked accommodation with these guys in first place as we had a nice room and very central to town with also the availability for express checkout through phone as we left 4am which was very convenient. If we come back to Honolulu definitely staying here.

The hotel was located very close to the beach and to other stores and restaurants that made it almost unnecessary to require a car unless driving very far. Very helpful staff, eager to please. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed in a deluxe quadruple room with ocean view on the 19th floor, breakfast was included in the room rate, at this centrally located hotel, and even though it was close to all the main shops and restaurants it was still very quiet. We saw the firework display from our room, at night which was spectacular.The pink trolley bus that went to the Ala Moana shopping centre was just a few minutes walk across the road, Waikiki Beach was a 5 min walk., the hotel provides beach towels.Booking tours was a breeze with this hotel. The staff friendly and helpful. Great initiative to provide bpa drink bottles and the filter & ice station on our floor very handy. Only down side was that we weren’t given enough information about our breakfast, or what it included,

Wanted to try a smaller hotel for a quick trip to Waikiki, and Hyatt Centric fit the bill. Quit rooms,Great view of the ocean and the pink palace. Will stay longer next time. My only request would to simply put soap despencers etc. attached to the wall in the shower, would make so much eco friendly than little bottles and tubes of everything.

Over priced. Ocean view obscured. King room fits one person comfortably. 1 chair. No desk/table. Daily resort fee $25. Daily parking fee $39. RIP off. Concierge was no help. We enjoyed our time on Oahu, but we did not relax at this location. Do not recommend.

Recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric and found the hotel to be great. We had two rooms a twin and a king. Both rooms were very spacious with ample bathroom space. Staff were always friendly and helpful. It is close to shops, restaurants and only a few minutes walk away from the beach. For those who love shopping there is a Ross' and Nordstrom Rack just round the corner. There is also access to a Starbucks directly from the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking to stay in a central location when visiting Waikiki.

I stay at the Hyatt centric very often and the staff is all very friendly and pleasant. Especially front desk and valet the hotel room is always clean and the maid service is excellent !And very quiet to sleep the only area that I believe really needs major improvement is the Restaurant food .I would say is just about average and the service is getting better since the hotel opened

Everyone was full of smiles and very welcoming, the room was very classy and comfy the bath and shower is most girls wish. Room service kept it up very well. No complaints here I'll most definitely come back. Also we loved having Starbucks reserve downstairs very convenient for my daily morning cup of joe.

I needed a bit of R&R, so I ended up choosing to stay at the Centric as it was more reasonably priced and felt less impersonal than the grand properties that are right on the beach. I was very impressed by the staff at the hotel from check-in, where the agent provided the right amount of information about the hotel properties and its services before sending me to my room. The room was great - very bright with a partial ocean view. Breakfast at the Lanai was very tasty. The location of the hotel is a few blocks from the beach, but it was very convenient to the restaurants and shops on Waikiki Beach. I'll stay here again the next time I am back in Honolulu.
user_name:
awc4
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel itself was newer compared to others in the area but the friendly staff really made the difference. Alex helped us check in our first day but unfortunately our room was one of the smaller ones. We asked if others were available and he gave us 3 room keys so we can look in person and choose the room to our liking! That has never happened before. Needless to say, we found the perfect room and loved our stay. The valet was quick and easy as we could call down to give them a 5 minute notice. Each time, our car was sitting there waiting for us. They also open the door for us (which is too much for me) but definitely a nice gesture. Linda at the front also gave us a nice thank you during our check out. Overall, would stay again.

This hotel is beautiful and the staff are WONDERFUL and its location is PERFECT. Thank you for offering gluten free toast for a sub with breakfast! And an additional thanks to the woman at the front desk who gave me a bandaid for my huge blister after hiking. Wonderful service.

I got upgraded to a ocean view suite room, the room was very nice & modern, thank you! The location of the hotel is close to everything - shopping & few minutes walk to beach.I would love to come back when I visit Honolulu next time.

There’s no denying the chic & trendy decor in this hotel. Everything is so modern, clean and elegant in this hotel! Every detail does not go unnoticed. The hotel staff is wonderful and very accommodating as soon as you enter through the lobby. Here’s what we loved about it:+ The room & the view was amazing!+ For a place near the hustle and bustle of  Waikiki, it was super quiet! + Beds are nice and comfy+ Hotel staff is wonderful and accommodating as soon as you enter the lobby!Here’s what we didn’t love as much:- Service was a little slow at the Lanai  restaurant- The “pool” is more like a splash pool- There’s no balcony to enjoy the  wonderful viewI definitely will be staying here the next time I come to Waikiki. Location is great, staff is super accommodating, decor is chic & modern, rooms are a nice size and very quiet. Thanks for a wonderful stay Hyatt! We’ll see you again soon!

In summary, the staff and host at Hyatt Centric were nothing by helpful and professional!As it's our 1st family vacation, we felt like home and didn't have any issues with asking many questions. Location is great and close to most things. Will definitely come back again! Thanks Kaniala!David

Great location with excellent shopping, food places, easy beach access and great for day trips. Newly renovated with nice big bathroom with movement sensor for those nighttime toilet trips, big screen TV, very pleasant and helpful staff...nothing was a problem. Will stay here again.

We stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel location is just perfectly fine for us. It's 2 mins walk to the shopping area, surrounded by many good restaurants, stores, 5 mins walk to Waikiki beach. It's a boutique hotel, which has a very new, clean, nice decoration room. I really could not find any minus point while staying here. Staffs were so friendly, very helpful too. Free reusable plastic bottles (that you can bring to the beach), free coffee in the morning. Parking lots is convenient. If you park at 6F, it's directly connected to the hotel elevator. Self-parking costs $39 per day though. You can get in-out as many times as you want. Since you need to pay resort fee $29+tax a day, so you can borrow beach chair, umbrella, towel from the 1st floor. We borrowed ones for beach picnic, sun bath. :) Pool was not really a pool but not bad for relaxing in the afternoon and enjoy hot bath Jacuzzi.No washing machine inside the hotel, but there's one coin laundry nearby. Well, I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Hawaii. Here's strongly recommended.

Stayed here for 5 nights in Ocean View room 21st floor, floor to ceiling windows in a corner room - AMAZING !! Few little hiccups - air-conditioner made rattling sound on the first night - hotel fixed immediately and followed up to check if there was no noises after. Issues with TV working , staff member at the door within 5 minutes to fix. Staff are so friendly and attentive to every need. Location is perfect to all shopping, restaurants and beach, We would definitely stay at this hotel next time in Hawaii. Also happy hour is great with cocktails.

The hotel was very nice, super central, but in a quite street.The room was very clean and the "ceiling to floor" windows amazing!!!!What I didn't like was that you have to pay more then 30 dollars per day for "resorts fees" when the only thing they give you is a very small towel, some sun screen and a portable chair. The pool is ridiculous as it is very small.In addition they block 50 dollars per night from your card, without telling you. And this could couse problems if you have a limit.

Arrived the day before my birthday from Australia. We got picked up at the airport and we were presented with a lei and shell necklace which I wore everyday. We arrived around 1230, checked in and luckily for us our room was ready. Room was nice and big with a view. The hotel is modern, new and clean. The hotel is close to everything. Walking distance to the beach and all major shopping and eating shops. Staff were all very nice and helpful. They give you beach chairs, towels, beach toys, sunscreen and umbrellas free to use when you want. Thanks for a great stay.

We stayed here for one night, we didn't have it booked ahead of time but I punched in the price on my phone on the Hyatt web site and thought wow great deal, so we just showed up there, but when I said I wanted the room that I punched up for a certain price that the web site was showing me, I was told that the room is quite a bit more when you just show up and ask for a room.. That kind of suprised me because I think it was around 60$ or so more maybe more. So I used the lobbys website and punched it up and reserved it using my phone for the deal that I had previously saw, then walked over to the desk and voila got my room lol.. We were given a beautiful room, very clean and very modern yet beachy, one of the nicest rooms I have ever seen, everything was done to perfection! We were given complimentary Hyatt reusable water bottles also, very nice touch! Loved this place!!

This place is the exact opposite of a tourist trap and is a welcome oasis of it tranquility within the insane bustle of Waikiki beach and it’s large unfriendly disgusting tourist hotels! When you arrive, make sure to look for Dan, who is one of the best hotel employees you’ll ever meet in your life. Even though it’s not right on the beach, it’s just a block or so away, but it seems like 1,000,000 miles and wait when it comes to the fact that you don’t have hordes of tourists and screaming children and all sorts of other stuff happening. It is really quiet and high-end and felt more like a Four Seasons than any Hyatt I have ever stayed at. It’s pretty much brand new, or at least it seems that way. I’ll be back over and over.

Beach front hotels in Waikiki are often expensive and fall short of delivering quality for the price (mostly due to reliance on reputation with very poor maintenance and service practices). The Hyatt Centric is two blocks off the Waikiki beach front, but that comes with some major advantages: More reasonable rates for larger rooms with less street noise. The hotel offers a quick and easy walk to all that Waikiki has to offer as well as convenient access to the major thoroughfares for driving to the rest of Honolulu and Oahu. A few caveats:- Reception, concierge, valet and restaurant staff are top-notch (the reception staff definitely went above and beyond for us), but the quality of housekeeping can be hit-or-miss... Excellent and efficient one day and haphazard, bordering on sloppy, the next.- If you want a decent view, city or Diamond Head, be sure you're above the 12th floor.- The hotel employs eco-AC... In larger rooms/suites like we had, it is not always sufficient to properly cool the entire space, especially during the day when sunlight through the windows raises the room temperature, so you have to set the thermostat to a much lower temperature than you would normally expect and be ready for it to take 10-15 minutes for the room to cool down upon return (the system shuts off when the room is unoccupied).- The fitness center isn't worth the extremely limited space dedicated to it... The hotel would be better off using that space for another purpose and forming a partnership with a local gym for those interested in maintaining their training regimen during their visit. The Honolulu Club is only a 10-minute drive away with ample parking and is probably the best fitness center in the city (and they offer day passes).Overall, we had a very pleasant stay in one of their Diamond Head View Suites (with King Bed), but because we got it for a discounted rate, we were on a lower floor without much of a view (not very important to us, but in Hawai'i, having a view can definitely impact the experience).
user_name:
Todd G
Washington DC, District of Columbia
