review_body: We are frequent visitors to Hawaii. We prefer Maui, the Big Island, and Kauai, but often fly into or out of Honolulu. My daughter and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric in June 2017. The hotel is well situated, close to shops in Waikiki and walking distance to the beach. I'm a fan of the Honolulu Cookie Company, and they have a shop a block away. There is a parking structure with ample parking for the hotel The lobby and bedroom decor is clean and modern. Check-in was swift, and we were offered a bottle of water on arrival. The beds are comfortable and rooms quiet. We did not eat in the restaurant, so we can't comment on that experience.

Hyatt Centric is well located right in the heart of Waikiki, close to shops, trolley routes and restaurants. The staff at Hyatt Centric are extremely courteous and friendly. The too are very spacious and clean.with excellent views. We had an enjoyable stay there recently.

We pay 29.99 for services and it's been lacklustre at best. Certain things Hyatt Centric asks us to pay for per day weren't being done. I can understand mistakes happen, but something everyday? It's too bad because the set up here is terrific.

This is my first time in Honolulu, HI and the staff has been great! The room is nice, spacious and very clean! My favourite part is the the bathroom with the wet bath and shower combination. The views from the hotel room are nice. The only downfall is that parking is an additional charge as it shares a parkade which is $39/night. Also the rooftop terrace is only a hot tub and splash area, which I though there was an actual pool. I was slightly disappointed but nothing that would deter me from staying here again. Overall the experience so far has been wonderful as they provide reusable water bottles and beach towels for all the guests to use.

Excellent room with modern finishes. Awesome helpful staff for the cleaners to the desk and great facilities. Really looking forward to coming back in the near future. And the location is great, central to everything.

Everything about our stay was fantastic! Upon arrival the staff were amazing, so helpful, nice and attentive! The hotel was absolutely beautiful & our room was so big! Staff were happy to help and were so honest and nothing was too much trouble! I love that they also offer you a $5 credit for bar/restaurant for each day you don't get room service done! What a fantastic idea!!!The pool was BEAUTIFUL & the cocktails AND food (both bar & restaurant) were to die for! I can't wait to come back to this beautiful friendly hotel! Really made our trip so wonderful!

This was our first time staying at a Hyatt Centric. Although the hotel wasn’t on Waikiki Beach, it was only a short 5 min walk through Sheraton to get to the edge of Waikiki beach. My husband and I enjoyed being in the middle of the hustle and bustle, with awesome food and shopping just within steps of the hotel entrance. The room was large, spacious, clean, and modern - definitely hard to beat this city living in the center of Waikiki! The foldable lawn chairs and beach umbrella for borrow was easily handled by the staff and very convenient for guests to carry over to the beach. There is a daily resort fee which I think is a little high for it not being a ‘real’ resort. We will definitely book Hyatt Centric again in the future!

I live in a small country town, so when I’m staying at a hotel in the middle of a downtown environment I’m always slightly skeptic about the quality of my stay.Boy was I impressed here.....The Centric staff are welcoming and friendly, they looked after me like I was a regular at their facility - loved that. Location was great with a good mix of food/bar options nearby.Quiet.....wow the rooms were so quiet, no noise from rooms above or the road below. If the beach/ocean are not your main reason for visiting Waikiki then give this place a go.

For someone who also works in hospitality this is once place probably the only place I’ll recommend. They have def set the standard of what great customer service is and I respect that. That’s why I’ll continue to come to the Hyatt Centric.

King bed with an ocean view - a large room with an extra large bathroom as well! Just what we needed for a week's holiday at Waikiki. 5 minute walk to the beach - 2 minutes from main street. Felt safe at all times. An expensive holiday but compared to some hotels I've seen it was priced for what we got.

This hotel was amazing! All of the staff was friendly and very helpful. I love that this is a pet-friendly hotel. The pet fee is just one payment, not a per night situation. It is a perfect location for downtown Waikiki. You can walk to restaurants, shopping malls and the beach. My room was spacious, clean, and it didn't smell like some hotels that are pet-friendly, which is good. The only thing I would suggest is for you to go elsewhere for drinks if you plan to drink a couple of alcoholic drinks, because you can find cheaper prices elsewhere.

The hotel is new and well decorated. There is a nice bath tub in my room.The location of the hotel is really good, there are bus stations nearby, and walkable distance to the Waikiki beach and restaurants.

We greatly enjoyed our first stay at this Hyatt property. The service was great and the atmosphere of the lobby was upbeat, vibrant and welcoming. Located close to lots of great restaurants and shopping. We would definitely stay here again.

Loved this hotel! It had music on Friday night and free water bottles, refill stations, the coolest chairs. I was greeted by the nicest people and the room was amazing. I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend!

Nice, modern hotel. Great location, etc. it’s near the shopping area and the Int’l Market. It’s also just a ten-minute walk to Waikiki beach. Starbucks around the corner and lots of boutique shops nearby.

I had decided sense this is where me and my friends hang out on Friday nights for the amazing weekly live music this is where I should have my birthday celebration. I approached Jackie one of the managers and told her what I was thinking about for my friends and I. She took those ideas and put them in motion and her and her staff way exceeded our expectations my hats off to all of them. It's a perfect location an awesome lobby bar venue and an incredible staff and a special thanks to Glenn at the bar who always handles me with so much Aloha. Mahalo

We loved this boutique Hotel, quiet and away from all the busy front resorts, but only a 4min walk to beach! Staff were very friendly and made us feel at home. Rooms were spacious, clean and lovely interiors. Staff even decorated our room with flowers,chocolates and balloons, as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The concierge staff were extremely friendly, happy to help in any way and always knew who we were when we arrived back from the day. Drinks on friday night in the lobby is a must, they have a live entertainer who was outstanding!!! we recommend staying at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach and will definitely come back, it was a home away from home!!!

Watch out for the resort fee which they all charge but some don’t tell you and they don’t tell you when you arrive so you won’t use it , covers towels ,beach chairs , umbrella etc ! You can forgo the daily linen and get a credit but they will try to restrict your use if you use as a group at dinner .

Excellent clean new rooms. Really nice boutique feel away from the giant crowds of the beach front hotels and yet you are only 3 min walk to the beach. It's right in the heart of all the big name shops. On Friday nights they have an entertainer called tavana (I think). He was superb. Great crowd and awesome atmosphere. Friendly staff and great food. Can highly recommend this place and would definitely stay there again.

Excellent stay in every manner. I stay here every time I come to Honolulu for work. Staff and quality of the hotel are the standouts. Love the rooms. Perfect location. I really wish more hotels were of this standard.

This hotel offers a very different and unique experience from your traditional hotel. It provides a personal, friendly vibe that feels relaxed and comfortable. The staff are great, and the size and quality of the rooms is amazing.

I had an awesome stay at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki while there for business. The staff is professional, always kind and courteous. The onsite restaurant's food is amazing. Jaime, Kylie, and Jamela greeted me with a smile every morning as I enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Robert and Glen were the bartenders that provided g.d reat conversations and cocktails to wind down at the end of the day. Finally, Rachel, Tom, David, Alex Osaki, Romelo, Erica, Sally, and all of the Hyatt Centric staff played a major role and made my stay enjoyable.

This is a great hotel, with well appointed, modern and clean rooms. We were provided with drink bottles and there were water filling stations in 3 locations through the hotel (handy for visiting Diamond Head, etc.). The location is superb as it is just around the corner from the main shops, etc. and very close to the bus service. My daughter loved minding one of the hotel's pet fish in our room. The only negative was that the 'pool' was more like a wading pool, but this is petty as you are very close to the beach! Would definitely go back again.

This is a great hotel except for timeliness of housekeeping. So if you like timely housekeeping and taking a break in your room to relax forget it.... you’ll be waiting all day. We were out everyday before 8am and arrived back in late afternoon around 3pm for a week and every day our room was as we left it. Unacceptable for the amount we paid per night and there is absolutely zero the hotel will do. Glad to leave

Great Hotel! Great Staff! Easy in and out for business travelers. My over all experience was great! Parking next door and easy access to hotel rooms. Walking distance to almost all of the shopping. Will be back often.

My family and I stayed one night at the Hyatt Centric. We had two rooms - one a double for my wife and I and the other a twin for our two sons. We were impressed with the freshness of the hotel. Simple, but uplifting decor as well as comfortable beds made for an enjoyable stay. Bathrooms were clean, bright and well set out. Other touches that impressed were the open air reception, bar area that led to the pool. We loved the idea of having a pet fish for a night and grew quite attached to Wyatt.The only question mark that we did have was the pool which did not seem to have any adult area.The position of the hotel is fine, set back just over 100 yards from the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua Ave but still being easily accessed to the sights and restaurants of Waikiki.Staff were bright and friendly and very helpful. Would we stay again - You bet!

Was a little shy at first about this hotel but I got over that fast. It's like in a remodeled office or apartment building so the rooms are HUGE. Lots of space and tons of stuff to do and eat very close by. I will look at booking this hotel in the future for sure. Check in was a bit awkward as I believe someone was being trained and the manager was not jumping in when it was getting very backed up.

The hotel is new and of good location to shopping. The hotel staff are friendly and the room is comfortable. It would be of better value if they could offer more water station per floor. The hotel staff did not remember to print out the receipt for us which will be better they provide us a electronic copy.

As always, the pros and cons in a quick review:PROS:Clean rooms and bathroomsHas an awesome Starbucks attached to lobbyBed was nice-no issues.Always ice water with fruit in lobby.Cool complimentary sport water bottles you can take home (2 of them)CONS:DO NOT stay in any room ending in 03. We stayed in a room ending in 03 which we were told was an upgrade. Hardly an upgrade, but just the opposite since it shares a wall with the elevator shafts. The whistling noise of the elevators was too much and the front desk could only offer ear plugs. They did offer to refund our money so we could go somewhere else, but due to the time of night no availability close to us. We tried to get sleep, but the noise was loud. We didn't sleep to stay the least. Not what we expected from a Hyatt. No joke (look at my other reviews), our worst experience in a hotel. Luckily we only stayed here one night...My overall thought, nice hotel but never accept room ending in 03 if you plan on getting sleep.

It was my husbands bday trip and The Hyatt Centric did not disappoint. The front desk staff were so welcoming and sweet! They welcomed us with leis and Melia checked us in right away with the warmest smile! The room was on the 22nd floor with floor to ceiling windows and the view was spectacular! We even got to enjoy the weekly Friday fireworks from the comfort of our room! The location is also great, it was in the heart of everything! This trip will be deep in our memories forever, and the best present from the staff to my husband!

I recently spent a week here on vacation with my girlfriend. We were very pleased with our choice to stay here, as opposed to one of the beachfront hotels that are just a few blocks away. This hotel was completely renovated a year ago. It could pass for new. It even had that "new hotel" smell.We had a Diamond Head view Suite, Room 1602. Room was spacious, exceptionally clean and had a modern contemporary design. The side of the room overlooking the city had full glass walls instead of windows. Mattress was soft and comfortable. There were a variety of pillows with different firmness to choose from. One day we were alerted there was going to be a protest in the street the next morning, but we didn't hear a thing. Nor did we hear the sirens, crazy homeless people yelling on the streets, or the madhouse that is Waikiki. Very comfortable stay!Basic Wifi was complimentary and quick enough to stream video without issue. Room Key card needed to access guest floors by elevator. The pool is small and only about three feet deep, and there's no Hot tub to compliment it, but so be it. We don't usually even end up using the pool when we stay somewhere. Located just off the main drag, the beach is less than five blocks away. The surrounding streets are filled with convenience stores, markets, restaurants, high end clothing outlets, etc. anything you might need. However, prices are much lower if you have a car or Uber and can go do your shopping at stores away from the touristy area the hotel is in. If you don't want to spend $50+ a meal to eat out, there's a large food court on the 2nd floor of the mall at the end of Seaside Ave with a decent selection of cheaper offerings. The place was always packed with other tourists.Only two minor issues, not a big deal and not really even the hotel's fault for the second one...After two nights declining housekeeping, they failed to clean our room and change the sheets the third day. We left for the day at noon and took the DND sign down. Cleaners were out in the hall. Had to request sheets/towels, and do it ourselves when we returned that night. They were super quick to bring them up to the room.On the morning we checked out, we'd misread a street sign and got our car towed. The front desk manager was helpful with contacting the police and locating the car. However, she gave us the wrong address for the tow lot. The tow company had moved the year before, way out by the airport, on the the other side of town from where we Uber'd! We spent three hours on a wild goose chase looking for the car! (I think she Googled it and the old address popped up? So I won't blame her for our mistake. ) Make sure to read the signs! With that said...FREE PARKING ADVICEParking is expensive in Waikiki. Usually about $50 per day. However, non-guests can park about a seven minute walk down the street at The Banyan Condo tower garage for $20 per 24 hours. The cheapest you'll find. A real deal actually.Also, free street-side parking can be found three blocks north, along the 1+ mile Ala Wai Blvd, boarding the canal, (everyday except Mon and Fri from 8:30am-11:30am for street sweeping) It's best find a spot early, say, before 4pm. Then leave it there and use Uber for short trips around the city.You can also park for free down by the zoo on Monsarrat Ave, and walk 10 minutes back, or Uber for $5-6. And there is free parking about a mile away on Ala Mona Blvd, -next to the park and Marina-Almost empty late at night. Uber 5 mins back to hotel for $6, or take public bus for $2.50During daylight hours you can park in the large Ala Mona park's parking lot for free. We managed to go a whole week and only paid to park one night. (Although getting towed ruined our pride and savings over the accomplishment!) I recommend renting the smallest compact car. We couldn't have fit into the spaces we found with a midsize or larger. With the compact, we always found a place to squeeze in.

We traveled to Honolulu with our 1 year old baby and were looking for a family and location-friendly spot. We were incredibly happy with our stay at the Hyatt for several reasons. Firstly, we were in Hawaii for our friend’s wedding - and saw a few other hotels that they stayed at (eg Royal Hawaiian, which I initially wanted to stay at since I have SPG status but so happy I didn’t - rooms are significantly smaller and much more outdated). Hyatt feels brand new, has quite a chic feel to it and has VERY spacious rooms / bathrooms. We requested a baby crib for our arrival , which sadly wasn’t set up when we got there after ten hours of traveling, but the staff (especially Lydia) was incredibly courteous and professional and did right by us! The location is another amazing advantage - as soon as you walk out, you are right on the main boulevard. We also loved the restaurant located inside the hotel - I think it was called Lanai. We rarely eat at hotel restaurants (they are usually underwhelming and overpriced). This one was a pleasant exception - their seafood squid ink pasta is one of the best I’ve had (and I am a foodie!). The one downside is the shallowness of their pool, which other reviewers note. There is a hot tub, which on a hot day is not that pleasant. The shallowness of the pool was actually perfect for our little girl (and other older kids) but don’t expect to be able to do laps there. With that said, it was very serene and pleasant - and we never had an issue getting a (complementary) cabana, which was definitely not the case for our friends in Royal! Overall, very very happy with our stay and special thanks for their professional staff (especially Lydia, who works in Sales I believe, and their housekeeping, that has a top-notch attention to detail..)Highly recommend this hotel for your next vacation to Honolulu. Oh, and if you end up going, make sure to go to the coffee spot right across from H&M on the second floor up the escalator...prob one of the best cafes in the area!

Rooms were not sound proof. We were changed to a different room (than what we booked) that was right next to the elevator. No sleep. The front desk offered us earplugs. Grrrr I already had earplugs and it was still crazy loud! Never again!

Great hotel in nice area near shopping. Quick 10 minute walk to the beach, staff provide beach chairs, towels and refillable water bottles! Room was nice size with good view. Front desk open 24/7. Only downside is no laundry on site.

Loved this new-ish hotel with updated furnishings and a great bathroom! The large picture windows gave the room some wonderful natural light. Our room was facing the golf course/Ala Wai Canal/mountain side. Great sleep until our early wake up call of a rooster crowing - but he adds to the character of this spot on Waikiki. I'm sure he was here before the hotel was established! The pool area is more for sunning than swimming, but the beach is 2 blocks away. There is a small fitness room and a nice Starbucks on the ground floor. The hotel is surrounded by great restaurants and convenient stores. There's a small grocery store nearby on Kuhio.

My husband and I stayed for 5 nights for our Honeymoon. We didn’t have anything negative to say but we also didn’t have anything amazing to say either. Pros:- staff are all friendly. As we arrived into Hawaii early in the morning we couldn’t check in until later that afternoon but after staff seeing my husband and I waiting in the lobby they “upgraded” us to a slightly bigger room so we didn’t have to wait which was nice.- room size is quite good! With a coffee machine in the room. No mini bar though. - they give you free water bottles on arrival and have cold, fruit infused, water in the lobby to re fill your bottle. As well as access to a coffee machine to make yourself a free coffee. Leis on arrival also. - they also give you a $50 voucher to use when booking any tours through them which we used on a helicopter ride. - they have different events on throughout the week such as free yoga class or bands playing. One night Taimane Gardner played in the lobby and that was really cool to watch. - Main Street is a 30 second walk. Ross store right next door. As well as a Starbucks, Nordstrom Rack and an ABC store. Cons: - They charge you an extra fee of $30US everyday to use their amenities such as pool towels, drink on arrival (just fruit infused water), wifi and the gym. They also claim that charge gets you sunscreen, however when we asked for it they didn’t have any. - The pool is just a shallow sitting pool. Can’t actually swim or submerge your body. They have a “hot tub” style connecting to it which is a nicer touch though. - Breakfast selections are limited. We didn’t pay the extra $30 odd for breakfast every morning and kind of glad we didn’t as the buffet is quite small and so is the a la carte menu. Pricy too! - a bit of a walk to the beach. Couple street back but about a 10min walk. Overall we did enjoy our stay just wish we had chosen something a little more “romantic” or closer to the beach for our honeymoon. I feel it’s a great hotel for non honeymooners but if your after something a little fancier maybe something along the beach with a nicer view and facilities.

My wife and I recently stayed at this location for a week in March, just before spring break. We wouldn’t hesitate to come back to this hotel. The service is fantastic. The location was great for us.Staff are prompt and very friendly. Front desk check in/out was a breeze. House keeping worked like ninjas, we never saw them even though we were in/our of the room at odd times throughout the day. The room was always turned down with attention to detail, sometimes even twice a day! The room itself was great, I believe they upgraded us from what we originally had which was a plus. The decor is modern and stylish. Soaker tub is a nice touch though it’s very loud when filling/draining. My wife loved the ring light/mirror but wished it could go brighter. The toilet had a heated bidet seat, another nice touch. The cheap paper thin toilet paper however was out of place in a hotel like this. The king size bed was firm and relatively comfortable. My wife didn’t have any issues with it while I would wake up sore from pressure points on the hips. To be fair, I have a tempurpedic at home so it’s hard to get used to other beds. Bedding is a very subjective issue.The lobby, restaurant and splash pool are all on the 5th floor and if you use the parking garage the hotel elevators are on the 6th floor. There aren’t clear signs that tell you this and most people like us end taking a different set of elevators on the first try. It’s a bit confusing at first. Parking is $39/24hrs. There are no weekly discounts unfortunately. I think the hotel should have special rates for guests because $273 to park for a week is steep. Especially when you add on their “resort” fees. The location was just right for us. Right in the middle of everything. The beach is a 10-15 walk. Shopping all around. Kalakaua Ave has most of the high end shops and street performances. Lots of things to do and see.All in all I would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here during our wedding'/honeymoon. Decided to surprise my husband with a little something/cake for after our ceremony. But Jackie went above and beyond to decorate our room with beautiful orchids and gifted us with sparkling white wine, too! She was super creative and fun! Absolutely adored her! The hotel itself was gorgeous! We got a higher level room with ocean view. Spectacular views!!! It was new as well, so everything was spic and span. The location was also really good as it was close to everything in Waikiki. Walk everywhere! Cool/chic lobby! It would be even better if they have hot tub/jacuzzi at the rooftop pool. The restaurant was just so-so. But there are so many other great restaurants within walking distance. Definitely will come back and recommend to others!

The location of this hotel couldn’t be better. Easy walk to beach, great shopping and restaurants. The hotel is beautifully decorated and our room was very comfortable. Beds had very nice linens, lots of room for our family of four. Bathroom was very large. Hotel Pool is really just a splash pool, not deep at all. The surrounding deck/Lanai area is awesome to have drinks and watch the sun go down. Very nicely decorated with comfortable seating. Every staff member we encountered during our stay was friendly and helpful. Parking garage is convenient but tight fit for larger vehicles. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Our condo owner recommended the local entertainment on Wed and Sat in the Hyatt Centric Lounge. Really good Hawaiian musicians in a small informal setting, no cover charge. Seating (in the bar or at the pool) goes fast so check with Hyatt about the start times (they vary) and show up early. Good drinks and appetizers, and the service is good, notably Randy.

Great central location in Waikiki. Starbucks and Jamba Juice literally part of same building. Shopping all around and in walking distance. Rooms are much larger than normal and very nice! Lower floors will be more prone to noise from the "city". Don't expect to swim in the "pool". Deepest part is 14", but there is a "no-diving" sign to remind you!! There is a hot tub. Housekeeping consistently came in the late afternoon, 4-5pm, everyday that we were there, but did come. Good supply of all the room amenities that you'll need. Jackie is fantastic! Amazing how she remembers a lot of the guest's names and is down for good coversation and recommendations as needed! Thank you!!! Overall a great value for Waikiki area if you're not looking to swim in a pool!

To us this hotel is disappointing. The room is nicely designed with white color and modern glass shower, and that is all it offers. We are situated on a low floor overlooking the street with ice machine noises being constant as our room is right next to it. Service comes really late and the rooms are cleaned after 5 which means the room stays messy and towels don’t get replaced till the evening. This hotel somehow gets to call itself a resort but it is not. It really doesn’t offer anything like a resort. It just offers you a location in the middle of the upscale shopping district. There are many better options for same money where you can get a real adult pool and beach. The pool on pictures is just a very shallow one, fit for toddlers. You have to ask for everything which feels like you are begging to get an amenity that is included in your costs. For example a robe if available upon request. Everything is available upon request but they don’t make it known what is available to you. They give you for example $50 toward activities but that only applies to very expensive activities so you probably won’t use that. The worst part of staying here is that there is no balcony, no fresh air, the windows are inoperable and that is no way to spend your vacation in Hawaii. I will be more careful next time with the hotel to choose.

The room was great and clean. The elevator was slightly old, but the building was renovated and you can’t really complain on the elevator. Stayed about 6 nights. First room we got was amazing but close to the elevator. I could hear everything from outside clear and loud. I wrote a review on that and they actually switched the room to upper floor. Since I was 5 months pregnant, I needed good sleep and that was nice of them to change the room.

I was lucky to sit next to someone on the plane who recommended I go see Taimane at the Hyatt. He said she plays every Wednesday night and it’d be well worth my while to check it out. Let me tell you, she absolutely did not disappoint! Taimane is incredible! Her sheer talent, performance and personality is all top notch. Highly recommend seeing her on Wednesday nights! The venue and the service are amazing as well. Our server, Randy, is the best!! He went far out of his way to make sure we had a fantastic experience. We told him how much we loved the performance, and could tell we were becoming fan girls already, so he arranged for us to meet Taimane after the show! Who does that?! This guy should definitely be getting a raise. As if that wasn’t enough, he recommended the best drink and food options to us. Everything was delicious! This was actually one the best experiences during our entire trip. We will definitely be coming back to the Hyatt to see Randy, and will be seeing Taimane again in our hometown in May! :)

I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Hyatt Centric and it was a blast! Apart from the comfy room, and the really helpful staff, the hotel was in a great location, not too far away from the beach, and just a block and a half away from the shops on Kalakaua Ave!

The hotel is located a few streets back from the beach but it is not a long walk, close to lots of food and shopping options. The room we had was large and had a view of the beach either side of other buildings and diamond head. The bathroom was huge. It seems to be one of the only hotels that has 2 queen beds. It also had a fold out sofa so our kids didnt have to share. Staff were all lovely. The spa is not deep and only mildly warm and the pool cannot be swum in as it is too shallow, more of a pond than a pool but looks good in photos. Live music twice a week, we saw one performer who was great.

I was here on business last week and was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. My first impression was very positive as we took the elevator to the lobby and saw a well-appointed lobby with a wide open floor plan that spills out to the pool / patio area. They had fire pits going in the evening.There was live entertainment on Wednesday night (I found out they have it on Friday and Saturday as well). It was contemporary and I noticed that most of the crowd was made up of locals and not hotel guests. That should say something in itself.I had breakfast in the morning and appetizers for dinner in the evening. Food was excellent. My only nagative comment was that I ordered the breakfast buffet. I do not like a pot of scrambled eggs and asked if I could get 2 eggs over easy. I would have thought that this is reasonable for the $28 price tag with breakfast as most places actually have an omelet station. They gave me my eggs but there was an additional $6 charge. Just beware of this and ask before ordering. My room was spacious and had a nice view of the city. The room was modern and clean. There were plenty of outlets for my electronics. They offer a free water bottle which is nice as to not add to the pollution of plastic bottles. Even though there was a shower door water did spill out of the shower onto the floor. No big deal as long as you are careful getting out of the shower. Towels were changed every day and the room was kept clean.The pool is small but the hotel is near the beach. I am not sure if it would be a great place for a large family but I think it is perfect for business or a romantic getaway for 2. I should also mention that the staff was very friendly and attentive.I will definitely come back to this hotel

In our recent visit to Waikiki we stayed at the Hyatt centric and found the hotel great. Great maid service. Great bar service. Special shout out to randy for the excellent bar service. Always friendly and willing to help. We will recommend this hotel to our friends.

This hotel was so beautiful inside out . All the staff were do friendly. I was speechless . The food was great and the location was prime. There is a Starbucks down stairs and to put the Icing on the cake a Nordstrom Rack for all you shoppers !

I love the location of this hotel. Shops restaurant almost all the essential are adound. The room is pretty new and a lot of space to walk around. The parking in the hotel will be a challenge for some people to drive up since some of the turns are quiet tide. And it is on the 6th floor in the building. I think the price is reasonable for its location and the quality it privides.

Can't say enough about this hotel! ive never been to a hotel where you can have a fish in your room! So clever and such a fun idea! The scent in the lobby just makes you instantly feel you're on vacation. The staff were all wonderful but a special thank you to Jackie, who was always so warm and engaging each time we saw her whether in the restaurant, lobby or even in the elevators. She always stopped to chat with us and give us recommendations. Thank you for the sweet note in our room and a little surprise we got when we returned to our room one day. :)We were welcomed with a yummy hibiscus drink when we checked in which was welcoming after a long flight. The entire time we were there, everyone made us feel so welcome. Housekeeping was as well. Well appointed room with great amenities. Thank you Hyatt Centric and Jackie for making our stay a great one!

This was my boyfriends and I first time traveling to the United States from australia so we didn’t know what to expect but the hyatt centric made all of our expectations come true. We were greeted with fresh pineapple juice, a lei and by Rachel who we think is the manager of the resort. Within the first few minutes we felt at home and comfortable asking the loads of questions we had written down prior to arriving. She was the perfect example of a friendly outgoing american girl that you picture from the movies and even gave my boyfriend a few secret spots to take me that I didn’t have on my list like the tantalus view spot. This hotel was everything we could of imaged and the mountain View from the tub in our large room was incredible. Cheers to every worker at this hotel and we will be recommending to our mates at home!

This hotel is right in the heart of all the action and it's fantastic. The staff was super friendly but we will not stay here again. I don't know what would posses the designers to put a 1 foot wading pool at a hotel in Hawaii. People come on vacation for the beaches and the pools. And even with the wading pool, I feel like Hyatt Centric should at least offer day passes to the other Hyatt Regency or another Hyatt property close by that does have a pool (at no fee) for its guests but nooooooo. The extras charges were quite disappointing like getting charges for a resort fee and a hotel that isn't a resort especially without a proper pool and the laughable "ocean view".

Stayed here for two nights whilst en route from Maui to Australia. We had a nice room on the 20th floor with good views. Comfortable bed and room very clean. Breakfast was OK but nothing to write home about.

This hotel was clean and quiet. We were in Oahu for business but made time for play too. This hotel is with walking distance of several nice restaurants and the beach. The concierge was nice and answered our questions about things to do. Because we were in a large group we had to valet a 15 passenger van. The staff knew us because of the van! They were good sports and took good care of the van. Our room was cleaned daily. The breakfast buffet was expensive considering there are several less expensive places to eat close by. I didn't drink at the bar but someone in our group said the mai tai was great. They also have beach towels and chairs to take to the beach.

Ocean view rooms are the way to go! We started off in a Diamond Head view room but it was poorly laid out and the elevator was noisy. The staff very nicely moved us to a much quieter room with an intelligently designed layout and a much better ocean view! And the service has been absolutely stellar—front desk, valet, housekeeping, waitstaff—all going out of their way to be helpful!

This was such a wonderful hotel for me and my grandmother. We waited for our room and while we waited we visited the Lanai restaurant for a bottomless mimosa special. Started the stay just right. While I was enjoying some drinks I started to get to know the staff and told them about why we’re visiting Hawaii and it was for my grandmothers birthday and also wanted to get an extra room because her friend was visiting. They staff all greeted my grandmother with a happy birthday and wished a great stay at the hotel. Kani one of the receptionist at the front desk approached me and had told me he wanted to do something special for my grandma’s birthday and get her a special room with some balloons and some cookies because my grandmother doesn’t drink, which I was happy he told me he wanted to do this cause it would have been a small issue with the drinks instead of cookies! He also booked her room right next to mine so if my grandmother needed anything I wouldn’t be to far away at all.. once I finally got her room she was brought to tears as she was so happy she was not even door down from me and all the balloons and cookies she received. Also a note saying “ Happy Birthday Grandma Janet, enjoy your 21st birthday at Hyatt Centric!” We all laughed and she couldn’t stop thanking me for this surprise. It was just so wonderful. Kani also recommend me to so many places to go restaurant wise and beaches also a wheel chair company that actually comes to the hotel and shows you a demonstration on how the chair works. It’s was so awesome to have all the staff be so friendly and very attentive to what ever you needed for your stay. The food at the Lanai is wonderful! Good portion sizes and the flavors are spectacular. Tell Randy or James that Dillon says hello! And they will take great care of you. Alex is the manager I believe and he was very helpful when had any issues with the bill or a concern I had staying at the hotel. You honestly feel like your family at this hotel. The beach is not even a 10 min walk and it’s so beautiful. The pool is a lounge pool, not very deep but it is nice after a long day to dip your feet in the pool while having a cocktail. One problem that was out of their hands was a lighting bolt hit the transformer or basically whatever powers the building and the staff was quick in motion into solving the issue, they also fixed my air so it can be colder and everything was perfect ever since. Thank you to all the wonderful staff for a perfect stay for my first time and my grandmothers time in Hawaii! Mahalo my friends, you won’t be disappointed staying at this lovely hotel!

Cute new hotel I'm convenient location of Waikiki. Staff is friendly. Early check in request not granted. They offered to call me on my cellphone if the room was ready earlier than the official 3pm check in time. No call ever came. Around 2:30pm I checked and the room was ready. Pool is not a pool But a place where you can hold your feet into the knee high water. Practical filtered water stations are environmentally friendly and save you buying bottled water. Beautiful Starbucks on the ground floor.

The hotel is clean and the staff are very helpful. Rooms are modern and it’s only one block away from waikiki beach. The music streaming thru the corridors is so laid back and relaxing. We had to change the length of our stay by one night and the on duty manager was very helpful and supportive of our plans. Breakfast at the hotel is pricey but there are plenty of places close by, and the Cheesecake Factory is just up the road on your way to the beach.Overall, a fantastic hotel that I would recommend to anyone.

Amazing stay at the Hyatt Centric, Staffs were very friendly. Check-in was easy and quick. Great location. It was very close to DFS and other shopping places. Also it has a parking building with plenty parking space, although you need to pay $39 each day. AND FARE RATES!!

Amazing stay at the Hyatt Centric. Staff were amazing and so friendly, always going out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Location is great, really central to everything, beach is only a block away, max 5minute walk but lots to look at on the way. Rooms are spacious and ocean view is lovely! Pool was shallow yes but the end that is slightly heated is more than sufficient to have a dip (spa pool/hot tub depth), when sitting it came up to just below shoulders. Other pool area was awesome for our toddler. Hardly ever busy in the pool area. No complaints, will stay here again next time we come to Hawaii :)

Ok so looks modern and attractive and more or less ended there for us...Check in, we arrived at 07.30 were offered no drinks, food, refreshments or welcome of any kind until our room was ready at 12noon which was early so can't grumble about that, we were grateful. Told if we didn't want room service each day can save $5 for drinks at the bar at the end of our stay = $30. We declined as I don't come on holiday to make my own bed. Told bedsheets only changed once weekly if requested.Drinks at bar that night dreadful, returned twice until they got them right, first time completely wrong liquors in error. Never drank here again. Young staff delightful but inexperienced, attracted by the modernity doubt.No room service, long walks for ice and water. This all saves the environment apparently?Requested high floor rooms didn't get, but ok accept it was a request only. However we are Hyatt members but little recognition as this is a franchise hotel only.Today was out all day on excursion so phoned first thing to request (as you have to to have room made up) and returned 4pm and not done. When called to request, sheet replaced with ones ripped and entire room basically done in a hurry and items not restocked etc. The pool is ankle deep only, they call it a lounge pool not deep enough for swimming so don't be fooled.Rained yesterday so all lifts were out and had to use stairs, guessed after waiting 10 minutes and discovered this was why later. No explanations given.Concierge waiting 3 days to see as only 1 person there, office hours and so booked via viatours.Overall disappointing for the price. No balconies as these are converted offices from 2016, hence the modernity. Shame on you Hyatt this was a blunder giving your good name to this. If you are used to Hyatt service and reputation think again before staying here.

Two of favorite things! This idea was totally unique to any hotel I've ever stayed at. And the atmosphere was so young and fun. Live music, great company, and delicious food and beverages what more could I ask for to start my weekend getaway.Even the employees were super friendly. Ms. Jackie came around to make sure that we were comfortable and was very accommodating. I didn't want to leave!

My mother and I stayed at the Hyatt centric for a 12 days during October/November of 2017. Our trip was made all the greater by the attentive and wonderful service of a lovely room attendant, Virgee. Thank you Virgee, for bringing our Malasadas in the morning and for the lovely conversation.

This was my first time staying at a Hyatt Centric and I was a little doubtful only because I wanted to stay on the beach, but this was an amazing experience and I would definitely re-book again! Location was fantastic- only a 5 min walk to the beach with lots of shops and restaurants around (albeit expensive!). The staff was excellent from front desk to waiters to valet, especially Malia who was always super friendly, helpful and accommodating. We were able to get upgraded to a bigger room with ocean views, which was great for our toddler to run around. The floor to ceiling windows were great and offered fantastic views. Splash pool was also great for us to lounge at and sip drinks. Starbucks was convenient to have in the downstairs lobby. Parking + resort fee ended up being close to an additional $70/night which was super pricy.

Went to the bar and saw a Smores and scotch event. It was awesome! So many guests showed up and we all got to mingle and talk. Jackie co who works there was SO MUCH FUN! the asked all about my trip and really WANTED to get to know me and my and my friends. I really liked this event and thought it was a really engaging way for everyone to mingle. Really enjoyed myself! Alex at the front desk was super nice as Well! Really good team and hotel!

Staff are very friendly and niceRoom is clean and spacious Very good location ButSwimming pool is very shallow and smallMy children could not swimIt’s okClose to beach anyway We had great time !!!!!!!!!!!!

I recently traveled to Waikiki Beach with my wife for the first time and we stayed at the Hyatt Centric Hotel. I was not impressed. It was a new building but when we got there the front desk told us that we would get a room upgrade and we ended up with a room overlooking a parking garage and directly into another building. They advertised a pool but in reality it was more like a puddle with a Max depth of 8 inches. The hot tub was lukewarm and unusable. They did have a friendly young staff and some nice entertainment on Wednesday and Saturday so that is why they at least get 2 stars. If we ever do go again, we will stay somewhere else.

Everything we expected and more! Super clean, spacious rooms, quality furnishings, modern and new. The staff offered an exceptionally warm, casual yet professional service, very available and attentive. Thank you Linda on recepetion and Mark bellboy - but thank you everyone, you lived up to our expectations and played a great part of our Oahu experience;

WOW!! From the moment we stepped out of the cab and into the foyer and up to reception -to those smiling, happy, welcoming faces- our first time in Hawaii could not have been more memorable!! From the advice about restaurants and beaches and sightseeing , local taxis and public transport to hiring cars - everything was spot on and noteworthy advice!! A drink and restaurant voucher for my daughter's birthday was a nice surprise too! We had no idea when they handed us beach chairs , sunblock and umbrellas that they were all included n the resort fees! We don't have this back home! Our room was amazing - huge, clean modern with floor to ceiling glass windows with the most amazing views of the mountains on one side and that beautiful Waikiki beach on the other side -ask for a high floor! I'm a person that loves balconies - but as they don't have them the glass windows were enough to suffice! The locality was just perfect - walking distance to everything! A local told me that it used to be an old office building !! The only downfalls - and they were minor- the restaurant food was not amazing - but the cocktails and mocktails and wines were! And the pool was a splash -I'm not sure what you would call it ? Wasn't really a pool but the spa was lovely! I didn't; think you needed the tiny pool anyway with the beach across the road! Would definitely stay there again!!

Great and central location while visiting Waikiki. Close to all shopping,restaurants and of course Waikiki beaches. Spacious rooms and modern features in the rooms.Really reasonably price for the quality of the place. Highly recommended. Parking garage, pool,gym and bar. Very modern decor and high tech in lobby,bathrooms and light fixtures. Staff could have better training and more attention to guest, specially bar staff and front door services. Housekeeping is great and very friendly. Overall great experience. We'll be back.

I think this hotel could be as good as it is rated on trip advisor. However, we had a room near the lobby (802) and across the street from a night club and had two mostly sleepless nights due to loud pounding and patron noise. I should have suspected something when we entered the room and noticed two sets of ear plugs. When we complained after the first night, they assured us that the bar across the street was just having an eviction party and it would be better our second night. It was not and was possibly even worse. This was certainly not what I expected from a Hyatt and I am disappointed that we had to end our vacation exhausted.

Great room but lesser rooms seem to be larger and a better value. Location was great as it was located in a good spot. Parking was expensive but available onsite which was rare in location. Would recommend bit not worth the more expensive room.

Even though it looks like there is a pool, its just not even foot deep! Jacuzzi got cold water in it! Hotel rooms are nice, clean, but no view, no balkony. We got 7th floor and that is even lower than lobby.

At check-in Alex noticed that my husband used a walker which makes navigation in a small room difficult. He gave us a room with ample space and a great layout. We appreciated the bathroom with a large shower. Loved the stylish room decor. The staff was warm and friendly. The following people provided exemplary service - Jackie, guest experiences coordinator, Pua and Ray, at the front door, Robert and Glen, bartenders, and Kylie, Lanai restaurant. We will definitely stay here again.

Stayed for 5 daysPROS : very laidback, clean spacious rooms, very accommodating staff (especially Elise ), good breakfast buffet, awesome lounge.CONS : not beach front, no self-parking, partial beach view, loud bar across the street.SUMMARY: I had an awesome time at this property, will definitely stay again...

I live here on Oahu but discovered this oasis of a getaway. It's perfect for me and My Bruno a "Frenchie" staff is always warm and welcoming from the time we enter the entry at the ground floor, to checking in at the main lobby, throughout our stay until we check out. Rooms are classy, clean and modern. A very quaint hotel with everything you may need without having to leave. Location is central and minutes away from the beach and or shopping malls. I like the cozy open air atmosphere with the lobby, bar and lounge, restaurant etc., all in the main area of the hotel. My Bruno and I have stayed here on many occasion's and have always enjoyed our stay. We love it here and like to bring friends just to stop in for drinks and some pupus. Mahalo Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach for doing an Awesome Job!

Nice small intimate hotel in Waikiki with phenomenal local musicians Wednesday and Friday evenings. Some of the best music I've seen!!! So it is worth it. But stick to the happy hour menu in the restaurant (which is a bit pricey for the size of the dishes....and the quality) or just drink, haha, and avoid the food. Or walk to Slice of Waikiki and get a NY style pizza slice.

Simply fantastic holiday accommodation for our family. Thank you all staff. The food and beverage was wonderful and the hotel was so clean and the staff were super caring and friendly. Our family of 5 loved it!

Perfect location. Pleasant and helpful stafff. Unfortunate no spa at this location however the gym is 24 hours and clean.The entertainment in the evening by the pool area was a nice surprise. Would definitely be staying here again. A Hyatt member and the staff made sure I got my reward points.

Unlike most of the hyatt hotels, this one offers new refreshened style. I like it. Other than the pool and a little noise from the street. Everything others were excellent. Super comfy bed and room is my priority-we do need good rest after whole day exploring Honolulu.

I figure there are mostly 2 types of hotels in Waikiki: older beachfront resorts that have seen better days and/or get very crowded (Sheraton, Westin, Hilton Village, Outrigger types, etc...) and newer, hipper or more luxurious hotels just off the beach (Hyatt Centric, Four Seasons Residence, The Prince, The Modern, The Laylow, etc...). This is probably a gross over-simplification but in any case, we had to decide early on if we wanted to pick a hotel right on the beach or within walking distance. We decided the second type would be a better fit for our family and we were not disappointed, especially that all beaches in Hawaii are public beaches so beachfront hotels can't hog them. Our family of 4 fit comfortably in a Deluxe King size room with sofa bed. Here is in a nutshell what we liked and didn’t like about the Hyatt Centric:What we liked• New hotel• Modern Design• Boutique hotel vibe• Helpful staff• Well-appointed rooms with modern amenities such as plenty of USB outlets, Bluetooth speakers, Keurig coffee maker (good for tea too)• Oversize shower • Very quiet and effective AC (Air Con)• Great location • Easy 7-minute walk to the beach• Beach chairs and umbrellas available • Full blown Starbucks Reserve store on the ground floor• Lots of restaurants and shopping just outside the hotelWhat we didn’t like • No swimming pool (the one you see in the pictures is a 1-foot deep “wading” pool)• Hot tub temperature (doesn’t get warm)• $39/night for parking• $29/night for “resort” fee even though this is not a resort• Steep restaurant prices• Inconsistent happy hour menu (depends on live music schedule)• Sleep quality (mattress is too firm and some street noise)Overall, the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach is probably one of the better value on Waikiki but you have to watch out for extras (such as parking) which can add up really fast. We got by with Uber and Lyft whenever we wanted to explore the area outside of Waikiki, except for the one day we rented a car to drive to the North Shore (highly recommended). The location is great, close to the beaches, shopping and great restaurants. Providing beach equipment is a fantastic service and pretty much the only real value of the “resort fee”. We were able to borrow Tommy Bahama folding beach chairs (the ones you can strap to your back), umbrellas, towels and boogie boards daily. They also have some snorkeling gear and a few other items. Wonder why more hotels don't offer this? We enjoyed our stay enough to extend from 6 nights to 11 (we cancelled another reservation in a different hotel) but there are several annoying things that if they can be addressed by management, would make this hands down the best place to stay in Waikiki (if you don't have to be right on the beach)

We live here in Hawaii but stayed for New Year's Eve to get away form all the fireworks. Anyone who knows Hawaii, knows the locals here burn hundreds of dollars worth of illegal fireworks. And if you have sinus trouble, like I do, we what to get away form all the smoke and ash. We stayed here the year before when the hotel just opened and we loved it enough to come back again this year. Staff is great and the room accommodations are nice and new! Very quiet and very mellow.

This hotel is strongly recommended for its location and the comfort of its rooms. This Hyatt property is centrally located in the Waikiki area. It is near to shopping area, ROSS is next door. There is Jamba Juice and Starbucks on the ground floor. There are also restaurants nearby.The staff are helpful and friendly. After checking in a staff member will explain further of its facilities and services. We liked that you get a few dollars off if you choose not to have room serviced on certain days.We selected mountain view rooms which we enjoyed. The only issue is that there are no windows to open to get fresh air in the room.There is a pool area which is on the same floor as the lobby and bar.Strongly recommend.
user_name:
Evan Qelo N
Viti Levu, Fiji

review_body: I was really prepared to dislike this place because I HATE mandatory resort fee charges. It just feels like deceptive advertising to me. We got stuck in Honolulu and the Hyatt looked like a good value until I got to the last page of the booking and found out about the extra$30/night resort fee, then not so much. However it turned out much better than I expected. I think we stayed in the worst room at the property and it was still great. Large, very well decorated, stylish, modern, also floor to ceiling windows with lots of light. It was the smallest room at the property, oddly shaped with alot of wasted space, and also on the lowest floor which is why I think it was the lowest price, nevertheless was very comfortable and the even with the wasted space still felt spacious. I’m guessing most of the rooms are much nicer, but ours was beautiful even at the low end. Nice bathroom and shower facilities. My one complaint is it was noisy, our room was street side and there was lots of traffic noise even with good, sealed windows. Also the air conditioner in this particular room was noisy. I use earplugs to sleep a lot so no problems for me, but if you’re noise sensitive this might be an issue. There’s an open lobby, bar, restaurant and sort of a pool at the reception area. It’s relatively small but has a good relaxing feel to it. We didn’t eat at then restaurant but it has good reviews. The pool isn’t really a pool more like a spa with a water feature for cooling off. You can’t swim and kids can’t do much more than splash but it will do a good job of cooling you off if you need it. On Friday an excellent live singer Tavano (I think.) performed don’t know if he’s here forever but his performance was great and inspired an enthusiastic audience. Much better than most of the live entertainment I’ve seen at most places in Waikiki. About the resort fee, this place is not a resort! But...they have umbrellas and beach chairs that are easy to carry to the beach, they’re surprisingly high quality and make for a leisurely day at the beach. Chairs have storage pockets for you sunscreen, glasses, key set, etc. and an insulated pocket you can use to keep things cold, with backpack straps to carry it all. Makes going to the beach pretty easy and the umbrella makes it so you can spend most of the day there in the shade. This is another good feature, a lot of people have flights that leave later in the day or even in the evening, checkout times are always at noon so they end up homeless for a few hours wondering what to do. The hotel stored our luggage and let us use the chairs/umbrella until the late afternoon even after we checked out so we had a nice way to spend the time until we actually had to leave. This was a great solution to a chronic problem. Staff was very helpful. Bell staff and doormen were especially helpful, couldn’t do enough for us. We’ve stayed a lot of places in Honolulu and this will be one of our favorites.

I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach for 8 days. The location is good (essentially one block away from Waikiki beach), wifi is fast for a hotel, the Expedia concierge was very helpful, and the restaurant stands out for its good food and sometimes excellent staff. There were several glaring problems for a 4-star hotel, though, namely:1. My travel companion was arriving before me, so I had called ahead to inform the front desk of this. My companion was not able to get the keys to the place for about one hour. The front desk person either arbitrarily decided to do so after an hour, or finally came upon the reservation note he originally claimed was not there. 2. There is one tiny trash can (by the toilet) in the entire hotel room. Would it have killed them to put two tiny trash cans in their hotel rooms? Maybe one in the living area?3. The guys at the front door are usually checking their cell phones and can't be bothered to hold the door for guests, much less ask if you need a cab.4. The hotel restaurant staff is either excellent or utterly incompetent depending on who you get.5. There is no minibar or room service menu!6. By far the worst aspect of the hotel is the housekeeping. On several occasions, I returned to the room in the late afternoon (after 4PM) and my room wasn't cleaned. I was told that the cleaners were still working through room. I left before 8AM on those days, by the way, so it's not like they didn't have hours to do so. During the entire 8-day stay, I don't think they changed my sheets once. Also, they would frequently leave trash in the room (empty food boxes, empty cans, hotel wine glasses from two days prior), and I would have to tell them to come back, and direct them to what is trash to be collected. This was by far the most frustrating part of my stay.Much better cleaning services, a more helpful front door staff, and an additional trash can would go a long way to improving the guest experience.

My third stay in 6 months at this hotel. I was upgraded to a worse room and was told by Kaniela (sp?) that the room I originally reserved was not available (even though he told me it would be available when I returned from dinner that first night). The Front Desk service ranges from good/great (where is Erica?) to not so good (everyone else). I dread having to ask for or request any information via the Front Desk.Upon check-in, the wood desk in the king room had a sticky substance across the surface (I cleaned it) and right on the same wall as the desk, was a smashed bug with its entrails dripping down the wall. After housekeeping refreshed the room the next day, the bug was still there. Since the empty shower gel container was still in the shower, I'm guessing the shower wasn't cleaned, eitherl. I pointed out the smashed bug to Jackie, who removed the bug’s carcass, but the remnants of its entrails remained streaked on the wall. Gross. I'm guessing it's still there. It's clear (based on previous visits), no one is checking the room after it is serviced by the housekeeper. Hey someone: you might want to consider cleaning the carpet in 1711; very obvious and untreated stains. Filtered water stations (great idea) never seem to be operational. One or two are always broken at the same time. Decent hotel, but service remains an issue; and the lack of supervision of the housekeeping staff leads to the rooms looking used, old, and not particularly clean. The hotel isn't that old, but it's looking rough around the edges.

This hotel is located right by great stores and a couple blocks from the beach. The location is great but the hotel left me a little disappointed. The pool is just about 1foot deep and the jacuzzi never gets hot. The rooms look good and nicely decorated.

The staff was all great and that was the best part of the stay at the Hyatt Centric in Waikiki. The hotel was clean and looked new. The Lanai restaurant was great. But I wouldn’t stay here again because of the “pool” only being about a foot deep- only a wading pool. And the hot tub is almost the same temperature as the “pool”- so basically not a hot tub but it has bubbles to give it the appearance of a hot tub- disappointing. And I know every hotel has a resort fee- this one was $25 a day- but I don’t know if it is standard to have a tax on top of that fee. Parking (Valet) was ridiculously expensive-$39 a day. The resort fees and parking alone at the end of our 6 night stay ended up being about $400- I was not expecting this charge after already paying for the stay through Costco. I don’t think the stay was worth it for how much we paid. The bed was on the hard side- which I didn’t like and made my back hurt. But I know some people like their beds harder, I was ready to go home to my own bed though before the trip was over.

- Hotel location is great if you're a pedestrian; if you're a driver, be prepared for congested city conditions! - Bell, Valet, and Concierge are located on the Ground Level. But you Check-in at The Lobby on Floor 8 (Floors 1-7 are for shopping & parking). Lobby is spacious and modern with friendly front desk people. - Nice size room - requested and got partial ocean view. - Great shower with hand-held shower head; all the extra toiletries I need and use (e.g., ear swabs, shower cap). - Restaurant just ok - go elsewhere for your meals.

They Hyatt Centric isn't a beach hotel. It's close to the International Market Place and Duke's Market Place. The vibe is hip, trendy and chill. There is a swinging bed in the lobby that you can crash out on. The bar and pool are also right off the lobby. You can get towels to visit the beach and get your urban on at the Hyatt Centric. It's pretty cool for the right crowd.

Condition of hotel was nice with modern amenities. Guest room condition was poor due to bad housekeeping: ripped bedsheets, dirty bedsheets upon check in, looked like they didn't bother to change the bedsheets from the last guests that stayed there. Visible dirty foot print on inner bed sheet, and rips/holes in the sheets, along with other people's hairs (not ours) in the bed... cockroaches found in bathroom. Housekeeping did not pay attention to detail, left room unlocked after cleaning which posed huge security issue for potential theft/break in. They knocked over our belongings on the bedside table and we found our items on the ground when we returned to our room. Emptied the garbages and left behind some garbage on the floor. Forgot the floor mat towel every single time they changed our towels.

I tried booking 2 beds at this location online and called ahead to confirm as I needed 2 beds before I booked and they said it's not available for Globalist upgrades. They seem to have wide availability but I am unsure why they cannot accommodate return visitors.

Perfection! Can't say enough about this hotel - location, hospitality, rooms, ocean view, entertainment!!! Staff went above and beyond and the personalized care was truly memorable. Thank you everyone!

PROS: -Great staff -Clean room CONS: - Shower water pressure was extremely weak, nearly unusable (was on the top floor so perhaps that was the reason) - Pool is (I am not kidding) 9" deep. - Hot tub was cold and staff told me it doesn't get any hotter. big disappointment during a December stay.

Excellent hotel, great location, would definitely stay here again! Staff was very friendly and we received excellent customer service. Nice pool area too. No true hot tub but there is jetted pool. Walking distance to the beach and everything you’d ever need!

Overall cleanliness, design and decor of hotel is great. Front staff all very helpful. Well located in Waikiki among all the luxury retailers, but be wary of an oceanvirw room as the ocean is quite a distance away and not worth the upgrade. Continental breakfast leaves a lot to be desired and at $70 + tax and tip for 2 people I’d recommend going elsewhere.

At first they could not find our booking, apparently there was some miscommunication between booking.com and their systems. They could accommodate us anyway, but imagine if they would have been fully booked!We got the ocean view king size room and it was spacious and clean. The bed - which is important for me since I have back problems - was very comfortable.The view was nice, although the hotel is like a block away from the beach.The parking is 39$ for both valet and self parking, so you're better off with handing over the keys, as the parking is quite tight and convoluted.What was disappointing though, was the breakfast situation. They have fruit, pastries, juice and cereal &milk on one table, and then 4 pans with bacon, scrambled eggs, veggies and potatoes and rice, on another table.Then, for everything else, you have to rely on the waitress. If you go early, and there's only a few people, is not bad, but otherwise you can wait quite a lot, even for a glass of water.And let's say you decide to skip the toast or the coffee...there's always something missing from the tables: one day there was no milk for the cereal, another day there was no more bacon, another day there was no fruit left. I'm not sure if it's a staffing problem or just bad management, but it's not a great system.Would be great if people could get their own water, toast and coffee...PS: a menu would be great too...

I did not find the beds to be comfortable and of the Hyatt quality I would expect and the rooms were noisy with thin walls however the items available to take to the beach FOC for the day were a nice touch. Staff on front door very helpful.

The service is excellent. The staff was friendly, welcoming, professional and responsive to request! The hotel itself is very modern. I found the location to be excellent to using the buses to travel around Honolulu on the cheap to explore on your own. Waling distance to the beach with plenty opportunities to spend money whether it's for amenities or high end shopping.

--Hotel--• The front desk was very helpful with places to go to since it was our first time in Oahu.• Too many fees: daily resort fee, daily parking/valet fee, optional housekeeping fee($30 credit for food at the Hyatt Lanai if you don't have them clean your room).• Tip: Lobby/Check in area is not on the ground floor. (you have to go to floor "L")• Hotel located near luxury row shopping center, yokocho (Mostly ramen restaurants, sushi, and Japanese bbq), starbucks downstairs, several ABC stores. 5 min drive to Ala Moana shopping center. Around the corner is Marukame Udon (very good!).• Hotel provides beach towels, and beach chairs for you to borrow.• Pool is shallow, not really for swimming. It has jacuzzi jets at the end of the pool, but is not a hot tub.--Room-- • Got an upgraded room on 12th floor with somewhat of a distant ocean view upgrade because I'm a world of Hyatt member (Hyatt credit card).• Occasional noise from screaming kids at pool below or if there was a special event out there (live music).• See through glass shower from bed.• Bathroom could use a bit more lighting. Could be brighter.

We went there for our honeymoon and got booked in room 1506. This room was great during the day, but at night when it came time to sleep, the bar across the street (Tsunamis) was SO loud and we hardly got rest. The noise kept up until well after 3am some nights and the rest of the nights it was loud past 1am. Our stay was from Wednesday to a Thursday morning and we waited until Tuesday or so to bring it up to the front desk. The girl there offered us another room as an ‘upgrade’ but we had to pay for it since all of the Mountain View rooms were booked. She wasn’t accommodating and we just beared with the noise for the remaining two nights. We loved Hawaii but we won’t be staying at a Hyatt next time we visit.

We stayed here back in April for our 'Babymoon'. My wife got a great deal on this hotel and since it was pretty new, we were excited to check it out. I originally wanted something right on the beach but it's still super close to Waikiki Beach and all the delicious restaurants and just one block off the main strip. The staff is super friendly and nice. They would always be at the front to greet and open the door for us. When we would travel for the day, the hotel provided us with lawn chairs, umbrella's and towels. The hotel was attached to the new Starbucks which was very convenient. I recommend this hotel and will continue to book this as my first priority when I come back to Waikiki.

This was a great hotel! Perfect location in Waikiki, few minute walk to the waikiki beach and shopping area. The bus stop is right around the corner as well. The room was very spacious, staffs were all very helpful and nice. But if you are a light sleeper and/or sensitive to noise you might not like this hotel. You can hear everything that's going around the building. I personally can sleep through anything so it was no big deal. Also if there was another trash can in the living room area... would have been nicer. But overall I would recommend this hotel and probably will come back.

If you are going to this hotel to sleep, I strongly recommend that you go somewhere else. I am at top tier level with Hyatt and I was awakened more than 5 times on my stay until 4 am. When checking out I was given 65 dollar credit, I appreciate the gesture but not worth it and I would definitely go to another location next visit to Honolulu. Staff informed me that this has been a continued problem and that the General Manager had not been able to resolve the issue. Unfortunately, it is the customers that will pay the price for their inability to correct this issue. Hyatt, please step up and work with the police to fairly govern this business across the street, it is out of control.

The hotel and room itself were great! Rooms were modern, and we really enjoyed the Japanese style shower/tub area with a soaking tub. The washlet was a nice touch, too. Bed was comfortable and there were conveniently located outlets for charging electronics on each nightstand. AC worked well and was very quiet. We heard no noise from our adjacent rooms. The problem I had was with the noise from Kuhio Ave. We stayed for a couple of nights and both weeknights, I could hear the music from the bar across the street on Kuhio Ave until they closed at 2am (we were on the 11th floor). Not loud, but loud enough. I used earplugs, but it still kept me up. I am a light sleeper, so if you don't have trouble sleeping though some noise, it won't be an issue (my husband was fine sleeping through it). If we stay again, I will request a room away from Kuhio Ave. We didn't get to explore the bar/restaurant or the pool area.

I arrived early after a long flight staff were very friendly and watched my bag while I went shopping and lunch I returned around 130 just to check and my room was ready “Dimond head view suite” on the 18th floor The room size was great and well laid out the seperate tv room was a good too But the street noise was very loud even this high up without a Lanai the apparent “Dimond head view was also missing in its place was someRun down apartment blocks and parts of the canal. I was too tired to complain the room was right next to the lift so I heard that stopping on the floor and doors being slammed shut their was a wind noise from somewhere so considering windows don’t open and no Lanai was confusing where it was coming from The bed was hard as a rock as wasOne pillow the the rest ok Could not fault the staff they are all fantastic and what you would expect from the Hyatt brand. The shower was huge At check out the staff remembered me and I asked politely about the missing Dimond head view they said you have to “look around the corner” The hotel is right next to Starbucks and shopping is only steps away the beach is only 1 block a nice flat walk Due to no Lanai the bed and poor view I would not stop again unless a great deal or the regency was booked out but that’s just my taste.

Great hotel in a great location. The bed and pillows are top notch as are the sheets. The entire staff is upbeat and the facility is clean and modern. The bartenders and front desk staff provided recommendations for meals and tours that turned out to be excellent.

Very nice hotel, lovely reception area, very spacious and comfortable room. Awesome friendly staff. Location is great too. I would however ask for a room on a higher floor: ours was quite noisy at nighttime particularly with the bar accross the road on Friday and Saturday nights.

Stayed here for 2 nights, and the service was bar none! Although a boutique hotel, my room was well appointed and every interaction I had with the staff was hands down great. So many great amenities! Lobby was spacious and beautifully designed! They had live entertainment until 830pm and Tavana (a local artist) was mesmerizing! I can’t say enough about this property and the outstanding staff. Thank you Hyatt Centric for making my stay a memorable one! I will be back for sure. You guys are doing a fantastic job.

I want to give a shout out to Rachel - the amazing lady that checked me in! She was super friendly, bubbly, welcoming, and awesome! My mom and I were greeted with Hawaiian seashell leis when we checked-in (this really made my day!). I also REALLY REALLY wanted the super cool bathtub, and she tried her best to give me the best room with the bathtub I wanted. (Best check-in experience of my life!) Everything is perfect! 5-star customer service, super clean and trendy room, amazing bathtub, great location, amazing food close by, near Waikiki Beach, and next to the mall. Oh yeah, the bed is super comfortable and I slept for 10 hours straight! What more can you ask for?

Hotel is new. Service is great. Breakfast food, not many choices and not tasty but service are great. Valet Park very fast and polite. Location is golden. walking to ABC stores super near. But the city views not that good.

Hyatt centric was the best hotel my wife and I have ever been to. Not to say that there are other hotels that can't provide good service or look good, but the combination of everything was what really got us. It's in the middle of the city, you've got Duke's market right next to you (like an upscale CVS/7 ELEVEN/ EATERY/ SIT DOWN DINNER) and even things like Ross and H&M in case you need extra clothing. The staff was extremely nice, always providing awesome recommendations and actually showing genuine interest about how our trip is going. The room was beautiful! There was an entire wall that was actually a window which you could see the intersection and everything had a tropical feel with the wooded decor. Amazing Hotel and Amazing Price! You won't regret it

I was reluctant to book this hotel because it wasn’t right on the beach, however being a very loyal Hyatt elite member, I took a chance and was blown away as they exceeded expectations in every possible way. First, the hotel is only a block from the beach so you can get there almost as quickly as you would if you were staying at one of the beachfront properties and waiting for a high rise elevator, then walking through one of those huge lobbies to the sand. Even better, as you leave the front lobby at the Hyatt Centric, they will provide you with chairs, towels, boogie boards/sand toys, and umbrellas at no cost! We have stayed at many other hotels in Waikiki, even on the beach and almost every one of them charges for these things, so it is not to be overlooked the Hyatt is providing these complementary.More things I love about this Hyatt boutique hotel:Every staff member we encountered was courteous and willing to go the extra mile. I’m a tough critic when it comes to service and you can tell this hotel is under great leadership and management because every single person was there to please, with a smile.The hotel rooms are brand new and absolutely gorgeous. They are extremely well laid out with beach modern decor. The common areas, pool deck and restaurant are also refreshing, modern and new. The hotel has a very soothing and spa like feel throughout. Gym is small, as expected at a boutique hotel, but I love that it is located with floor-to-ceiling windows with a view! The restaurant offers a buffet or made to order option. Plenty of great choices. Many of the Waikiki buffets we’ve visited lack a ton of choices compared to the mainland. However we found this one to be one of the more comprehensive for the money.The pool deck is awesome and more of a sun soaking platform than dive-in and at all day type of pool. But, at the end of the day after the beach, the Jacuzzi is wonderful, or if you’re just looking for some quiet sun time and you don’t want to deal with sand on the beach, it is a perfect option.
