In the lobby there is also an inviting bar area with open windows to the outside which is a great place for a cocktail. Starbucks is on the bottom floor adjacent to the hotel.We stayed here with our family and loved the room layout. We had a king suite room which had the bedroom in the main area and then partitioned off with a closing door was a little living room with a pullout sofa where the kids could sleep.Cannot be happier with the location, and quality of this hotel. The friendly service was an added bonus. We would stay here again without second-guessing. We typically stay at the Hyatt Regency which is only a couple blocks away but overall I like this hotel better. It is less crowded and the newness is so refreshing - not a tired or outdated corner anywhere.

This hotel is pretty good for the price. Clean and a great view overlooking the city. The food was a bit expensive and that was a major drawback but the food was good. The breakfast selection was minimal.
user_name:
Dianne D. M
Stone Mountain, United States

review_body: I stayed here I believe a few months ago, but the service is still great!!! rooms are spacious and quiet. you can't go wrong by staying here. They also have great local entertainment for HH W-Sa (confirm days). There is self or valet parking. Starbucks is adjacent for all you coffee junkies!!! Resort fee but reasonable, you can get a chair, umbrella, sunscreen, aloe, towels. it is fine. The 'pool' is not a diving pool so be careful!!! it is more like a wading pool

Hotel was very new, room was very modern and clean. Location was very good as well to be close to waikiki beach and downtown. I visited here with my parents, Linda helped us to coordinate the room to be next each other. :)

Nice and clean hotel.No real pool at this hotel to charge a resort fee.We stayed 10 days and the parking bill was huge along with the resort fee. The room was so small it was funny. The round end table with the USB port was pushed up against the small fridge so it was hard to open the fridge at all.It was a sad view of homes behind the hotel with laundry hanging out to dry. During our stay a murder happened across the street. A man shot another guy with a gun. A huge fire drill also happened and everyone had to leave the hotel.The last day we got charged with breakfast for 2 people and we never even went to that restaurant once because of the high prices.The air worked off and on, sometimes cold and sometimes hot. Hawaii is a sad place now, lots of homeless people sleeping all over the streets..Also one last problem out of so many. No desk in the room to even place your computer.

Well kept, spacious rooms and incredible staff on hand to welcome you. The room we had had both city and ocean views, and the bathroom was very large. Interactions with staff at the lobby, guest services and housekeeping were pleasant, helpful and satisfying. I would certainly come back to this hotel every time I go to Honolulu.

Overall..a great hotel in a great location! Easy access to everything Waikiki has to offer! New , clean, modern rooms with nice big showers & comfy beds! Only complaint is no balcony but thats minor ! They have a wonderful poolside area that makes up for that! Highly suggest this hotel!

Nice and clean place. Newly renovated hotel. The decor is very nice. Included in the night stands is a USB port for charging your phone without a block . A large LED TV on the wallGreat location and central to everything in Waikiki. Rooms do not have a balcony, perfect for us ...Very fast elevators!

My stay was enjoyable and friendly. I stayed for work and the hotel provided every reasonable accommodation requested. Additionally, the room service staff worked swiftly and I didn't experience any unreasonable delays with food or drink orders regardless of the time. Also, the front desk staff definitely embodies the Aloha spirit.

Was able to spend the weekend here and really enjoy the hotel! Had an awesome king bedded room with pullout sofa and living area (1507). Love the floor to ceiling windows and had a fun action packed view of Kuhio Ave and the mountains. Room was super spacious with many amenities: Keurig coffee maker, cell phone USB jacks in the nightstands, fridge, safe, and HUGE shower. A/C was ice cold (had to shut the vents at some point during the weekend) and it was super quiet in the hallways. Hot water came quick. Modern furniture, super sleek giant screen tv that pivoted to bedroom and living room, and had the best sleep all weekend (they even give you different types of pillows).There is a lot going on that is included with your stay: both nights we attended the nightly entertainment by the pool. There was happy hour drinks and appetizers with great prices and the night it dumped rain, the fire pit was a nice touch! The staff are super friendly from the valet guys (opened the doors EACH time without asking), to the front desk staff (love the cookies!) and the bartenders. The pool was nice and the always was able to get lounge chairs no problem,. Even though it's a splash pool, (3 feet at the deepest) it served it's purpose to cool off on the deck! Maybe put more loungers in the pool. We wished the "bigger" pool would have been warmer but I guess it's not a hot tub either. On Sunday, we took advantage of the Football Sunday all day happy hour and that was the bomb. All the appetizers were like $9 each and the beers $5. We stayed all morning to watch the game and it's probably the best price for watching the football games on Sundays in Waikiki. Great location in the heart of Waikiki and next to the new International Marketplace. To be honest we were enjoying the hotel so much we didn't even go to the beach (but hear the hotel lets you borrow beach chairs and towels for the beach).Had a great time, the food and drink were great (especially the prices) and the evening entertainment was awesome! The room even came with reusable water bottles to fill up at their britta stations. I also used the gym on two mornings, was the only person in there both times (6am) and I like that the excercyle has you cycling thru the villages of France on their screen! LOL. We didn't take advantage of the $22 bottomless Mimosas but will come back on another weekend to really enjoy (and early at that too!)Thanks Hyatt Centric for an awesome weekend! It was great!

I stayed here for vacation at the beginning of November. The hotel is in the heart of the upscale shopping district and within walking distance to Waikiki Beach, resturaunts and bars. I’d recommend this hotel to those looking for a quiet stay. It’s a great option for the price.

I️t didn’t matter that i was a Hyatt proffered memeber.. booked a king room.. only ADA avaliable.. they were very happy to have me pay for an upgrade. Room was noisey, ear plugs supplied.. not kidding. Resort fee and Parking fee of $39 per night self parking.. i won’t be staying here again
user_name:
David Michael R
Jackson, United States

review_body: I was very happy with this hotel! The one and only drawback was none of the rooms have a lanai. The hotel is modern and clean with a great location. The pool is sleek and had a hip evening vide on Saturday night. They give you beach chairs too if you want to hit the beach. I loved the free refillable water bottle as well..

It was our first night in Hawaii after a 22 hour flight journey, we were very tired by the time we reached the hotel. We felt welcomed at the reception, staff were friendly and helpful. The room is average in size but clean and functional in general. I think it's a good fit for a stopover stay. However, do bear in mind that their hotel fee already covered resort fee which is charged whether you use the facilities or not. We did not have the luxury of time to use the resort facilities though, it would have been better if they could have an opt-out for stopover travellers like us.The breakfast was ok but boy impressive. Not much food was on offer for the buffet breakfast covered by the hotel fee to be honest.

I usually stay at Hyatt Place in Waikiki but it was sold out so decided to try the new Hyatt Centric.... Super cool and modern, rooms were spacious and nicely designed .... The bedding and pillows were divine.... The lobby is really cool and put me in a good mood as soon as I checked in...

Perfect location. You can walk to Waikiki in 5 mins, they even provide you complimentary beach towels and beach chairs. I love the fact that this hotel is fairly new, so all rooms are in a great condition so far. Love the shower, room and view. I got a room with the ocean view, which was amazing. The gym was funny, all you see is 2-3 treadmills and one set of dumbbells. Shame to call it a gym. Starbucks Reserve is located in the building, which is amazing. So easy to get a nice coffee. Nordstrom and Jamba Juice are also in the same building, it is very convenient to shop anything. Staffs are super friendly and helpful. If I come to Honolulu again, I will definitely consider to stay here.

I posted earlier about Courtyard Marriott Waikiki. We had originally book there for 6 nights. The 1st night was a sleepless experience. If you want to more you can check my earlier post re. Hotel. Anyway, this post is about Hyatt Centric Waikiki. This hotel is great! Its close to eveything, room is immaculate and it is quiet. This hotel is highly recommendable. There is a restaurant but its overpriced. There are better restaurants around the area.

The location is great and close to all famous shops and restaurants within walking distance. The interior inside the building is fantastic and the staff treated us like a family. The room (2 queen beds with city view) was spacious and roomy despite no TV channels. The pool was great and shallow enough for our 15 month old daughter to try walking in the pool for the first time! Access to the parking lot for our rental car was easy. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Did a staycation with my husband for a couple days. Hotel registration is located on the 7th floor (concierge is on the 1st). Leis are given upon checkin. Loved the decor and cleanliness of the hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel stay comes with free reusable water bottles with Brita refill stations on 3 different floors. Rooms had a Keurig and coffee/tea available (complimentary). Shower was spacious and beautiful. Bed and pillows were comfy. Shower products provided were from BeeKind, which worked well for us. Overall, this is one of the most lovely hotels I've ever stayed in. Would come back for sure. Oh, and the location can't be beat. You are steps away from everything. Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center is across the street and international market place is a couple blocks away. If you're looking for something healthy, head to Coco Cove. It's a few stores from the hotel on the main strip!

After a couple long flights it was a great place to recharge. Staff was super friendly. The hotel is new, so was in good condition and clean. The room was spacious and comfortable with a nice well thought out decor. No hotels in Hawaii are cheap, but the extra luxury was worth it when you’re exhausted from travelling. Started the family vacation off on the right foot.

The hotel was clean and beautiful. The staff treated my family and I well. I loved every moment at the hotel. The room was very clean and peaceful. The bathroom in the our room was clean and inviting. We loved the pool. The coffee and food are very good. I would stay here again.

Hotel is Brand new. Very nice and clean. Hotel staff is very kind and helpful. Unfortunately lift is very noisy so avoid rooms close to it. Hotel staff accepted to change the room for us. We recommend this hotel for holidays in Waikiki.

Stayed here for a night. Great hotel. Was upgraded to a high floor corner view overlooking the city. Room service is okay, it does not come on a room service cart - more like a take out/to go bag hand delivered to you. I would stay here again.

From early check in thru late check out the staff at Hyatt Centric Waikiki fully took care of our needs. Forgotten sunscreen and contact solution? No problem. Easy hookup with rental car at Expedia desk downstairs. Great cocktails and food on lanai. Unexpectedly fun music by the pool. Super value for experience.

I could not have more positive things to say about the Hyatt Centric. We arrived in the morning prior to check-in time after a long flight from Australia and Alex at the front desk ensured he got us into a room straight away and even upgraded us into a bigger room than the one we had originally booked. He made sure he answered our questions and recommended some nearby places to check out.We were drawn to book this hotel due to its location and it did not disappoint. As soon as you walk out and turn left, walk past an ABC Store and Ross Dress for Less, you're at the heart of the shops on the strip and it is only a short stroll before you're at the beach.We received the complimentary water bottles and the staff were attentive to any of our requests or needs. Our room was incredibly spacious (we made the living area our shopping room!), clean, modern and comfortable. I will forever miss showering in that shower. We chose the no housekeeping option for the duration of our stay which in turn gave us credit to spend at the restaurant/bar however the staff and housekeeping were always prompt in providing us with anything we needed whether it ranged from fresh towels to a bottle opener.We had an amazing dinner at The Lanai where we truly had the best dining experience of our trip with the young gentleman that served us, he was funny, entertaining and a pleasure to meet. The food was also delicious and the hotel had regular entertainment.I want to put out a special mention to the boys on Level 1 at the concierge who opened doors for us on the daily with our arms full of shopping and took our towels from a long day out and about exploring the beach. They were so friendly, kind, funny and a joy to see everyday!Thank you Hyatt Centric for making our first trip to Hawaii so memorable, we will definitely stay again!

We had a great overall experience with the hotel. Only issue was our first room was located in a section that created a Wind tunnel therefore our glass shook pretty violently. The staff moved us as soon as we complained about the issue. The hotel was very nice, modern and the entire staff, from the valet, concierge, and front desk were helpful and professional. We rented a car and the parking was easy and very convenient in the same building but there is a cost. The hotel is about 1.5 blocks from the beach and near many clothing and convenient stores. It’s also near plenty of restaurants and bars. An excellent option when staying in Waikiki!

The room was clean, staff was friendly and attentive to our needs. The air conditioning did not work in the room, they immediately moved us to another room. Really? I don't have 200 words to say- it was a nice hotel, good location, friendly staff. Only complaint would be the pool is on the 8th floor, and it is only 3 feet deep. It was extremely windy by the pool, and pool was small.

Door staff - what a treat to have someone open doors for you, all day everyday! Friendly and inviting people.Central location - seriously, so central that Ross and main street Waikiki is right outside the door!Modern decor and beautiful furnishings. I spent a good while walking around taking photos of the art work. I guess the only negative comment I have is regarding the events. For 4 out of 8 of the nights we stayed, the pool area was being used for private functions. Officially, we were told by staff that the pool "wasn't closed" and that we could still use it but to us that would be like gatecrashing - they were full on functions attended by a lot of people. After a long day shopping and walking around, all we wanted to do was soak in the spa, which we were unable to do. This spoilt part of the hotel experience for us and we had paid a lot of money for a once in a lifetime holiday to our dream destination. For the hotel to charge a resort fee, which is US$25 per night is a bit cheeky. It made us question - did we just pay for that event? The resort fee covers use of hotel facilities, including the pool area. Unfortunately, we did not get to enjoy it.
user_name:
Reti K
Greater Wellington, New Zealand

review_body: The location and newness of the hotel were the reasons I chose to stay here. The remodeled International Marketplace shopping center is only about a 5 minute walk from the hotel...very convenient! I reserved a Diamond head view King room (non-suite) , but the actual view of it is partially blocked by high-rise apartments and hotels. The main part of the view is facing Kuhio Avenue(see my pictures), which happens to have a bar that can get somewhat disturbing at night if you're a light sleeper. Consider that I was on the 18th floor , i was still able to hear fighting bar patrons outside on the street at 2 am...I found it funny that disposable earplugs were provided by the hotel when I first came to my room, but then I came to understood the reason why.Upon check-in , the front desk offered a $30 food and beverage credit if I chose to not have daily housekeeping. If you choose that option you can still call housekeeping for additional towels and bathroom amenities to be brought to the room if necessary. If you want to stay in the middle of Waikiki , but not directly on busy Kalakaua street, Centric is a good choice, but try to get a higher floor if you don't choose an oceanview room.

Very happy with our choice of this hotel Newly remodeled, clean and friendly. Enjoyed that it was centrally located to everything. Happy hour was enjoyed, we did miss the entertainment, liked that we got assistance in lobby by an expedia agent to help arrange our excursions. Would defiantly recommend.

This is a hotel not a resort, yet we were charged a nightly resort fee which was not advertised upon booking or at registration. Aggressive front desk staff pushing no room cleaning or towel replacement unless we called... Not worth the $$$.

We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was wonderful! The staff was amazing and the room was awesome. There was a lot of food and shopping within walking distance and the beach was just a short walk away. I would highly recommend this hotel!

First time visitor to this hotel, although I've been traveling to Oahu the past 25 years. Usually I'm on the island for a family vacation, but this trip was for work. The hotel seems quite new, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I believe the hotel was built in the shell of the prior Waikiki World Trade Center office tower. As a result, the layout is a bit unusual.. I had a suite on the 19th floor, and it was spacious. There were lots of outlets, which is always a plus. Breakfast in the restaurant was fine, particularly as its included in the Globalist benefits. Housekeeping did a great job, lots of nice small things like extra coffee and tea that I noticed. While the hotel is not on the beach, it's only a long block or so away, and the location is right in the midst of great stores and restaurants., I'm really impressed with all the new business popping up on Kuhio Avenue. I'd gladly return again to this hotel, and likely will next spring.

Well, I have to say the place is clean and trendy in a good location in the heart of Waikiki. Now let me tell you why I have mixed feeling on my review and I get it, my situation is not that of the normal holiday traveler to Waikiki. I always book on one of those discounted pages and plug in minimum four star, well I got a great price for a Waikiki four star but keep in mind I was traveling on business not pleasure in a tourist destination. The lobby is not on the ground floor, in fact there is not even a seat to sit on on the ground floor (first world problem). Had to take the elevator up a few floors to check in, staff are extremely friendly and quick to check me in. I was informed that I needed to take two elevators to get to my room, so up to the 20th floor and that is the Penthouse level (I'm thinking the girl at the front desk must have really liked me) then walk around the corner to the next elevator that takes me to the very top 22nd floor. I open the door and the room looks fine, Istart looking to see if I can find a complementary bottle of water but the only thing I can find are packs of earplugs ( I'm thinking thats nice because the trash trucks can be a little noisy at 4am in Waikiki, WRONG!!!!! My top floor room #2203 was up against the machine rooms of the elevators and man are  those things annoying especially when you are trying to watch TV. Add to that there was no place to set up a laptop to do some work and I needed up not having the best experience. I think I got the one bad room in the hotel but then again I did get a cheap rate so I got what I paid for. Had I had any other room and I was on vacation I would give this place five stars. All I say is beware of the second elevator floors and room #2203..

The food was beyond good and great value for money and service in both places attentive and efficient. The room itself was well equipped and comfortable. I could go on but suffice it to say I was very pleased with my stay, and although short and sweet this time, I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.

If you're looking for a hotel that SUPER central and within walking distance of everything you need, look no further. Hyatt Centric is the place for you! You have multiple shopping centers, the beach, amazing restaurants... and though you're paying a bit more per night, the amount of savings on taxis due to everything being walking distance helps to offset the costs. Small tip: The musubi place across the street is amazing for snacks for when you go on hikes! :) Beyond location, the staff at the Centric were awesome. Super friendly and willing to lend a helping hand anytime you needed it. Highly recommend this hotel!

The room was so great and the staff was so friendly. I would recommend to everyone. The food was amazing. I would recommend the nachos. It is very close to Waikiki beach and lots of good shopping and restaurants.

Beautiful, new, modern hotel in the center of Waikiki. Perfect if you want a wonderful room and good service but plan to spend most of your days out and about on the island. The pool is rather small but enough for a small plunge.

If you want a hotel with great value, mountain views, and minutes walk to the beach, then this is it! Check-in was easy and we mentioned we were on honeymoon, and got a voucher for 2 glasses of bubbles at the bar.Room is spacious and had great views of the mountain. Bathroom is clean and well designed. Love the automatic sensors that turn on the night light!Each floor had ice machine and filtered water. Was also given 2 reusable bottles which was handy. Lobby had a great outdoor pool (although very shallow), and sunbeds. Great to relax after a day full of shopping.The location of the hotel is amazing; as soon as you walk out and turn left, it's the main boulevard with all the shops and the beach just a stone throw away. Valet parking was hit and miss, and on our last day, the valet service was terrible. I called the front desk up to complain, and was immediately re-imbursed of our valet fees. That is what I call customer service!Overall very happy customers and a great hotel!

We'll be back - this is our new go-to hotel on Oahu! Loved the staff, the rooms, the location - everything. There are thoughtful touches throughout, staff was super friendly & accomodating, location is convenient, everything felt clean, comfortable and stylish.

The Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach is centrally located in the heart of downtown and boasts 230 Rooms and Suites with Contemporary Design. The hotel is only an 8-minute walk from Waikiki Beach, the beach where surfing was created. This hotel has the feel of a luxury with a mid-range cost. You enter on the ground floor where there is a Starbucks Reserve. You take an elevator to the lobby where there is the Restaurant, Bar, Pool, and where you check in. Room: Expect plush beds with floor to ceiling views of either the City, Mountains, or Partial Ocean. I stayed in the King Room and it was larger than expected when you’re thinking of Waikiki hotels. I was graced with a soaking tub and bidet; little details truly can be the best part of trips. Two nightstands (with outlets) with rooms with a King-Sized Bed, very essential when you want to charge your phone next to their bed. You never notice this until you don’t have an outlet and your phone is charging on the opposite side of the room. Be Kind – all-natural bath products. The hotel gives you (2) Refillable Water Bottles in the room where there are multiple water fill up stations on the grounds. They are plastic, not glass, but still a step forward in sustainability! Entertainment/Hotel: Taimane Gardener plays every Wednesday on their rooftop. She is a local musician who was discovered by Don Ho while she was playing on the streets of Waikiki. She is a virtuoso ukulele player who defies all norms of the ukulele and its limits. Families are welcome, although the Hyatt Centric boasts an elegant and mature atmosphere, many barefooted kids danced around as the night continued. The pool is quaint however with less than 300 rooms and suites, you don’t need anything extraneous. Cabanas are perfect to hang out in after dark.Food/Dining: We dined at Hyatt Centric our first evening in Oahu, very impressive. Carefully curated dishes. Buffet breakfast is above average at the Lanai. I do not think I will ever forget the Lilikoi Bread Pudding. Phenomenal and genuine service with exceptional professionalism.Tip: Plan your stay at the Hyatt Centric in Waikiki around Taimane playing on Wednesdays. I promise you she is that great. Eat Dinner at The Lanai and move outside once finished. It’s the perfect Wednesday Waikiki evening. Would recommend for millennial-thinking travelers who are okay not being directly on the beach. Would not recommend for anyone that doesn’t want to walk or Uber to the beach. This being said, it really is only a short 10 Minute walk or even shorter Uber ride. The hotel is very hip and attracts trendy clientele of all ages, including families. 5-Star customer service from the entire staff. Would highly recommend with the utmost confidence.

Everyone was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were always clean. Food was great! Pool was perfect for little kids and adults. They even provide lawn chairs and a towel for you to take to the beach! And LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!

Stayed here for my daughter's wedding. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rehearsal dinner in the Lanai was first class. When visiting Waikiki in the future, I would not hesitate to come back.

I was only here on a 2 day business trip. The rooms where large and comfortable. They have little extra like the water bottles that are nice touches. It's not on the beach but a short walk. The final day I ate at the hotel. And it was ok. The ribs were overlooked. The poke was not the best (like they included the cut off meant to be throw out). The pool is like 6-9 inches deep with a 2-1/2 foot deep section to sit in. Good for a little lounge. Not for a swim. But you do have the ocean a short 5 minute walk. It also gets extremely windy on the podium. My beer blow over half full. They did offer a free refill but I needed to head out anyways

This is very average hotel for what you get. The overall staff is not very friendly, the rooms are average at best. We have stayed at much better hotels in Waikiki for the same price. The room had a noticeable slope in the floor, no microwave in the room. Ice and water are only located on 2 floors in the hotel. We did not get maid service for one of the days we stayed. Around 5:00 pm someone came by to see if we wanted service, at that time we are getting ready for dinner. Not a great time to service the room. No notice or anything. They could have called, texted or something. Other hotels we have stayed at have done this.

This hotel was a 5 star, the staff went over and above to help. They opened the doors coming and going, very friendly and knowledgeable. They supplied everything you could possibly want and need to take to the beach. The rooms were amazing, clean oh so very clean. The bathroom even had a bidet with heated toilet seats. I have to say I really felt like a queen. The locals were so friendly and I felt safe walking around the area. This was the most stress free vacation I have ever had. WONDERFUL can't wait to go back.

First time I have stayed at Hyatt centric and it was wonderful. Firstly the staff. Happy, helpful, and quite frankly just really nice. Room was huge. We had the double queen and it was really very big and comfortable. I can't wait to come back and stay again.

I booked this hotel due to good TripAdvisor review & good price for our stays 9/6-10, which I had 3 room booked for 3 couples of us. I think the rating of TripAdvisors really misleading, & should not be rated so high for its class for the following reasons:1) It's a hotel converted from a business building, so no window can be opened. Why you come to Hawaii & stay inside an air-conditioned room2) Some people said the small & shallow pool area is an issue, however, I think the true issue is how the pool facing toward the sun. It gets so hot right from the morning, so u'll always find few people around3) The included breakfast is really basic & almost no change everyday. Only the local fruit included is good.4) The reason it has good review is that the hotel is really too new to have any bad review, in my opinionsHowever, I do want to share a few good things on the hotel:1) The service is good, all people are friendly2) The location is very central if you really want to be @ Waikiki beach3) Room is very modern & bathroom is very updatedIf you really wan to stay there, please ask for floor 20 above, as the view will then pays for itself. However, you'l need to suffer 2 things: 1) Extra elevator 2) low showing pressure.I stayed @ room 2105 which has magnificent view of the beach.

My fiance and I stayed here over our 5 day period in Oahu.The Hotel is tidy, you can tell it is relatively new and the decor is modern, it is the perfect quiet spot if you are intending to not spend much time at the hotel and be out and about during the day or if you are planning a short stay. The staff do not wait on you and apart from opening the door for you in the lobby that is the extent of interaction you can expect, which is completely acceptable given this is a hotel not a resort. The hotel does not have beach views, but is in close proximity to the beach. Our room was comfortable and spacious. The only minor criticism I would say is that it should be clarified in the hotel description that the pool is a "lounge pool" not a swimming pool. The common areas are quite small but again this is understandable being a city hotel.I did read another review which made a very good point that the hotel does charge a daily 'resort fee'...given that it is most definitely a hotel and not a resort I think this is a bit ridiculous. I did not question this when I booked or paid because I thought this was perhaps a typical charge associated with accommodation in Hawaii given we had paid a daily resort charge at the resort we stayed at in Maui prior to coming to Oahu, but now I feel a little naive. Our overall review was that you get what you pay for and the location of the hotel is good and it is good value for money.

Stayed in King Room with Sofa and view of Diamond Head Crater- but off to one side). New, new, new! The best part of this hotel. Service at desk is very good. Bellman at groundlevel are very helpful and friendly. Easy to find in Waikiki and to park without a valet.Room was very clean and quiet the entire stay.Love the water bottles and filtered water they make available to you. Room was large and had a large bath--overall looked and worked great. No balcony on the room--but did not miss it as much as I thought I would--as the weather was warm while there.Comfy bed. Visited the pool area and it is very shallow (less than two feet for most parts) but Waikiki is two block away and many, many people were walking between the hotels and the beach--so not an issue.Staff was super friendly.Bonus: "Starbucks" at groundlevel and attached to groundfloor enterance.Would stay again.

My room was beyond expectations. The room was modern, clean, and had an excellent view. The staff was very professional. I would definitely return to this hotel. The hotel was in a perfect location. Right in the center of shopping and restaurants.

Beautiful Mint condition! Clean, clean clean! Great customer care! Room sizw was great! Loved the bath tub with the stone floors. Enjoyed the nice medium firm bed. Slept like a baby. This hotel is located in the best location.

It was a clean modern facility with excellent Wi-Fi and very nice people working at the hotel. There was a pair of pants left in our room that belonged to a former guest (I assume), and the "partial Ocean view" we paid for required straining at the side of the window to be able to get a glimpse of a sliver of water. Truly the room faced an apartment building if you looked straight out the window (Seaside Ave). If you're sensitive to noise, we were on the 12th floor and I could hear the untz-untz of nightclub noise from Kuhio Ave. and the traffic below. Our first night we discovered there was only one coffee pod of "real coffee" provisioned and even though we booked for two guests.(There's a Starbucks on the main floor). I am a World Of Hyatt member, and really wanted to give this place five stars. The pool is merely an ankle wading pool, so if you're a swimmer, you may be disappointed. It is however, really charming with little cabana seats and chic surroundings. Loved the bar service and pupus. I would not have a car if you're just going to stick around Honolulu and Waikiki; the buses are great and Uber is everywhere and cheap. It's just a couple blocks to the beach, and there is good local food (Pho Old Saigon + an udon house) right behind the hotel on Kuhio.

The room was technically old but in excellent conditions. Expected more small facilities such as tea/coffee stuff. The staff were very nice and helpful. The room was excellent regarding cleanliness...

Has a small pool, just enough to cool off, excellent food and service, which you can get pool side too. No balcony in our room type, close enough to the beach and everything else Waikiki has to offer. Enjoyed our stay and found the hotel quiet at night and with upmarket but restful ambience.

This is a great hotel! It's very close to the beach, the hotel staff were exceptional and the room was really nice. The room was really clean, had a decent view of the beach (it was peaking out behind some buildings), and the bed was very comfortable. It was an enjoyable stay!

This is a really beautiful, modern, new hotel in an awesome location in Waikiki. Excellent customer service; they even provide you with a number to text with any questions you may have during your visit. Centrally located to LOS of restaurants and shops and just minutes away from the beach. Very close to the International Marketplace and Duke's Lane, which provides lots of restaurants and shops, They provide everything you need for the beach, which is great - nigh quality towels, mats, chairs, umbrellas. Reasonable rates, too. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Hotel was conveniently located at heart of Waikiki area with lots of shopping malls and eateries. 5min walking distance to famous Waikiki beach. They provide beach hotels and beach chairs should you require.Room assigned was clean and large by Asian standards. However lobby was located at 8th floor (not ground level) which was a little inconvenient but staffs who assisted are always smiling and ready to help. Kudos to the dedicated service!Didn't try the hotel breakfast but there are many choices around hotel, so no worries.

I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. The staff are so friendly here, and the hotel itself is brand new! So all of its facilities are working properly and look great! The pictures of this hotel, do not lie. I stayed at a single bedroom overlooking the mountains-not the ocean-and the view was jaw dropping still. The bathtub are super cute and elegant, surrounded by a glass door, where you can still see the marvelous window view if you prefer to, while taking a nice relaxing bubble bath. The location is super convenient also, walking distance to the beach -about 10 minutes to Wikiki beach, although I do not recommend that one, is packed with tourist and homeless people. If you walk 15 minutes down towards the mountains, there is a much nicer beach call Kimana beach where the locals go. I never rented a car and I was still able to explore because most hiking, snorking agencies will come and pick you up from almost any Wikiki Hotel as part of their package. There are tons of shopping stores and restaurants around this location as well.

Ended up at this great hotel after a horrible AirBnB experience. I had to find a hotel in a hurry as the AirBnB was absolutely a disaster (swamp cooler like a jet engine, dirty shower, etc.) while I was attending the University of Hawaii volleyball tournament. Thank you HYATT! Came here and was welcomed and appreciated. Great service. Great bed. Centrally located. I'll be back

Hyatt Centric is hands down one of the best hotels that i have ever stayed at! The staff there has customer service that is honestly out of this world, you can tell that they truly do care about their guests and is more than happy to assist in any way that they can to make your stay more pleasant. The front desk staff always had big warm smiles and was so welcoming that it made us as guests feel very delightful and appreciated. I must say that one of the highlights of my trip to Honolulu was having a host like Kani that truly assisted my friends and i. He made us feel like we were at home (even better honestly)! He looked out for our needs and gave us lots of tips for our activities and even gave us a print out of food and activities places that we could go check out! I honestly can say that without Kani as a host at Hyatt Centric my stay would not have been as pleasant as it was! Overall, the hotel was very modern and clean and had really nice complimentary items like refillable water bottles, sunscreen and aloe vera upon request and yummy lemon/cucumber infused water. I will for sure stay here again the next time I visit Honolulu :)

Hyatt Centric was an amazing hotel. When we first arrived, the staff were very welcoming. Everyone was so friendly and spent time telling us what activities we should do and where we should eat. They always tried their best in answering our questions and helping us with any problems. It may seem like a small thing but I really liked how the staff would always greet us when we seem them. Loved how waterproof sunscreen and aloe were provided. Also appreciated the waterbottles in our rooms that were available for refill of fruit infused water in the lobby. The room we stayed in was very clean and modern. Although I would appreciate more lighting in the washroom. One of the upsets was that the pool was closed half of our stay. It was very convenient to have an Expedia agent at the concierge to help us plan excursions. My friends and I had a wonderful stay. And definitely a huge shout out to KANI. He was extremely helpful and so incredibly kind. He definitely made our experience at Hyatt even better. 10/10 would recommend this hotel.

My room was super clean. I even had my own robe. The flat screen said welcome, "My Name" you are here. With a photo of Hawaii. The Staff was very welcoming and helpful. My bed was very comfortable. I honestly hate my bed and room now. I miss my room at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki so much. So, I plan on staying here when I revisit Honolulu. However, I would recommend staying here to anyone and everyone. Great first time!

This was a very nice hotel. The room was spacious, clean, and had modern furnishings. The service was great, everyone was courteous, professional, and very helpful. The hotel was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see and do. We will definitely be returning.

The staff was friendly and the deluxe room was just as the advertised. The room was extremely clean. I would recommend the hotel to anyone. You can even checkout from the television. The hotel is right in the middle of Waikiki.

Hyatt Centric Waikiki is located at the cross of Kuhio & Seaside Avs. It's Good Location for Shopping (T Galleria, Macy's, ROSS & more) Good Location for public transpotation (the Bus, Waikiki Trolley) Clean & Quiet Room + Good Services from All the Personnel (Hotel Front, House Keeping, Concierge) And I & my wife stayed there for Honey Moon at 'Ocean View' room, it's the Best View I've ever seen. Hope This Hotel to Be Loved More by More People.

Some of the best and helpful staff you'll ever find! Large, roomy, and clean rooms. Visitors should understand that the pool really is only deep enough for small children; there is a pool that looks like a large hot tub, but it is not heated. Good breakfast buffet. A short walk to Waikiki beach and shopping.

Visit Hawaii with my wife and stay this hotel about 7 days. Hotel staff give us early checkin at 11 am, let us put all luggage and have more time enjoy Waikiki . The hotel also have a 3-6 floors self parking, very good for people who rent a car. Although our bathroom glass broken automatically at 3 am (don't know why), but hotel staff help us change room very quickly (within an hour), very nice.

My husband and I booked 6 nights through Expedia and selected a room with an ocean view. We were given a room on the penthouse level with a very pretty view. The room was immaculate and the service at check-in was great. We really enjoyed the food at Lanai, the prices were reasonable, the breakfast buffet was ok. As some of the other reviews have mentioned, the pool is not really a pool. This was the only thing we didn't like but the beach was just a short walk away so we ended up renting the free beach chairs and umbrellas at the hotel and lounging on the beach instead.

Received a last minute offer for upgrade to ocean view for $10. On the 14th floor, we could see a little bit of blue water between buildings in two areas. Glad I didn't pay more for ocean view. Extra easy check in and out online. Exceptional service from everyone. Used Valet parking, quite reasonable if you have to pay for parking anyway. Great for one night. I just don't feel the need to stay near the beach in Waikiki anymore. Too crowded, too expensive. However, value seemed comparative to other hotels in the area. Pool area was lovely but full of children, even in the early evening. Great for kids and parents, not so great for others.

Rooms were clean and nice, service was exceptional, Pool was a downside as not much of a pool for adults except a cold jacuzzi style. location is great however parking price is a bit steep but for the area is right.

Not impressed by this hotel, yes it is a hotel and not a resort, there are no facilities that would make this a resort so don't believe the hype. Front desk service is poor, they welcomed us then stated our room wasn't ready (despite using online check in the day before and arriving 20 minutes before standard check in time). I asked how long until the room would be ready and was told 20 minutes "guaranteed". After the 30 minutes we were still sitting in the lobby, despite other guests receiving their room keys. Approaching the front desk and asking about our room, we were told it wasn't ready! I asked for a different room, no more rooms was the answer, meanwhile other guests were checking in and getting room keys, shocking service. The poor service continued on check out, we were advised by the bell desk it would be easy to get a taxi at 5:30am and they would call for one. Departing the hotel, the bell desk ignored us and it took 15 minutes to get the taxi. I didn't find any staff at this hotel remotely helpful.

Hyatt Centric Hotel is modern and convenient for guest, especially bed condition is perfect. Restaurant, ABC store, DFS, shopping ceter and ROSS are very close to this hotel, thus you can do anything as you like in this Hotel. Ammenity and interia are also modern and very impressive. I recommend using this Hotel when you will stay within Waikiki.

Stayed for 2 nights in May 2017. Great location (no real sea view and not beach front but we knew that going in and were 100% fine with the location). It's about a 5-6 min walk to Royal Hawaiian and Sheraton Waikiki's, both of which are beach front hotels so distance to beach was great. It was also very convenient to a ton of shops and restaurants including the high end stores. Musubi Cafe IYASUME was literally across the street and so good! Marukame Udon was also just around the corner and it was cheap and delicious (the line moves fairly quickly)! Service was great, from front desk to valet. Rooms are very spacious (we had a suite) and very nice modern decor and layout. We didn't make use of the small pool but the lobby and other public areas looked very nice. Overall, met our purpose of a quick 2 night stay in Waikiki for shopping, sightseeing and foodie trips. And we got a great pride to boot! If it's the beach or ocean views you are looking for, go elsewhere. But for value, service, and location to prime shopping/restaurants in Waikiki, this hotel can't be beat. Would come back!
user_name:
Tnylcaj
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hyatt Centric does not go out of their way to make your honeymoon special--in any way. I sent in two requests months in advance before the honeymoon asking if they could maybe do champagne in our room or chocolates on our pillows or something, but then added I wasn't sure what they did for honeymooners and to maybe do something nice because I wanted to surprise my new husband. Well, they did nothing. They told me to buy the chocolates and champagne myself. But outside of that, they didn't even do ANYTHING. No special little messages to welcome us in our room, no flowers, no room upgrade offer, no meal vouchers, no free pineapple juice for our stay, NOTHING. To Hyatt Centric, we were a dollar sign, another number. The room itself was okay, but had a weird window to the shower and bathroom, and the view was okay of the city area below on the street, but the TV had NO movies to rent, and hardly any TV channels (yes, rainy days happened). The sheets felt cheap and the pillows were flat and uncomfortable. Thankfully the A/C worked well. The location of the hotel is in the middle of the everything, we spent a week just walking everywhere. But I left Hyatt Centric wishing I had chosen another hotel for our honeymoon, somewhere more romantic or a place that cares more about honeymooners (who drop a LOAD of cash).
user_name:
Kayla H
San Mateo, United States

review_body: From the moment we stepped in to the moment we walked out this hotel was more than we expected. Staff went above and beyond to accommodate us. The young gentlemen that checked us in even printed us his personal to do list and must eat list. Hotel was perfectly located right in the centre of everything, close to public transport and 2mins away from the beach. They even helped us organize a rental car at pretty good rates. Would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time we visit Waikiki.

Staff member was rude prior to arrival. The hotel is nicely appointed and most of the staff very helpful but I spoke to a real jack wagon prior to my arrival VI's a VI's a special request. A senior staffer fixed it but he wasn't much more polite. Let's just say by reputation one expects more from Hyatt but a few lousy experiences illustrates that this reputation is overrated.

Before going to Honolulu, I read various reviews of hotels in Waikiki. I chose the Hyatt Centric and having stayed there for 4 nights, I can't believe anyone ever could find anything negative to say about the experience. The hotel is in pristine condition, the staff were all friendly and the room was exceedingly comfortable. I used the business center on a couple of occasions and was happy to find there was no charge to print out things that I needed for work. I did not eat at the restaurant, but did have a few tasty cocktails from the bar. The service was impeccable and the drinks were delicious. The one criticism I read before I went that has some basis in reality related to the pool. The deepest part of the pool is 3 feet. Most of it is for show rather than use. That didn't bother me because I didn't choose the hotel for a pool and the beach is just a couple of blocks away. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Waikiki.

Paid for a partial ocean view room but you could barely see the ocean - had to walk right up to the window and turn to the side to glimpse a hint of ocean through buildings. Felt a little misled and ripped off to be perfectly honest. 'Afternoon delighters' included in resort fee consisted of 2 bite size pieces of pineapple. Despite this, central location and modern rooms.

Hotel room was very clean and modern. Hotel is located in the middle of Waikiki shopping area. Every hotel host was very kind and helpful. One of the hotel guest helped me exchange my broken rental car with a new one. Very appreciated.

Excellent service, friendly staff, innovating processes with check in and text services, excellent amenities and accommodations, great location, within walking distance of almost everything in Waikiki.

Misleading information - the pool is not considered a pool - it is only for babies. The photos make it look like it is deep. We had to go to other hotel pools and to the beach to swim. Charged a resort fee and were not told about this upfront. The pillows weren't good - one was way too soft and the other way too hard. The food portion size was very small yet very overpriced, as well as the drinks.. even happy hour the drinks were still too expensive. Considering how much we were paying a night, our needs were not met.

Great, modern central hotel in Waikiki. The staff were just lovely. From the check in staff to the restaurant staff and the cleaners, everyone is really friendly and welcoming. I would definitely stay here again.

More affordable than the beach hotels, but you get what you pay for; poorly trained staff, from check-in to housekeeping. If you don't mind dealing with staff that doesn't care and a room that may or may not be cleaned each day, this is your place.

The Hyatt Centric is located at an extremely convenient spot in Waikiki next to the malls, duty free shopping, beach, food, etc. We were able to walk everywhere and only had to rent a car for when we ventured off the other parts of the island. The staff was accommodating in every way. The rooms were clean (I didn't have to worry about cockroaches). Thanks Hyatt Centric, I would be happy to come again.

It was decorated very cool. The rooms were very clean, relaxing, and beautiful. The location was very central. The staff were friendly and accommodating. We will definitely do another staycation there again! Thank you!! Cheryl H.

the check in experience was wonderful, the staff is extra friendly and helpful. location is very close to Waikiki beach and all the good shopping areas. Hotel was clean, and the only drawback is the pool is kind of small. But excellent value and experience.

Fantastic location and NEW HOTEL & ROOMS. Rooms are a little on the smaller size but this may be due to the huge bathroom which included separate shower and bath and excellent idea of have 2 USB plugs on ether side of bed. Starbucks is directly under hotel which was great but I rate our stay 10 out of 10 and highly recommended if your looking for a fantastic relaxing but efficient hotel. Thank you for the wonderful service throughout the hotel. An Excellent team you have!!! We would stay again!

Great location with easy access to eatery and shopping. Short walking distance to all the premium shopping main strip. (International Mall, Michael Mina Street Hall, Duke Lane Eatery, Royal Hawaiian Mall, main Kalakua street, Kuhio street, Yukocho Japanese Food alley - all less then 5 minutes walk). Nordstrom Rack is in the same building. This is no longer the shady Kuhio back street area. Make sure to park at the 6th floor which is directly connected to the hotel. The hotel facility is small which is great and you wont have to walk a mile to get in/out the entrance and parking. Very clean and spacious room. I would definitely come back and stay in this hotel.

I thought the hotel was beautiful but, pool was very small, bed was uncomfortable it was really hard. I had back pain every morning. And the food in hotel was really expensive and not good. Drinks were good though.

If you want to be where the action is, this is the perfect spot! They have an amazing top level pool, great nearby restaurants, and a quick walk to the beach! The staff was great, the hotel was perfect, and they even gave us free parking! If you go to Hawaii, you got to do it right by staying at the Hyatt!Below is my wife and I at the nearby beach!

We booked Hyatt Centric in Waikiki because we had points and credits. This new hotel is very clean and the rooms are trendy, cool and good sized! It is also walking distance to beach, shops and lots of restaurants. JONELL was very friendly & helpful as was the entire staff we came into contact with from the bellmen/women to the happy hour crew to housekeeping. Hospitality with smiles goes a long way on a vacation!! I would say the downfall for this particular location (or maybe our room location) was we didn't sleep very well. First two nights we stayed with a partial ocean view (didn't sleep one night because of arguing in the room next to us) but then we returned for two more nights. We were more on the inland side and heard people all night long & traffic. I'm not sure if it was from the apartments below or other hotels but we did not sleep for two nights! I would ask for a higher floor and definitely on the ocean side if you plan on staying. Another plus was the Happy Hour Hawaiian pizza and fries were very yummy. The pool is a bit funky only being 9-14 inches (yes inches!) but soothing laying in the lounge chairs in the pool itself. The little kids seemed to love it!

Overall, this is a fantastic, new addition to the upgraded Kuhio Ave corridor. This former office building (from what I recall anyway) was very nicely refurbished into a modern and clean hotel with thoughtful design touches. I think there's a range of room sizes and layouts within the same rate class, so perhaps we got lucky. Anyway, it was a large, beautiful shower with a soaking tub that was fantastic after a long day of walking. The room was very spacious with floor to ceiling windows and a v. comfortable bed.When we first pulled up and began unloading our bags, though, the two valets at the front just kept talking to each other, and one only approached us after we had already unloaded to ask if he could help. Uh, really? This gave me a very poor first impression. The front desk person who checked us in couldn't be nicer, so then I thought the earlier experience was a one-off. Went downstairs for a happy hour drink, and the bartender was unbelievably grouchy and seemed irritated when I asked him for the happy hour specials and again when I ask to charge it to the room after which time I heard him tell someone else some system was down. He literally rolled his eyes at me, but that's my fault how? He could have just politely explained that and asked for alternate means of payment. Back to -1. For the rest of the weekend stay, though, everyone else, including (to be fair) that same bartender who said hi, good evening, etc. when we passed by the next day, were friendly and always asked how we were or if there was anything we needed. Even accounting for the occasional bad moods or days, though, I have to deduct one star for service overall. When we were leaving, the valets again didn't offer to help us with the bags. I've seen this same comment on other reviews, so I really think the hotel needs to address this. First impression and all...I would definitely stay again, though, because the accommodations were beautiful for a reasonable rate and the majority of employees who were otherwise friendly and service-oriented. The location is great, too.

I like the location of the hotel. The staff are all friendly and bright. Room condition is also good. I went on a family trip and I am satisfied. I have to bring the water back. I can eat breakfast too.

I wished I had extended my three night stay.Hyatt Centric is a recently developed property that offers an excellent overall product.The front of house staff are excellent, the rooms are beautifully furnished and have a modern beach feel. The views from the higher levels are exceptional whether towards the mountains or the beach. As the name suggests, the Hyatt Centric is situated centrally above the hustle and bustle of Waikiki within a short walking distance of the beach, shops and restaurants you'll likely wish to go to.My one piece of constructive feedback is that the restaurant's menu and service levels need to be carefully reviewed. The breakfast was very expensive and frankly not great and thankfully this was the only poor service i received.Also the photos of the pool are a little misleading, there's two large plunge pools connected by a very large, very shallow pool.Overall a really terrific product that is not far from being perfect and although you'd expect the deficiencies wouldn't justify a 5 star review, the front of house and design of the property more than make up for it.

Hyatt Centric Waikiki employs the friendsliest, professional, kind, courteous and helpful staff ever! Everyone made us feel at home. The hotel itself is very clean with warm & beautiful decor. The food at The Lanai is awesome! The rooms are very clean, cozy & spacious! Views are amazing! There was always lots of parking spaces available in the parking structure. This hotel is a quick walk to places to shop & dine. We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone! We will definitely be back!

Very central great location! Very cheerful and helpful staff. As the hotel was recently built, it is very modern, clean and technologically well equipped. Very good price for Waikiki! The parking fee was also reasonable. We loved the amendments such as the beach umbrella and the chairs. Try to avoid the rooms next to the elevators, as they are quite loud.

Excellent location and service. Hotel was at the center of all the shops, dining areas and walking distance to the beach. Room was on the smaller side and had a strange bathroom set up but it was very clean and stocked.

Found Hyatt Centric on Bookings.com and when we arrived for some reason it hadn't made it to there system however the reception staff where amazing and where very accommodating to us and got our room and matched the rate! We have had an amazing 4 days in Waikiki and the Hotel room is perfect! Bed great, bathroom stunning and beautifully decorated. Can't fault the accommodation however the breakfast mmm a miss! But this can happen in Hotels. There is plenty of spots around to have breakfast so don't waste time in house go out and explore. The situation of the Hotel is perfect. Just a bit back off the main street and as we aren't real beach people it was perfect for us. Recommend and well priced.

The employees of the hotel made all he difference in the world. They were always very professional, kind and courteous. I would definitely stay there again. Highly recommend you stay there. Didn't try any food in the hotel, so I am not sure if food was even offered.

We loved this hotel - it is indeed centric, right in the centre of Waikiki, but also relatively small and personal. The staff service is truly exceptional, they will do anything to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable.

This gem of a hotel is new, clean, and hip, with modern but warm decor, and friendly service. Near lots of shopping and restaurants. We were greeted with smiles and fresh squeezed pineapple juice. We arrived late morning, and I called ahead to see if it was possible to do an early check-in, and when we arrived, a lovely room was waiting for us. Clean, quiet, bright, with simple but pretty decor, modern white walls with warm wood furnishings. Our room, an ocean view with two queen beds, had large comfortable beds, a huge bathroom with both a gorgeous tub and a separate shower, and nice amenities. The major con, and the reason for only three stars, is that the "pool" is only three inches deep. Up to my ankles. Seriously! My kid said he'd stomped in puddles deeper than this. I mean why bother? It is not even a lap pool, more like a fountain. Other minor cons are that the "ocean view" is slices of ocean between big high rises, as the hotel is three blocks from the beach, and that the windows don't open. Still, the prices are reasonable for such a modern high quality hotel, and if you are looking for business or a more hip slightly urban take on Honolulu (and don't care about swimming), this could be your spot!

My husband and I live here in Hawaii we stayed at the Hyatt Centric for one night 7/22-7/23 we had an amazing time, the room was extremely clean and Watson the manager went above and beyond to help us enjoy our stay by doing a turn down service with flowers all over the room. Very nice and professional staff.

Good location as everything is walking distance .Restaurants,shopping malls etc .You don't have to rent a car .Bellman was well trained .Reception and lobby was good ..Restaurant and pool ,jacuzzi are at the same level .Room was small but very clean.I like the set of room with good ocean view .A great hotel .

Very clean and nice rooms. It looks like the finishing touches are not there yet. The touch up paint used in the bathroom, although still white, seems like a different paint. Very visible from the side that it is different, but not if looking directly at it. I like the idea of the water bottles that they provide, but not executed very well. First of all, the bottles whistles when you use it. Not good to use when my wife is sleeping as she is a light sleeper. Second, why are the water stations only on a few floors. If you are telling people that the bottles are being provided because they are better for the environment, won't your guests have to take the elevator (wasting electricity) to the few floors with the water stations? The bathroom only has one small hook to hang a towel. Most hotels want their guests to hang their towels up to reuse the towels, reducing the need to replace towels everyday. We use the towel holder on the shower door to hang the wet bath mat, so no place to hang towels if more than one person staying in the room. There is a whole blank wall in the bathroom that could be used to install a towel holder. A recycling bin in the room would also be good. There currently is only one garbage can in the entire room, by the toilet. If anybody is using the bathroom, you have no place to dump any garbage. Most hotels I've stayed at would have a garbage can by the desk, one by the bathroom sink, and possibly by the toilet. So I am a bit confused about their environment strategy. But overall a very nice hotel. Thanks to other TripAdvisor posts, I knew where to park, the Hyatt website doesn't tell you to enter the self-parking garage after the Ross and to park in the 6th floor. It just says that self-parking is available.

Being that we stayed in a few hotels during our PCS (in am an Army Soldier), I wish we had stayed in this hotel initially. Compared to the other hotels, the Hyatt Centric is head and shoulders above the rest. The staff from the front desk to the Valets are there to help you with anything you could possibly need. They're very friendly, knowledgeable, and can help enhance your stay whether you live here in Hawaii, or are just visiting the island. I definitely will recommend the Hyatt Centric to everyone that I know is coming to Oahu. Awesome hotel!

We had an amazing experience using Trip Advisor. We were able to on tour around Oahu, see the Polynesian Center and visit Pearl Harbor. The tour guides were very joyful and friendly. They made us feel very comfortable and provided great information for our tours.
user_name:
Ali M
Moreno Valley, United States

review_body: The staff itself deserves a 6 star rating. Everyone was kind, accommodating and helpful! This particular hotel has a very boutique look and vibe. We loved staying here and would come here again. The pool is shallow so it's great for kids.

I try to book the hotel directly but not through Expedia/booking.com, so I can get more information about the hotel. When I asked the first reservation agent if we will have access to beach. The agent said: that you should ask concierge ( ??? Can't even answer that question???). And we I said could you please put me on hold for second, I just need to talk to my friend to make the decision, she just hung up on me. The second reservation agent I called, gave me the different price compare to the Hyatt website, and when I ask why the price is different, the agent said that I will get an accessible room based on the price ( not show on website, and the first agent didn't tell me that). And I said are you sure, she said please hold for second and hung up again!!!!I still made a reservation on Hyatt website because my friend likes Hyatt brand a lot. Hope we can get a good stay.

Spent 3 nights at this hotel and was overall quite pleased with everything. While not a beachfront hotel, the hotel is centrally located and a couple blocks from the beach. The hotel gives you beach chairs and umbrellas to take to the beach. And while you may think this would be a hassle, it's quite the opposite. The chairs and umbrellas are very easy to transport. This was a very nice touch and convenient that they rented them for free. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Booked a room on Hotwire, so they put us in the most basic room that directly faces the loud club across the street. Mentioned the trip advisor reviews about how loud the club is at night and they moved the room to another side that was less loud. You could still hear the club, but it wasn't too terrible from the room. Definitely request to not face the club.

Food at the restuarant is expensive and not really good. The other issue is the pool, please be aware you cannot swim in this pool, too shallow. Maximum depth is 3ft at the jacuzzi rest is less that that.

Have stayed at all the good hotels in Waikiki, the new Hyatt Centric is already on the top of the list as one of the best, and newest. Amazing location, quick walk to beach, and right next to the best new shopping/restaurant complex in town. Rooms are fantastic, everything's brand new, with high end finishes across the board, and some stunning views. I get that they don't have an Olympic pool, but you're a few minutes walk from the beach, and the pool they do have is cool and fits the vibe of the property. The GM has done a great job here, staff is fantastic, including Jackie and Erica at the front desk, and Alex at front desk on evening shift. Couldn't be better, and food is GREAT!

Great little hidden gem in the middle of the Waikiki craziness. Location is outstanding as you are near all of the great shopping spots and restaurants. Parking is a little rough as you have to park all the way on the sixth floor. However, everything else about the hotel is fantastic. The staff is extremely friendly and polite. The rooms were amazing. Best room I've been in for years and I travel often. Just a beautiful room. Front door staff was great. For the price and the location, there is no way you can beat it.

This was such a beautiful hotel! Loved the modern feel and decor!!! And loved the pool and the staff was awesome!!! We would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!!! Would stay here again!!! Loved!!!!

The new Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach and its next door neighbor, The Laylow, are the hottest tickets in town and very welcome additions to the tired hotel scene in Waikiki. I visited Hyatt Centric in June of 2017 and it definitely exceeded my expectations. This was my first visit to a Hyatt Centric. I have stayed at three Andaz properties and preferred this hotel to all three of them. I don’t quite understand Hyatt’s branding, as I assumed Hyatt Centric would fall below Andaz but, based on our experience at Hyatt Centric Waikiki, I would rank their brands as follows from best to worst: Park Hyatt, Hyatt Centric, Andaz, Grand Hyatt, Regency Regency. I would choose this hotel over the nearby Hyatt Regency on Kalakaua.Pros:-Excellent service. Front desk staff was wonderful and very responsive. Casual friendly vibe. They promptly responded to any requests by phone or text message. Love the option of text messages. Housekeeping staff was excellent and flexible-Stunning 8th floor lobby with pool area. Live music many nights.-Rooms are very nice with dramatic views of Honolulu on higher floors(see photos). We got upgraded to a suite so I’d be curious to know what the standard rooms are like-Excellent bed and linens-Excellent lighting (recessed lights on dimmers, which was a stark contrast to the Laylow next door, where your only two choices are "Pitch black" or "brighter than a Target store"). Recessed lights on dimmers should be a requirement of all hotels.-Our suite had a separate zen sitting area with a huge round window. Nice place to chill while gazing out at the lights of Honolulu (see photos). It may have been a sofa bed (I never thought to check)-The room had two refillable sports bottles and there was a filtered water dispenser as well as an ice machines right across the hall to refill them. Very nice touch-Great restaurant with 24 hour room service. Fast room service delivery.-Second floor of building is one of the biggest and best Nordstrom Racks I have seen. Makes it very easy if you forget anything-Great location on much-improved Kuhio. Less than two blocks away from the new International Market Place and possibly the best food court on earthCons:-Hotel is located in a converted office building and it felt like it upon arrival. The valet staff didn't mention that the lobby was on the 8th floor so we weren't sure where to go until we asked. The only staff that was not very helpful or friendly were the valets-Because it’s a converted office building, the hotel does not have balconies or lanais or even windows that open. I think this was a big mistake on Hyatt’s part. It would make a huge difference if some windows at least opened for fresh air. After all, this is Hawaii. I understand now why it’s rare to see a commercial building converted to a hotel. The upside is unique floorplans and lots of recessed lighting; the downside is no outdoor areas and a somewhat confining feel.-If you are seeking a beachy resort, this isn’t it. I would describe it as an urban escape. I do not think this would be a particularly good choice for families with kids (same goes for the Laylow next door)Despite the lack of balconies, Hyatt Centric Waikiki is a wonderful new option in Waikiki that gets an A+ for effort and a 5 rating from me. Concept is well-executed, staff is exemplary.

Just like all of the hotels in the Hyatt brand this one is also very nice and about two blocks to the beach. The hotel area and pool area are very clean and nice condition. If you're coming to Honolulu this place is definitely worth staying at and the staff was fantastic. After staying here a couple of days we wanted an oceanfront room so we packed all the bags and left them in the corner of the room and let the front desk now and when we came back they had already moved all her bags into the new room and give us a new room key it was all done for us. I cannot say enough about the staff

Okay, I am on the fence with this property! It's new and looks nice on the inside. The people working there are super kind. However, I had a major major issue with this property, the pool. Where is the pool? You can't invite families over and make a waddling pool. It was so tiny that it wouldn't even cover my three year old's knees. Major disappointment!!

This is my first tripadvisor review and I feel I need to share my experience. The hotel and room is renovated and modern but we were assigned to an accessible room on first night which layout made us feel uncomfortable. They changed to a standard room for us next day but that room was not cleaned yet after we came back from the beach at 8pm and they wanted us to wait 30 minutes for the room to be cleaned because they did not have other room available. The guy (I forgot his name but he made me feel like lacks of experience) at front desk kept justifying it is their system issue (which means ok for customer?). Even after room cleaned, we found hair on the bed and pillow smells and they only put 1 glass in our room. I choose Hyatt Centric because of their location, modern design and the quality of Hyatt (used to be?), but this experience made me disappointed. Their staff definitely needs more training.

This place is brand new and decked out with modern facilities. Big rooms and great beds. Awesome bath and showers. I couldn't get my son out of his sofa bed because he loved it so much. Best of all the service is first class - everything was easy and staff are so helpful. The only thing to watch for is the cab company they use to take you to airport. The hotel organised it at $29 including tip - but the driver tried to play dumb and get more. This was not the hotels fault - it's the dodgy cab driver. Otherwise a fantastic place to stay - will definitely go back there.

I guess I wasn't as impressed with this hotel as some other people reviewing it. The hotel rooms were clean for the most part and a nice size. The shower had some mold growing in the bottom corners, but that is my only complaint about the cleanliness. We were originally put in a room that shares a wall with the elevator. I knew a few hours in after trying to take a nap that it was going to be an issue, especially since we were staying a week. The front desk staff was able to find a different room that was a little further from the elevator which helped a lot. The new room also had a partial ocean view. If you are able to I would recommend requesting a room away from the elevators on a high floor to avoid noise. I wouldn't pay extra for the ocean view. It was nice, but you basically get to see a small section of it between buildings. We didn't use the pool, but it looked fairly nice. It attracts a lot of families with kids. Probably because it's shallow so a good place for young ones to play in the water. We went to the bar once during our visit. I don't remember who our bartender was, but he wasn't very friendly and the drinks were more expensive than anywhere else we went. We ended up spending time at another hotel's bar. The location was ok. It is about a block away from a nice shopping area and if you walk through it then you can get to the beach on the other side. There is also another alley you can use a little down the street to get to a public part of the beach. There is a Ross and an ABC store next door which was convenient for picking up a couple of items we needed. The shopping center had a nicer ABC store though so I ended up going there more. Next time I may be willing to pay more for a hotel on the beach. If you are looking for a hotel where you can walk outside and be on the beach or that has more of a resort feel then this isn't the place for you. Overall, if you can get a really good price for it then I would say this hotel is worth it. I'm not sure if I would stay at it again.

This is a fairly new hotel and I was looking forward to giving it a try. It exceeded my expectations despite the fact that it wasn't right on the beach. The hotel was beautiful with a modern understated elegance. The suites were so very comfortable, clean and well maintained. The check in staff was superb, explaining all the free amenities including access to beach towels etc. I highly recommend this hotel.

You are kidding, right? Really? I'm here on vacation and have tired children. Your hotel has scheduled a private party right outside our window. Your manager offered to move us to another room or provide extra pillows or earplugs. Seriously? We aren't moving since we've already unpacked and the children are in bed. They won't be sleeping until the party is over. It has been going on for at least three hours now and according to the manager in charge, will continue for another hour. Also, how do I know you haven't scheduled more parties for this week while we are staying at your hotel? You have a very unhappy customer.Why would you ever schedule a loud party at night? Ever? You will always have guests affected by such a party. Surely someone in charge of a hotel has more sense than this? Does your hotel have a different business model than others? Most hotels are in the business of providing a clean, quite place where people come to _sleep_!If you want to pay a bucket of money to take a shower in a clean room with a view of the ocean and then get a partial night's sleep, then this is the hotel for you.

I think this hotel opened in 2016 so it’s on the newish side. This was a 3-night stay and I reserved 2 rooms. I had the king suite and my companion had a king room; both had views to the ocean. It’s an obstructed view (i.e., the view is blocked by other buildings) so if want to save money, you might opt for the city view or Diamond Head view.King suite: I didn’t like my 2-room suite. The bedroom space was fine, but lacked sufficient natural light. The window is above the bed, but it’s a long, wide rectangle that’s not very big. The bedroom room had sufficient storage space for one person (two would be challenging) and the bed was a bit too soft for me. The living space left a lot to be desired. Even though the view looks toward the ocean, there wasn’t a lot of natural light coming in through the windows. The space is very small and contains a sofa (very uncomfortable), chair (small), table for the TV, and another low table (the finish had visible water damage). As you enter the living space, the floor slopes down. There is no desk at all in this room so getting any laptop work had to be done using the low table and the sofa. It killed my back! (I was told that none or most of the suites did not have a desk.) The bathroom had a newfangled toilet (i.e., the kind that washes your bottom with the push of one of several buttons). The enclosed shower (which I liked) also included a tub (which I didn’t use – who uses a tub when they travel?). The vanity had sufficient counter space. The Keurig coffer maker was located at the correct height so it was easily accessible in the king suit. (This statement will make sense in the next paragraph.)King room: This was a much better room. Much better natural light, much better use of space (open with very little unnecessary furniture), and it had a desk (albeit a small, narrow desk, but a desk none the less).
