The enclosed shower did not have a tub and it had a standard toilet. The storage space was in issue (not much of it) and the location of the Keurig coffee maker was weird. It was on a slide out shelf in the armoire, but it was too high. I’m fairly tall, but even I had to stretch to ensure I had the correct water level. If you’re of modest stature, you’ll have to use a chair or move the coffee maker to the desk. Overall, however, this king room was a much more comfortable room than my king suite.Service: Check-in by Erica was great. She was gracious, upbeat attitude, and helpful. Subsequent visits to the Front Desk were good experiences except for once. I’ll be sexist: men/young men make the worst Front Desk attendants. Ask a man/young man a question and you often get “no” with no alternatives/options or a deer in the headlight look. Usually not helpful. That said, some of the men/young men here were good. There was one (whose name I did not get) who was rude and consequently, unhelpful. Excellent service by the waitpersons on breakfast days 2 and 3; and lunch on day 1. Again, I didn’t get their names (apologies!), but they were quite good. Service by the downstairs Front Door attendants ranged from good to very good. I didn’t know they provided beach towels, but a young lady at the Front Door mentioned it and that was a plus since we didn’t travel with beach towels.Parking: Self-parking here is the challenge. Very tight and narrow ramps, but I was not OK with the very tight parking spaces. Be advised that the parking garage is not operated by Hyatt and as with most (if not all) hotels, it’s a subcontracted service. Hence, the rules/requirements are not always obvious. Each time you enter the garage, you have to take a ticket, but no one tells you that you need to keep the parking ticket each and every time you exit the garage. The rude guy at the parking attendant booth threatened to charge me the higher rate if I didn’t have the parking ticket “the next time you come out.” He was rude, but I let it go. I’m guessing he hates his job and he’s burned out with tourists. :-)Others have commented about the small pool. I never use a hotel pool so I don’t have anything to offer regarding the pool. Besides, if you need that pool experience with someone hoovering and serving you all the time, this probably isn’t the hotel you want. Others have also commented/complained about the location of the hotel in relation to the beach. Good grief! The hotel is not that far from the beach. You can walk there in 10 minutes! :-) If you want to be ON the beach, then you might want to select a different hotel. Does noise filter up from the street? I don’t know since I was on the 20th floor, but keep in mind the location: It’s off Kuhio Ave. (a busy street) and not far from the very busy Kalakaua Ave. Overall, the hotel is fine. Though, I would probably pass on getting a suite. (Well, at least the one I had, [room 2009]). If you’re looking for luxury or upscale, this isn’t it. But if you’re looking for a newish hotel with acceptable amenities and better than average service, the Hyatt Centric Waikiki fits the bill. Who knows what it will look like when the newness wears off and its seen too many tourists, but for right now, it’s a good hotel. It certainly scored well on service during this visit.

Plusesfabulous location in central Waikikisuperb wifiLess expensive than beachside hotelsspacious rooms (see below)new and clean, great linenNegativesA few blocks from beachWading pool onlySmall scale/facilities Larger rooms have unusable space because of columns and layout as the building is a former office tower

We stayed for 3 nights in a king suite, beautiful rooms, spectacular view, really modern, new and spacious accomodation for my husband and I and teenage son. Excellent service, staff were quick to remedy any problem and were helpful and attentive. Location is excellent with fab shopping close by (Nordstrom rack next door for great bargains) and 5 mins nice stroll to Waikiki beach. Will be back!

We spend six nights on Oahu and our last night on the island we stayed at Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. The two things we liked about the hotel were the location and the size of the king size bed room we were given.The hotel is located very close to Waikiki beach, only a few minutes walk. There are plenty of stores for shopping around the hotel as well as restaurants. Very convenient if you want to be in the center of life at Waikiki. Our room on the 12th floor was a very good size and it felt and seemed new. We enjoyed the spaciousness of it, the bathroom was also spacious. Why then give it an average rating? The room was spacious but it was noisy especially at night. When we arrived in the room my wife noticed that the hotel room came with complimentary ear plugs. We thought it was cute at the time but when we went to bed at night we realised that it was no joke. The noise from Kuhio avenue that the room was facing warranted ear plugs. So, spacious room but very noisy at night.The other point that we found average was that the pool is relatively shallow and not a real swimming pool (as in being able to swim and do laps). To note: as we live in Asia, we are spoiled for choices when it comes to four or five star hotels. The room prices of Hyatt Centric are five star superior room Asia equivalent but the hotel does not feel like it is of that standard. Overall it is a centrally located, spacious rooms, clean hotel. Not a five star luxury property but efficient and good for a short stay (if you don't mind the noise).

We recently rented 2 rooms at the Hyatt Centric when our family traveled together to Waikiki and we couldn't all fit in the other condo. The location was great - close to shopping, restaurants, the beach. Probably could have gotten by without renting a car. The property is clean and nicely designed. We spent an afternoon by the pool. Really beautiful setup and nice open air entry to the lobby area. The rooms were very nice although there were some issues with noise from the street. We will consider this hotel again for our next trip

There were three mistakes for our three nights stay, check in process, room charge and deposit authorization. They did not offer anything except a "sorry" to compensate, not even a free ride to airport.

Overall this is a great hotel to stay in Honolulu area. It's a very convenient and easy to get around by bus, walking or other transportation. The pice is fairly good, only complaint that I've is the front desk personals need to be cooperative with the visitors.

Extremely friendly and helpful staff! Modern, up-to-date rooms! Beautiful pool/outside area! Accommodating with beach amenities. Ideal location except bar across street noisy at night. Would definitely visit here again

We stayed 9 nights in the Hyatt Centric I attended a conference for the first 5 days while my wife enjoyed the Waikiki Beach. The was quite large and comfortable, but the hotel is noisy at times. The staff were very helpful in outfitting us with beach equipment and guiding us to places on the island. Always helpful. One should recognize that the pool is only 9 inches deep, but the cool water Jacuzzi is refreshing. There was a lot of construction around the hotel which could be noisy in the morning. In addition, the hotel itself was a bit noisy. Sounds created when toilets are flushed or service doors allowed to close noisily.

We stayed for two nights at a relatively new Hyatt property, the Centric, in Waikiki Beach, Honolulu, Hawaii. The property is a refurbished office building that has been very nicely done. But what makes this property very special is the super staff.We were greeted at the front door consistently with warmth and offers to assist. The check in experience started off less than optimal and when a manager looked at our reservation, he was able to get us into our two rooms on the same floor at 10 am! After a 8+ hour travel day from Japan, we were very glad to get into our room so early. The bar staff was great and very flexible. The front desk helped us with local directions, including finding a great pizza place that delivered to the hotel. On checkout, Jennifer was very helpful and cooperative.The property is very well located within the Waikiki Beach area. Close to shopping, restaurants, and the beach!Great property and super staff. Highly recommended.

Nice convenient location and the staff was extremely helpful. Would definitely stay here again. The breakfast was a bit overpriced and the buffet was a bit underwhelming. Other than that great. If you are into shopping there is a Nordstrom Rack downstairs and around the corner there are tons of stores, both hi end and regular.

Vacay w/my daughter was great. The staff at the hotel are all super. Rooms are beautiful, nice modern decor, spacious, comfortable and most importantly CLEAN!! I would have no issues returning here again!

They claim to have a pool but all they have is an ankle deep to 14 inch deep water filled depression outside the Lobby - very disappointing. Be prepared to fork over $32/day for parking in the building.

I would recommend the Hyatt Centric Waikiki for anyone looking for an awesome, relaxing stay in Waikiki. The rooms are very large, and nicely appointed. Staff could not be more welcoming. Very close to lots of shopping and dining as well.

The hotel room was nice as they are new and the staff was friendly. We had asked for a quite room and were placed in a suite next to the elevator and facing a club across the street on the 16th floor. Needless to say between the dinging and traffic from the elevator and the crazy loud music at night from the club, it was not a pleasant stay. when asked to move rooms we were told nothing else was available and that we should use the earplugs that were in the room. Don't think we would come back.

STARWOOD: GOLDMARRIOTT: GOLDAs I continue to ditch Marriott in 2017, I needed to find the perfect spot in Waikiki for the end of my Hawaii trip. I had just spent 5 nights in Maui, and needed 1 night here. I wanted it close if not on the infamous beach, new or remodeled, and affordable, well THIS IS IT! HOTEL: The property itself is not new, but Hyatt has renovated it and opened recently this Centric brand property. I'm estimating from memory here, but I want to say it's 28 floors or thereabouts. It is a mid rise building with stellar location. Inside ground floor, elevator up 1 level to check in, this is also where the bar/lounge and beautiful pool deck are. During my stay there was a beautiful Hawaiian artist singing from about 5-8 and with its location the streets are alive, especially from say 4p to 10p.THE LOCATION: As stated above, the location of this property is excellent. The only thing better might be one of the Hotels right on the beach, but the walk is a nice one, and one should get out and experience wherever they stay anyhow.Its about 5-10 minutes to Waikiki Beach itself. This property is surrounded by all kinds of shopping and restaurants. Excellent Asian Cuisine in Honolulu ;-)For those using UBER in Honolulu, please know that they have an arrangement with the local taxi's, not all of them, but some, and for that reason they are not the best option here. Use Lyft instead as they are their own drivers.The Missouri Memorial is about 15 minutes or more depending on traffic, and the airport a bit further. Diamondhead by car is 5-10mins, and can also be reached by foot.THE ROOM(S): I can understand the frustration of the one who just posted , if all the rooms are not of the same size. I doubt there is a huge difference however, and it would have to do with the former life of this property.I found my room, a Double on a top floor to be exactly what I needed, and you cant beat that it feels brand new being it was just created. Excellent opportunity for views of the city as well so be sure to ask if its possible. The front desk I found to be very accommodating.THE STAFF: I did not deal with too many people for this stay but the Sales support team was fantastic to work with and they clearly wanted my business, more than I can say for Marriott teams right now, guess what, they got it, and Marriott did not. Again as stated above from the greeting at the lobby doors, to the Front desk, to the Bar staff, and Maids, everyone was cheerful and accommodating. Was my Elite recognized? I am not yet Elite with HyattI would absolutely recommend this property. It was $150-200 cheaper than staying on the beach, and prices are insane in Honolulu. Save yourself money for everything else and stay here, especially if your stay is short, you wont regret it.

This hotel is set against a beautiful backdrop in Waikiki. It boasts contemporary rooms and entrance. It is elegant in its design but it seems like the developer wanted to scimp on the first comforts of the guest. The parking lot is adjacent/shared with a major Department store. There are no visible signs to the hotel, which lobby is actually on the 8th floor in the hotel. If you've never been to this hotel, there is a good chance you will park on the wrong level The actual entrance to the hotel is a SEPARATE entrance on the other side of the mall elevators. Please note you must go to the 6th floor level to actually get to the hotel elevators. Once you get inside the posh lobby, it is very nice. You may ask where is the restaurant, well, you have to look carefully and begin to take 25 paces before you realize if you are near the pool, you are near or in the restaurant. The rooms are plush and nice and have a beautiful ambiance. The engineering of the rooms and design are high tech. and very nice. That is what made this hotel a 3 star hotel for me.

My husband and I just arrived to Hawaii to celebrate our 1 year anniversary . We just checked in to the Hyatt centric today and was so excited after seeing reviews and pictures online. We got to the room and was very disappointed. The room size is very small and does. It look like the pictures depicted. I called down to the front desk to see if there were other King size bedrooms that were bigger. A gentlemen informed me that there are different size rooms. He explained that Expedia puts pictures up that don't always represent the true picture. That's false advertisement to me. I asked if there was another room bigger available, we were willing to pay any difference. The gentlemen told me there was not. So I go down to the bar (the bartender was excellent) and a young lady, who had just checked in, tells her companion "they just upgraded us to a suite"! I am so confused because I thought there weren't any more rooms. We are booked here for 7 days and I am trying to not let this ruin the rest of my trip, but right now I am extremely frustrated and irritated. Kiona Fuller

Very friendly staff. Clean rooms. New hotel. Great location in Waikiki, in walking distance to the beach, shopping and many dining options. We rented a car for one day, which saved on the expense of the parking garage or valet parking. The parking fee for the hotel is the same fee all over Waikiki. We booked 3 different tours, which they pick up and drop off, so there is little reason to rent a car for an entire vacation. Renting as needed is a much better option. I was surprised by the pool, only 14 inches deep but I don't feel this took away from our trip. Upon check out, there was a problem with our bill- Delta Vacations didn't provide them with all the information that we had paid all fees, including the daily resort fee. Kaniala was so helpful , he allowed our room bill to stay open until we could get back home and have time to call Delta Vacations. Once we were home, Delta Vacations called the hotel and cleared the balance with them directly. The one suggestion I do have for the hotel, is there needs to be additional trash cans in the room. We had one small trash can in the bathroom, but it was continually over flowing because we are a family of 4. I would recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay here again!

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric for 6 nights at the end of May. This was an excellent hotel and I really cannot fault anything.- Check in and check out was a breeze, and at all times the front desk staff were lovely- We booked a partial ocean view room and we were upgraded to a stunning ocean view from room on 19th floor. We has beautiful views across Waikiki Beach- The hotel decor is modern but with a touch of Hawaiian charm. Our room was very spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel has only been open about 6 months. Being so new is a really nice change from a lot of older hotels that are in Waikiki.- The pool area is a little on the small side however we always were able to find a lounger and spent most afternoons there- The service at the pool and bar was fantastic. We really enjoyed happy hour and the live music in the evenings- The hotel location is perfect. There is a Starbucks right downstairs, Nordstrom Rack and the International Market Place (with the amazing new foodcourt) a few doors down and the beach less than 5 mins walk away- The staff on the front door were possibly the nicest and friendliest hotel staff we have ever encountered.- For what you get the price is excellent - We really enjoyed that although it is a Hyatt it is reasonably small and has got a boutique type feel to it.When booking this hotel I read extensive reviews and was a little concerned about two things 1) having no balcony and 2) the pool depth. As it turns out having no balcony was no issue at all - the floor to ceiling windows more than made up for it and we spent most of our time at the poor and bar anyway. The pool was also not any issue at all. It is actually separated into 3 parts - the middle is only ankle deep, one end is about 1 foot deep and the other end is essentially a jacuzzi (although bigger and not hot)which is about 3 feet deep with seating all around the edge. We swum everyday and were more than refreshed in the far end of the pool, we did not miss having something deeper at all. My only comment would be that at times there were kids splashing around and because it was quite small it could be a bit annoying - it would be nice to make that section of the pool adults only.You will not be disappointed if you book this hotel. Next time we go back to Waikiki we will 100% be staying here.
user_name:
Nicola W
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: Treated very well... outstanding service. Comfortable, modern and clean rooms! Very close to everything Waikiki... stayed for business, but plan on returning for a vacation. Highly recommended all-around!

The hotel overall is nice and perfect for a business trip or if you're solely using for sleeping and showering. Hotel was helpful with food and things-to-do recommendations, offered all the right things and gave me honest service which I truly appreciated. The staff was great and had a swift response time with any issues I had. I overslept in my room during the housekeeping hours. I called the hotel while I was at breakfast and my room was serviced. Something happened to my remote and two big guys (they were very nice) came and fixed it right away. Only negative thing I have to say which is no one fault at the hotel is the pool is not a real pool. It's called a "lounge pool". I received an elaborate reason why the hotel didn't have a deep pool. It was over good overall though. Two thumbs up!

It is our first time of booking this hotel and it is our very best one. The hotel is always clean and fresh. All the staffs here are very friendly, cheerful and helpful with any questions that we had. The rooms are big and elegant looks inside. The spaces are wide to walk around. Food here were so good. We are very happy with the chefs. He or she did a fantastic job.

Great as a stop over from other islands to get back to Sydney Great rooms spacious clean bright good bathroom lovely lobby bar and pool area not too big and busy staff very accomadating and friendly close to shops and beach

Hyatt Centric is a nice brand that I trust. This hotel is great - nice location near the beach and shopping as well as fantastic staff. The bar and restaurant blend together and live music is offered two nights each week.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach. The hotel itself is fresh, clean, new and modern. Our room was nice and spacious, and we had a great view towards the ocean. The hotel was very central in Waikiki, walking distance to locations in all directions. It only took about five minutes to walk down to the beach (potentially even less), and all of the restaurants, shops, etc. The staff were absolutely fantastic - so welcoming and friendly. They gave us plenty of great tips and information about the local area and made us feel very welcome. The pool area was really nice to chill out in - even though it was a wading pool, that didn't really matter too much to us, as we were more interested in swimming at the beach during the day and then just hanging out beside the pool when we returned to the hotel.Thanks again to the Hyatt Centric Waikiki team!

My stay at the Hyatt was comfortable and the staff were very friendly. No hassle checking in. Although my trip was short, but I would definitely stay here again. The view wasn't what I expected but it was beautiful in the morning when I caught the sunrise. The buildings in front of my room (1811) was, however, a bit of an eyesore. The room was beautiful and so was the bathroom! (That mirror though) Hyatt Centric is probably the first hotel I've ever stayed in that provided a keurig machine with different flavored coffee which I enjoyed very much in the morning. Lol! Also the entertainment (I can't remember the singer's name) by the pool was excellent. A talented singer with a beautiful voice that made the other guests just get up and dance. I didn't know about the discount at the bar and restaurant you get as a hotel guest until I read the pamphlet they have in the room the next morning. Lol! Oh, well. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Centric.

Great new hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Clean spacious rooms, friendly staff, kid friendly wading pool, Starbucks attached to the ground floor of the hotel, good hotel restaurant but very limited room service options.

I felt like VIP staying here....they offered water bottles, beach chairs, umbrellas and even rice to help dry my phone. I will always choose to stay at Hyatt.Employees made me feel well taken care of. Genuine service

Impressive looking but lacking in Customer service. First, being on the 11th floor you would figure it would be quiet at 1 am to 4 am right? The noise from a restaurant bar across the Street on Kuhio avenue was unbearable, the motor cycles revving their engines for hours did not impress me. Insulation appears less than satisfactory to minimize noise. Housekeeping lacks supervision, one day housekeeper did not refill supplies in the coffee station. I requested that our room be cleaned between 9 am and 12 noon, next 2 days nothing was done to comply with my request. Housekeeping supervisor needs training on how to supervise not show me her tablet she claims had the instructions to do as we requested.

The cleaning lady used the same cloth to clean the toilet to clean my water glass!!!!! You thought you were in a much better place, but not here. I have Hyatt Credit Card and spend $10,000/moth; I own a Hyatt Time share as well. I spend 9 months of the year in hotels. This is terrible!

After spending 2 weeks in Hawaii, we finished our stay with 2 nights at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki and this was a perfect end to our tripFrom check in, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and made us feel so welcome. When we checked in our room wasn't quite ready so we just waited at the bar and had some lunch and a few cocktails.The menu here is amazing and I highly recommend the Kona Komachi Sashimi as this was so delicious we had it 2 days in a row!!When we got up to our room.. Wow! The design is so beautiful and our view of the ocean was sensational. Being a little back from the main strip we didn't think our view would be that great but it was better than expected and we actually enjoyed the fact it was not directly in the hustle and bustle but still close enough to all the action.The friendly staff, the design and little touches of this hotel just topped off the end to our holiday and made us want to stay longer so thank you Hyatt Centric Waikiki! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely stay here again when come back to Waikiki

Returned from Oahu about a week ago and still having hawaii withdrawls from my great vacation experience, of which the great service and location of this hotel was a great contributor. Booked an ocean view room with 2 queen beds for a 5 night stay over memorial day weekend (which is not enough time!) Was quite dissappointed when we checked in and did not have the double sink as pictured on the booking sites which they said is indeed a part of this category room but unfortunately they were all booked. They should allow this specification to be selected when booking if not all the rooms have the double sink as pictured because we are 2 girls and need a lot of counter space and expected that to be a part of the room. We also found the closet space to be very limited, but we were determined to enjoy ourselves from the time we arrived and made it work instead of waiting to switch rooms. Room could use more garbage bins, we only had 1 in the bathroom, needed 1 in the mainroom as well since my friend was constantly throwing out food containers that would make the bathroom smell. "Ocean view" was very limited and distant, but did get a nice view of the pool and the lights of the city looked lovely at night. Could also see people on the main street moving around to engage in nightlife. The beds were dense and plush and very comfortable, as well as the robes. Room was always clean. Room service menu is on the tv which is cool and convenient. Upon arrival we devoured almost half of the poolside menu as we were so hungry after our 12+ hours of traveling. Enjoyed the poke, rainbow tartar, ribs, and the chocolate cake smore with ice cream was good too. Room service was disappointing. First it arrives in a brown bag as if its take out, which does not seem to match the standards of this hotel which has otherwise good attention to design details and aesthetics when you see the nice lobby and poolside dining space. They should upgrade the room service experience by delivering it on rolling trays on proper plates like most other hotels. The fish entree we ordered that comes on rice with a side of I think fennel was also underwhelming, which was surpising because it looks so good in the elevator pictures but I would advise you skip it. The shrimp sandwhich I had a couple times was pretty good, never had a pattie made out of shrimps and its a great idea, just wish it came with some kind of sauce or spice on the sandwhich cause its missing just a hint of flavor. Request ketchup with your order and its flavorful and satisfying. For breakfast we often ordered the egg white omlettes which were good, only problem is they came drenched in oil, to a noticably unnecessary and excessive level. The cooking staff should scale back a bit on that and try to cook the omlettes a little dryer. 0% greek yogurt would be a great addition as well. The gym was small and limited but sufficient and has towels, a scale, city views, and brita water station. Appreciated the orange water bottles in our room that we were able to regularly refill at the water stations, just wish there were a few more water stations available on each floor. We were on 11 and I would constantly have to go up to 19 to refill, which became a problem when that machine was broken because thats also were the ice machine is, so I would go up to 19 for ice then go down to 7, the main floor, to fill up on water. Even though the elevators were usually fast, thats a lot of hustle when you are trying to relax and be on hawaiian time. Although it is not beach front, so glad I chose this newer hotel for our girls trip as the existing waikiki beachfront room options looked so old and tired and were much more expensive. Thanks to it being well located a few blocks directly behind the Royal Hawaiian, we really didnt miss anything. In just a few blocks, maybe an 8/10 minute stroll, we were on waikiki beach and it was nice to pass through the shopping area and nice decor such as the alley of surfboards coming from that side of the beach, that we may have missed if we were staying directly on it. Also on your way out of the hotel, you can ask the staff for as many beach towels, beach chairs and umbrellas as youd like to borrow and just return them on your way back. They also offer sunblock. Just a reminder, as stated in other reviews, the pool is more for show than for swimming, it is just about 4 inches deep and there were actually a lot of families with kids there while we visitied so the kids were the only ones really enjoying the pool, adults just came out to lounge poolside and get their tan and drinks on. I saw a couple that was being romantic with each other, but getting annoyed that kids were splashing in the jacuzzi with them and ruinning the relax vibe. They eventually got fed up and left. Maybe there should be a sign that limits the kids to the regular pool area and leaves the jacuzzi area for the adults to have something to themselves, cause I guess some parents dont have enough awareness and consideration to pull their kids away from adults clearly engaging in intimacy and leisure amoungst themselves. Because of this, I would not recommend this place for couples and honeymooners, unless you dont plan on spending much time by the pool. Everywhere else was pretty peaceful and kid free.As far as Oahu, definitely rent a car to get out to Lanikai beach and some of the beaches on the northshore, as well as try some great local eats around the island, particular fresh poke from foodland, teds haupia pie, and portugese doughnuts from Leonard's. But right in waikiki theres the fresh fruit shaved ice stand in front of the royal hawaiian shopping center, and the calimari and fish tacos at Dukes were yum, both right down the street from the hyatt centric hotel. So the hotel location was good, as most things in the area we visited by foot or a short taxi ride (like the bar at The Modern and Al Moana beach), but the stand out is the great friendly staff and service. From the front door, to the front desk, to the bar, to the pool, everyone always seemed very happy kind and happy to help or be of service, which seems to be the disposition of hawaiian people in general, throughout the island just lots of lovely, kind, chill people. Shout out to Kani (hope I got your name right :-) who I often had nice converstion with as he would genuinely ask how my days were going and he and his colleagues would give great recommendations of what restaurants and bar/lounges to check out. Only thing is there seemed to be a female manager that often seemed to be talking to the staff a little harshly, like being too hard on them just an observation of what i saw a few times from a distance, and there was just a noticeable different energy from her versus the rest of the staff, she seemed very tense in the little bit of exchange we had with her but maybe it was just these few instances. Overall they are doing a great job managing the service and just need to make small adjustments to their food prep and room service as well as their clarity in booking rooms as pictured. Pricing along with location and service makes it a great value. Will not hesitate to stay here again whenever visiting Honolulu.
user_name:
FlyGirlNYC3
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is brand new and smells new. The staff is amazing. They were always welcoming and energetic.My room had a king bed and was huge. I loved how modern everything looked. The only thing that was strange about the hotel was the bathroom/shower area. There is a glass door of the shower that oversees the bedroom. I didnt mind because i was travelling solo, but I would imagine for people who share the room it might be weird. Although there were blinds on the glass part of the shower.The location was great - very close to the beach and in safe area with lots of restaurants and shops. I even walked from there do Diamond Head.The hotel has a cool pool that isnt too crowded with a bar.I stayed for 2 nights and both nights was a little loud. I cant tell if the music came from the hotel or if there was a club near by, but it didnt bother me.I would stay there when I return again.,

Very comfortable hotel, attentive and accommodating staff. Not on the beach, but pretty easy drive in and out of Waikiki to get to the rest of Honolulu-although the parking is a little confusing, be sure to drive all the way up to the 6th floor so you can catch the elevator to the lobby. Also an easy walk to International Market Place and all the shops and restaurants in Waikiki.Pool is shallow, good for wading and cooling off, although pretty windy when we were there, was hard to really enjoy and relax there because of the gusts. But the bar and 8th floor lobby were very welcoming and comfortable for relaxation.If you want to sit by the water at the beach or pool, this might not be the place. But if you want a comfortable friendly place to stay with easy access to all the great restaurants in Honolulu at International Market Place and in town, this works great! And, an excellent value.

This hotel was absolutely fantastic we can not fault it. The room we had was stunning the views looking out to Diamond head and the ocean were amazing!! The location is perfect just off the main strip and a short walk to the new international market place. Cocktails are to die for make sure you take advantage of Happy hour!! The staff were very attentive to our every need they even provide sunscreen,towels, beach chairs, beach toys and a beach umbrella for FREE!!!!! It is little things like this that make this hotel a little gem on Waikiki definitely do yourself a favour and check it out!!

Great stay at this hotel. Everything is new and very modern. Position is wonderful, only a block away from the centre of the main strip. Easy walk to the beach & access to all shops/food. Breakfast buffet was a bit annoying as the staff have to get toast, eggs, yoghurt, for you so they come out at different times making food go cold but that's really nitpicking as the staff were lovely and nothing is a problem. We just prefer to help ourselves. We didn't have an issue with the pool being only a wade pool as we sat around on the lounges and it was comfortable, relaxing & quiet. Definitely recommend this hotel!

The hotel was clean fresh funky and new. The staff were amazing super helpful and friendly couldn't do enough for you. Great location and excellent facilities including beach chairs and umbrella which we loved

I was not impressed with this Hyatt hotel. Food is 'too Asian' and not balanced menu. Had twigs and sticks in the poorly tasting broccoli soup. Bathtub fills from ceiling which prevents sitting in tub while filling-tub far too high for safely getting in and out of-tub far too short-making the hotel Asian does not accommodate most Americans.

The rooms are very spacious and good attention to comfortable living design. Two queen beds and a nice bathroom. Coffee machine needs a science degree to get it working, and no expresso machine in the restaurant, but Starbucks is just below the hotel. Pool is a bit small, so no lengths, but the gym is well equipped with stepper, treadmill and weights. Very pleasant staff.
user_name:
RichardBB_13
Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: We loved our stay and we are very sad to leave. The rooms were lovely and clean and new and the staff was so friendly and went out of their way to help us.The location was perfect and was right in the centre of Waikiki.The pool area was lovely. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Our stay at the Hyatt Centric was wonderful because of the attentive and pleasant staff, always eager to help! It's a new, modern and very clean hotel, very centralized in Waikiki, close to beach, wonderful restaurants and easy access to everywhere in Waikiki. We loved it!

I travel to Oahu quite a bit for business. I've stayed in a lot of properties over the years. I was bringing my wife with me for a few days, I'd passed the Centric on my last trip and decided to give it a try. VERY happy I did. This property has great energy, the staff is warm and welcoming, and it has a very cool vibe. Our room was clean, spacious and modern. The bathroom was especially nice, with a soaking tub inside the large shower area, and a fancy Toto toliet/bidet combo, complete with a warming seat. Very nice touch. Pool area and lobby are very hip. Nordstrom Rack is next door and a Jamba Juice and Starbucks in the same bldg. Just a great experience overall. We will be coming back.

I think this hotel is very good, OK, just not great enough for 5 stars. It is very clean and I was happy with that. For example, its one of those hotels with the lobby on another floor (floor 8?). The parking is $32 a night and you need to drive up the multilevel garage to the hotel elevator entrance on the 6th floor. The room doors slam shut. You can hear the music from the hotel pool bar singer inside the room on floor 18. Cable tv and room furniture are both great and modern. Beds are very comfortable. I noticed the bed sheets were VERY noisy.

Overall nice hotel that is new there. The pool or lack there of is not good. The staff did a good job for a new hotel. The location is close to the beach and other locations that I use there. My first stay at this brand of Hyatt.

If they fave star ratings purely based on room quality, this place is as good as some five star hotels. Staffs were exceptionally friendly and location was actually great - if you are renting a car from Avis, it's practically next door. Highly recommended- only down side is that it's a couple blocks away from the beach but that didn't bother us. They also gave us nice beach chairs and umbrella that were easy to carry. We look forward to going back!

The Hyatt is a very nice, centrally located hotel on the main strip of Waikiki. The staff is professional, accommodating and very friendly. Rooms are clean and nicely sized. Although the breakfast buffet is not included, it was tasty, plentiful and offered a great variety of items.

New chic hotel; new clean rooms. The "Ocean View" room that I reserved and paid was more of a Partial Ocean View. It did not match with what was shown online when I reserved the Ocean view room. It was more of a standard room.

Wife and I decided to check out this place as it looked extremely promising. As soon as we arrived to the hotel, Alex greeted us and was very charismatic. We had an conflict with our room, but he promptly resolved the issue for us and provided us with a really nice upgrade. The staff was beyond helpful & at night the hotel has small gatherings with singers. Although breakfast its not included it was great. Wife REALLY liked the hair dryer provided by hotel.Moreover, the hotel provides you with beach towels, chairs & umbrellas to take to the beach at no additional cost. Couldn't had asked for anything else. Thank you for the delightful stay

We were so pleased with the Hyatt Centric. The staff was awesome, the room and the views were spectacular. This is a new hotel, and the property is very nice. Property is close to the International Market, Dukes, very much centrally located. We thought and researched other properties, and we were so very much pleased with the Hyatt Centric. There's not one thing more than could have been done to make our stay perfect. We really enjoyed staying here, and we will definitely recommend to others. Great job by the management and staff of this new property. The fresh pineapple juice, leis, and water bottles was a nice touch upon arrival. Bedding is also very comfortable. Stay here, you won't regret it!

WOW.....just WOW. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Waikiki and this is by far one of the best. Great location in the middle of Waikiki so everything is super close. The large guest rooms as well as the hotel overall were exceptionally clean. Very quiet also. The pool area was comfortable and not overcrowded. What a great little treasure in Waikiki. And only a block and half from the beach....

Our room was modestly sized, with large windows offering a good view of the city and the mountains. It had everything we needed for a relaxing base as we explored the island. Our room was on the top floor next to the elevator, so the noise from the elevator can be irritating at times especially in the early hours of the morning when we wanted to sleep and relax.Location is amazing for shopping (wife loves it), and for travelling around the island as most of the bus lines pass by the area. It's right next to the main shopping streets of Waikiki, and It's maybe around 5 to 10 minutes walk to Waikiki beach.Amenities were as expected from a well known hotel brand, though I felt cheated by the "hidden" resort fees (my first experience with this American "resort fee" culture). In most other hotels I've stayed in Asia, Australia or Europe, they don't have this "hidden" cost, and the use of the facilities was included with the original price, so I never felt cheated. I guess something I need to keep in mind next time I visit the USA and stay in these big name hotels.Fortunately, the staff are very friendly and very helpful, so I don't feel as bad, but still... somebody needs to put a stop to those resort fees, before they pollute other continents.

This is a wonderful hotel, we stayed for a couple of nights during our honeymoon May 2017. We had booked a deluxe city view and ended up with an upgrade to a suite. The staff were so welcoming on reception/ concierge. We received a lei and a complementary drink.The only thing I would change is the pool. The swimming pool is only for paddling/ jacuzzi, not deep enough for a swim.Overall an excellent sty was had by my husband and I. The whole place had a professional, yet laid back feel about it, fantastic stop whilst in Waikiki.

This hotel is conveniently located. It use to be the Waikiki Trade Center. Each room is unique in shape and size. The newly renovated International Market place is just footsteps away. The hotel features a great restaurant for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Staff is very friendly and very accommodating.

We had a lovely time at this hotel! The location is great, our room was spacious and the restaurant in the hotel was superb! The best part about the hotel was the staff. They were incredibly friendly and did everything they could to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. Highly recommend staying here and trying the restaurant!

Honestly the best hotel I've stayed at. So clean and so friendly. They give us robes, water bottles (plastic and reusable) Eco friendly. The one concern is with room cleaning it was not cleaned thoroughly but the overall is 5 stars. Amazing service.

First time staying in Hyatt Centric and this location is perfect- close to waikiki shopping center Yokocho food hall and Royal Hawaiian shopping center. Trendy yet comfy design with nice reclaimed wood look in the bedrooms and a very inviting and relaxed lobby. The pool area was chic and peaceful. The Lanai restaurant was lovely for dinner on Friday with a Hawaii music duo playing by the pool. The staff is very friendly and helpful and appear to really enjoy working here. Highly recommend this hotel to all!

Loved this hotel! I stay at hyatts around the world and this is by far one of my best experiences. The location is great, steps from the beach, near good food, staff is so excellent and warm. We had friends staying at the Sheraton (super close by) and we were glad to return to our quieter charming hotel, where the staff remember you! Rooms were clean and newer than most Waikiki hotels. We were steps away from the famous Marukame udon and cafe masubi and Waikiki shopping. Will definitely only stay here on future trips ! Love the water bottles and water refill stations too ! It is a little loud at night because of the proximity to the street but all Waikiki is like this and it doesn't go too late. They provide earplugs and it wasn't anything that kept us up.

There's some room for improvement. We can start with parking garage the turns are super tight. Don't even try to go in there with a full size pick up or SUV,hence the wall being all scuff and scratch from vehicles hitting it. Parking fees should be free if you're a guest at the hotel $45 a day is a little much. Resort fees of $35 a day are also little high specially if you're the type of guest who wont utilize any of the "resort" amenities.
user_name:
lesliej696
New York City, New York

review_body: My friend and I stayed at this hotel just last week and had the best experience. Our room was super clean and our bed was very comfortable. We loved the spacious bathroom and shower. The area itself was easily accessible to the beach and shopping malls. The Lanai restaurant, although a touch on the pricey side, had superb cocktails and food. All the staff members were so polite and approachable! Eddie at the front desk went above and beyond to help answer our questions and get us settled in:) We felt like really valued guests during our entire stay. Will definitely come back and recommend this hotel to friends and family.

I will certainly be back. The hotel is very clean and welcoming just like the staff. I like everything that the resort fee offers, if you can upgrade to the suite, you won't be disappointed. The property is also 1 block from the beach, the nicer property in Waikiki

Stayed at the Centric for three nights while in town on business. I knew it was a new propriety, but was not sure if I would like it as much as the other two Hyatts on the island. In short - from a business perspective - I loved it. The elevators were fast, the rooms were new, the wifi worked great and they had live music two of the three nights. While there is a Starbucks at the bottom of the building and there are tons of restaurants nearby, I ended up eating breakfast and dinner all three days at the hotel. And during breakfast it was practically empty! (the other two Hyatts can be a zoo during breakfast). The property is a few blocks from the beach, but you can walk to everything. I want them to stay in business so I say go, but let's keep it our little secret.

This is a new Hyatt property that I have been 'eyeing' and waiting for a deal. I found one and stayed here 3 nights this week. They offered to show me choices of a room, very nice 'European' touch (I am from the mainland!). They do have a resort fee BUT they offer filtered water and bottles for it as well as other amenities.There is paid valet parking only so prepare for this.I have not eaten food at the hotel restaurant but breakfast looked phenomenal!they also have a nice fitness center. This hotel is located right in the central area so you really can't go wrong!! Staff is very accommodating!

We were very excited about our stay in the Hyatt Centric after reading all the great reviews on Tripadvisor and we have not been disappointed. Everything we would expect from a new hotel, clean, modern, friendly staff and excellent location, right on one of the main Bus routes and restaurants and shops all around. When we arrived we mentioned that this was our anniversary and that we were staying for two weeks, and we we're immediately upgraded to a suite, which was great and it really made our stay.To be honest I can't say we used any of the other facilities that this hotel has to offer, so can't comment on those. Our only negative would be the resort fee (although I think a lot of hotels charge this fee) - $25 a night, over two week holiday worked out to $350 for 2 plastic water bottles, free wi-fi, oh, and we borrowed a beach towel on a couple of occasions. Seems a shame to have to moan about a resort fee, after having such a lovely time but it does leave you feeling a bit ripped off. And not fair if only to make the room rate appear better than it is on a booking website.

My husband and I had a mini staycation at the Hyatt. The room were clean, I do have to stay the room would get hot at times but other then that I would differently stay here again. I do wish they had better pillow too.

Hyatt Centic Waikiki is an excellent choice for business or pleasure. Just a block off the main drag and close to the beach and shopping. The rooms are quiet and clean. The staff is friendly and attentive. Would definitely stay here again

My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel over MLK weekend 2017. The property was brand new, and had yet to have it's grand opening. We were pleasantly surprised at the renovation as this was the former Waikiki World Trade Center. The room was amazing, and though we weren't directly on the beach, the views were spectacular.

This hotel was were the Waikiki Trade Center use to be, same structure but, gutted the interior to make way for this cheek hotel. I gave the 4-star rating because I couldn't find anything that dramatic to complain about. In our group, were my husband, myself and my 7 year old son so the room was adequate for our stay. We stayed in the double queen bed room with a huge bathroom, separate Rainfall showers, Deep soaking tub (my sons favorite) and toilet areas. Floor to ceiling windows in the room. Mini refrigerators, Keurig coffee maker (with coffee and tea), in-room safe, Hooded bathrobes, free Wi-Fi, Air-conditioning is not as cold as we would've of liked it. There's only (1) tiny trash bin in the bathroom but, we had extra grocery bags to make our own trash collection. On the 2nd night the TV didn't go on, called front desk and the repair man came in 10 min. Awesome Customer Service. Food was okay, too pricey for the quantity of food given. I had the "Kanak Attack Breakfast" and believe me when you say Kanak Attack, I'm believing it would be a "huge portion" for $17 but the serving size was small and the price should have been in the $11 range. I absolutely loved the key card system. Valet people are so accommodating, my husband forgot a few items in the car, they offered to get it for us and bring up to our room, not once but twice during our stay. That's what you call the "Aloha" spirit. I must say check-in was great, she was the supervisor, I feel bad I don't remember her name. She explained everything from the free reusable water bottles in the rooms, filtration water fill up on the different floors to the pool and lanai areas. The lobby is inviting and comfortable. The staff is super courteous. Just be informed that the pool is a wading pool, the deepest I believe is 3 feet. It was perfect for our grand babies and our (7) year old son. It was walking distance from most of the surrounding popular restaurants and beach. Especially the newly renovated International Market Place. It's a place we'll visit again. We may make this an annual event for Mother's Day.

This is a great place to stay!! The rooms are very clean and designed well. The staff there is so friendly....especially at the door. They were an exceptional group! Made us feel so welcome every time we returned to the property. We look forward to visiting again!

I stayed at the Hyatt Centric just recently and could not fault anything! The staff were personable and very helpful at all times. The room I stayed in was an ocean view and the views were great, the room was extremely clean and serviced daily, it was super modern and spacious also! The amenities were fantastic including the pool area with the little cabanas and the restaurant was good value, great service and superb food! The location was about a 2 minute walk from the Main Street, it was next door to Ross Dress for Less which was convenient, and only minutes away from cafes, restaurants and luxury shopping! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family, and if I were to visit Waikiki again, I would stay here again!

This was our first trip to Hawaii. We loved this hotel. Everyone from the manger to the people working at the front door were helpful with everything. We had questions about private beaches to dinner reservations and they didn't not fail. Everything they recommend was perfect. The room was still like new. Beautiful view of the city and diamond head. If your ever in Oahu, you have to stay here. Also this hotel is very detailed and beautiful at night. Thanks Hyatt centric for making our 20th anniversary one to remember

The hotel looks brand new down to the flooring and furniture including the reception, restaurant, pool area and rooms. We couldnt fault our room it was spacious with lovely furniture, a nice big power shower and plenty of wardrobe space. We had a great stay. We used the restaurant for breakfast every morning they were very accommodating and the menu was great. My wife requested something that wasnt exactly onthe menu and they had no difficulty getting it for her. We tried the evening meal at the restaurant and that was very tasty too. The pool has a cool down area to sit in and the rest of it is a paddling pool. Does the trick cooling you down when sunbathing paddling through it but shame not a swimming pool if like me you enjoy swimming. The hotel does make it clear on their website and info. The staff there were amazing and haad great local knowledge. We also got advice and booked a trip with the expedia local guy in the lobby of the hotel. He was very helpful. The concierge were great too. If I was in Oahu again I would use this hotel and use it as a base to see the whole island. Very competitive price for the stay although we found Waikiki to be expensive with the GBP being weak to USD compared to last time I was in the states.

We visited Hawaii for the first time and stayed at the Hyatt Centric. From the second we arrived we were greeted with amazing and friendly staff. We went to the lobby and we're helped by Kaniala. He was so friendly and helpful and gave us some amazing suggestions for restaurants and things to do. Every time we saw him he would greet us and ask how we were enjoying our stay. His thoughtfulness genuine friendliness was so appreciated - especially as first time visitors. The hotel itself was great. Very clean and modern. The rooms were very large and beautifully decorated. We had a slight issue with our TV but as soon as we called the front desk they had someone sent up to the room within minutes. The pool was more of a wading pool but that's no issue when you have the beach so close. There were always spots available to sit and soak up the sun. Staff would come around and ask if you needed drinks/food and were always gracious and didn't push you to buy anything. We booked a few excursions through our hotel and the staff member (can't remember his name!) was helpful and didn't try to up-sell us on unnecessary add-ons. We told him what we wanted and he helped us plan our days at the best prices. Definitely a great place to stay! It's only a short walk to Waikiki Beach and steps away from the main shopping streets. There's a Starbucks connected to the hotel for those who need their caffeine fix. I would recommend this to anyone traveling in this area.

As Hawaii residents, we were on a staycation to celebrate the husband's birthday. The hotel location is convenient to all the major spots in Waikiki but off the major street so that it was nice and quiet. A new hotel, very smartly done. We were most impressed with everyone who worked there. Friendly, responsive and out to ensure we were satisfied. As a Hawaii local, venturing into Waikiki isn't top on our list, but we'd gladly return for another weekend at the Hyatt Centric. That says a lot about the hotel!

Hotel is located deep downtown and easy access shopping, dining. but hotel room space is not enough. swimming pool is very shallow (60 cm), can't swimming and also gym is small. Staff are very kindles and clean room.

Stayed a night here with a small group that came into town. My company likes me to be close by to the clients. Since they got me a room at one of the newer hotels in Waikiki, I obliged. It's a converted office building to hotel. Some may say that it has no real lobby (it's not on the ground floor but on the 7th floor) but I think it's totally fine as it keep the riff raff from Waikiki out of the hotel. The "lite" lobby is all the rage at most new hotels so it's fine. I had a king size room with a view of another tall building (19th floor)Since I'm sure we were getting a great rate it was fine by me since I was only going to be sleeping overnight. Acoustics were pretty good as I didn't really hear the garbage trucks that roll into Waikiki at 4am. A/C was nice and cold.My room was pretty nice, big comfy bed with nice linen and nice new modern look (not the tropical look that many hotels try to do. Super nice pillows. Bathroom was big (shower had nice pressure) and the bathroom amenities quite nice.) Nice floor to ceiling windows but I recommend if you want to take advantage, get a room with ocean view or mountain view. The breakfast buffet was pretty good, I especially like the healthy options of the local pineapples and papaya! Since the lobby is actually on the 7th floor, it's pretty quiet for being in the middle of Waikiki. Sat at the "pool" but be advised that it's more of a "soaking" pool when the day get hot or the trade winds stop blowing and you need to get your body wet. It's definitely not a "swimming" pool but good enough to go in and cool down.What I liked the most about the hotel (apart of it being brand spanking new) is that from 5pm-6pm they have local cultural workshops (lauhala weaving, petroglyphs reading, Hawaiian tattoo designs, conch blowing. etc) It definitely beats the other kitchy stuff that other hotels do. All the staff I ran into seemed pretty nice and friendly. Overall, I like the Hyatt Centric hotel, new modern and not over the top. A good, solid, modern hotel with nice amenities, close to everything since it's in the heart of Waikiki but quiet enough to not have to feel like you are in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. I would definitely stay here again.

Overall, an excellent hotel. Good rooms and good service. The small pool area is nice and welcoming. The Bar/restaurant by the pool is seldom busy. I think people are put off by the unappealing entrance to the hotel. Basically, you enter the front door into what feels like an office building with few signs that you have entered a hotel. You need to take the elevator up to the lobby, pool, bar level. It is quiet most of the time which is nice but not much energy.

The Hyatt Centric is in what was once the Waikiki Business Center - the developers did a good job of converting an old office building into a new hotel. I've stayed there a couple of times now, and while it's still a work in progress, the hotel is a good addition to what currently available in Waikiki. The rooms are well appointed. On my first stay I used a suite upgrade certificate and was given a very nice high floor suite with views in two directions; towards Diamond Head from the bedroom and the Royal Hawaiian and the Pacific from the living area. The shower was huge and had a glass wall that looked into the living area. (I'm not sure why designers think this is a good thing!?) On my second stay I had a regular room and was assigned one on the Seaside Avenue side of the building looking directly into the apartments across the street. This led to having the drapes closed most of the time which isn't really desirable when you're in Hawaii. I found it odd that in both rooms there was no desk. I realize that for the most part guests are on vacation, but some of us are there for work, and having a desk is essential.On both stays the restaurant was empty at breakfast time, and on both occasions the server told me the buffet was not available because the occupancy rate wasn't high enough to warrant it. The breakfasts were well prepared and the service good. I think the restaurant is still finding its feet a bit, and being on the 7th floor, no one on the street would really know it's up there.The hotel is still getting settled, but it's in a good location - a short walk to the new International Market Place, and just a block off the main drag of Kalakaua Avenue. The beach is about a 20 minute walk away.

This hotel opened its doors December 2016 so everything is fresh and clean. Hope they can maintain it as long as possible. Comfort - 4With the Centric being so new the comfort level is top notch. Beds, baths and amenities are on point. Rooms are just a tad small. Location - 4The hotel is located smacking the middle of Waikiki. Shopping and eating is all walking distance from this place. Only downfall is that it's in the wrong side of the street to the beaches. Can be a hike Misc. - 5Staff is professional and helpful. The pool is located perfectly so that you can get some late afternoon sun. Lastly, offering free water bottles where you can refill is great! Not only is it eco-friendly it is economical. I will return to this location for future visits.

Hotel is well maintained and the staff members are friendly. Located close to many stores for shopping and restaurants. Beach is no more than a 5 minute walk from the hotel if you know where to cut through.

Fabulous new and fresh hotel. Loved the quiet pool with no kids! Also a great area to sit and relax in lounge style as if home. Staff super friendly and would highly recommend this hotel for people wanting to be in Waikiki without all the tourist crap.

We stayed here for the first 4 nights of our visit to Honolulu before moving to another hotel - after moving hotels we kept wishing we could move back to Hyatt Centric! It's a great new hotel in a perfect location with a starbucks on the ground floor - one block from International Marketplace and 2 blocks from the beach, in a fun and lively neighborhood. Staff were very nice and helpful and the facilities - lobby, swimming pool, room were all top notch. New, stylishly outfitted, clean, and modern. Nothing but great things to say - highly recommended for anyone visiting Waikiki!

My husband and I just spent two nights at this hotel and it was very nice. We had a king sized room on the 20th floor that had a view of the ocean. The room was spacious, the bed was very comfortable and the Wi-Fi was fast and reliable. The bathroom was decent – it had motion sensor lights that actually shut off in the middle of my shower, so they definitely need some adjustments to either the timing or the sensitivity to motion. The shower was huge, but it missed the mark on a couple of different spots. For as big as the shower was, it should have had either multiple shower heads or an overhead rain shower, since this building was converted from offices, they had plenty of opportunity to do that. The water knob was also located behind the shower door, meaning you had to step in to the shower to turn on the water making it a bad design. Definitely not deal breakers, but like I said, they missed a good opportunity to really stand out.We had breakfast both mornings in the hotel restaurant and thought the food was fabulous – great flavor combinations. We had happy hour one night at the bar and that food was good there too. We poked our heads in to the fitness center, which is entirely way too small (not enough equipment) for that size of hotel. And the “pool” was for show only – it’s literally only nine inches deep. Overall it’s a nice hotel and we’d gladly stay there again upon return to the area.

Stayed here for 2 days for my birthday for the first time. I love how close the hotel was to everything, great location. Got to go relax in the pool. Royal Hawaiian shopping center and international market place for so close and great for shopping. I loved our room it was so nice. Definitely coming back again. Alex was very friendly and helped us with all our needs. Thanks again Alex.

New, clean building and rooms. Very nice staff. Location was excellent - walkable to everything, although not directly on the beach. Reasonable price for what I paid for. Pool area was pretty but the pool is not for swimming. I would skip the breakfast - it was okay and the service was good, but pretty expensive.

We stayed here for 4 days on the last leg of our vacation... I was completely blown away by the hospitality of the staff. From the doormen to the front desk. We even were serenaded an "aloha farewell" song from one of the housekeepers as we were leaving our room. This is a crew that genuinely enjoys where they work! If management is reading this, tell Ricky and Akea that they are awesome and are the number 1 reasons we will book this place next year!

very kind staff who went out of their way to be helpful under trying circumstances for me. (husband hospitalized while traveling) A truly uplifting atmosphere; beautifully appointed, and serene rooms.

Stayed here for a night with my fiancé. We were going to stay the weekend but checked out early because we wanted to be right on the beach. Other than that however we really liked the place. New. Modern. Great neighborhood. Lots of stores, restaurants and an easy walk to the water. The pool area was a bit of a disappointment however. My fiancé is a photo opp fiend and although the pool is on the 8th floor, there were no phot opps to be had. You basically looked right into the perimeter fence and the other tall buildings around you. The lobby and bar area right beside it are nice however. And as I said the staff could not be nicer. Even my fiancé commented, everyone sure is happy around here.

Our experience was exceptional from the start. Great price, great location and such friendly, professional staff. Our suite had modern yet traditional furnishings and was spotlessly clean. The bar was classy, the pool are small but clean and quiet, the restaurant served delicious food and the hotel as a whole was bright, elegant and radiated warmth. Nothing seemed too much for the staff and receptionist Erica was particularly helpful on several occasions when I needed to store my bag and organise certain logistics. I highly recommend this hotel - thank you for such a great experience.

This is my 3rd time to Waikiki and this is hands down the best accommodation I have encountered. We stayed in the ocean view suite on the 12th floor and it was just perfect. The hotel is centrally located and brand-new (20 years newer than most of the hotels in this price bracket)The only thing to know is that the pool is a wading/plunge pool which I can see has annoyed previous reviewers but honestly was not an issue for us - you're a stones throw from the beach and the hotel provides chairs, mats etc!Definitely would return :D

We are still glowing from our trip to Oahu in particular from our stay at the Hyatt centric in Waikiki. From the moment we pulled the car up to the valet , escorted to the front desk and shown to our beautiful room we knew it was going to be a great stay there. Our room was super modern ,clean with a minimal design sense . Simple and elegant . The bathroom was state of the art with a beautiful soaking tub inside of the glass shower and a high tech toilet!The view took care of everything else . We felt connected yet felt we got the privacy we craved. We had s wonderful lunch by the pool and a very special shout out to the staff particularly our bartender, Nydia who makes some fierce cocktails and made us feel so comfortable and welcomed. Thank you Hyatt centric we will see you again soon!!!

this is a fantastic new hotel, located a block from Waikiki beach. fantastic décor, fun beach vibe. loved the bucket bathtub with rainfall shower. This hotel has a boutique feel to it. fantastic customer service. all employees were friendly and eager to please.

I chose this hotel mainly because it's new since I don't like dated and crowded hotels. We stayed here for three nights and found out on our last day that the pool is fake. The depth of pool is 9-14 INCHES with a little area that's more than 3 feet?!?!?Pros:Friendly staffReasonable room pricesGreat location next to plenty of shopping and restaurantsCons:Resort fee but it's not even a resortNot functional pool

Excellent location to shopping (T Galleries) and food (Japanese Yokocho). Staff are nice and friendly. Hotel room is clean and tidy. The only downside is it is right next to a few night clubs where it could get quite noisy at night. I was on the highest floor and could still get disturbed by the noise.

Excellent hotel and staff definitely will recommend and stay again. It is a keeper . All the staff seemed to love there job and make the guest (me) as comfortable as possible and they did succeed, thank you all I will definitely be back, Aloha

I've never checked in to a hotel that had no desk or even a chair in the room. At the Hyatt Centric the only place to sit in a "standard" room was the bed. And I plaid $200 for that? Cute hotel but somebody dropped the ball in room furnishing.

I booked this hotel because it was within my budget and I had a gift card to the Hyatt. So I was apprehensive about what I was actually going to get. This is a fantastic hotel. We arrived to a new clean beautiful centrally located hotel. We chose to valet park as the ballet told us it was only an extra five dollars more a day which was worth it to me. It's a little strange that the lobby is actually on the eighth floor but they are very clear about that when I put you in the elevator. Got to the check-in counter where I was greeted wonderfully by the hotel staffer named Erica. She could not have been more helpful or more wonderful. Upon learning it was my 50th birthday she gave us a room upgrade. She also offered us fresh squeeze pineapple juice which my husband never had and it blew his mind. We got to our room which was very spacious, very light, airy and had everything that we needed. We had a beautiful view of the mountains and the city. The hotel was centrally located to all the different events and tourism stops that you would like to make. Also although it's not right on the beach it is about two blocks down and three blocks over so very short walk to the beach. They do provide you with Tommy Bahama beach chairs that you can take that fit over your shoulders like but backpack style and beach towels which was very convenient. I can't say enough about the hotel and the hotel staff. Everyone was very attentive -everyone was very helpful -everyone was very nice. We got our car quickly whenever we need it. Got directions and recommendations on places to eat that were wonderful and things to do that were very entertaining. I cannot say enough about this hotel. I can't wait to get back.

We only stayed at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki for one night on our return to Oahu from the Big Island before flying home to LA. Overall, we had a great experience there: friendly staff, modern/stylish/comfortable rooms, centrally located. If you're looking for a pool to take a dip in, might want to go somewhere else as the main part of the pool here is only about a foot deep.

I've never written a review but this hotel is review worthy. I've stayed at several high end hotels in Waikiki, but Hyatt Centric Waikiki's customer service and spacious rooms are outstanding, at much lower prices. It is located in the heart of Waikiki which makes it very convenient especially if you don't have a car. Thank you so much for the wonderful stay -- I will definitely be back again!

The overall experience exceeded my expectations - upon entry, we were greeted by the friendly check in staff who made us feel very comfortable and welcomed. They gave us pineapple juice and a shelled necklace while checking in! The lobby area gives off a very relaxed environment so we felt like we walked into vacation almost immediately. The check in staff had great food recommendations and although we only stayed for 2 nights, they remembered us when we walked by each time! The hotel room was super spacious and had a modern luxurious feel to it because the hotel itself is fairly new. It's about a 5 min walk to the beach, the only downside is if you wanted to lie on a chair on the beach you would have to carry the chair to the beach. Nonetheless the hotel was very central to everything and we enjoyed our short vacation.

Beautiful hotel with very friendly staff. As soon as we got to the door we felt welcomed. Rooms were new and clean Loved the atmosphere. The pool area was clean and well maintained. There was great entertainment in terms evenines.

Great experience overall. The service was friendly and professional from start to finish, I would definitely return again. Our room was a good size, though technically a suite the room was separated by curtains. The only negatives were the high parking fees, and the poor views from the lower floors but that was a sacrifice we were willing to make for more space. If you want to be on Waikiki beach then this location is not for you, although it is just a 10 min walk if cutting through the hotels.

The hotel was great, staff was awesome. You were given towels for the beach and we were even offered chairs and umbrellas. Food was delicious! Rooms were nice and big. No musky smell. Will stay there again No complaints

Amazing hotel. Lovely and contemporary with great staff. Vey comfortable bed. Superb bar with quality entertainment and reasonably priced drinks and food. Highly recommend. Loaned chairs and umbrella from the hotel to go on the beach

This Hyatt was conveniently located in the middle of all the action on the strip. The room was large and well appointed. The staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs. The only short-coming was the pool, which was a wadding pool, and there was a lot of wind with no windbreaker. We had a promotional room rate, which made the experience very enjoyable. We would definitly re-book, if and, when we come back to Oahu.

Modern, young, urbane and sophisticated. Inmaculate, well thought out decor. The common areas on the 8th floor lobby were spectacular, with a great indoor/ outdoor flow. Don't miss their Happy Hour- it is a soothing experience, an oasis from the nearby shop till you drop stores. Next time I would get a room away from Keiho street which has some bar/ discoteques with music that still can travel upwards: though muted I could still faintly hear it at 3:00 a. m. Other than that a five star stay.

My girlfriend and I had a staycation at the Hyatt Centric and had such a great overall experience. Although we are kama'aina and live in Honolulu, we booked the Hyatt Centric because we were running the Hapalua Half Marathon and the starting line was just a short walk away. We were super impressed by the service and overall care everyone gave us, as well as the amazing room (watching the sunset from the huge windows both nights was a highlight!). For service, I wanted to give a big mahalo to Jackie at the front desk...she had so much aloha and was terrific! The bartender (who really went above and beyond not only serving our drinks but explaining the ingredients and delivering them to us in the pool) and the morning bell/door person (recognized us on the second day of our visit and said congrats for running the race) were great as well. Unfortunately I didn’t remember their names.Mahalo to everyone!

We found this hotel on TripAdvisor and the reviews are accurate - The hotel is newly remodeled, has a great location and our room was over 500 sq.ft We were on the 19th floor with an ocean view. All of this for less than $300/night.

A very clean new hotel, enormous rooms, very comfortable. Fantastic staff who were always very helpful.The location was great too, close enough to the beach but not so close that it was among the crazy busy of Waikiki beach.

The people in this hotel made our experience so memorable. They were so friendly and genuinely nice. The location was perfect ROSS was downstairs. Rooms are huge and brand new! Free entertainment at night with the most amazing talented artists. Thankyou for such a great stay!

Parents and I stayed here this January for one night (waiting for morning flight after a 22 days vacation including all 4 major islands!) Upon checking in, I received a room upgrade as Diamond (now Globalist) member and three cups of pineapple juice! What a lovely treat :)I love the room, and I know some may complain that there is no desk/table in the room. But, man, Do you really have to work on the desk while staying at Hawaii?Great stay. Check out the lobby area and try the breakfast!

the hotel was very clean and staff was helpful and friendly. Hotel close to main strip and only a few minutes to walk to beach. The only downfall I felt was the parking at hotel is $32 a night I feel a little pricey for a guest of the hotel. Also the pool is not a pool to swim just to sit in on both ends pic in add deceiving lol but was still very nice

We debated whether or not to stay at a hotel closer to the beach, but this turned out to be perfect. The beachfront hotels were insanely crowded. The Hyatt centric gave us beach towels each day and we took a beautiful stroll to the ocean, and could settle in a more secluded spot. The hotel upgraded us to an oceanfront room. That first night the bathroom cabinet fell off (don't try to open the middle cabinet, it's just for show!) and nearly fell on my foot, so they moved us to a "suite," which was the same room without an ocean view plus an extra little room with a couch and tv. View of volcano or mountains was beautiful. They give plastic water bottles. But they're recycling code 7, which means BPA leaching into your water that causes cancer, and other harms. Don't bring those bottles into the hot sun!I'm super happy I stayed at the Hyatt centric. Good deal. Super clean and new. Friendly staff! Great location with organic breakfast spot across the way (heavenly) and Starbucks on floor one of hotel. Room was always cleaned well. There is a keurig and empty mini fridge. Great location near tons of shops & stores in case you forgot anything. There's great restaurants in the intl mkt place. Solid four star. Thanks for the awesome stay!

Friendly, professional staff was very accommodating of our every special request. Definitely planning to stay here again. One of the Starbucks Reserves is located in the lobby. I'm told there are only 15 of these concept Starbucks stores in the world so far. Large shower stalls. Most other hotels that distribute their video through the network have terrible latency, but this hotel's video display and channel flipping was very quick. While some hotels give 2 free bottles of water, the Hyatt Centric Waikiki places two empty refillable water bottles in the room. You can see the plastic orange bottles in one of the photos. Instead of a vending machine near the floor's ice machine, there is a Brita filtered water station. All the complimentary water you want. Their green concept in complimentary water deserves points in itself.

The staff is great. The property is close enough to the beach and shopping, only a block away but far enough to be quite. The rooms are ultra modern, and very comfortable. This is a very upscale property. The staff is out standing!
