Perfect location in Waikiki but most I'm importantly the service is outstanding! The rooms are new and spacious and it is a home away from home. We arrived about 6am in the morning from Sydney Australia (i had discuss with them prior to our trip about leaving our bags at the home whilst we waited for our room to be ready) and checked in and we informed our room was ready! The staff were friendly (Thank you Ray for going out of your way to find us a place to purchase US sim cards!) and we will be staying there again!

This hotel is very clean and modern in a great location. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly throughout our whole stay. The only downside was the "pool". We booked this hotel after seeing the photos of the beautiful pool area only to arrive and find out it is not in fact a pool. It is a wading pool. Considering we were charged $25 resort fee per night I found this to be dissapointing. The rooms do not have a lanai which we knew before we booked. The room itself was clean and modern but a little on the small side. We were upgraded to a room on a high floor and had a nice view looking out towards the beach. Also, I was in the room one morning when there was a slight tap on the door before it opened and one of the hotel staff explained they had thought we checked out and quickly apologised. There is a nightclub across the road that goes until all hours of the night and the music is extremely loud. We did not hear it from our room because we were on such a high floor facing the opposite direction but I think this may be an issue from some rooms.Also, the parking is $32 per night to self park and $37 per night for valet. We only had a car for 1 night and had planned to leave the hotel early the following morning to hike Diamond Head. We seen a sign at the parking garage that if you entered after 5pm and exited before 6am it was only $15 so we did that. Overall, the staff made our stay enjoyable but I would probably spend a bit more money next time to stay somewhere with a proper pool.

AMAZING! Stayed here for 4 nights, (writing this the day I am back home). The hospitality was amazing they treated us like family and every time I walked into the lobby they always spoke to us, not once were we ever ignored. Everyone remembered us geez and let me get to the door people, every time we walked in and out they opened the doors for us to walk out EVERY SINGLE TIME WITHOUT ASKING, it's the small things that count to us. Everyone in the staff is amazing smiled and always spoke to us. We will definitely not hesistate on coming back and staying here. We enjoyed the lounge pool with the jets, and my mother loved the small gym as she's into fitness. They had great breakfast at the restaurant it delicious! Their pastries are like none I've ever had before! All in all I give them 5/5 stars ✨! They were truly their to help us and even offered help with anything which amazed me the staff was always telling us if you ever need help ask us we are locals, they recommended us best places to eat (other hotels don't they want you to eat at theirs or partners) but these guys truly want you to experience Hawaii! Location is key right in between the beach and stores! All you need within minutes of walking. My father had a bad knee while here due to recovery of recent accident but managed to walk every without any hassle which was good as we weren't far from anything. Gotta admit there is some noise from outside there's a club and lots of stores but I can't complain it's the city! There's always noise in the city I was able to sleep so I was set. But in all honesty I'm pretty sure it's much more quiet than being right on the beach or right next to all those shopping plazas with restaurants pretty sure that's much more louder. Thank you Hyatt centric from the bottom of our hearts, you made our first family trip to Hawaii memorable ❤. - Rangel Family

My fiancé and I were in Hawaii for our wedding and stayed at Hyatt Centric for about a week and a half. We loved it so much that we recommended the hotel to our friends and family as well. Amazing service, thank you to Jonell, Jackie and everyone for taking such great care of us. Beautiful grounds, very modern furniture and the rooms were spacious and bright. The food was also delicious! Highly recommended!

Had a top floor room, ocean view with tub, and my stay was heavenly! The room was so spacious. I was worried about not being able to open the windows but the windows were so big and the view just so stunning that I actually appreciated the quiet and not being exposed to the city sounds and didn't miss that amenity at all! And to soak in the beautiful tub at the end of the day was icing on the cake! I came with my partner and we had to get some work done, so we enjoyed the lounge/pool area in a shady covered lounger and had a productive morning. The location is very central with wonderful restaurants and entertainment nearby, so I left our bags with the bell, found some free street parking, and stayed and strolled in Waikiki for the 2 nights I was at the hotel. Mahalo to the gracious staff, especially Jackie who helped arrange our stay, the welcoming valet and bell folks, housekeeping, and the smiling accommodating check in folks for making our stay so enjoyable!

Although the hotel is NOT on the beach as advertised, the staff is exceptional, the food is great, and they make you feel welcome. The chef made us onion rings even though they weren't even on the menu.

I travel 5 - 6 times a year to Hawaii/Oahu for business. I've stayed at many of the hotels and really appreciated the service, the "new" hotel and the friendliness of the staff. I would stay here again.

This is a brand new property in Waikiki. The lobby is modern and the staff is impeccable. The rooms are unique, modern, and at the same time comfortable. The artwork in the units have such a wow factor.I would like to comment on the outstanding service that was extended to us by the bellman/valet Rick Deponte. He personally greeted all of us at street level and took us up in the elevator, escorted us to the lobby and left us in the hands of our site coordinator.

This is a new hotel in Waikiki. Although it is not a beachfront property, it completely makes up for it in terms of its staff and rooms. The entire hotel is clean, modern and the rooms are more spacious than you would find at other hotels. After a long flight, it was nice to be greeted by the friendly staff at the hotel entrance and in the lobby on the 8th floor. In fact, everyone was friendly and inviting. We were offered fresh pineapple juice and given water bottles which we could re-fill from the brita-filtered fountains. The room was very spacious and had nice views of the city. Beds were very comfortable and there is an in-room fridge that you can fill on your own. If you are headed to the beach, they will provide you with beach towels, chairs and an umbrella. The location is fabulous on an inner street, away from the crowds but not so far away that you couldn't get to shopping or food in a few minutes. It is a short walk to Waikiki Beach but we preferred to drive around the island and spend time at other, much nicer beaches. We tried the restaurant a few times and were never disappointed.

When I found out that this hotel was less than 6 months old I jumped at the chance of staying here. The staff was uber friendly and helpful. There's a daily presentation on the culture of Hawaii which I thought was a nice touch. Ocean view rooms are the way to go here and the location is also great with shops and restaurants galore. Waikiki beach is less than a 10 min walk away as well. Don't forget to ask for fresh guava juice upon check in!

Impeccable Staff. This brand-new, modern and comfortable hotel is unparalleled. I am a Mixologist and the drinks here are exquisite. The food is phenomenal. I ate at least one meal here daily. The lanai dining area is perfectly decorated and conveniently located next to their pool where your waiter is more than happy to accommodate your party.I came here after eloping and was welcomed into paradise by smiling faces that wanted to endure my stay here was unforgettable. The pool is never overly crowded and the perfect space to take all your pictures. The staff is by far the greatest asset. Young, beautiful faces with warm smiles, king eyes and helping hands. And Mr. Young is a phenomenal manager for keeping everything running so smoothly and keeping this amazing bunch of PROfessionals happy and wanting to serve guest. I will recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone I know visiting Oahu. Mahalo!!

While tourists flock to the big beachside properties by the thousands, this Hyatt property gets little attention & thank goodness. Lobby area is amazing - open floor plan with indoor outdoor space that is very relaxing. The only drawback is you cannot see the beach - that said, I don't want to see the crowds & don't have to here

We liked the welcoming environment created by the Centric concept. Not much of a normal hotel feel as you arrive at the lobby level, stepping out of the elevator. A couple reception counters with a lounge area and outside expanse in the background gave impression of a small boutique place. Inviting check in process followed by a juice drink got us moving up to our room. Nice environment particularly the large windows and large glass lined shower. We missed having a second chair so one person didn't have to sit on side of the bed. Pool and outside lounge areas were very nice plus all staff provided great service and help.

I love Hyatt Hotels. Whenever I go on vacation, I always stay at Hyatts. I've been a hyatt rewards member for years. I normally only stay at category 4+ Hyatts. I decided to try this new hyatt out since it's a new hotel and the theme is pretty cool. Let's just say that this hyatt has a lot of things it needs to figure out before it can charge the price it charges and come out with happy customers. There were so many little things they missed. If you don't normally stay at nice hotels, you will probably love this place and not notice. But if you frequently stay at Grand Hyatts or Hyatt Regencies in big cities (especially in asia) you will be very disappointed. I hurts me to leave a bad review for hyatt because I really do like this chain a lot, but I thought this could be used as constructive criticism and a headsup for new travelers who are not as familiar with hotel chains. The rooms start at floor 7. Floors 1-6 is parking and floor 8 is the lobby, restaurant, and fake pool. Things that bothered us: - $32 for self parking. in a terrible terrible garage. This garage is like an obstacle course. It's very poorly designed and many people have hit the sides trying to drive up the ramps. If there's a better alternative around (there probably is for cheaper) STAY THERE. You also have to use your roomkey to badge into the parking garage floor. This makes no sense since the garage also serves as parking for nordstrom rack so it's not exactly a private garage! - resort fee?! for what? the pool is not a real pool, it's about 1-3inches deep. Even kids were complaining it's too small. There's no spa. There's 1 restaurant. The fitness room is a joke. What resort are we talking about here? I've seen non-resort hyatts with better facilities. How do they justify that resort fee? - The cleaner clearly did not vacuum on some days. I know we're not the cleanest, but we're not the messiest either. When we're paying $200-300 a night for a hotel room, we expect the floors vacuumed. - the check-in process was painful. This isn't really the hotels' fault as we did arrive at 2:30pm but normally hyatts have always accommodated my early check-in. even when i get there around 11am. I was surprised to find this one wasn't. Oh they also don't have a regency lounge so you're stuck hanging out by the fake pool or something. -__- I don't think hotel is fully booked for the weekend we were in honolulu so this is surprising. - The check-out process was painful. I didn't receive a 'checkout online' email like I normally do for hyatts. I tried waiting in line to check out but I couldn't wait because of my flight. One of the staff asked for my room number and told me he'd check me out. HE didn't. He forgot =( I called back later in the day to find that I wasn't checked out yet! How do you forget?! I was the only person in line and the original staff person was finishing up with his last customer. I don't understand how you can make this mistake when you're trying to be a high-end "resort" hotel. - I ordered an acai bowl from the restaurant. When my bf went to pick it up after 10 minutes, they made him wait another 10 minutes. at which points the bowl was completely melted. it was acai juice. I called down to tell them what happened. At first they were very apologetic and told me they'll remake it. - they called back after 5 minutes to tell me "that's how an acai bowl is suppose to be" It's pretty liquid. No. it's very clear that the bottom portion was still somewhat smoothy-like but the rest was 100% juice. They were nice enough to take the bowl of juice off of my bill, but this is pretty unacceptable. I tossed the juice out. All in all, as you can see the hotel was fine. it's the attention to detail that bothered us at the price point they are going at. If they were cheaper, say ~$150/night all inclusive I think a lot of these things would be more acceptable. i think they are a newer hotel so they have a lot of kinks they need to work through before it's worth staying at. I'd recommend staying at the Grand Hyatt a couple blocks away over the hyatt centric if you're still thinking hyatt. They have a spa and a real pool. The room itself was pretty spacious and the view was really nice so no complaints there. and outlets everywhere!!! always a plus :) Side note: A hotel like hyatt centric or andaz could really consider a partnership with amazon echo or google home :P
user_name:
Mengying Z
San Francisco, United States

review_body: My hubby and I arrived Valentine's Day. We were greeted by Erica and given pineapple drinks. We booked the diamond head view room with views of the city as well. Pros: Friendly staff Beautiful room and hotel is cleanWater machine by our room was greatWifi worked well. Close to shops and eating. Breakfast across the street for $5 (2 pancakes, bacon and eggs)Nice scent throughout hotel Cons:Ridiculous resort fee amount. $30/niteResort fee "included" complimentary sunscreen and lotion but didn't get either upon arrival. So we were credited one nite resort fee upon checkout. The pool is not a pool. Water came up to my ankles..more like a kiddie pool. Jacuzzi didnt have hot water yet! Bummer2 drinks at the bar cost $30Can hear parties happening at the bar across the street till 3 amWe mentioned We were visiting for our honeymoon but unfortunately we weren't offered a complimentary meal or simple room upgrade. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I would prefer beachfront next time.

We stayed here during a recent visit to Oahu. We had cabins on the east side of the island but wanted a getaway for our wedding night. Nothing disappointed at this hotel. The rooms were excellent, the customer service was top-notch, and the hotel was beautiful. It was a perfect stay.

We loved every part of our stay at the Hyatt Centric. The hotel staff were fantastic, the room was spacious and clean, the food was delicious. It was a great place to spend our first visit to Hawaii. The cultural activities each night were great for our kids; the experts they bring in to teach the classes were a blast. We plan to visit again :)

Great new hotel with very nice facilities and central location. Stayed there for a total of 3 nights, very nice and clean rooms, with staff being very courteous and helpful. Reasonable price for the quality hotel, would stay here again.

New hotel which was within walking distance to Waikiki and transport. Great value and central hotel position with very good quality rooms and facilities. Friendly and helpful staff, highly recommended.

Nice new property that is convenient and not too busy or frenetic like the rest of Waikiki. Nice staff, quiet hotel nice rooms, but no patios and the windows do not open. Loved the location since you can walk almost everywhere. Convenient to drive, but entrance a bit hard to get to on the side street.

So happy to stayed at Hyatt centric Waikiki Beach , room very clean & the staff very friendly .good location my family and I enjod so much at Waikiki Hawaii will be back and stay at Hyatt centric hotel .

All of the staff at the Hyatt Centric were fantastic. From check in, to the bar, to the valet, all of the staff were super friendly and helpful. I never had to ask twice for anything. There were no delays. And at check in we were welcome with fresh pineapple juice and a shell necklace - super cute. I would definitely stay there again.

Best thing about holidays in Hawaii ( besides the beach and the weather) is seeing what is new.Hyatt Centric is so brand new it smells new! I understand after talking to the staff there ( who are all so helpful ) this was an office block conversion to a hotel - well they did a great job! We booked as members and arrived early - no problem relax and have a coffee while you wait - 10 mins later - in the room!The room - we booked a suite - with seperate lounge and were very happy we did! Floor to ceiling windows with views from Diamond around to the beach - and the room was great - all brand new but well considered - even powerpoints! Full bath and shower room - just wait till you have a bath!! Wifi was excellent and the whole place was so relaxing. Lounged around the pool - ordered room service, and ate in the restaurant - the Ahi Poke is to die for!Its not a big hotel - and not a resort - but the pool and restaurant are linked - so you can relax around the pool. Great Location - short ( and I mean short) to the beach and all shopping in Waikaki.We have been several times to Waikaki and tried alot of properties - but i think this will be the one for the future - cant wait to go back.Thanks to the team!

Diana, the head of housekeeping, is phenomenal! Genuine and sincere, she treated me like an extended family member, and even left me a personal note wishing me an amazing day during my week there! In 20+ years of travel, I have not experienced a more welcoming, and friendly staff.

The Hyatt Centric is a fantastic new hotel. The rooms are clean, airy, modern and comfortable. We got a king room with a nice big shower. We were travelling with a baby and you can request a pack and play, baby wipes, shampoo and lotion at no extra charge. Everything was new and clean (beach umbrellas, beach toys). There's a great little pool for kids and the pool area is nicely equipped with chairs and cabanas. The lobby on the 8th floor is bright and inviting. Wifi is great throughout the hotel. Filtered water stations available on 19th floor and fitness centre. All the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, especially the bell/front door team. I would definitely stay here again! Pros: Staff at front door were always so nice. Malia even remembered our little girl's name and would greet us with a smile every time. Clean and new facilities, beach towels, umbrellas and toys. Comfy bed. Nice view. Location close to everything...International Market Place, Ross, Nordstrom Rack, Jamba Juice, Marukame udon, Island vintage coffee, etcCons: We booked a last minute snorkel tour through their tour desk. They only take credit card and it turned out to be pricier than we hoped with the exchange rate. I'd suggest going to other indie tour places that take cash payment. No balcony or widows that open, but not a big deal as the beach is a few blocks away.

Came over from Maui for a quick weekend of Soccer with our son. Loved the hotel. Valet staff was super friendly when we arrived. Warm welcome from front desk. Room was clean and very nice. Bathroom was huge. Loved it! Need another waste basket in room as the only one was in the bathroom. Don't think getting an ocean view is worth it as it's pretty obstructed and no balcony. Probably won't next time. Mountain view would be fine. Loved the convenience of the Starbucks downstairs. Valet was pricey ($37.00) a night but they were super nice and helpful. Conveniently located and within walking distance to most everything in Waikiki. Would definitely stay here again. One thing I would change is the pool needs to be deeper and the deceiving cold pool with jets needs to be hot:) Mahalo!

The recent remodeling of the hotel was quite successful. Our room was spacious and had a great view. The friendly professionalism of the staff helped to make our stay a weekend to remember. We recommend this hotel to all who are thinking of visiting Waikiki.

We just had a wonderful week at the Hyatt Centric! This is a very new property that used to be an office building and is a great location-near the beach, shopping, restaurants. The only reason I wouldn't rate it as 5-excellent is that there are no lanais and that's because it was an office building. However, the lobby (on the 8th floor) is beautiful, open aired and the pool (wading) deck is beautiful to sit on too. The room isn't large-basic with a comfortable bed and nice sized bathroom with a coffee maker and small fridge. The most wonderful thing is the incredible staff-right from the door people always there opening the door with a smile and friendly greeting, to the concierge, the people at the desk in the lobby, and the bartenders. Truly, I don't know that we've ever stayed anywhere with such very happy and wonderful staff. Another perk was that they provide beach towels and Tommy Bahama chairs to take to the beach (about 3 blocks away). On one rainy evening we ate in the restaurant there too and it was a fabulous meal! Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Brand new hotel, absolutely gorgeous. Friendly, warm staff, large beautifully appointed rooms, lovely pool, great restaurant. Hotel is small 200 rooms compared to other resort hotels which contributes to it's warmth and friendliness. 2 blocks to Waikiki beach, close to shopping and every others amenity. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

We don't usually stay in Waikiki when we visit Oahu... but it was a great time staying at Hyatt Centric. The beds are super comfy and all of the amenities were top notch. We're extremely pleased. No complaints!!Tip for future guests: the driveway of the hotel is on Seaside, not Kuhio. Seaside is a one way street so you can't turn onto it from Kuhio. I can't remember the street that we turned on but it was parrallel to seaside and then made a left at the first alley to make a left on Kuhio. Sorry, I'm not giving better directions ; )

Stayed here with my husband and 16 year old daughter for 5 days. This is a brand new modern hotel steps away from all the high end stores on Kalakaua Ave which we nicknamed Rodeo Dr. because it felt as if we were in Beverly Hills for a moment. Negatives:1. the beach is approx 2.5 blocks away, and we suggest walking through the pink hotels lobby (Royal Hawaiian) as a short cut. You have to ask for beach chairs and umbrellas from the 1st floor street entrance of Hyatt Centric early. The first day we went to the beach they were all out of umbrellas so we had to rent an umbrella from the Royal Hawaiian Hotel $40 for the day. 2. The pool at the hotel is not a swimming pool just enough water to put your feet in, if the plunge pool was heated it would've made up for the lounge pool 3. Charge for self parking is $32 per day4. Ocean view rooms are not full view just a peak between buildings. I would suggest not paying any extra for ocean view 5. Housekeeping cleaned half our room and was there late in the day Positives:1. Comfortable, clean and spacious rooms2. The staff were all friendly especially Malia who reserved our chairs and umbrellas for the beach the 2nd day3. Fire pit and plenty seating around next to the wadding pool4. Keurig in the room with coffee and tea k-cups5. Definitely a great location for vacationers that like to shop, plenty of restaurants in walking distance. We would recommend this hotel to someone who require a clean and modern hotel room however does not require a great view or a swimming pool. Overall a nice stay, may look for a new hotel or resort that is beachfront on our next vacation.

There is no doubt that the Hyatt always get their interior design right! The building which houses Hyatt Centric used to be an office block. The rooms are an excellent size and bathrooms well designed. The lobby, restaurant and wading pool area have a relaxing vibe and a nice boutique feel. All the staff were friendly from reception to bell desk. We upgraded to a King Suite which was huge. There is only 1 negative and that is the music which carries up from the street on a Friday and Saturday night from the Bar diagonally opposite. We were moved from level 10 to 17 and could still hear it. That was our first 2 nights of our stay. Fortunately for the rest of our stay it was not noisy. There's a Starbucks Reserve which literally opened on the day we arrived a new upmarket concept which comes in on par now with the great coffee we are used to in Australia. The Reserve coffee is other blends from around the World and they have press, drip or siphon methods too.... more of an experience. Thanks Hyatt Centric for a great stay. We wish we were staying with you for our full vacation however are off to the Modern Hotel. Places we love to eat are Marukame Udon, The Pig and the Lady Restaurant and at the KCC Farmers Market on a Saturday, Highway Inn for true Hawaiian food, Fumi's Shrimp Truck (North Shore) and one of the best beaches which is a 30 min drive is Waimanola.

We picked the hotel initially because of the relatively reasonable rates and the fact that it was new, which brings both pluses and minuses. We spent 3 very pleasant nights for a wedding in Honolulu. We then flew to the Big Island for some volcano viewing. We had planned to come back to Honolulu for one night prior to going back to the mainland. We had a reservation at a much larger hotel. We canceled that reservation and made a new one at the Centric. It has a small-hotel feel. The check-in manager was very helpful and accommodated our request for a late check-out as our plane was a late flight out. One thing went wrong. The TV did not work when we came back from a full day of tourism. This was at 1030 pm on a Saturday night. We were told an engineer would come by. We were skeptical, but within minutes an engineer came by, looked at the TV, went out for a few minutes during which we lost our power for a brief moment. Then the TV rebooted and started working. The engineer cam back to confirm the everything was all right. The folks at the street level entry were also extremely helpful. If we come back to Oahu, this is where we will stay
user_name:
bobandeva2017
New York City, New York

review_body: Hyatt Centric in Waikiki Beach is a great hotel based on it's location. However, there was lots of issue during my stay.I had tried to book with them over the phone initially because I didn't want to get stuck with a room that I would've been unhappy with. I didn't know which hotel rooms had tubs and etc. I couldn't get a hold of them - might have been an issue on my end so I just ended booking on Expedia instead. The checking in process felt like I was at Motel 8 or something - Wesley had asked us if we were celebrating anything and I told him that it was my birthday weekend and his was response was just "oh". Why bother asking in the first place if you don't care?The room that they had put us in was extremely lacklustre and I had the view of the hotel boilers. I had called down to front desk and Wesley that had checked me in insisted that they were completely booked...well that is until I told him that I would just like to cancel my stay completely. The toilet in that room was also dirty...which grossed me out.He had moved us to another room on a higher floor but it was half the size so I decided to stay in the original room. He had advised me to come down the next morning to ask about switching to a higher room when people are checking out. The front desk agent once again did the same dance and song in regards to being completely sold out. I just didn't have the energy anymore to try to get onto a higher floor.The room cleaners in the hotel was completely spotty - no one cleaned our room mirror for 4 days. The wood floors by the doors were also dusty at times - I don't think that they have a complete check list. I don't blame this on the housekeepers, this is something that management should be taken care of and properly trained the housekeepers. I also called into the front desk on one morning to have our room cleaned while we went for breakfast, sure enough no one came by despite my call to the front desk. Finally the last day, there was this middle aged male housekeeper that had cleaned our room and he had done an amazing job - he was the only one that had cleaned the mirrors!The older aged staff (guy with moustache/salt & pepper hair) at the door and also the female with glasses were amazing and extremely friendly. The younger guys at night could care less about their jobs, they were more focused on their friends visiting them and drinking their protein shakes then greeting you and opening the doors.Overall, in my opinion - management has a lot to work on with this hotel. The $25 per day resort fee is like highway robbery because there's not even a pool at this place - it's like a foot deep, that's it. I would have paid more money to stay at a place with better service and house keeping,

Our stay was amazing! The staff is super friendly and helpful! And the decor was so beautiful, from the lobby to the room. Location is hard to beat!We stayed at the Hyatt Centric towards the end of Jan 2017, so the hotel had been open for about a month. The lobby is on the 8th floor, so you have to take an elevator up. The decor of the lobby is modern, with homey touches. We were greeted by the most friendly front desk concierge, Kaniala. He was extremely friendly and helpful. He ended up upgrading our room, which made the stay unforgettable! He then gave us a tour and walked us up to our room. Now that's what I call customer service! He also checked in with us whenever he saw us in the lobby. His hospitality was above and beyond. . Our room was gorgeous. We had a city view suite with a bath tub, and the view was to die for. The entire wall was made up of a window. The bathroom was so relaxing, with a standalone tub located inside of the shower area. There was a bidet toilet seat, which was a nice touch. The next day we order room service for breakfast, but were mildly disappointed when the meal was served in all to go containers. The food was from the restaurant downstairs, and it was pretty good. The pool area was smaller than expected, but it was still a relaxing place to hang out. The main pool is maybe a 1-1.5 feet deep, while the smaller soaking pool was about 3 feet. For being in the middle of Waikiki, the pool still felt pretty isolated. The only minor problem we ran into was the housekeeping. We were gone for most of the day, but there had not been any turn down service by time we returned at 4 pm. We had called down to request turn down service, and had to call again 25 minutes later until someone came to the room. The person came up to the room appeared very agitated. She definitely had done a great job though.

From the minute we arrived on our vacation from the front door man to the reception to the room to the maids the bartender everyone was wonderful. We ate at the restaurant one night and the food was outstanding, the presentation was five star and the waiter was great.

I am in my 8th day of a 14 day stay at Hyatt Centric. There is a lot to like about this hotel. It is new, the room and bathroom is large and well appointed.. The front desk staff are helpful and friendly. The bar is nice and the bar staff do an excellent job. The food is good and the prices are reasonable. There are several things that keep this hotel from getting 5 stars. The biggest problem is the pool, which is only a few inches deep (yes I said inches and not feet). The only ones that use the pool are babies--they love it. The pool is not well protected from the wind. Expect an additional charge of $25 for towels to use around the pool that cannot be used. If you like the windows open at night, they do not open. The people cleaning the room need better training. They should be working from a checklist to insure everything is properly cleaned and in working order. I have had to leave a message on several occasions to have additional cleaning done. Overall I have been enjoying my stay at this hotel, but it needs some improvements. I will update this review once I return home to let you know if there is any additional information I might add.

Pretty, clean room with a wonderfully friendly and informed staff eager to help make your stay better. The smell in the 8th floor lobby is worth the trip alone! Stay for the mai tai and elevated breakfast fare and the great proximity to shopping, beach, night life and clean, inviting rooms!

I booked a room with a jacuzzi tub, didn't get it. Also got the diamond head view. Didn't get that I got a view of the city. Couch was stiff and uncomfortable to sit on. The hotel at a whole is nice but not the price spent. I have spent less in oahu and got better quality. The bathroom was one of the only good things. The shower was great good water pressure and big. Down flaw the room had this random wall that made no sense. It got in the way of the TV there. Over all the room wasn't bad but not what I asked for and paid for.

Great Staff and location. Highly recommend this hotel The room was fantastic and the staff were incredibly accommodating and friendly the whole time. I loved everything about this hotel. Book with confidence!

We have stayed at many hotels in the Waikiki area and decided to try something new. New it was, and the customer service was EXCEPTIONAL! Beautiful trendy hotel with the warmth of the Aloha spirit throughout. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out the hotel staff was amazing. The front desk went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The rooms are modern and clean and the beds are very comfortable. We stayed here 2-2-17 - 2-4-17.

Thought I would try this new hotel on a business trip I was on. First the staff was great very accommodating with any of my needs. The property itself is very modern and very well done, the rooms are a nice size and the bathroom has a very large walk in shower. The hotel is located beside the International Market Place, which is an great area to restaurants and a short walk to the beach. The hotel also provides complimentary beach chairs and umbrella. Nice pool area with bar and restaurant. Will definitely be staying back at the Centric when I come back. Thanks again.

I had just checked in on Jan 23rd at the Vive Hotel and was wondering where to eat seafood close by. the recommended this one. I had not eaten since 0600 AM as Westjet did not serve ve food only a ps mall package is pretzels. I sat at the bar as I was alone. I told him that I had not slept all night anxious about missing an early morning flight so was dizzy and tired and would not be drinking. He was ok with water only I asked for a seafood dish not on the bar menu. He ordered a plate of the tastiest Opah fish with mashed potatoes and okra in a great sauce. it was fantastic!! I

Really enjoyed our stay here! Many Honolulu hotels are overpriced and outdated, but the Hyatt Centric is brand new, the perfect price, and a great location. We stayed here on a layover to Kauai for our honeymoon so we could enjoy the city for a night/day. The staff was so welcoming and greeted us with puka shell necklaces and fresh juice. They even upgraded us since we were on our honeymoon. The first room we had was right next to the elevator, which was pretty noisy, and when we asked to switch rooms, they were very accommodating and gave us an even better room. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone visiting.

We just spent 4 nights in a 22nd-floor room with a view of Diamond Head and the Pacific. Rooms are nice in that edgy, minimal-furnishings, weird light switches, boutique-hotel style, and staff was unfailingly delightful. But this is probably the only hotel in Waikiki with no lanais, balconies or windows that can be opened. It is in a re-furbished office building, and the windows are sealed. So if it matters to you to get some of that island breeze, or the sound of the surf, choose somewhere else. Also, what looks like a swimming pool is an ankle-deep "water feature" and the whirlpool is not heated -- that's right, stone cold. Brrrrrrr. What a place for Hyatt to cheap out. You should know these things, and if they matter, stay at one of the other Hyatts in Waikiki instead.

My boyfriend and I changed our booking last minute after seeing this pop up online. Great decision! Hotel is brand new, so it's all super modern with gorgeous rooms. The reception staff couldn't have been more helpful, even arranging a room upgrade after hearing it was my birthday as well as complimentary breakfast for us on that day. It's a little bit off the Main Street but an ideal location, gets you out of the busy streets but still no more than 5 mins to the beach. The only downside came at around 7am every morning when construction noises would start outside (from a diff hotel). We told reception about this and they were very helpful and said we could move rooms, which we did- twice. But both of the rooms had other noise (could hear the lift clearly in one of them, and the aircon rattled in another). We actually ended up back in our original room as that's all they had avail. Construction noise was annoying but best we could do. And FYI The pool is also just a wading pool, which we didn't care about because we preferred the beach anyway! Apart from that, I can't recommend the hotel highly enough.

Diamond member and was very impressed. Quick check in. Upgraded to ocean view suite. Would definitely stay again. In center of everything, very walkable. Very comfortable bed. More signs would be nice didn't know lobby was on 8th floor and difficulty finding room, lots of twists and turns. Surprised in suite only one outlet easily reachable, hard to iron or plug in devices for charging. Easily accessible plugs would be great. Wardrobe lights automatically come on when opened. Mine wouldn't go off if closed all the way. Had to use a towel over the door to keep the light from coming on.

We visited Hawaii to get married. The staff was very accommodating and we had our impromptu wedding ceremony next to the hotel pool. They made sure to help us celebrate with champagne and took photos of the ceremony. They also printed and framed one of the wedding photos as a courtesy! I was very happy and impressed with their service. The room and lobby are also fantastic. Everything is new and clean. It's right in the heart of Waikiki and a great value. I'll be sure to return.

The hotel is new, the staff is highly motivated. The rooms have a convenient size and are equipped with everything you expect from a hotel called Hyatt.Some details are in improvement. The bar is equipped with very good spirits, but cheap mixers. The doors to the balcony are not fully waterproof. These things actually disturb the really good overall experience.

We first came here for just 2 nights and loved it that much that we stayed for a week and a half. Literally at soft-opening, the hotel had zero to no teething problems and evey staff member was incredibly courteous and oozing aloha! The hotel has such a lovely, calm, relaxing vibe and is a haven of Hawaiian charm amongst the energy of Waikiki. The furnishings are top quality, luxurious and well designed. The outdoor area with the spa pool and shallow splash pool is so chilled and relaxing with a great vibe, day and night. The branded water bottles and leis are a lovely touch and this hotel will go down in history as one of the great boutique style hotels in Waikiki. Definitely stay here, you won't regret it. And the staff are all an absolute credit to the brand who are clearly striving to make a success out of the place...and succeeding! Rooms are beautiful and if you get one with a wet room and a sunset / city view, you will not regret it. We returned straight back and this is now our home from home on our business trips to Honolulu. Mahalo for evrything.

This is a newly opened hotel. As it was converted from an office building, the design and structure are very unique. The staff were very enthusiastic and ready to help. The night we arrived, Ty, introduced not only the facilities and services of the hotel, but also local delicacies. Following his suggestion, we ate in a restaurant full of local people. The breakfast was great too. The only thing you might want to pay attention is to drive to the hotel as you can only enter the hotel from the beach direction.

My wife and I had an outstanding time staying at the Hyatt Centric. Kaniala checked us in, and gave us a tour of the lobby and pool. He could not have been more informative and welcoming. Robert behind the bar made us some great drinks and even gave us some wine glasses to take to the room. The staff at the restaurant were a joy. The eggs Benedict with pork were delicious! All in all, I can't wait until we can stay at the Hyatt Centric again. Thank you all for a wonderful stay!

I've stayed at many hotels in Waikiki, from The Modern to The Royal Hawaiian and this place takes the cake! Location couldn't be better (right next to waikiki beach and newly renovated international marketplace) Beautiful modern decor and incredibly friendly staff! We were blown away. I've already booked 6 more trips this year. Thank you Hyatt Centric for being so AMAZING :)

A new hotel with friendly and helpful staff, clean big rooms. The hotel is located centrally with pickup point for most tours located nearby, near to shops and restaurants. In-room dining needs a little refinement.

What a wonderful little hidden gem in WaikikiThe hotel is brand-new, exceptionally clean and modern. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The appointments are exquisite.I came here for a family getaway. We live on the island but decided to run away and treat ourselves for the weekend. The kids had a blast. They thoroughly enjoyed the pool which is not overly crowded. The lanai dining was perfect. A kids menu that kept them and their little tummies happyThe staff was exceptional. I have never seen a more warm, professional and welcoming bunch of people. Just in my first few hours here, I can see their commitment to hospitality.We spent many weekends doing stay-cations here on the island. This by far will be one of our favorites !!!!

We stayed at Hyatt Centric Waikiki this past week- first time in Hawaii and the experience was nothing short of AMAZING. Right when I walked in we were greeted with modern decor and extremely welcoming staff-! The rooms were wonderful and we even got an upgrade because it was my birthday! We got an amazing view--Ill never forget it. LOOK FOR A HOST NAMED EDDIE YU! hes AMAZING! told us where to get the best local eats and what activities to do. He was always there to answer any and all questions! Room Service was great, Room was Clean and Modern, Middle of everything- very convenient and Staff were courteous and friendly! YOU GUYS NEED TO CHECK THIS PLACE OUT! We will definitely be back! <3 Mahalo

Thanks for a great experience! The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly. The room was small but efficient.Comfortable bed, great tv nice view! Would have liked some reading material in the room and a hotel guidebook.

I've stayed on Waikiki before, and most rooms that are around the area are old and small. This is NOT the case at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki. In addition, the staff was incredibly kind and accommodating. It's only about 1.5 blocks away from the main drag (and beach) in Waikiki, and believe me, if you are able, it's worth the 3 min extra walk to stay here. I wouldn't change a thing about our stay, and plan to book again this coming October. There is no question in my mind this hotel is one of the best on Waikiki, after I've had experiences at other hotels. We ended up having breakfast and The Lanai, and was shocked at how tasty it was. They literally had the best french toast I've ever eaten. If we had been there longer, we would have loved to try it for lunch and/or dinner. It's pretty rare that a hotel eating establishment is very good, but this is beyond that. This is such a rare gem, and to have a nice, new and clean hotel with such a stellar location is great. If you are thinking about staying here, do it, you will NOT regret it. Special thanks to the staff there who made everything about our stay (including the people at The Lanai) so wonderful. See you in October!

What an amazing experience! The staff really embody the "Aloha" spirit, the hotel is brand new with a modern look and spacious rooms, and some of the best views in Waikiki. The lobby is a relaxing place to hang out and we appreciated the service at the front desk and pool area! Definitely one of my top picks in Waikiki!

Brand new hotel in the center of Waikiki. Although it does not have direct beach access (which is actually a blessing in disguise - Waikiki beach is too overrun anyways),it is only a block walk to the beach. The hotel is steps away from the International Marketplace and other shops, bars and restaurants. Our hotel room was beautiful- modern bathroom and bedroom furniture and design, giant move-able TV, desk, couch, and floor to ceiling views of the mountains.The restaurant/bar/lobby/pool areas are all immaculate - very open, light and bright feel. The restaurant food is delicious - try the kalua eggs benedict for breakfast.This is definitely my favorite hotel in Waikiki! I look forward to returning!

A hotel's decor is important to me, and I was looking for a place that exuded both sophistication and comfort. Hyatt Centric Waikiki fit the bill. Clean ivory with splashes of turquoise blue, softened by wood accessories of various shades throughout, the hotel and rooms embrace both urban Honolulu and the natural elements that make Hawaii special. I booked a junior suite for myself and three teens to celebrate an 18th birthday. The hotel is right in the middle of the shopping district of Waikiki, yet not far from the beach. It is easy to walk to everything, including inexpensive and pricier restaurants.The best part was the enthusiasm of the staff. I told them about the birthday and arranged to have mocktails created for Friday evening by the pool. Despite picky orders, the bartender was happy to create custom drinks that looked special and tasted great. The wait staff, housekeepers, and front desk staff were all friendly and professional and made everyone in our party feel special.I used the gym and, though plain with white walls and no decoration, it had adequate equipment. The large windows were a plus, and I appreciated the interactive workout videos (like what one would see in a spin class). Cold filtered water, towels, mats, free weights, and exercise balls rounded out the traditional treadmills and bike. It also had both an elliptical and a stair machine.The food I had was fresh and good. I had a fruit plate and bacon for breakfast (bacon was crisp but not hot, unfortunately), and my coffee cup and water glass were always full. For lunch, I had the baby romaine salad and coconut shrimp pupu. Both were excellent. The menu may seem expensive at first glance but, considering my costs the day before eating outside the hotel, I thought the quality and prices were right on par, if not slightly better. Not to mention, a whole lot less crowded and more relaxing.Top all of that off with a lobby and pool area that we constantly found ourselves lounging in, I'd say this short stay was just what we all were looking for. This will now be my choice for a hotel stay whenever I come to Honolulu.

My wife and I were visiting Waikiki for our 40th anniversary. We were staying at a modestly priced condominium so we decided to splurge and spend our last night at the Hyatt Centric. What a great decision.The hotel front desk staff was fabulous. They were very pleasant and attentive.The rooms were unbelievable. They were well decorated and very modern. The beds, linens, and other amenities were "top notch".This is a fabulous property!

This hotel is brand new - probably only opened a few weeks ago. Smack dab in the middle of everything and a short walk to the beach. The whole neighborhood looks brand new since the last time I was here - the International Marketplace is totally revamped, Yokocho has some of the best new Japanese casual restaurants (see also: ramen ramen ramen), the Kona coffee shop is the coolest coffee shop I have ever seen, and we no longer have to drive to Nordstrom Rack - there is a brand new one right next to the hotel! Waikiki is back on the map for me now. All this stuff was steps to the hotel.Again, the hotel is brand new - a breath of fresh air as some of the other hotels in the neighborhood are pretty stale. I had a King room, view of the ocean, totally modern bathroom, giant TV (not that I used it), hardwood floors, the works. I didn't get to use the pool or the restaurant but they are airy and bright. Waikiki pools are usually depressing but this one looks sweet - I regret not hanging out there, next time. I did have an awesome drink at the bar (maybe on the sweet side) but didn't have time to finish it. I need to go back to Waikiki and spend more time at the hotel, I guess. The front desk was all "Aloha Aloha" but they got me checked in and on my way fast. One lady helped me late at night when I couldn't print out my boarding pass so friendly. (Sorry, I forgot your name!) Bellman went out of his way and helped me contact a taxi where I lost my phone - got it back, thank you - lifesaver. Also printed me out a map to my dinner - bam. I was visibly ecstatic when I asked for a taxi to Nordstrom Rack for my overseas friends but was instead escorted to the new one next to the hotel, kind of blew the Budget on Aloha shirts though. Jamba juice and Starbucks seem to be opening right next to the hotel but, I suggest checking out Kona at International Marketplace. The Starbucks will be good when you just want a latte but you don't want to dress up for anything past the elevator. The hotel even had this freakishly tall guy in the elevator dressed as Elvis (check! Kind of a dork though, sorry dude.) What can I say? Can't wait to get back to the new Waikiki.

This hotel stay was fantastic. Everything in the hotel was of a modern design and the staff was acceptionaly helpful during my short business stay. I will definitely be planning on staying here again during my next visit to the islands

Pay attention to your bill. This hotel is charging a resort fee and they are NOT a resort. This is what it pays for:Two (2) Reusable Water Bottles — two low-quality bottles one of which broke almost immediately.Beach Chairs — You have to get them from valet and carry them to the beach (about five blocks away) yourself.Local phone calls from the guest room up to 60 minutes per stay — No one does this anymore.Pool & Beach Towels — This pool is a joke I’ve seen much bigger pools at airport hotels.Business Center Access — two computers in a hallway near the lobby that I never saw anyone use.24-hour Stay-Fit Gym Access — A very basic gym and not worth a fee.Daily Hawaiian Cultural Hour (available five days per week) — nobody mentioned this or knew about it.Complimentary Arrival Beverage — I was offered a plastic cup of pineapple juice while I waited for my room. "Complimentary means FREE stupid!"Discounted Beach Activities — this was never mentioned at check-in or check-out, so it’s not clear what’s included.What a resort fee is, is just a way to make you think you are paying one price when you compare to other hotels and you actually pay another price when you check out. If you compare apples to apples, this hotel is TOO HIGH! I now look for hotels that charge a fee and mark them off my list whether they are a good location or not. It is dishonest since you cannot opt out, the fee should just be part of the price. A fee is something for something. You do not get a value out of this, because it is charged every day and you only get the FREE drink once. They need to learn from the airlines and start including all charges in the price unless it is optional before someone sues them or the government regulates them. By the way, the end result is you think you are paying for five nights stay but the fee adds on enough to pay for a sixth day.

I loved the Centric. The location is off the charts, right in the middle of everything yet once you are in the hotel it's a quiet oasis! The staff is so friendly. The gave me great recommendations on where to dine and shop. I also loved eating in The Lanai, their restaurant. The egg white omelet is delicious. The Executive Team meets in the living room (lobby) at 10am every morning to share their oli (Hawaiian message), such a nice touch. The rooms are so spacious, so many thoughtful touches, great light, amazing views of the ocean. I can't wait to go back!

This is a brand new hotel in the Waikiki Beach area on O'ahu. Even though it is not right on the beach, it is only a block away with very easy access. The hotel provides beach chairs (transport easily with back pack style straps, includes a cooler and other pockets), towels and umbrellas. The hotel itself has a beautiful wading pool with several cabanas surrounding it. The restaurant was competitively priced and very good. Fitness center had nice equipment. We had a king room with shower/tub combo bathroom. Very spacious and functional. Floor to ceiling windows were very nice.

My wife and I were greeted with complimentary beverages after we checked in. The lobby (FYI located on the eight floor) has a clean, modern feel to it with plenty of room to relax or do some work. The rooms are super spacious with and comfortable beds and breathtaking views from their floor-to-ceiling windows. Brand new hotel with top-notch service just steps away from shopping, activities, and the beach. Highly recommended option for a romantic weekend getaway.

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki Beach during a business trip and I was blown away. The lobby is beautiful, and it opens into this sweet...lanai (I think they called it?). Picture perfect, and a great place to enjoy a drink.The rooms were spacious and tastefully done. The desk rotates open into an L if you need more space, which is something I've never seen before. The beds are comfy, and the showers are YUGE. Fast (and free) wifi, plus they included an orange reusable water bottle. Not sure if that's standard. OH and I had floor to ceiling windows that looked right onto the mountains, super dramatic.Location is in the title, and central to everything. Right above a Nordstrom Rack in case you forgot anything.-JTB

I've now stayed twice at this amazing new hotel and will return! Its location is right next to the new International Market Place, and a block from the Royal Hawaiian/beach. I love the high energy of Waikiki, but it can sometimes get overwhelming. Even thought the Hyatt Centric is right in the center of all the action, the open air lobby and pool deck provide the perfect oasis. The lobby is a great place to relax over a drink - they make delicious island cocktails too. The restaurant is the best hotel food I've had and the menu mixes in a lot of local flavors. Every morning there's a cultural activity so I learned a lot too. The rooms are truly the best I've seen -- very large with a local/contemporary design. The windows are super large so the views are expansive. The best part of my room though was the bathroom where the shower wall looks out across the room to the view - exceptional! Really friendly and helpful staff too.

The rooms, staff, and foods is all fantastic. Views are ok. Pool is pretty but only for soaking your feet. I really like the breakfast options. They have some great local food and buffet stuff available. Parking sucks. The attached garage is not connected to the hotel well. I had to walk up 2 flights of stairs or go down to the 1st floor to get up to the hotel. Without a car the hotel is perfect.

Beautiful new hotel...very stylish. Really wonderful, enthusiastic staff who provided tons of important info for touring around. We loved that they provided beach chairs and towels. Would have liked, like other hotels, a couple of "extras' in the lobby like coffee, flavored water...but not a big deal and I'm sure they'll work it out as hotel gets busier.. Pool area is not for swimmers but if you like to lounge, its a pretty and relaxing spot.

The rooms and ambiance are awesome, a fresh and updated Hyatt experience. Fitness center is a bit small with relatively few machines, pool area is more of a wading pool with about a dozen or so lounge chairs. Negatives? The poolside/lobby bar staff is extremely slow in responding. Waiting 10-15 minutes to be recognized and to get a drink is just dumb - come on people - you're in the hospitality business - get it together. (This happened all three nights). $25 resort fee...for wifi and a water bottle? Yea...that's a bit of a stretch. The $24 breakfast buffet was underwhelming - few selections and they hadn't replenished the items at 8:30am...back to that hospitality thing.

beautiful rooms, great staffs, the location is central to Waikiki, easy access to beachshops and restaurants, hotel has a restaurant and bar as well...Each room has Japanese Toto toilet...I stayed at many hotels from 3 stars to 6 stars,I was impressed by this one, the staff is friendly and genuine, very helpful

Just stayed here - January 2017. They opened in December and had not even had their grand opening. We wanted to spend one night in Waikiki before moving on. We chose this property over some of the old standbys in that area. This property is not on the beach. It is about 3 blocks away. The Good: Very enthusiastic and friendly staff. The property is newly converted from an office building. In my opinion, I will take a new 3 star hotel over an old 4 star. Nice views from many of the rooms. Stylish modern decor. Very good to excellent food in the bar and restaurant. The Bad: Pool is small and really just a wading pool. $25 resort fee. I hate resort fees. They are not optional. Just charge me more for the room up front instead of hiding part of the room rate in a resort fee.I like this property and would be happy to go back.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of January this year, and we were so impressed by everything there. The location was so great, just a few blocks away from the beach and quick access to shops and restaurants, and the view from our room over the city was fantastic. The pool/bubble tub was also very relaxing, and we could definitely tell that the building was brand new. However, the best part of this hotel was its service. Although it had just opened a month before we stayed there, the hotel's service made it feel like it had been operating forever. My husband left his iPhone at our hotel at the Big Island, and the staff worked tirelessly in order to help us get it back. Special shoutout to Jackie who called our old hotel and the shipping service every day to keep us informed as the phone was transported. We had to leave Honolulu before the phone arrived, and Jackie still sent us updates of our phone and helped us find the tracking number. Jackie even texted us the day of our phone's arrival to make sure that it had come safely. Also, thanks to Alex for helping us in the process. We loved this hotel, and we know that when we go back to Honolulu, we will definitely be staying here again!

This is a new property in an older building. In fact not yet fully opened. Hyatt put an experienced team in there to run it in the initial months, and they are running a smooth operation.Rooms are comfortable, albeit a bit basic with the furniture (at least in our ocean view room): 2-door wardrobe, chest with the enormous TV, round bed tables and a chair. Meaning you have plenty of space to roll your yoga mat out;)Quick service at check-in. We checked the pool (more a water feature) and the restaurant, but did not use these facilities. We had our organic breakfasts across the street in Heavenly Island.Location is great. Walking distance from the new International Marketplace mall, several restaurants, and Waikiki beach is 5-10min away.We paid the new year rates, and we thought that was not really value for money. However outside the peak season without the sky-high rates you should be fine.No service lifts in operation, so elevators shared with staff which may be a let down for some people; not for us.

This is a great hotel in an amazing location, you have everything near by and the hotel itself is great... an open lobby in the 8th floor with very comfortable areas to restYou really need to save some time to enjoy the terrace area with the pool and enjoy the cocktails at the barThe room was really comfortable, great bed and the bathrobes are something elseI will definitely come back to this property
user_name:
Juan Carlos G
Los Angeles, California

review_body: Not all trips go as planned! I fell while shopping and broke my ankle. When I arrived back at the hotel the staff could not have been more helpful. Anson and Malia helped me to my room. Kaniala checked up on me more than once and the hotel GM Charles Young was outstanding.In my years of travel, this is the first trip that was difficult from beginning to end but the hotel was the shining star of the whole experience. From genuine care and concern to help to and from my room for hospital visits, this team was tremendous. They hadn't even had their grand opening and the the team was on point and doing all the right things for their guests. We will return to this hotel every year!

after the Hyatt Regency Waikiki and a Hyatt place property, Hyatt opened (at this time soft opening, will fully open at 18th January 2017) a third property. This is one of the new Hyatt Hotels with the CENTRIC brand.I arrived two days ago in the afternoon, booked in a standard room with a king bed as a Hyatt Diamond Member. Upon checkin the friendly guy advise my, they upgrade me to (in my opinion) best accommodation in the hotel, an ocean view suite. This is a corner suite with a separate bedroom, facing the ocean and the city and one of the rooms where you could see the sunrise and sunset as well.The staff was very friendly, starting in front of the door, the front desk, members in the restaurant and more. Friedly, with a smile and always nice.+ good location, restaurants are close by, beach just minutes walk away+ brand new hotel, clean and well designed rooms+ nice bathrobe+ welcome giftonly some little things could be changed- need a blind in the bedroom, it's only a small window but is the side with the sunrise- missing a balconyIt will be definitely a nice place to be. If you had a chance to go to Honolulu, check it out.

Finished our Oahu trip with a two-night stay at this property, and we loved it! We actually left a neighboring hotel early just to stay here, and I'm glad we did. For a hotel barely two weeks open, we were surprised how professional and attentive the staff is here. Let's start with the one and only negative: the cold pool! Otherwise, the property is fantastic. Rooms were modern and spacious, with high-end furnishings. Bathroom shower was gigantic, and double sinks round out the large bathroom. Food at the lobby level restaurant was also very good (try the warm cobbler dessert). We'll defnitely return!

My family and i stayed here for the last leg of our extended vacation in hawaii for four nights. Overall, it was a great stay in a fab location although if i could change some things i would to make the stay superb. Everything was new new new. Being a clean freak i prefer things squeaky clean if not new. Our room, in my opinion was a bit on the small side... or perhaps the furniture was a bit too big for the size of the room? The bathroom had a soaking tub plus a separate huge shower stall. I think they could've designed the bathroom to be a bit smaller and save the space for the living area instead. The bathroom lights were quite annoying, especially where the toilet was, which had a separate light. I think it was supposed to turn on if it sensed motion (which it never did) or if the button was pressed. There was a towel hook above the main bathroom light button/sensor which i thought was oddly placed. Our a/c kept coming on and shortly off at night time, so not sure if this is just a function of the sensor being overly active or what (we kept it at 71F). It didn't keep us up but it was noticeable when we were still up watching TV. Overall the room was comfortably, even though a bit on the small side. If you're planning to stay in the hotel room for long periods of time maybe this isn't the hotel for you. On several nights we heard kids screaming at midnight... not sure where the kids were because it didn't sound like it was next to us (on one side it was the exit stairs) - so the walls seems to be pretty thin.Check in is on the 8th floor. The main door to the building is not sensored operated and valet clerks either open the door for you or you have to open it. Sometimes valet clerks are not around, which is not a big deal, but maybe the door should be auto operated for those in wheelchairs or don't have free hands to open the door. Elevators (4) were a bit slow and at peak times you have to wait for several minutes before you can get on. Also noted that service/house keeping uses the same elevator banks which i found odd... most hotels have service elevators for their use i think. This hotel provides 2 reusable plastic water bottles which i found awesome because less waste is better.. but ice and water machines are not available on every floor (only 3 to be exact). I visited 2 during my visit and they were far from the elevator banks. Finally, we visited The Lanai (their restaurant) twice during our visit. Both times were were the only diners there, which is fine... maybe a better quality control over what comes out of the kitchen is needed. To be fair, the food that came out is tasty, but cold/hard or uncooked food (that should be fully cooked) is unacceptable.All the staff we encountered during the visit were very nice. We would visit this property again but maybe ask for a bigger room next time. Location is even better than the Hyatt Regency in my opinion.

We just completed an 8 night stay at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki, a brand new, upscale resort in the heart of Waikiki Beach. Located at 2255 Kuhio Avenue, the place is so new your GPS may have trouble navigating to it, but this latest Hyatt property is well worth the hunt.We had a 2-queen room with a beautiful ocean view. An in-room refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker and large flat screen TV made us feel at home, and since we actually had to unwrap some of this stuff, I'm fairly certain we were the first family ever to stay there.Everything about the hotel whispers exclusivity. With a walk-in entrance at street level but the actual check-in lobby on the eighth floor, guest rooms are located on floors 9 through 20. The eighth floor is also where you'll find the hotel restaurant, bar, workout room, business center and outdoor deck with open fireplace, spa, pool and a group of cabanas that can be rented for the day. The non-traditional layout reminded us of the Mandarin Oriental in Vegas, giving the property a feeling of privacy and seclusion like we've never previously experienced in the bustle of Waikiki Beach.A super friendly and eager-to-please staff were icing on the cake of this nouveau-chic oasis. We really loved it. The Hyatt Centric is a rare find, and truly over-the-top terrific.

It is a new hotel with an ideal location to everything in Waikiki. Although it is new, the hotel and staff have gotten many things right from the start so there is no need to worry about opening glitches. Kuhio Avenue is one of the two main avenues in Waikiki, the other being Kalakaua Avenue. The hotel is within very short walking distances of many shopping, dining and entertainment choices, as well as the Royal Hawaiian Center and the recently renovated International Market Place. The hotel is also on the bus line. Honolulu has one of the best bus systems in the world. The hotel is not directly on the beach but its convenience, comfort, soothing soft décor, and views will serve you well. And regardless of where you travel in the world, the hotel staff can make a huge difference in your stay. The staff members at the Hyatt Centric have what is referred to as the Aloha Spirit with their warm smiles, friendly greetings and offers of assistance. There is a restaurant in the hotel called The Lanai and the food is delicious with generous proportions. Also a pool, exercise room, bar and other amenities. As word spreads about the hotel, it is guaranteed that it will be much sought after place to stay, relax and enjoy a wonderful Hawaiian vacation.

Stayed here for two nights really enjoyed the clean modern look and feel to the hotel. Centrally located to all the major shopping whether it be Cartier,Ferragamo, Prada etc. Super close by the international marketplace which is completely remodeled making it really hip and cool. Right across the street from crackin kitchen. Staff was very friendly. It's about 2 blocks from the beach. I must say for anybody who's looking to do some shopping.

Stayed at the Hyatt Centric on it's opening night, Dec.8! Couldn't have been better and somewhat surprised for an opening. You would expect a glitch but no way! Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and very accommodating for last minute request/changes. The lobby area is open, modern, with smart furnishings and clean lines. Nice little bar in lobby area. When we arrived at the room (double) we were thrilled that it was so spacious, well designed and comfortable furnishings. Floor to ceiling windows are awesome! The bathroom was oversized for most Waikiki hotels, shower nice size and the water was hot and pressure fantastic! We were late for a function so decided to give the restaurant on property a try. Scary for an opening night usually but not here. Service was fantastic. Food tasty and presentation great. The Ahi Poke outstanding! Noticed also that they had a great kids menu and very reasonably priced. Lastly, location, location, location. In the heart of Waikiki with shopping all around and 1 block from the beach. Pool area was sleek and trendy and fitness area right off lobby too. Loved the echo friendly water idea! They provide you with water bottle that is fillable on several different levels of the hotel with filtered water. Also, the most amazing hair dryers! You will want to take one with you and you can! They are available for sale! Just sorry we stayed only 1 night. This is the new GO TO HOTEL in Waikiki!

This brand new hotel is centrally located with beautiful rooms. The pool are is stunning and the staff was wonderful, especially Jonell! He was so kind and helpful. This hotel was modern and had the most important thing to me- bathrobes! Cant wait to go back on next trip to Hawaii!

First off, I just want to mention that we are not guests here. However, after meeting the staff yesterday I felt that I need to write a review because my girlfriend Henny and I had an amazing experience. Mind you, we never used TripAdvisor before and did not know about it until one of the staff mentioned what it was. Because of the excellent interaction with Eddie and after mentioning he is 5 STAR material, I promised him we would do it when we have time. We are staying at the Sheraton Waikiki and we were walking by. Valet greeted us and was nice enough to send us up to go check out the hotel. It looked brand new and it was interesting because the lobby of the hotel is not on the bottom. We went up to the 8th floor and immediately greeted by the front desk Eddie and Alex. I got to personally meet with the manager and what a nice man he is. Eddie immediately stopped what he was doing and offered to give us a tour around.That was the best tour ever. His service is exceptional and I cannot stress that enough. It blew us away that he had so much knowledge and provided great service to us knowing we are not guests. A very young genuine man who took the time to stop what he was doing and showed us around. He offered to show us all the great rooms and also gave me his business card so that when we are interested to stay the next time he can let us know how much it would cost. How amazing and convenient. The rooms are fabulous. Very spacious, great decor, love the open shower! Great place for my girlfriend and I. Alex and Eddie are just amazing and again I want to thank the both of you. I am surprised Eddie is not a manager because WOW! He has excellent service and is definitely good at talking! I was so interested in the rooms after all the information he gave us. With the both of you, the hotel will run successfully and Eddie mentioned you are not fully opened so best of luck to the both of you. You both have amazing things to come to you and Eddie, one day I can see you being an amazing manager. I hope your managers know how valuable you are and take care of you. Thank you Alex and Eddie. Shaka.

First off, I have to disclaim we were probably one of the first patrons to the Hyatt Centric's opening. I mean they didn't even have their grand opening yet...which we found out isn't until Jan 15th. So there were minor hiccups, but nothing that they weren't able to resolve quickly. We came in on the Thursday they first opened. They have valet which is $38 per night or you can self-park for $32. Probably best to valet since you have in-n-out privileges. Once you get past valet they direct you to the 8th floor where the front desk is located. We were greeted by a group of their personnel who were all very welcoming. We got leis & fresh pineapple juice from their bar while we were checking in. We just flew over 9 hours so it was a very nice touch. The lobby is decorated in very modern decor. Nice ebb & flow to the space. They have a restaurant & bar on-site on the floor which is situated to the left of registration, the space also opens up to their outdoor pool & cabana area which is a great spot to 'chill.' They even have an outdoor fire pit area...Nice.ROOM: We had a King room which was well decorated, very similar modern style as the lobby. Bathroom was very nice. Shower area is big w/10ft ceilings & good water pressure with a height adjustable shower head. Linens, pillows, amenities were all great. Enough outlets & USB slots to power up your devices. Overall very comfortable room with updated ammenities.SERVICE: Everyone we met were very accommodating & very friendly. At one point, after our 1st day you can tell they were still fixing issues on our floor. One of their maintenance guys just walked into our room, not knowing we were in there but profusely apologized when he realized his mistake. After our 1st night we had to move rooms since they were having issues with their hot water on our floor. We moved up one floor and we were all good. Like I mentioned they were still just working out all the small kinks of opening up this hotel. For our trouble one of the managers (Alex) gave us a complimentary dinner at their restaurant. When we went down later that evening to grab a drink at their bar, Rommel Espina (restaurant supervisor) introduced himself & knowing what happened to us earlier in the day, took care of a couple rounds of drinks for us. What a very nice gesture. It also showed great communication within their hotel staff to know what was going on w/their patrons. He's someone who you have to seek out. Great customer service!AMMENITIES: The hotel offers its guests beach towels, beach chairs & umbrellas which you can get from valet. It was great to know & use with Waikiki Beach so close & the weather a bit unpredictable. We were also able to use these when we went to Kailua Beach. It was another added perk to have during our stay. We didn't have to purchase these items unnecessarily. RESTAURANT: The Lanai. It's not available or showing on Trip Advisor, yet. But it's the restaurant located in the hotel. It's a higher end restaurant with higher end prices. We started off with the ahi tuna avocado poke as an appetizer. It was good, nothing extraordinary but a good start to our meal. I had the seafood pasta. The pasta was a 'squid ink,' which was unique & different, so the pasta itself was dark purple in color...Very good though. The tomato based sauce with scallops, shrimp & mussels made the dish very good. I'd recommend it for those looking for pasta. My wife had the grilled jack fish. Very light & well prepared over a bed of rice with local veggies. She enjoyed it very much. Again, very recommended. To end the night, Rommel the supervisor remembered that we were celebrating our 19th anniversary, so they brought out a very nice dessert of ice cream & fruits with 'Happy 19th Anniversary' written in chocolate. Very nice!!! Thanks for this Rommel!OVERALL: Great stay in a very nice new hotel! A hotel is only as good as the people they employ. From what we experienced, they have a winner here. Erika, Greg & Eddie Yu at the front desk were all great. All were very engaging & offered up some great places to hit up while on our stay. Rommel Espina (supervisor) & Lauren (waitress) in the restaurant were also employees who stood out that made our stay memorable. Again, we didn't get everyone's names but everyone was so friendly & gracious from valet to management. We will definitely be back when we visit Oahu again! Mahalo.

The lobby is very inviting and the staff is friendly. Love the choice of beers on tap. Just dropped in to check it out, but we will try staying here next time. Good new choice in Waikiki by international marketplace.
